story:
Who I Am

I am a poet, critic, and book designer living with my partner in Lancaster, PA. During the school year, I teach writing, one class per semester, at a nearby university -- this still qualifies me for Medicaid and other types of assistance, and I must collect unemployment every summer.

I am the author of two chapbooks of poems and one full-length collection, Ordinary Beans (Pecan Grove Press, 2007). My poems and reviews have appeared in three anthologies and over 60 periodicals; this fall, I will be presenting at the Celebrating African-American Literature conference at Penn State on the spoken-word poetry of Joel Dias-Porter, aka DJ Renegade. Someday I would like to start my own small press centering on poetry.

I am also disabled. I have severe fibromyalgia, quite possibly as a side effect of PTSD, although even the experts have a hard time saying for sure. I have degenerative disorder of the spine, which bends in the wrong places, and arthritis in both hips. A 13" laptop is perfect for my crooked little hands, and allows me to recline, sit, or whatever position is most comfortable on a given day as I work. Or it used to.

What Happened

One day the ceiling fell in. The upstairs tenants overflowed their sink, their floor, my ceiling, and my bed, where the Macbook was sitting. Luckily the data was recoverable from the hard drive, including a novella in progress. The rest of the 13" Macbook Pro, however, is hosed. No one can agree on whose insurance should pick up the cost. I don't have time for legal wrangling! I have poems and that conference paper to write, and video to edit for the conference presentation. And with the severe exhaustion caused by my combination of disabilities, as Sweet Brown so famously said, ain't nobody got time for that.

What I'm Asking For

The goal amount I have set is half of a new Macbook Pro of the model that would exactly replace mine, or perhaps an entire refurbished one. Any overfunding will go to the following areas first: 1. paying for the recovery of my data and putting it onto the new computer; 2. buying non-included software (such as Adobe Creative Suite or Final Cut Pro) or peripherals (they make a separate, wireless touchpad); 3. RAM upgrades or any other hardware adjustments needed to make my variety of creative projects run smoothly.

What You Get

You get the best thing I can think of to give anybody: poetry, written from me to you or perhaps a special person you know, on your choice of topic. Four very special backers will get some of the last few signed copies of my book in existence -- Pecan Grove Press has sadly, and quietly, been defunded by the university it was attached to upon the death of its founder, my great friend and mentor H. Palmer Hall. You also get boundless, humble gratitude and a special place in my heart.

story: It has been a dream of mine for as long as I can remember to do mission work in Africa. I believe it is what I am meant to do. Through an organization called Family Legacy, I have the opportunity to live my dream. In July 2014, I will travel to Zambia to attend Camp LIFE. This camp is seven days long and is patterned after a traditional church camp. However, Camp LIFE is created specifically for the orphaned child, a class of more than one million in Zambia. During this week, I will be matched up with a group of ten orphans and two english speaking Zambian ministry partners. Throughout the week, I as well as 1,000 other Zambian orphans will participate in teaching, worship, and song, all together. I will also be blessed to get to enjoy small group time with the ten kids assigned to me as well as having time set aside for one on one time with each child. This is where I will get to learn their own personal stories, their lives, their struggles, their dreams, and their feelings. This is where I will feel what God feels for each of their precious hearts. I will have the opportunity to tell them about God and hear their feelings about a higher power. In the past, this has been the time in which many of the orphans come to Christ, transforming their lives forever. On Thursday of this treasured week, we all journey together, each American with their group, into the compounds that the orphans call home. During this time, the children will share new found relationships with Christ to their surrounding neighbors. Sharing love, care, and the Gospel to the ten orphans I am assigned to will fulfill my heart but, more importantly, I hope it will give these precious souls hope for their future. Camp LIFE not only changes the lives of children who have been completely neglected, but will likely change my life forever. God is calling me to share my testimony to the most precious lives on Earth. I hope and pray that I will not only be changed by this experience, but touch the lives of those who need it most.

story:
The Background:

As tensions continue to rise between the governments of Iran and the United States, the face of humanity is being lost. The complex reality of the situation is being replaced by simplistic propaganda.

This propaganda is attempting to generalize the entirety of the Iranian population under the stereotypes of oppressive tyrants, military fundamentalists, and xenophobic isolationists. This propaganda is attempting to create and reinforce a new fictional schism between West and East - a new farcical vocabulary of “us” versus “them”

The outcome?

Regimes shout for war. The people plead for peace. Yet the voices of the people are not heard above the cacophony of power struggles.

We need to hear the voices of the people, rather than the monologues of tyrants and politicians. Yet slowly, the people are being smothered. Slowly, their voices are being lost. Slowly, our eyes are being diverted. We are losing sight of reality, and falling into the fog of fiction. The voices of democracy in Iran are being repressed and neglected by the influences of power, hired media, and global politics - on both sides of the Atlantic. The vicious truths of geopolitics surrounding the Middle East are being covered up by a fictional vocabulary of spreading “stability” and “democracy”.

There is a need now to create a vehicle of discussion - a vehicle of anti-propaganda between the people of Iran and the people of the United States. There is a need now to amplify the voices of liberty and justice over the voices of tyranny and injustice.

"Confronting the Clash: The Suppressed Voices of Iran" is a project aimed at achieving this end.

The Project:

There are two individuals compiling/authoring this book - myself (Sinan Ziza) and Sepa Sama. I am a Turkish American writer beginning my PhD studies in the United States. My colleague, Sepa is an Iranian American artist out of California.

I am on the East Coast. He is on the West Coast. Together, we have at our disposal a wide-reaching network - a network of writers, poets, artists, intellectuals, activists, professors, and journalists working in connection to the Middle East.

Over the past eight months, we have been using this network in order to gain insight into the raw, unbiased reality of the political and geopolitical context of Iran. We are now beginning to compile this into a book entitled "Confronting the Clash: The Suppressed Voices of Iran".

The goal of the book is threefold.

1 - To amplify the voices of the public of Iran speaking against war, injustice, and repression.
2 - To unveil the voices of Iranians living within and outside of Iran that are (or at one time were) actively pursuing, rallying, or representing reformist and democratic causes.
3 - To gather some of the world’s most noted political intellectuals in one book, as they talk about the geopolitical reality surrounding the situation of Iran and the Middle East.

This is not a history book. This is about Iran - today. This is more a form of independent journalism than anything else. We are simply trying to unveil truths that are getting more and more entrenched in the fog of propaganda with each passing day.

Help us fight this fog. Help us spread the truth. Help us confront the clash.  

The Details:

The book is going to be finished in June 2012, and published in July 2012. A few publishers have approached us on the subject, but we want to keep the book as accessible and affordable as possible. This is easiest to achieve through independent publication. 

We are asking for your help to make this possible.

We consider this project to be an important one. We have done a great deal of the leg work on our own funds. We do not, however, have enough to cover the costs involved with publication. At a minimum, we need $3,000 in order to achieve this. That being said, the more we can raise beyond $3,000, the more we can print, and the more we can subsidize the final price of the book. 

Thank you for your support, and for your time.

About the Title:

The title, "Confronting the Clash" has three meanings.

1) Confronting Samuel Huntington's theory of the Clash of Civilizations.

2) Confronting the volatile talk of war and "military action" between the United States and Iran today.

3) In Sepa's childhood drawing, he depicted a mythological figure (Simurgh) rising in order to confront the clash of the Iran-Iraq war. 

Sepa's art piece:

Name: "Spring Mattress, Light, Dream, Decay" (2008). Professionally pressed print between two sheets of plexiglass. 

Explanation: "What happens when a dream falls into the springs of a mattress"

Size: 41" x 66"

story:
Short Summary

Lolly is a new culture magazine that promotes innovative ideas for thriving on a limited budget. Our voice is edgy, charming and cool. It inspires young women to place less emphasis on the overpriced and just have fun. Based in LA, Lolly documents current, noteworthy and free treasures, while providing coverage of fashion, food, music and unique ways to explore the city. 

We are three creatives in our 20s who aim to create an uplifting environment for those (like us) with empty pockets. Unlike traditional magazines, Lolly inspires people on a budget to max out on free fun without pushing expensive products.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Funds will go towards startup costs: web design, web graphics, photography, and promotional materials.

In addition, if we reach our goal of $4500, we will create a print magazine!!  If not, the funds will still go towards improving our website / generating promotional materials.

Unique perks: REAL mixtape by our blog friend MusicMeds, NOSTALGIA gift basket filled with goodies like bubblegum, cootie catchers, etc, and PERSONAL articles - we will write a fun story about you!

 

The Impact

Lolly Magazine was created on June 7th 2012.  During its first month, the website reached 4,000 views! We are hoping to improve our site and expand our readership but need your help!  

Your contribution will have a HUGE impact on the success of our business. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Promote our campaign: 

Email the link to all your friends, RT our campaign efforts on twitter, post the link on your facebook wall, etc.

Donate craft supplies or weird nostalgic items:

This will go towards our "Throwback Thursday" column. The weirder the better.

Collaborate with us!

Email LollyMagazine@gmail.com.

story:
Danita Rountree Green (R Satiafa)

                 Re-Languaging for Social Change:

      Re-stor(y)ing our Lives by Rewording our World

 

Language and word choice is powerful. In our abbreviated text-messaging world, our use of language is more important than ever. By re-languaging our conversations to promote dialogue that is both kinder and more inclusive, our familial and personal relationships will improve, opening doors to greater collaboration and partnership. This re-languaging will be achieved through the creation of new words and phrases that will foster kindness and cooperation.

I was elated to receive a graduate scholar award to attend ARTS IN SOCIETY 2013 and serve as a chairperson throughout the conference. This award only pays for conference fees, not travel, room or board.

What your contribution will buy:

Roundtrip ticket to Hungary          1,700

Room and board                             600

Misc expences                               200

___________________________________

                          Total               $2,500

What your contribution will do:

It will enable a student/teacher/parent/author and social activist to bring global solutions to community issues with the potential of long term possitive impact in many different arenas.

I am equally excited about learning more about the different cultures represented.  It is my hope that I will be able to extend my stay and visit several institutions that my expand my knowledge base and open the door to more global solutions to our ever troubled prison system and the pitfalls caused by incarceration. Admittedly, my viewpoint is limited, and I would like to take this racially and economically motivated issue that plagues the US to a greater audience.
 
In otherwords, I want to also visit prisons and hospitals to observe how others have used re-llanguaging (or biblio-therapy) to increase both mental and physical health, and restoration of a quality life.

The Impact

This re-languaged way of speaking will positively influence outcomes in several different ways including

  • promote better emotional and physical health

  • allow individuals to re-evaluate past events

  • draw more hopeful conclusions about their futures.

This re-languaging may also cause society to revisit certitudes that are based on old stories that were languaged poorly or now no longer serve.

You see, my basic issue with how we treat ex- offenders in the US is that they never finish paying for their crimes in the same way most chronically ill patients never fully recover from their illnesses.  

I have documented where in cases people have learned to re-language these life-altering events, their futures have been impacted emmensely. 

To read about my successful examples of re-languaging, go to -

https://docs.google.com/file/d/0B26rNEH3HQNHSTF...

About Danita Rountree Green (R. Satiafa)

Creative Writing Facilitator,Mayors Youth Academy, City of Richmond, Masters Program in Transformative Leadership and Social Change,Maryland University of Integrative Health in cooperation with Virginia Union University, Depart of Fine Arts.  I am also the archivist and wordsmith for The Real Woman Empowerment Project, a collective that supports and mentors women globally and is dedicated to redefining sistership. 

 I have always been interested in the personal pathology of individuals. As an author of both fiction and non-fiction work, that curiosity has extended to the characters I create and the ones that have been a part of my life since childhood. What makes us who we are? I say a lot of personal profile or 'characterization' comes from our interpretation of stories - real or imagined - and those stories are made up of words. Words chosen to create, influence, build or destroy. As a student,  teacher, artist and African American single mother of 3 sons, my goal is to use words creatively to restore lives, particularly of those affected by long term upheaval such as incarceration or chronic illness. I write novels in the field of re-entry/reclamation in the hopes that I can help people begin again. I do the same at MCV hospital so that the long-suffering can move forward. When people realize their own words are powerful, they can create a story that better serves us all.   

                      Money isn't everything .  .  .  . uh .  .  .  really, it isn't - 

As much as I would appreciate your monetary aid, I would equally appreciate your kind words randomly spoken to someone else on the planet whom you would not normally interast with. That's the cornerstone to building new worlds Please tell your friends about re-languaging and help someone re-stor(y) a life.

                                                          Thank You!!

story:
We need your donations to publicize this protest, print materials, buy sound equipment, make signs, banners, displays, buy costumes, and others things needed to make a SPECTACLE OF RESISTANCE against

THE INSTALLATION OF SALVATORE JOSEPH CORDILEONE, WHO HAS NOTHING BUT HATRED FOR WOMEN...
At the beginning of his appointment to Bishop of Oakland in 2009, Salvatore Cordileone spoke to & trained hundreds of high school youth to fight for the anti-abortion agenda, at “Pro-Life Boot Camps.” In 2010, he spearheaded resistance to abortion aid in the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act.  This year, he is working hard to get Catholics together and pass an initiative in California to mandate parental consent for minors who need abortion care.
 
NOTHING BUT HATRED FOR QUEER PEOPLE...
In 2008, Cordileone raised $1.5 million, gave $6,000 out of his own pocket, and organized major evangelist figures such as James Dobson into activism to pass Prop 8, banning gay marriage in California.  Two years later he was named Chairman of the Promotion & Defense of Marriage Subcommittee to ban same sex marriage.  This year, he has repeatedly expressed public support of an initiative in North Carolina, again denying families the financial and legal benefits provided to heterosexual couples. 
 
...BUT SYMPATHY FOR RAPISTS!
Cordileone was appointed Bishop of San Diego in 2002; he left in 2007 as they were filing for bankruptcy protection in response to 150 claims from sexual abuse victims.  Since then, he refuses to release a list of names of the 26 priests in Oakland who have sexual abuse allegations against them, to the non-profits that help abuse survivors. 
 
…and he was just appointed Metropolitan Archbishop of San Francisco by the Pope in late July 2012.

story:
Story of My Book

Through a travel-based fictional narrative of a recent college graduate, Romance of the Climate Crisis documents stories of real people who witnessed the worst impacts of climate change in their everyday lives. Using such narratives from different parts of the world, this book is my effort in depicting what climate change looks like in real life, beyond the world of numbers and graphs. The protagonist, throughout this book, travels to different parts of the world, vicariously experiences climate catastrophes, and searches for meaning in life by looking at solutions and careers that can potentially contribute to fighting climate change.

My name is Shreyansh Budhia, and I am the author of Romance of the Climate Crisis. I wrote this book because I felt that the global climate narrative needed more personalized stories of people on the frontlines to be told. This narrative, I felt, was essentially what people needed to hear, besides the climate science and data that continues to hint at the urgency of climate change.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that climate change is as much about people as it is about numbers and that it is already severing people’s lives in the worst ways possible. With this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for nature, people, and the search for different ways young people can do their part in fighting the problem. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you understand the severity of this problem, develop compassion towards the communities impacted, and know that there are professional ways for you to build a career that fights the climate crisis in some way or another.

In this book, you'll learn about people from different parts of the world and the different ways their lives are impacted by climate change:

 

  • A wildfire in California incinerates several residents of a town, burns their homes, and melts a bus.
  • Floods in South Carolina make residents consider permanently abandoning parts of Charleston.
  • An airline pilot observes Alaska’s Columbia glacier receding 15 miles inland within two decades.
  • An entire village in Fiji decides to relocate and save its residents from rising sea level.

You will love this book if you love people and you care for others. Romance of the Climate Crisis is a fictional work that speaks to environmentalists and young people who are looking to vicariously experience climate change, explore careers that deal with climate solutions, and find meaning in life.

 

The Book - Romance of the Climate Crisis

The book is written in 4 Parts....

  • Part 1 contains the introduction plus Chapters 1-5. This sections sets the protagonist’s resolve to travel the world and find something purposeful to work on. The protagonist travels to different states within the US and sees the impact of climate change on the communities and wildlife in those states. The reader might learn that climate change isn’t alien to America. In fact, some of the worst climate-impacted communities call America home.
  • Part 2 contains Chapters 5-13. The protagonist flies abroad and discovers climate survival stories from other parts of the world. He travels through some of the prettiest landscapes of the world and learns about the local inhabitants' struggle with the climate crisis.
  • Part 3 contains Chapters 13-17. The protagonist learns about governments and nonprofits in different countries that have been working on mitigating the climate crisis. He thinks about corporate social responsibility and sees how some corporations are trying to become sustainable in the face of an ever-increasing consumer demand for environmentally friendly goods and services
  • Part 4 contains Chapters 18-21. The protagonist considers different strategies to fight climate change. He thinks about the different ways young people like him can contribute to climate solutions, not only by being independent citizens, but by also building climate-conscious careers. He ponders over chances of completely restoring the climate and questions whether such ambitious goals are possible. He muses about his drive to find purpose in life and vets if the environment can give him that purpose.

 

​What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish,
  • A personal, handwritten thank-you note for pre-ordering my book,
  • Your name will appear in a special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”),
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback,
  • The opportunity to help me select my cover,
  • A book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experience of writing my book,
  • And more!

 

About the Author

Shreyansh Budhia is a graduating senior at George Washington University. He is an independent environmental policy researcher who has been published by Comparative Advantage, a Stanford University Economics Journal, and Open Americas, an online magazine about current affairs in the Americas. He is also a Leader at the Climate Reality Project leading climate awareness events and presentations in rural parts of India, an intern at the Healthy Climate Initiative exploring carbon negative business models, and a research assistant at Pyron Lab - GWU assessing threat status of 50 lesser known snake species in southern India.

Shreyansh wrote this book because of two reasons. First, he personally felt that communicating climate change needed more stories to be told than just data. He felt it was only possible through climate survival stories that people could learn to connect with communities directly impacted by the climate crisis. And second, he really wanted to look for ways young people could find a life purpose by working to contribute to climate solutions, not just by doing their part, but also by finding sustainable careers. This book is a collection of his efforts in finding such climate stories and careers that he set out looking for.

In his free time, Shreyansh likes to hike, bike, visit local forests, and watch South Park. Making Bonsai plants and taking care of some young cacti are his newly discovered interests.

For more information you can connect with Shreyansh Budhia at shreyanshbudhia@gwu.edu and on Facebook and Twitter.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up to date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #ClimateThruStories and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of this page
  • Share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for your love and support!


Thanks again,
Shreyansh

story:
Story of My Book

Have a Good Mourning is a book about discovering how to smile – and even laugh – in the face of loss. It will give you unique ways to help you mourn with joy, so you can heal, grow and transform your life.

My name is Jen Hale and I am the author of Have a Good Mourning. My life forever changed on April 25, 2018 at 1:47am. That's when I had to say goodbye to one of the most important people in my life – my dear, sweet mother, Sue. I wrote this book because I want to do nothing but honor my mother and the impact she’s had on my life every single day, but do it in a happy, transformative way – a way where I can do good for the world around me while helping myself heal the massive void she left behind. But, most of all, do it with joy.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will begin to see a new life opening up for you as you read inspiring stories of people already on their own good mourning journeys. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of dedication that I have for having a good mourning in you. And, then, ultimately, I want you to view this book as a powerful resource equipped with a set of soul-enriching practices that will give you the rare opportunity to change the way you mourn, so, you, too can transform your life.

In this book, you'll learn about how joyful mourning can lead to hope, change, and most of all, transformation:

  • How Anthony Samadani, along with Muhammad Ali’s oldest daughter, May May, have partnered together to launch the Good News Network in an effort to spread joy instead of fear in the mainstream media…
  • How Kinja Dixon, a self-made millionaire and best-selling author of Recreationism, feels even more connected to his late mother now than while she was alive…
  • How Jennifer Morilla uprooted her cushy life as a marketer in New York City to give the gift of water – and a renewed sense of hope – to underdeveloped communities all over the world…

You will love this book if you are looking for something different when it comes to mourning, in particular a new, fresh perspective that evokes joy and infuses hope in your life. Have a Good Mourning is a non-fiction book that will speak to anyone who wants to discover how mourning with joy can change their lives forever.


The Book – Have a Good Mourning

The book is written in three parts in an effort to show you how long we've let outdated cultural norms dictate how we mourn. Next, you'll quickly see how easy it is to leave these boring, depressing rituals behind as you experience your own "good mourning" shift. Finally, you'll feel empowered to start applying the fun, unique good mourning practices inside this book to your own life.  

Part 1, Understanding How We Mourn, contains the Introduction, plus three additional chapters. Part 1 will give you a taste of what we’ve been given, from the "experts," when it comes to grief and mourning. You’ll quickly learn there is so much more to healing after a loss than simply observing Elisabeth Kubler Ross’ 5 stages of grief or reading Sigmund Freud’s theories.

Part 2, Principles of Joyful Mourning, includes Chapters 4-6. In Part 2, you will discover something incredibly powerful – something you may not even know you had – that will give you the strength to use your loss as a springboard into your new, transformed life. It’s called the Good Mourning shift. It lays dormant inside your soul until you need it, of course. Once you find it, your life will never be the same again.

Part 3, How You Mourn With Joy, contains Chapters 7-23 and a conclusion. In Part 3, you’ll meet some pretty incredible people like Jennifer Morilla, Kinja Dixon, Dan Benjamin, Natalie Sanchez, and Gigi Trencher, who have all been impacted by a heartbreaking loss. They will inspire you to leave your old, sad grief-stricken life behind in search for your new, joyful destiny as you heal, grow and transform your life from the inside out.


What I Need & What You'll Get


This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are placeholders!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish in the spring of 2020

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

 

About the Author

When it comes to writing about herself, Jen's more of less "stumped." And it has nothing to do with the fact that she grew up on a Christmas Tree Farm just south of the Mason Dixon line. She's just not that interesting...

Unless of course, you think driving a tractor trailer just to honk the horn, or skiing so ridiculously slow that you actually stop mid-hill, or scuba diving in a southern Virginian quarry to see two overgrown carp in a sunken bus is cool. If you do, you’ve just met your hero – a small town girl with a big appetite for life, and of course, pizza.

Although she’s always had a knack for storytelling, it wasn’t until she neared 30 that she began to find her voice. (And, no, it wasn’t held captive in some esoteric seashell by Ursula for three decades, either).

She took to Yelp, the crowd-source reviewer of anything you can conceive of – or consume. With each new review she wrote, her voice took shape – until she’d created a personal style of theme-based critiques that are transparent, detail-oriented, and satirical.

It was this rise-above-the-noise-floor style that got her noticed at The Agora’s Money Map Press – and then transformed her from a full-time marketer to a zany, idea-hungry copywriter practically overnight.

Over the past three years, that voice has made its way into packages that brought Money Map millions of dollars. But she doesn’t attribute her success to just hard work or even her drive to master the art of copywriting.

She believes it’s because she’s a “people person.” Not in the traditional, “social-butterfly” sense of the term; it’s more of an “She-wants-to-help-as-many people-as-possible-achieve-their-dreams” focus on her work. She can “see” the people she’s writing to. She can see their needs. She knows what she needs to say to reach them.

Her journey through the financial realm has been exhilarating – even enlightening. But in June of 2019, she decided to bring her voice and her “people-person focus” to NewMarket Health. She, along with the folks at NewMarket, help people from all over the world live their healthiest, most-fulfilling, most-vibrant lives.

When her mother, Sue, died, she knew there had to be more to grief than simply wallowing in her sorrow day in and day out. She set out in search for something different. When that “something different” turned out to be some outdated, unimaginative observations on grief, it hit her – she needed to create what her soul was so desperately looking for, all by herself. And that’s when her book, Have a Good Mourning, was born.

She’s infused her quirky take on the English language in her book, Have a Good Mourning, not in some vain attempt to exercise her creative juices for the world to see, but to help as many people as possible see all the goodness that can come from a loss, so they, too, can have a good mourning. 

One last thing…

In case you’re looking to steal Jen's heart – she loves lard-laden buns, endorphin-spiking runs and seriously epic puns.

For more information you can connect with Jen at jennifer.hale1@gmail.com and Facebook: @jenhaleauthor. 


Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.


Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #haveagoodmourning and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jen Hale

Have a Good Mourning is a non-fiction book that will speak to anyone who wants to discover how mourning with joy can change their lives forever.
The Book – Have a Good MourningThe book is written in three parts in an effort to show you how long we've let outdated cultural norms dictate how we mourn. Next, you'll quickly see how easy it is to leave these boring, depressing rituals behind as you experience your own "good mourning" shift. Finally, you'll feel empowered to start applying the fun, unique good mourning practices inside this book to your own life.  Part 1, Understanding How We Mourn, contains the Introduction, plus three additional chapters. Part 1 will give you a taste of what we’ve been given, from the "experts," when it comes to grief and mourning. You’ll quickly learn there is so much more to healing after a loss than simply observing Elisabeth Kubler Ross’ 5 stages of grief or reading Sigmund Freud’s theories.Part 2, Principles of Joyful Mourning, includes Chapters 4-6. In Part 2, you will discover something incredibly powerful – something you may not even know you had – that will give you the strength to use your loss as a springboard into your new, transformed life. It’s called the Good Mourning shift. It lays dormant inside your soul until you need it, of course. Once you find it, your life will never be the same again.Part 3, How You Mourn With Joy, contains Chapters 7-23 and a conclusion. In Part 3, you’ll meet some pretty incredible people like Jennifer Morilla, Kinja Dixon, Dan Benjamin, Natalie Sanchez, and Gigi Trencher, who have all been impacted by a heartbreaking loss. They will inspire you to leave your old, sad grief-stricken life behind in search for your new, joyful destiny as you heal, grow and transform your life from the inside out.
What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April, 2020
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are placeholders!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish in the spring of 2020
When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
And more... About the AuthorWhen it comes to writing about herself, Jen's more of less "stumped." And it has nothing to do with the fact that she grew up on a Christmas Tree Farm just south of the Mason Dixon line. She's just not that interesting...Unless of course, you think driving a tractor trailer just to honk the horn, or skiing so ridiculously slow that you actually stop mid-hill, or scuba diving in a southern Virginian quarry to see two overgrown carp in a sunken bus is cool. If you do, you’ve just met your hero – a small town girl with a big appetite for life, and of course, pizza.Although she’s always had a knack for storytelling, it wasn’t until she neared 30 that she began to find her voice. (And, no, it wasn’t held captive in some esoteric seashell by Ursula for three decades, either).She took to Yelp, the crowd-source reviewer of anything you can conceive of – or consume. With each new review she wrote, her voice took shape – until she’d created a personal style of theme-based critiques that are transparent, detail-oriented, and satirical.It was this rise-above-the-noise-floor style that got her noticed at The Agora’s Money Map Press – and then transformed her from a full-time marketer to a zany, idea-hungry copywriter practically overnight.Over the past three years, that voice has made its way into packages that brought Money Map millions of dollars. But she doesn’t attribute her success to just hard work or even her drive to master the art of copywriting.She believes it’s because she’s a “people person.” Not in the traditional, “social-butterfly” sense of the term; it’s more of an “She-wants-to-help-as-many people-as-possible-achieve-their-dreams” focus on her work. She can “see” the people she’s writing to. She can see their needs. She knows what she needs to say to reach them.Her journey through the financial realm has been exhilarating – even enlightening. But in June of 2019, she decided to bring her voice and her “people-person focus” to NewMarket Health. She, along with the folks at NewMarket, help people from all over the world live their healthiest, most-fulfilling, most-vibrant lives.When her mother, Sue, died, she knew there had to be more to grief than simply wallowing in her sorrow day in and day out. She set out in search for something different. When that “something different” turned out to be some outdated, unimaginative observations on grief, it hit her – she needed to create what her soul was so desperately looking for, all by herself. And that’s when her book, Have a Good Mourning, was born.She’s infused her quirky take on the English language in her book, Have a Good Mourning, not in some vain attempt to exercise her creative juices for the world to see, but to help as many people as possible see all the goodness that can come from a loss, so they, too, can have a good mourning. One last thing…In case you’re looking to steal Jen's heart – she loves lard-laden buns, endorphin-spiking runs and seriously epic puns.For more information you can connect with Jen at jennifer.hale1@gmail.com and Facebook: @jenhaleauthor.

Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media. Thank you so much for all of your love and support!Thanks again,Jen Hale

story:
Story of My Book

The Music Hustle: How To Book The Gig is a guide for musicians on how to successfully book live performances, that consists of a list of the best practices, and insights from myself and musicians across the country whom I have interviewed, to maximize one’s success in getting the gig.

My name is Andy Penk, and I am the author of The Music Hustle: How To Book The Gig. I wrote this book because I faced a lot of difficulty booking gigs when I first started performing — mainly because of my young age — and I consequently wanted to offer useful advice to other young musicians who are struggling like I did.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will increase your success rate in scoring gigs. I also hope to instill in you the same passion and excitement that I have for the hustle and for live performance. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you find overall success in your music career.

In this book, you'll learn how to find gigs available, how to set up an audition, and how to maximize your chances of getting the gig over the competition. You'll hear stories such as...
  • how I learned to tailor my setlists to particular audiences after a performance where my song selection was not well received
  • how I networked with musicians at my first open mic nights and used these connections to get more gigs
  • how I overcame self-doubt in the face of initial failure and persevered anyway.
You will love this book if you want to learn how to improve your chances of landing gigs, enhance the quality of your live performances, and become a more professional musician.

The Music Hustle: How To Book The Gig is a nonfiction book that speaks to musicians looking to start gigging and folks who are interested in the behind-the-scenes steps that culminate in a live performance for a musician.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.
When I pre-sell 120 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Andy Penk is an accomplished musician, who has been playing gigs for the past seven years in his home state of Maine. Further, he has written and recorded songs for multiple EPs & LPs, including Waiting On An Answer, The Free Fall, and Birds of a Feather, all of which are available to stream on Spotify and Apple Music. He is also an accounting student at John Carroll University in University Heights, Ohio.

Andy wrote this guide after reflecting on his first attempt to book gigs. He faced rejection by many venues as a consequence of both his young age in comparison to other established local musicians and a lack of knowledge about how to best arrange performances. Now, many years removed from these first attempts, Andy has learned a lot about the process, and he is passionate about sharing his insights — and those of his musical peers — in order to help musicians struggling to attain an opportunity to perform.

Apart from his musical interests, Andy is an avid comic book fan and movie lover. He always enjoys chatting with his friends, playing board games, and partaking in local trivia nights.

For more information, you can connect with Andy Penk at andypenkmusic@gmail.com and at @andypenkmusic on Facebook and Instagram.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheMusicHustle and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Andy Penk

story:
My Story

As a 12x children's author and former civic leader in Lower Merion, I have focused on bringing people together, doing whatever I can to foster connections between others and empower them to understand each other. This is almost never easy work, but the more that I do it and the more I commit myself to it, the more that it seems to repay me. It is always fulfilling to see that I have made a difference in a person’s life, especially a young person.

Toward that end, I have spent some time and energy on restarting a project that I first jotted down notes for a few years ago. Watching everything that has gone on recently, I feel that the time for this is right: I am writing a children’s book that will examine and discuss police and community relations, covering a tough topic in a way that is lighthearted, fun, and clear. I want this book to become a go-to resource for organizations and police departments striving to work toward positive change.

Featuring one of my characters, Aron & The Police Give Back to the Community will draw heavily on the real-world work that I have done to bridge gaps between cops and the community, all while embracing the spirit of giving that I celebrate through my story time, book drive, and food drive initiatives.

What I Need & What You Get

My goal today is to raise $10,000 to cover the costs associated with publishing the book and begin bringing it to bookshelves and Police Departments all across the country. These funds will pay for illustrations (in conjunction with a freelance artist), book formatting, ISBN number registration, proof printing, and curriculum production. Our hope is to also print a pilot run of 1000 books to be distributed to police departments associated with the Race for Peace Organization, a Committee that comprises members of law enforcement, clergy, government and citizens from Bucks, Chester, Delaware, Montgomery and Philadelphia counties who are actively working together to strengthen the relationship between law enforcement and the communities they serve.

Make your contribution and help bring this positive, fun book to life now!

Storytelling for Change

As thrilled as I am to tell my story to young people nationwide, I am even more excited to change hearts and minds via the message that I have written into this children’s book. As we have all experienced firsthand, stories can change our views of the world, setting us out on new paths and enabling us to understand others more fully and clearly. That is what this book is about: change for the better.

Other Ways You Can Help

In addition to making a monetary contribution to this campaign, you can show your support for me and my children’s book by sharing a link to the campaign on any social media platforms you use. Now more than ever, we all need to speak up for the sort of connections we want to see between cops and the community, thinking creatively to express ourselves and effect sustained progress.

I appreciate all your support as I get this story out there. Thank you for taking the time to read about what I am doing.

story:
Demoscene - The Amiga years reflects the making of the best demos as well as the history of the most emblematic and best known groups of the demoscene. Discover numerous pictures of demos through more than 450 pages as well as contributions of "sceners". This book is the first volume covering the years 1984 to 1993 with about 90 demos amongst the most famous and popular ones.

 

Demoscene - The Amiga years retrace l'histoire des meilleures démos réalisées sur Amiga mais également l'histoire des groupes les plus emblématiques et les plus connus de la scène demomaker. Découvrez à travers plus de 450 pages de nombreuses photos tirées de démos mais également des contributions de "sceners". Ce livre est le premier volume qui couvre la période 1984 à 1993 avec environ 90 démos présentées parmi les plus connues et les plus populaires.

After an history of the origin of demos and demoscene, start with the first demos including The Juggler and Boing then follow the Megademos period with RSI - Alcatraz - Kefrens - Rebels. The first slideshow with J.O.E (Scoopex / Red Sector Inc.). The creation and history of Rebels group by one of its founder Static, the first Trackmo with Mental Hangover from Scoopex which will change the style of demos in the early 90s and the history of this group from 1988 until in 2000. An other surprise like Budbrain productions which won 1st place at Amiga conference in 1990 with its megademo which will repeat with Budbrain Megademo 2 and the feeling of Diablo one of members. Without forgetting Anarchy with the participation of some of its members such as DAN, 4Mat or Facet, and Razor 1911 with its demo "Voyage". The Norwegians of Pure metal code with their demo Alpha and Omega. Go to Hungary with the group Majic 12 and its Ray of Hope demo who will explain the conditions in which this demo was created. PGCS will tell you the story of the Odyssey demo and its 5 disks, an intergalactic epic that will take you  to another demo called Hardwired, a Silents / Crionics production and the contribution of Jesper Kyd, Mikael Balle and Murphy.

Après un historique sur l'origine des demos et de la demoscene, entrez dans le vif du sujet avec les premieres demos dont The Juggler et Boing suivi de la période des Megademos avec RSI - Alcatraz - Kefrens - Rebels. Les premiers slideshow avec les debuts de J.O.E (Scoopex / Red Sector Inc.). La création et l'histoire du groupe Rebels vu par l'un de ses fondateur Static, la première Trackmo avec Mental Hangover de Scoopex qui changera profondement le style des démos au début des années 90 et l'histoire de ce groupe de 1988 jusqu'en 2000. D'autres surprises comme Budbrain productions qui remporta la 1er place a Amiga conference de 1990 avec sa megademo et qui recidivera avec Budbrain Megademo 2 et le ressenti de Diablo l'un de ses membre. Sans oublier Anarchy avec la participation de certains de ses membres tels que DAN, 4Mat ou encore Facet, Razor 1911 avec sa démo Voyage. Les Norgéviens de Pure metal coder avec leur demo Alpha et Omega. Petit tour du côté de la Hongrie avec le groupe Majic 12 et sa demo Ray of Hope qui nous expliquera les conditions dans lesquelles a été créée cette demo. PGCS vous racontera l'histoire de la démo Odyssey et de ses 5 disquettes, une épopée intergalactique qui vous fera voyager vers une autre demo nommée Hardwired une production Silents/Crionics et le témoignage de Jesper Kyd, Mikael Balle et Murphy.

In 1990 Seen and Paleface decide to create Melon dezign, they tell us their debut until the release of their first game. Discover the underside of State of the Art a production of the Spaceballs group. An interview with Mark Knight alias TDK on his personal and professional carrer, but also Audiomonster from Melon dezign. A big thank you to Zebig who helped us with sketches of their Arkham Asylum demo. Another demo "Booo" from Melon dezign where Heatbeat tells us about the creation and origin of the music. Desert Dream by Kefrens, but also an interview with Stripe the gremlin the coder of Talent. 1993 a very prolific year in terms of demos with Fairlight and 242, the Lemon. group of course with Dan and Facet, Arte from Sanity where Ra and Moby will explain their work on this French/German demo, as well as the details of the making of 9 Fingers from Spaceballs.

En 1990 Seen et Paleface decident de créer Melon dezign, ils racontent leur début jusqu'à la sortie de leur premier jeu. Découvrez les dessous de State of the Art une production du groupe Spaceballs, Une interview de Mark Knight alias TDK sur son parcours personnel et professionel, mais aussi Audiomonster Melon dezign. Un grand merci à Zebig qui nous a aidé à travers des croquis d'époque de leur démo Arkham Asylum. Autre demo Booo de Melon dezign ou Heatbeat nous raconte la création et l'origine de la musique de cette demo. Desert Dream par Kefrens, mais aussi une interview de Stripe the gremlin le codeur du groupe Talent. 1993 année très prolifique en terme de démos avec Fairlight et sa démo 242, le groupe Lemon. avec Dan et Facet, Arte de chez Sanity ou Ra et Moby expliqueront leur travail sur cette demo franco allemande, ainsi que les détails de la réalisation de 9 Fingers par Spaceballs.

This all started as a war between game developers and crackers : while game companies were adding copy protections, crackers would inevitably try and defeat these protections. Crackers would sign their feats and add the name of their group, their slogan or a text at the start of the game. At the beginning, it was only about small animations with jingles in the background, intros then became bigger and more complex, thus came the first demos into life.

Les pirates signaient leurs méfaits en ajoutant le nom de leur groupe, leur slogan ou un texte au démarrage du jeu. Il s’agissait au début de petites animations avec une musique en arrière-plan jusqu’à ce que les intros deviennent de plus en plus volumineuses et plus complexes, Ainsi sont nées les premières démos.

Demoscene - The Amiga years reflects the making of the best demos as well as the history of the most emblematic and best known groups of the demoscene. Discover numerous pictures of demos through more than 450 pages as well as contributions of "sceners". This book is the first volume covering the years 1984 to 1993 with about 90 demos amongst the most famous and popular ones. Demoscene - The Amiga years retrace l'histoire des meilleures démos réalisées sur Amiga mais également l'histoire des groupes les plus emblématiques et les plus connus de la scène demomaker. Découvrez à travers plus de 450 pages de nombreuses photos tirées de démos mais également des contributions de "sceners". Ce livre est le premier volume qui couvre la période 1984 à 1993 avec environ 90 démos présentées parmi les plus connues et les plus populaires.After an history of the origin of demos and demoscene, start with the first demos including The Juggler and Boing then follow the Megademos period with RSI - Alcatraz - Kefrens - Rebels. The first slideshow with J.O.E (Scoopex / Red Sector Inc.). The creation and history of Rebels group by one of its founder Static, the first Trackmo with Mental Hangover from Scoopex which will change the style of demos in the early 90s and the history of this group from 1988 until in 2000. An other surprise like Budbrain productions which won 1st place at Amiga conference in 1990 with its megademo which will repeat with Budbrain Megademo 2 and the feeling of Diablo one of members. Without forgetting Anarchy with the participation of some of its members such as DAN, 4Mat or Facet, and Razor 1911 with its demo "Voyage". The Norwegians of Pure metal code with their demo Alpha and Omega. Go to Hungary with the group Majic 12 and its Ray of Hope demo who will explain the conditions in which this demo was created. PGCS will tell you the story of the Odyssey demo and its 5 disks, an intergalactic epic that will take you  to another demo called Hardwired, a Silents / Crionics production and the contribution of Jesper Kyd, Mikael Balle and Murphy.Après un historique sur l'origine des demos et de la demoscene, entrez dans le vif du sujet avec les premieres demos dont The Juggler et Boing suivi de la période des Megademos avec RSI - Alcatraz - Kefrens - Rebels. Les premiers slideshow avec les debuts de J.O.E (Scoopex / Red Sector Inc.). La création et l'histoire du groupe Rebels vu par l'un de ses fondateur Static, la première Trackmo avec Mental Hangover de Scoopex qui changera profondement le style des démos au début des années 90 et l'histoire de ce groupe de 1988 jusqu'en 2000. D'autres surprises comme Budbrain productions qui remporta la 1er place a Amiga conference de 1990 avec sa megademo et qui recidivera avec Budbrain Megademo 2 et le ressenti de Diablo l'un de ses membre. Sans oublier Anarchy avec la participation de certains de ses membres tels que DAN, 4Mat ou encore Facet, Razor 1911 avec sa démo Voyage. Les Norgéviens de Pure metal coder avec leur demo Alpha et Omega. Petit tour du côté de la Hongrie avec le groupe Majic 12 et sa demo Ray of Hope qui nous expliquera les conditions dans lesquelles a été créée cette demo. PGCS vous racontera l'histoire de la démo Odyssey et de ses 5 disquettes, une épopée intergalactique qui vous fera voyager vers une autre demo nommée Hardwired une production Silents/Crionics et le témoignage de Jesper Kyd, Mikael Balle et Murphy.In 1990 Seen and Paleface decide to create Melon dezign, they tell us their debut until the release of their first game. Discover the underside of State of the Art a production of the Spaceballs group. An interview with Mark Knight alias TDK on his personal and professional carrer, but also Audiomonster from Melon dezign. A big thank you to Zebig who helped us with sketches of their Arkham Asylum demo. Another demo "Booo" from Melon dezign where Heatbeat tells us about the creation and origin of the music. Desert Dream by Kefrens, but also an interview with Stripe the gremlin the coder of Talent. 1993 a very prolific year in terms of demos with Fairlight and 242, the Lemon. group of course with Dan and Facet, Arte from Sanity where Ra and Moby will explain their work on this French/German demo, as well as the details of the making of 9 Fingers from Spaceballs.En 1990 Seen et Paleface decident de créer Melon dezign, ils racontent leur début jusqu'à la sortie de leur premier jeu. Découvrez les dessous de State of the Art une production du groupe Spaceballs, Une interview de Mark Knight alias TDK sur son parcours personnel et professionel, mais aussi Audiomonster Melon dezign. Un grand merci à Zebig qui nous a aidé à travers des croquis d'époque de leur démo Arkham Asylum. Autre demo Booo de Melon dezign ou Heatbeat nous raconte la création et l'origine de la musique de cette demo. Desert Dream par Kefrens, mais aussi une interview de Stripe the gremlin le codeur du groupe Talent. 1993 année très prolifique en terme de démos avec Fairlight et sa démo 242, le groupe Lemon. avec Dan et Facet, Arte de chez Sanity ou Ra et Moby expliqueront leur travail sur cette demo franco allemande, ainsi que les détails de la réalisation de 9 Fingers par Spaceballs.

story:
Sneak peek of the cover

_____________________________________________________________________________

_____________________________________________________________________________

Note: The cover and artwork are unfinished work in progress and are likely to change further.  The hardcover is contingent on stretch objectives.

Why this book? 

Love. It’s a mystery. It’s a catch-22 dressed as a sixty-four-thousand-dollar question. Cracking its enigmatic code is one of the toughest challenges in the world and clearly an endeavor only a top tier strategy consultant could even consider undertaking. Bazinga . . .

Management consultants are as incapable as the rest of us to truly understand love – although for the right price, they might argue the opposite. Besides, love is probably not one of the most complex issues in the world. Nevertheless, I believe we would be better off if we understood our behavior in relationships better than we do today – much better. That is the fundamental mission of this book.

Most relationships end. In fact, we're all entitled to precisely one happily-ever-after (best case scenario). All the other love stories will dissolve. This is as true as Nutella and taxes. However, we can learn an awful lot of ending relationships and breakups. Those insights have the power to put us in a much better position next time love comes around!

Who am I to write it?

Who am I and why should you consider funding and/or reading this book while Netflix has many years’ worth of great series to watch? I’m not a middle-aged woman with a decades-long career in relationship counselling. I’m not Dr. Phil or a been-around-the-block pickup artist. In short, I’m not an expert. I’m just a thirty-something guy with a deep interest in social dynamics and a tendency to escalate commitments. I started researching the subject over two years ago. 

Upon graduation from my MBA, I took a job in a top-tier management consulting firm – one of those corporate brands that earn you a lot of brownie points on LinkedIn. This turned out to be not entirely fit for the purpose of deepening my understanding of love. No sh#t, Sherlock! However, under the cobwebs of analysis-paralysis, I discovered a useful tool seasoned consultants apply when facing challenges: systematically break down bigger problems into bite size pieces. Now that’s something that resonates with me. That's the approach I've adopted in my quest to understand love.

In the process, I’ve picked the brains of academic experts in social and evolutionary psychology, communication & conflict sciences, emotional intelligence, and more. With a fine-tooth comb, I’ve gone through the work of escort girls, divorce lawyers, second-grade self-help gurus and first-grade self-improvement scholars. Gradually, I started to connect some dots. And although I cannot tell you what to do, I do have to share with you what I know.


What to expect of Eloveator Pitches?

Eloveator Pitches consists of two parts and seven chapters. Together, we cover all the different steps of a relationship, from before the first glance to beyond the last goodbye.

If you want to learn more, please discover what to expect from this book by clicking here (this link will take you to a Dropbox PDF with a four-page description of the content). The extended table of content can be found here.  Otherwise, here's is the 60 second elevator pitch of Eloveator Pitches. 

Chapter 1 [BE] tackles the individual characteristics that are relevant for our love life. Brain design, temperament, character, values and needs are all important components in our relationship behavior. The following chapter [LIKE], addresses interpersonal dynamics, like sex, attraction and limerence, in detail. These processes are often the foreplay of [LOVE], which is the third chapter. We identify key attributes that are required for loving relationships. Ever thought about intimacy, commitment and trust in a business-like way?  Now is the time. In chapter 4 [SUSTAIN], we describe which elements make love last.  This is a consultant's take on great communication, conflict management, individuality, fun, and a bunch of other tricks of the trade.
 
Starting from chapter 5 [DOUBT], the relationship begins going downhill. Maybe surprisingly, there is more structure to the mayhem than we'd expect. In an interesting dynamic of action and reaction, the once loving partners alienate each other at increasing speed, until a tipping point is reached... In chapter 6 [SPLIT], we kick the tires of the actual breakup and its consequences. I also outline "Project Breakup 2.0", which contains a boatload of suggestions to avoid screwing up while breaking up. We all suck at breaking up, and for valid reasons! In the last chapter [COPE], I address the booby traps and sensations of the newly-single experience, and also debunk some myths around singleness. We'll finish by highlighting the mistakes to avoid in the next relationship if we want to have a shot at our happily-ever-after!

What's so special about this book?
1. First of all - me. Or better, my perspective. Eloveator Pitches is written by a 30-something male foot soldier of love, not by an authoritative general observing the trenches from a distance (e.g. a retired relationship counselor looking to monetize her experience). This makes the book more accessible and relevant for younger targets, both women and men. For men, this is maybe the first book in its genre that takes a rain check on the trademark sticky toffee pudding tone associated with traditional relationship and/or self-improvement literature. Opting out? Know that love has more nuances than cricket and chess combined! For women, the views of a male author on love can provide some refreshing perspectives on relationships. Maybe I'm wrong, but there is only one way to find out...

2. Eloveator Pitches is a short book. I made it deliberately compact because your time is precious and I respect that. At the start of each section, the read time in minutes is announced. You can chop up your reading, and you'll always know what to expect. The absolute fastest way through this book is to skip straight to the 60 second elevator pitches you'll find at the end of each chapter. Eloveator Pitches is jam-packed with insights the way a Snickers bar is packed with calories. All 200+ pages (~65 000 words) count - sort of.   


3. Eloveator Pitches is hand-illustrated with more than two dozen of graphs and charts that, in another life, could have been used for real management consulting presentations. Besides clarifying key concepts, it also gives a quick look into what management consultants keep themselves busy with. Here are some actual examples from the book.


4.  This must be the first book ever written that comes with an entire 8+ hour Spotify sound track custom-made for each of the (sub-) chapters. The aim is two-fold. Firstly, this music can set an appropriate mood for reading a particular section. Secondly, most billboard charts and movie theatres are swamped with lyrics and stories that are as truthful or realistic as the average mascara commercial. Nonetheless, they impact our belief system around love and relationships in ways more important than we'd like to admit. While reading, you can compare the information in the book with what you hear in the songs, and spot the inconsistencies. Bottom line, this play list is entirely optional, but pledges to provide a more immersive experience. Because you've given me already some of your time, you can find it here, entirely for free. It matches the detailed table of contents seamlessly.

5. The approach. We're not here for a quick buck. We're in it for the long run. We've gone to great lengths to make this book as grand as it could be. We've put equal care in the support campaign. Take a break from the reading and check out our latest support video that has gone viral online (3k views in 24 hours). And it's only 2 minutes long.


What will the funds be used for?

The first objective - after two years of intense work - is to share my views with the broadest possible audience. This requires a finished product and a limited marketing budget. Eloveator Pitches went through a first round of professional editing prior to this campaign, financed by my savings, and recovering some of that investment through pre-sales would be welcome. 

Furthermore, I will need to fund the design of a professional book cover, final editing and the print of the first batch. I'll also need an author's website. These first objectives require about $9000.

When the campaign reaches $12500, I can work towards a hardcover version, with colored graphics. If we reach $15000 together, I'll do the necessary to have Eloveator Pitches made available in audiobook format.

And I promise, if the campaign reaches $20000+, I will organize a book launch party in June (In London) where all the donors get VIP treatment. I'll add additional stretch goals to share the love if our efforts really make the dollars go through the roof... Stay tuned!

Keep in mind that all pledges are subject to Indiegogo and/or Paypal fees which amount to about 10-12% of the total funds. I'm also covering the production and shipping costs of the perks you'll discover if you keep reading.

So what? Now what?

Well, this is the moment when I turn the mic to you... As you'll see in the perks, the contributions that I'm shooting for are pre-sales  and value-added services, rather than charitable donations (although I'm not in the position to turn those down either!). The perks cover a wide range of rewards, and I'm sure everybody who partakes in the action will find something of value in the options. Here's a brief overview - you can find more information of the 20 (!) different perks in the dedicated section to the right of this page.

I hope that I've tickled your interest and that you will - like my editor - occasionally laugh out loud with the many metaphors that color these otherwise relatively serious topics. Disappointed? Unlikely but...there's a money back guarantee*. If you've got any questions, drop me an email (woutermm@gmail.com). 

*Only the face value of the eBook or equivalent

P.S. The CCTV footage was truthful. I did quit my job as a management consultant, in part to focus on writing. I'll explain it to you later, Mom ;).

If you can't contribute, I would be very grateful if you could share this campaign, join the Facebook page or follow Eloveator on Twitter. By doing this, I can keep you in the loop about this book, and our next project (yes, something's cooking already!).

OK, but who am I ? For real?

Originally, I'm an engineer from Europe's belly-button, Belgium. Previously, I held different marketing functions at L'Oreal in Brussels, and at the Paris Headquarters. After a six-month sabbatical world trip, I crossed the pond to pursue my MBA at London Business School, where I was the official school cartoonist. I admit that there wasn't much competition for that role :). After a traumatic internship in banking, I spent most of my second year researching this book. Upon graduation, I accepted a job as a management consultant at The Boston Consulting Group [BCG] in London, which sharpened my ideas about writing and analysis further. After about a year and a half, it was time to drop the act and start chasing my original dream on a full-time basis - to get ELOVEATOR PITCHES published and continue writing. 
A warm thanks for taking the time to read through this page. I appreciate it that you're helping to bring me one step closer to realizing my "Evil Plan".

And last but not least, a massive shout out to my amazing team for sharing and caring! The unequalled Arjoon Bose, the resourceful visionary Ome Saidi, the creative superstar Yilin Choo (visit her page here for amazing, custom-made jewellery) and the superlative Sonia Bracegirdle (a.k.a. Soniaberry). You guys rooooock!

I think you deserve a treat!

You've hung in there for quite some time - we appreciate it's a lot to read through. As a treat, we'd like to offer you a very last minute of distraction before you make your contribution and choose your perk (no pressure :)). Have a laugh with the bloopers cut of the Official Campaign movie. Bye, for now!

Famous last words
