Besides, love is probably not one of the most complex issues in the world.
Nevertheless, I believe we would be better off if we understood our behavior
in relationships better than we do today –
much better. That is the fundamental mission of this book.Most relationships end. In fact, we're all entitled to precisely one happily-ever-after (best case scenario). All the other love stories will dissolve. This is as true as Nutella and taxes. However, we can learn an awful lot of ending relationships and breakups. Those insights have the power to put us in a much better position next time love comes around!Who am I to write it?Who am I and why should you consider funding and/or reading this book while Netflix has many years’
worth of great series to watch? I’m not a middle-aged woman with a decades-long
career in relationship counselling. I’m not Dr. Phil or a been-around-the-block pickup artist. In short, I’m not an expert.
I’m just a thirty-something guy with a deep interest in social dynamics and a
tendency to escalate commitments. I started researching the subject over two
years ago. Upon graduation from my MBA, I took a job in a top-tier management consulting
firm – one of those corporate brands that earn you a lot of brownie points on
LinkedIn. This turned out to be not entirely fit for the purpose of deepening my
understanding of love. No sh#t, Sherlock!
However, under the cobwebs of analysis-paralysis, I discovered a useful tool
seasoned consultants apply when facing challenges: systematically break down
bigger problems into bite size pieces. Now that’s something that resonates with
me. That's the approach I've adopted in my quest to understand love. In the
process, I’ve picked the brains of academic experts in social and evolutionary
psychology, communication & conflict sciences, emotional intelligence, and more. With a
fine-tooth comb, I’ve gone through the work of escort girls, divorce lawyers,
second-grade self-help gurus and first-grade self-improvement scholars. Gradually, I started to connect some
dots. And although I cannot tell you what to do, I do have to share with you what
I know.What to
expect of Eloveator Pitches?Eloveator Pitches consists of two parts and seven chapters. Together, we cover all the different steps of a relationship, from before the first glance to beyond the last goodbye.If you want to learn more, please discover what to expect from this book by clicking here (this link will take you to a Dropbox PDF with a four-page description of the content). The extended table of content can be found here.  Otherwise, here's is the 60 second elevator pitch of Eloveator Pitches. Chapter 1 [BE] tackles the individual characteristics that are relevant for our love life. Brain design, temperament, character, values and needs are all important components in our relationship behavior. The following chapter [LIKE], addresses interpersonal dynamics, like sex, attraction and limerence, in detail. These processes are often the foreplay of [LOVE], which is the third chapter. We identify key attributes that are required for loving relationships. Ever thought about intimacy, commitment and trust in a business-like way?  Now is the time. In chapter 4 [SUSTAIN], we describe which elements make love last.  This is a consultant's take on great communication, conflict management, individuality, fun, and a bunch of other tricks of the trade.
 Starting from chapter 5 [DOUBT], the relationship begins going downhill. Maybe surprisingly, there is more structure to the mayhem than we'd expect. In an interesting dynamic of action and reaction, the once loving partners alienate each other at increasing speed, until a tipping point is reached... In chapter 6 [SPLIT], we kick the tires of the actual breakup and its consequences. I also outline "Project Breakup 2.0", which contains a boatload of suggestions to avoid screwing up while breaking up. We all suck at breaking up, and for valid reasons! In the last chapter [COPE], I address the booby traps and sensations of the newly-single experience, and also debunk some myths around singleness. We'll finish by highlighting the mistakes to avoid in the next relationship if we want to have a shot at our happily-ever-after!

What's so special about this book?


1. First of all - me. Or better, my perspective. Eloveator Pitches is written by a 30-something male foot soldier of
love, not by an authoritative general observing the trenches from a
distance (e.g. a retired relationship counselor looking to monetize her experience). This makes the book more accessible and relevant for younger targets, both women and men. For men, this is maybe the first book in its genre that takes a rain check on the trademark sticky toffee pudding tone associated with traditional relationship and/or self-improvement literature. Opting out? Know that love has more nuances than cricket and chess combined! For women, the views of a male author on love can provide some refreshing perspectives on relationships. Maybe I'm wrong, but there is only one way to find out...



2. Eloveator Pitches is a short book. I made it deliberately
compact because your time is precious and I respect that. At the start of each section, the read time in minutes is announced. You can chop up your reading, and you'll always know what to expect. The absolute fastest way through this book is to skip
straight to the 60 second elevator pitches you'll find at the end of each
chapter. Eloveator Pitches is jam-packed with insights the way a Snickers bar is packed with calories. All 200+ pages (~65 000 words) count - sort of.   

3. Eloveator Pitches is hand-illustrated with more than two dozen of graphs and charts that, in another life, could have been used for real management consulting presentations. Besides clarifying key concepts, it also gives a quick look into what management consultants keep themselves busy with. Here are some actual examples from the book.





4.  This must be the first book ever written that comes with an entire 8+ hour Spotify sound track custom-made for each of the (sub-) chapters. The aim is
two-fold. Firstly, this music can set an appropriate mood for reading a particular section. Secondly, most billboard charts and movie theatres are swamped
with lyrics and stories that are as truthful or realistic as the average
mascara commercial. Nonetheless, they impact our belief system around love and
relationships in ways more important than we'd like to admit. While reading, you can compare the information in the book with what you hear in the songs, and spot the inconsistencies. Bottom line, this play list is entirely optional, but
pledges to provide a more immersive experience. Because you've given me already some of your time, you can find it here, entirely for free. It matches the detailed table of contents seamlessly.
5. The approach. We're not here for a quick buck. We're in it for the long run. We've gone to great lengths to make this book as grand as it could be. We've put equal care in the support campaign. Take a break from the reading and check out our latest support video that has gone viral online (3k views in 24 hours). And it's only 2 minutes long.

What will the funds be used for?
The first objective - after two years of intense work - is to share my views with the broadest possible audience. This requires a finished product and a limited marketing budget. Eloveator Pitches went through a first round of professional editing prior to this campaign, financed by my savings, and recovering some of that investment through pre-sales would be welcome. 


Furthermore, I will need to fund the design of a professional book cover, final editing and the print of the first batch. I'll also need an author's website. These first objectives require about $9000.
When the campaign reaches $12500, I can work towards a hardcover version, with colored graphics. If we reach $15000 together, I'll do the necessary to have Eloveator Pitches made available in audiobook format.
And I promise, if the campaign reaches $20000+, I will organize a book launch party in June (In London) where all the donors get VIP treatment. I'll add additional stretch goals to share the love if our efforts really make the dollars go through the roof... Stay tuned!
Keep in mind that all pledges are subject to Indiegogo and/or Paypal fees which amount to about 10-12% of the total funds. I'm also covering the production and shipping costs of the perks you'll discover if you keep reading.
So what? Now what?
Well, this is the moment when I turn the mic to you... As you'll see in the perks, the contributions that I'm shooting for are pre-sales  and value-added services, rather than charitable donations (although I'm not in the position to turn those down either!). The perks cover a wide range of rewards, and I'm sure everybody who partakes in the action will find something of value in the options. Here's a brief overview - you can find more information of the 20 (!) different perks in the dedicated section to the right of this page.
I hope that I've tickled your interest and that you will - like my editor - occasionally laugh out loud with the many metaphors that color these otherwise relatively serious topics. Disappointed? Unlikely but...there's a money back guarantee*. If you've got any questions, drop me an email (woutermm@gmail.com). 
*Only the face value of the eBook or equivalent
P.S. The CCTV footage was truthful. I did quit my job as a management consultant, in part to focus on writing. I'll explain it to you later, Mom ;).
If you can't contribute, I would be very grateful if you could share this campaign, join the Facebook page or follow Eloveator on Twitter. By doing this, I can keep you in the loop about this book, and our next project (yes, something's cooking already!).

OK, but who am I ? For real?



Originally, I'm an engineer from Europe's belly-button, Belgium. Previously, I held different marketing functions at L'Oreal in Brussels, and at the Paris Headquarters. After a six-month sabbatical world trip, I crossed the pond to pursue my MBA at London Business School, where I was the official school cartoonist. I admit that there wasn't much competition for that role :). After a traumatic internship in banking, I spent most of my second year researching this book. Upon graduation, I accepted a job as a management consultant at The Boston Consulting Group [BCG] in London, which sharpened my ideas about writing and analysis further. After about a year and a half, it was time to drop the act and start chasing my original dream on a full-time basis - to get ELOVEATOR PITCHES published and continue writing. 
A warm thanks for taking the time to read through this page. I appreciate it that you're helping to bring me one step closer to realizing my "Evil Plan".

And last but not least, a massive shout out to my amazing team for sharing and caring! The unequalled Arjoon Bose, the resourceful visionary Ome Saidi, the creative superstar Yilin Choo (visit her page here for amazing, custom-made jewellery) and the superlative Sonia Bracegirdle (a.k.a. Soniaberry). You guys rooooock!
I think you deserve a treat!

You've hung in there for quite some time - we appreciate it's a lot to read through. As a treat, we'd like to offer you a very last minute of distraction before you make your contribution and choose your perk (no pressure :)). Have a laugh with the bloopers cut of the Official Campaign movie. Bye, for now!





Famous last words

story:
Click here to keep up to date on the campaign and get something cool for free!


Not your normal self help book or author

I help people get better.

You might be an entrepreneur growing your business.  You might want to get in shape. You might just want to manage your time better.

My ability to do all this comes from my experiences in the military and specifically the US Army Special Forces  Green Berets.  The Special Forces Green Berets are known as masters at getting things done. By normal standards, some of our missions would be deemed impossible. Often times we were expected to operate far behind enemy lines with limited resources. Our  training gave us principles and techniques in being extremely effective and doing more with less.

Throughout the years I developed a philosophy and methodology that you can use to create amazing results.  You have to set your mind to it and work hard, but almost anything is possible if you follow the steps I teach.


Here's your chance to get copies of my best work to help you Get ER Done and support this campaign to produce the 2nd edition of Get ER Done.

Go to the right -->> and pick a great perk and contribute now.


Time for a reset and readjustment

In 2011, I wrote my first book "Get ER Done - The Green Beret Guide to Productivity." The book had good success with 28 of 29 positive reviews (you can't please everyone.)

Since then I have developed my writing producing more books - "Train Your Brain", "Improvise, Adapt, Overcome", "How to Get the Book Inside Your Head Inside a Book" and others. 

After awhile everything needs a re-look and rejuvenation. We are relaunching "Get ER Done" with a new cover, a new format and updated content to appeal to a larger audience and get our tips, tactics and strategies out to as many people as possible.


    The Secret of the Special Forces

    In the Special Forces, Get Er Done was simply a way of life. One of Special Forces’ mottos is “improvise, adapt, overcome.” The concept is that we would take the situation as it was. There wasn’t time or energy to waste on bemoaning what it should be. We would then take the skills we had, learn very quickly, or could purchase and get er done. The end result was most often success. The process might not follow the original plan. Because we approached things with the mindset of success we stacked the deck and found the resources to make it happen.

    In reality, us in the super achieving, get er done Special Forces have the same amount of time in their days as anyone. Our secret is that we learned techniques to make ourselves highly effective. I shared ten of the best techniques that people could use to get them started getting things done quickly and effectively. I made it an easy, quick read knowing that the last thing everyone needs is to be faced with a fifty page chapter on the benefits of goal setting, or a whole book on making to-do lists. 

    What people need are techniques that they can use quickly and get instant results from. The answers were out there, but more often they took a lot of sweat and pain to learn them the hard way. Over the years in my training I came across techniques that worked for me and others and kept them in my “mental toolbox.” I am making it super easy for people and giving them the tools to Get Er Done.

    Get Er Done – The Green Beret Guide to Productivity gives principles from which everyone will get amazing results and find that they are performing at levels never thought possible. It is a simple, easy-to-read system that gives a workable, proven list of things to put in action, right now and have positive results in getting things done. Some will fit an individual personality, some won’t. It is for each person to pick from and apply them immediately. 

    There is no heavy reading and no long dialogue to struggle through. Just useful information that to use instantly to take total control of your life. You’ll see results from day one, and by the end of a month you will wonder why getting things done ever seemed to be a problem.

    Go to the right -->> and pick a great perk and contribute now.


    Keep Calm and Get ER Done

    I have had many, many emails telling me about the great results they have gotten after putting in place the techniques from the book.

    Here is a testimonial from a reader:

    We all have busy lives; work, kids, families – and it seem these days that nothing ever gets any easier or slower.  Last weekend for me was no exception.

    A childhood friend was getting married, and had invited us to her wedding.  We wanted to go, but the time restraints, and the costs to move a family of 4 back and forth in one weekend was beginning to mount up, so it was decided I would travel alone for this trip.

    The trick was, this had to be fast, and accurate, and the wedding was in New York, and we live in North Carolina.  The entire trip was going to take place in 28 hours!  I had one day of leave, and had to be back on duty Monday morning at 0800. 

    I would fly into NYC Saturday morning, get my rental car, and drive to the Poughkeepsie area (90 miles away) where I grew up.

    I would go see a few old sites specific to my childhood, (high school, the track I used to train on, the old house I grew up in, the farm where my first job was, the old firehouse where I got my start in Firefighting, etc...)  Then head to the church for the wedding, then to the reception site that was 50 miles away, after the reception, go to my hotel and then spend the night, then fly home out of NYC in the morning.

    On top of that, I really wanted to get to the WTC and see the Freedom Tower and memorial.  I only had Sunday before I went home to do this, and I really wanted to since it had been completed after my last visit to NYC in 2008.

    This trip needed to be planned out to the hour.  I had to allow for traffic, food, gas, tolls, and the incidentals that would or could fall in line.  I knew that if I didn’t plan this out, something would be missed – and I definitely couldn’t miss my flight back home!

    I remembered reading in Mike Martel’s Book Get Er Done the format for Backward Planning.  I decided if there was every anytime that could benefit from using this method, this would be the weekend to do it!

    So dressed in a suit, carrying my one lone bag – a GR1 backpack from GORUCK, I arrived at the airport in Raleigh NC for my 0630hr flight on Saturday morning, and headed north.  From that moment, to the moment I was wheels up on Sunday to come home, I was able to hit every single time hack, and still have time to spare on the end before I scheduled myself to fly home!

    Walking out to the car on Sunday morning after my flight home, I replayed how fast the previous 28 hours had been.  I had accomplished so much, gotten to see and experience all that I wanted to, and was not rushed in the least due to the use of Backward Planning.  Thanks Mike!!

    Andrew Meier is a 15 year veteran of the City of Raleigh Fire Department in Raleigh NC, where he currently holds the rank of Captain.  He is a husband, and father to 2 young and very busy girls who keep him on the go!

    Here's a couple more:

    “What a great read! Mike does a great job of taking his years of Green Beret training and military skills into real life practical how to’s for succeeding in life. He translates the highly effective and intense training of the US military Green Berets and applies it to every day civilian steps and systems to help people achieve their dreams.” 
    Tom Haupt—Leadership Expert, Motivational Speaker and Best-selling author of TIME-OUT! Winning Strategies for Playing a Bigger Game in Life

    Hello, I don't often review books although I read many of them. This book was great because their was no fluff. It took 30 to 45 minutes to read, and everything was applicable to life, especially if you use a little creativity. I have read mostly psychology books and everything in here fit right in with what I know about psychology and neuroplasticity, but there was no explanation as to why it works in the book. I guess there is no need to explain why it works if it works, especially in an organization such as the military, where efficiency is key, and there is no room for theory. Great value, especially the kindle edition. I thought the title was cheesy, "get er done", but I was pleasantly surprised, the book gets er done...quickly. 

    C. Groves, Amazon Reader


    Go to the right -->> and pick a great perk and contribute now.


    Perks

    Look to the right of your screen and check out all of the awesome items available as  a token of appreciation for your generosity.  (Please allow 6 to 8 weeks after the end of the campaign for delivery.)

    Here's a description of the Green Beret Productivity Package -a collection of my best productivity package



    • The best selling book Get ER Done - The Green Beret Guide to Productivity -  This is a complete guide of 10 strategies that I have condensed from my many years of Special Forces training on how to get mission done no matter the odds against us. You can take these lessons and apply them to your life and make more money, feel better, have great relationships and live an outstanding life.

    • The book Train Your Brain - Achieve the Green Beret Way  - This book explains why you don't do the things you say you are going to do and how to "train your brain" to work with you instead of against you.
    • The book Improvise, Adapt and Overcome  - This is a collection of my best stories and posts that will provide you with inspiration and direct tips to get er done.
    • The book - Mastering Your To Do List - How to use checklists or to do lists to help you get more things done, easily.
    • The Getting Organized Field Manual  -  A 68 page book full of easy and simple strategies to getting (and staying) organized.
    • The book Your Guerrilla Sales Army -  If you do any sales, you will want this book on how to develop "an army" of people who will help you break sales records and make more money and
    • The book How to Get the Book Inside Your Head Inside a Book- Ever thought about writing a book? Here is how I did it for almost next to nothing and ended up selling thousands of my books. (Here's a secret - most self published authors sell less than a hundred of their books)
    •  The Green Beret Daily Planner - A daily checklist to help you get more done over the course of a day than thought possible.

    Go to the right -->> and pick a great perk and contribute now.


    Where's My Money Going?

    Good question  Funds from your generous donations will be used to cover the many different and varied costs associated with the relaunch of my book. These costs include things like:

    • Copy and  Content Editing

    • Printing

    • Shipping

    • Cover Design and Cover Art

    • Internal Design and Layout

    • Marketing and Publicity 

    • Traveling, Speaking Engagements, and Events to Help Promote the Book

    • Additional costs associated with self-publishing such as editing programs, software, website revisions, etc. 

    Got No Cash? You Can Still Help! 

    I know what it's like to be on the short end. Trust me on that. 

    So, if you truly cannot afford to help financially, you can still help by making yourself heard. Spread the word about this campaign to anyone and everyone you know. If you are part of a large family or big group email list, share it with all of them! 

    Tell all of your friends to share this. If you don't have any friends, I'm sorry about that. You should really go out and get some. Hey - you know a great way to get friends? Buy them stuff. Like an autographed copy of my book, for example. A simple donation of $25 will get you that, and then you will have a new friend. See, I told you this book is going to help people. 


    Obstacles

    There are always obstacles that come up during a project. Be rest assured I will improvise, adapt, and overcome my way around them. My team is working diligently to hit our deadline right on the nose. We all know that the unforeseen can happen, but you can rest assured that we will move heaven and earth to make certain that you receive the promised 'Thank You' gifts.  As a supporter you will always be keep informed of our progress.

    Go to the right -->> and pick a great perk and contribute now.

story:
Bok svima! Ja sam Vesna, i upravo sam završila svoju knjigu „Djeca znaju, i točka“. Od ovih 37 priča i 3 pjesme:

  • One istinite nastajale su tako da sam pričala s roditeljima i djecom o njihovim dogodovštinama i mudrolijama
  • One izmišljene su se gotovo same zabilježile, kad sam dopustila mašti da se razmaše
  • Svaka priča ima i svoj neponovljiv crtež by Leon Keserović, dečko s brojnim teškoćama ali jako bogatim unutarnjim svijetom
  • Svaka ima svoju poruku
  • Moja kćer Mia ih obožava, a naša kujica Didi uživa kad je Mia vesela (obje su naslikane na naslovnici)

Ovo je moja druga knjiga. Prvu knjigu „Fine nijanse“ (tako mi se zove i blog na Facebooku) objavila sam 2015. godine, i reakcija čitatelja bila je fenomenalna, van svakog mog očekivanja.

Financirala sam je sama i izdala u vlastitoj nakladi, što je vrlo težak put, ali radovao me svaki korak u njenom nastajanju. Ovu si ne mogu financijski priuštiti pa je želim financirati pomoću crowdfundinga jer vjerujem u dobrotu i snagu ljudi!

 

ŠTO JE VAŽNO

Nije važno trčiš li brzo
ili ti korak nije posao lak.

Učiš li dobro
ili ti je teško biti dobar đak.

Nije jako bitno ako pričati možeš lako
ili pričaš znakovima, a to ne zna baš svatko.

Jesi li bucko ili mršavko, ni to važno nije.
Važno je ono što u tvom se srcu krije.

Nije važno ni to, jesi li veliki ili mali.
Važno je da tvoja ljubav svjetlo u drugima pali.

Jer, jako je važno da svatko dobro shvati
da vrlina je drugome svoju ruku dati.

Ako je netko različit i zbog tog mu pomoći treba
on nas tako uči što je važno ispod neba.

Srce koje kuca za ljubav i za druge
da nikada više suza i tuge ne bude.

Uz malo truda, druge razumjeti teško nije,
a pravo se bogatstvo u svakoj duši krije.

Zato otkrijmo zajedno, kako jedno dijete može da nas uči,
pa otiđimo mudriji i teži za kilu ljubavi, svojoj kući.


Evo osvrta jedne od najpoznatije dječje spisateljice, Silvije Šesto:

Različak priča i tu i tamo koje pjesme Vesne Ferluge Antić „Djeca znaju, i točka“,  s ilustracijama Leona Keserovića, svjedoči toplinu i neposrednost kojom je autorica u stanju popratiti svakodnevne teme, nalazeći u svakoj životnu mudrost i istinu, koja je, sama po sebi, koliko samozatajna toliko i djelotvorna, životna, jaka, sjajna.

Čitanje zbirke postiže efekt šetnje livadom prepunom raznolika dobra bilja. Na bilo kojem kraju, a koji može biti i početak i sredina neiscrpnog autorskog beskraja, dočekuje nas jedno iskustvo poput cvijeta kojeg ćemo promatrati/čitati i ponovno mu se vraćati.

Tematski kreirajući priče kao svakodnevne zapise zbilje, događaja, dječjih upita i pokušaja edukacije u kojima baš uvijek zaključujemo kako su one naivne, dječje, prvotne misli spoj svjetova, odrasla i neodrasla, autorica pripušta krijesnicama da bljesnu i tamo gdje mi odrasli ponekad olako prelazimo preko prekrasne, pružene i tako jednostavne mudrosti. 

Životnost i nepresušna energija iskrenosti donosi nam beskrajnu ljepotu života i onda kad su nam na putu do te ljepote noge otežale, put neprohodan.

U mnogim će se pričama čitateljstvo pronaći, mnoge ponovno iščitavati, a ono što je sasvim izvjesno, u ovoj će zbirci uživati podjednako veliki i mali. Jer mudri veliki čitaju malima, a mudri mali propituju velike dajući istovremeno najsnažniji odgovor zbog čega je život dar, skupocjen i nenaplativ.

story:
Synopsis

Echo Wells finds herself the target of multiple con men. They're not only out to find out how much she knows about their long-running operation, but also to retrieve the ill-gotten funds that remain a secret...even to her. Soon Echo discovers a maelstrom of trouble brewing all around her causing her to lose her breath. In the middle of it all she finds that those close to her are responsible for the moment her life unraveled but she also finds love in an unlikely place. Refusing to drown in a sea of secrets and lies Echo is finally, Coming Up for Air.

What We Need & What You Get

This book is need of editing and proofreading. The goal is $875 which would cover the costs of having it professionally edited and proofread. After avid searching we have found two candidates for the job. 

As a supporter of this mission you will receive much gratitude, and some of you will even receive FREE product for your generosity!

Reviews

A few privileged souls have already read the pages of this upcoming book. Here is what they said about it:

"Never have I read a story so eloquently written. Readers will not only enjoy the suspense and authentic romance but they will appreciate the poetic way in which every description is delivered. Now this is literature." - Miasha Essence Best Selling Author of Diary of a Mistress, Whe n the Cake is Made, and Secret Society Trilogy.

"The poetically written work of Coming Up for Air by D. Sean stirred all emotions. This book is a fast and exciting read and an incredible journey of the many unexpected turns life can throw at you. You will laugh and definitely cry as many secrets are revealed. As the saying goes, "What is done in the dark, will come to the light." And Sean does a wonderful job to entice you to the very end!" -Anonymous

Excerpt

Seth and I were driving out to Mountain View to go hiking. I’d never been hiking before, so the closest thing I had to hiking boots were a pair of work boots that Skylar had bought while we were renovating our condo and he’d insisted I wear them. I swiftly threw my hair up into a sloppy ponytail and dashed out the door, keys and phone in hand. Did I brush my teeth? I cupped my hands over my mouth to smell my breath. No. I ran back inside, did a quick brush, grabbed a stick of gum for added defense and was out the door again. 

“Hi,” I said breathlessly, giving Seth a quick peck on the lips when I’d stepped off the elevator. “So sorry to keep you waiting.”

“Don’t worry about it. It was worth it, you look great.” 

“Thanks.” 

“Are you ready for this?” he asked.

“Not really, but let’s go before I come to my senses.”  We laughed lightly. 

Seth promised to take it easy on me, so he’d picked an easy trail for us to hike. I was still worried, because his brand of easy and mine could be vastly different. He told me the name of the trail, but I could hardly pronounce it properly. Every time he said it I heard: Eric Estrada. So I personally dubbed it the Estrada Trail. He thought that was hilarious and laughed, hard. He was like the awkwardly amused. Like the one person who finds a joke hilarious and goes to bits laughing, while everyone else gives a short chuckle and moves on. He’s that guy.

By the time we got to the trail my nervousness was apparent. I was inherently clumsy and he wanted to take me somewhere that would, no doubt, exhibit that particular trait of mine. Admittedly, this hike was easy...for Seth. He glided along the path like we were on an escalator, while I fumbled alongside him. It wasn’t all bad, there were moments of enjoyment. He even packed a backpack full of snacks. He also considered my love for sweets and packed chocolate covered energy bars. He was very proud of himself and I appreciated his thoughtfulness. Unfortunately for me, this thoughtful little bar tasted like chocolate covered dirt. I suffered through it. I didn’t want to discredit his efforts. A few hours later, sweaty and tired—I was anyway—the hike came to an end. Seth looked like he’d only taken a walk to the mailbox. 

We went to a tiny restaurant nearby for a late lunch or an early dinner, depending on perspective. I couldn’t believe how hungry I was. Seth was in awe of my ravenous appetite. He was staring with a slight grin. We’d been out to eat many times, but I was never so hungry or careless about how I was perceived. 

“What?” I asked, swallowing. Was he even eating or just creepily watching me?

“Nothing.” He smiled. “I’ve never seen you eat so much. That hike must have really taken a lot out of you.” No kidding. I thought to myself before responding aloud.

“It certainly did and I forgot to eat breakfast this morning.” 

“That explains it.” I smiled, noticing that he had not eaten very much at all.

“You’re not hungry?” I asked. I doubt if he’d even broken a light sweat under his shirt, whereas I was certain he could probably smell me from across the table. Being the gentleman that he was, he’d never reveal that to me. 

“Not really, but please don’t let that deter you.” 

In other words: go on, eat like a pig, while I watch in feigned appreciation. I was suddenly self-conscious and pretended to be finally full. In truth, I could have put away a few more bites easily. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We realize that everyone isn't in a position to contribute monetarily, but you can still be of help. Spread the word! Share the link. Keep a lookout for works by this budding author D. Sean.

story:
Money from this campaign will first be used to pay for the products, the book cover we'll have designed. Mom and Dad had one bill that wasn’t paid by the insurance (a little over $1,000.00 to the nursing home), we’ll use the rest to advertise so that more people will be able to read the story, so that it can touch them.

Dad fell on October 18th at home while doing some work in the yard. It was like he fell out of a second story window, landing head first oh his asphalt driveway. This is the story of how he survived, even when his Doctor said there was no hope. The story of a miracle and the hope that God gave us when there didn’t seemed to be any hope. It is the story of our family, how we pulled together and through prayer and God’s help became closer than we had ever been.

So far (without pictures) the book is about 50,000 words or a hundred pages. We will include images, actual reports and videos that will help prove to those that may be skeptical that God is Awesome.

The goal of our book is to bring hope to those that might have lost it, and help others to find Jesus.

The reason behind this campaign is to see how many people want a Hardback version of the book, also it is an opportunity to get your book signed by Dad (James Hamblin).

Other Ways You Can Help

  1. Share this url.
  2. If you have a Facebook page – go to ours – share the post we made about an Indiegogo campaign.
  3. Continue to pray for us!
  4. Buy more than one copy. These will make wonderful Christmas presents for your friends and family.

If you buy a paperback or hardback copy of the book - your name (if you wish) will be included in a thank you section at the end of the story.

If you buy a hardback copy - you can include a message to Dad (a sentence or two) that will be included after the thank you section.

Risks and Challenges

The rough draft of the book is complete. We just need to get a cover together, edit it, add the pictures and then publish. We already have five books published on Amazon and are sure that we can get this done.

story:
This book is a Christian pregnancy journal that guide's you through your pregnancy both spiritually and medically. In this book, you can read about the week-by-week developments of your own body and that of your baby. There is a daily prayer and Bible verse that directly applies to where you are in your pregnancy and room for you to write your own experiences and for any photographs or mementos. This is not just any Christian pregnancy journal but your very own PERSONAL pregnancy journal.

Here is an excerpt of week one of the book, please remember that the book is still going through editing and excuse any grammar mistakes.


About Me

When I worked as a maternity nurse, I assisted many women during
labor and delivery. I have always loved those beautiful big tummies, and each 
birth was special and touching. Many times I wondered how I would experience my own pregnancy and delivery. Thankfully, one day a pregnancy test showed a very clear pink dot! 

I was awestruck by the life inside me, and I wanted to let my unborn baby experience the love of God as I had. From the moment I found out I was pregnant I wanted to pray for my baby but sadly could not find any books or magazines that could teach me how to do that so I began to search the Bible for relevant stories and verses for each stage of the baby’s development and I found many! I used all the Bible verses I found in my prayers and decided to write my pregnancy experience down. Since the prayers and journaling helped me so much throughout my pregnancy I decided that I wanted to create a journal that would combine both the medical and practical with the spiritual. The pregnancy journal "BabySweet" is my gift to all the beautiful women who would like to actively involve God in their pregnancy.


Goals & Perks

The goal is to raise $3,900 to cover the cost's to publish the book in the USA. The cost's include, but are not limited to, professional editing, printing, and distribution. None of these funds will be used to pay us, the editors.  


Contribution Perks

Thank you for thinking about contributing and supporting my project and campaign. As a sign of my appreciation there are many different contribution perks that you can choose from.

$15 As a sign of my great appreciation you will receive a personal thank you note from me to you in your email.

$25 You will receive a personal thank you note from me to you in your email and a shout out on the "BabySweet" Facebook page.

$40 I hope you love the feel of a hard cover book as much as I do! With this perk you will receive the a hard cover copy of the "BabySweet" book once published.

$60 You will receive a personally signed hard cover copy of the "BabySweet" book once published.

$100 Thank you so much for your contribution, as a sign of my gratitude you will receive all of the above.


Other Ways You Can Help!

Thank you so much for taking the time to read about my project. Even if you can’t contribute, but you've enjoyed what you've read and seen, there are still many other ways you can help! One of the biggest way to help so to get the word out about this campaign. Please share my campaign and Facebook page, link underneath,  with your friends, family, church and even your co-works! 

Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/BabySweet-779831478827231/?ref=hl

There is a daily prayer and Bible verse that directly applies to where you are in your pregnancy and room for you to write your own experiences and for any photographs or mementos. This is not just any Christian pregnancy journal but your very own PERSONAL pregnancy journal.
Here is an excerpt of week one of the book, please remember that the book is still going through editing and excuse any grammar mistakes.





About Me

When I worked as a maternity nurse, I assisted many women duringlabor and delivery. I have always loved those beautiful big tummies, and each birth was special and touching. Many times I wondered how I would experience my own pregnancy and delivery. Thankfully, one day a pregnancy test showed a very clear pink dot! 
I was awestruck by the life inside me, and I wanted to let my unborn baby experience the love of God as I had. From the moment I found out I was pregnant I wanted to pray for my baby but sadly could not find any books or magazines that could teach me how to do that so I began to search the Bible for relevant stories and verses for each stage of the baby’s development and I found many! I used all the Bible verses I found in my prayers and decided to write my pregnancy experience down. Since the prayers and journaling helped me so much throughout my pregnancy I decided that I wanted to create a journal that would combine both the medical and practical with the spiritual. The pregnancy journal "BabySweet" is my gift to all the beautiful women who would like to actively involve God in their pregnancy.


Goals & Perks
The goal is to raise $3,900 to cover the cost's to publish the book in the USA. The cost's include, but are not limited to, professional editing, printing, and distribution. None of these funds will be used to pay us, the editors.  

Contribution Perks
 Thank you for thinking about contributing and supporting my project and campaign. As a sign of my appreciation there are many different contribution perks that you can choose from.
$15 As a sign of my great appreciation you will receive a personal thank you note from me to you in your email.
$25 You will receive a personal thank you note from me to you in your email and a shout out on the "BabySweet" Facebook page.
$40 I hope you love the feel of a hard cover book as much as I do! With this perk you will receive the a hard cover copy of the "BabySweet" book once published.
$60 You will receive a personally signed hard cover copy of the "BabySweet" book once published.
$100 Thank you so much for your contribution, as a sign of my gratitude you will receive all of the above.


    Other Ways You Can Help! Thank you so much for taking the time to read about my project. Even if you can’t contribute, but you've enjoyed what you've read and seen, there are still many other ways you can help! One of the biggest way to help so to get the word out about this campaign. Please share my campaign and Facebook page, link underneath,  with your friends, family, church and even your co-works! 
Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/BabySweet-779831478827231/?ref=hl

story:
What?

A look at four generations of African-Americans; their lives, loves, passions, food, victories and tragedies told in part from the perspective of a Raven that falls in love with a young slave so much she wants to become a human girl to be with him.

The book follows the lives of several characters, Among them Henna Brown; hair styling healer, wife, mother and transformer of her own life. 

Meet her by  reading an excerpt here.

When?

My goal is to have the writing of the book completed by December so that it reaches your hands with all the fine intentions in which I have written it by February 2015.

$5 Donations receive a downloadable pdf of my 58 page poetry & photography collection.


Where?

The book will then be available globally across the full range of e-book reading devices (Kindle, iBook, etc.) As a hardcopy via Amazon and other online bookstores.

Who?

I am a wife, mother, artist, poet and writer. Blackbird's Theory of Beauty is my youngest baby. I’ve chosen to self-publish, maintaining creative control and staying loyal to my characters is important to me.  Self-publishing also fits in line with my overall approach to living: DYI.  I am extremely passionate about this book and want to present it to my readers the way I’d present you with a plate of food if you were eating at my house; with my own two hands and with love.  

Why?

Holding a book, running my hands over the cover art, relishing the words, being enlightened, amused, entertained, having the pages become dog eared from so much handling and rereading has been therapy for my spiritual fractures, healing for the wounds inflicted to my soul and a joy to my heart all of my life. Those books live in my mind as good friends. My hope is that this book will serve as a friend, a companion and encouragement to anyone who has ever been lonely, unhappily married, desperate, sick, hungry, in debt or who has felt insecure, over-weight, under-weight, weak, poor, ugly, competitive, hateful, empty, unloved, overlooked or unseen.

How?

This is where you come in.  Indiegogo is a wonderful platform for this self-publishing author to collect advance payments to guarantee the funding necessary for the production of a beautiful and professional book that can hold it’s own against any book produced by the big publishing houses. If you believe in Blackbird'd Theory of Beauty’s journey to publication I am asking for funding to help with these things:

•  Developmental Editing

  • •  Proofreading

    •  Allow Printing In Bulk To Bring Down The Per-Book Costs

    •  Obtaining Isbn Numbers,

    •  Paying Registration Fees

    •  Additional Costs Associated With Getting Listed In Various Online  Bookstores

    •  Promotion, Such As Google, Adwords, Etc.

    •  Envelopes, Packing Materials, Postage

    •  Extra Review Copies

    I will be laying out (typesetting) the book myself.  I will also be designing and formatting the book, as well as promoting it myself.  The book will be available as a hardcopy and e-book. 

Thank you for taking the time to view my campaign and please keep in mind that Every Donation Matters And Is Much Appreciated!  Your donations will be used to offset living expenses, Indiegogo related fees and sponsor rewards but most of all, the professional development and completion of Blackbird's Theory of Beauty on schedule. Every single person who contributes to the success of the book will be listed on my website as a supporter and all perks will be shipped out beginning February 1st.

PLEASE help me get the word out by sharing with your friends and family if you believe this novel should live!  I'm so excited to bring to readers a story from my heart with joy, with love, with humor and the best of intentions! I'm also excited to offer some very cool and exciting perks!

story:
"Chez Milo & Fine" est un micro-café de 410 pc (40m2) qui ouvrira ses portes mi-janvier 2015 au 1123, rue Beaubien Est, au cœur de la Petite Patrie à Montréal. Originaires de Bretagne, on veut avant tout partager avec vous notre amour pour les spécialités bretonnes et vous permettre de les découvrir autrement! 

Du mardi au samedi, on vous promet une atmosphère simple et chaleureuse…comme si vous étiez à la maison!!!                                                                                                                                       

                                                               1986

C'est à 3 ans que j’ai été adopté et que je me suis fait adopter par la Bretagne. De là, sont nées des découvertes et des rencontres, notamment avec Milo & Fine, deux amis qui sont devenus pour moi des grands-parents de cœur. Ils m’ont accueilli dans leur ferme pour y passer bon nombre de mes vacances avec leurs petits enfants. J’y ai des souvenirs mémorables de journées de rassemblements familiaux dans le sous-sol de la maison où régnait une atmosphère de crêpes.

                                                       


2011

Arrivée à Montréal et installation dans le quartier de la Petite-Patrie

                                           


2014

9 journées de kiosques de bouffe dans le cadre  d’événements montréalais : Week-Ends du Monde, Fête des Enfants, Restaurant Day, Souks de Gouin et l'Ecofête !!! De belles rencontres, des rires, du partage et surtout beaucoup de plaisir!

               


2015

Le projet se concrétise avec l’ouverture du café au 1123, rue Beaubien Est!

                                   

       

  

                                        

Que ce soit pour un café, un déjeuner, un lunch sur place ou à emporter, il y en a pour tous les goûts! Nous souhaitons avant tout proposer des produits faits maison, que ce soit pour les saveurs sucrées comme salées. Tout le processus de fabrication est fait dans la cuisine du café. 

La Galette-saucisse:  le "Hot-Dog Breton"

                                                    

La robiquette, la vraie « galette-saucisse », est un élément incontournable de la gastronomie populaire en Haute-Bretagne. Grâce à sa simplicité et son aspect bon marché, c'est un en-cas de prédilection lors des manifestations sportives, des marchés, des kermesses, des fes­tivals et des réunions associatives.  Elle est bien souvent arrosée d’un verre de cidre.

Convivial, ce met festif se mange avec les mains! Il se compose traditionnellement d’une galette de blé noir froide pliée en deux dans laquelle se love une saucisse de porc aussi chaude que croquante! Nature ou relevée de moutarde ou ketchup, elle peut être agrémentée de fromage fondu. 


Les autres saveurs

"Chez Milo & Fine", c'est aussi la possibilité de savourer de nombreux autres produits traditionnels tels que le caramel au beurre salé, le far breton, les palets, les galettes de sarrasin, les crêpes de froment, le kir breton etc.
Parce que notre créativité culinaire est en constante évolution, et que nous aimons la partager, vous aurez l'occasion de les apprécier lors de nos 5 à 7 "Découvertes" les jeudis et vendredis soirs!

          


 Des choix éco-responsables

Dans sa démarche de proposer aux clients un maximum de produits frais et de qualité, "Chez Milo & Fine" fait le choix de s’approvisionner avec des produits frais et de saison,tout en  privilégiant les producteurs locaux.

                                             

                            

 Nous privilégions un maximum d'emballages maisons et écologiques, notamment en proposant des thermos et  la mise en place de consignes sur les gobelets à café réutilisables, les pots de caramel et de soupes à emporter.

           


                                  

                                         

 A quoi serviront vos contributions?

 Par son propre financement, "Chez Milo & Fine" a déjà acquis la majorité de son équipement. Grâce à votre participation, nous pourrons financer 2 équipements essentiels pour l'ouverture prévue mi-janvier  2015:

  • Une machine à café pour 5 500$
  • une emballeuse sous vide pour 500 $

Si par chance, nous dépassons notre objectif de 6 000$, cela nous permettra de réaliser davantage d'améliorations locatives dès le lancement du café!!!


  • De quelles autres manières pouvez-vous nous aider?

  • Peu importe votre situation financière, vous pouvez  tout de même nous aider en partageant cette campagne auprès de vos amis par courriel, sur Facebook, grâce  à la fonction 'share' d'Indiegogo, sur Twitter, et même en personne!

  • On vous invite également à venir découvrir nos produits le 15 novembre prochain dans le cadre de l'evènement Restaurant Day !!!!

  • Merci! N'hésitez pas à nous contacter si vous avez des questions ou des idées en écrivant à chezmilo.fine@gmail.com

story:
Hi everyone, this is Dver, aka Sarah Kate Istra Winter. I am a writer, artist and spirit-worker (if you aren't already familiar with my work, visit BirdSpiritLand.com) in the Pacific Northwest. I am hoping to start work on my next book soon (which will likely take at least a year to write), about the wonderful ubiquitous Amanita muscaria mushroom. As you may know, I've been obsessed with this mushroom for over a decade - the picture above shows me with the largest one I've ever found! I plan to delve into its use as an entheogen, its role in folklore, and its appearances in popular culture (which I also cover on my blog at rabenbrot.wordpress.com).

However, not only is my current desktop computer in need of replacement (it's ancient by computer standards), but my ongoing back/neck problems make it difficult for me to sit at the computer for long periods of time. I need to purchase a new laptop in order to be able to write in various places/positions more comfortably, as this book will require spending a lot of time at the computer both writing and researching! I'm here asking for help because I live paycheck to paycheck and don't have the extra funds available for this expense. I need your help to reach this goal and be able to continue my work!

PERKS

But I want to give something back, so I am offering some nice perks at various levels of donation. A little more information on these:

Personalized thank you note on a Carny postcard - self-explanatory - you can find out more about my Carnival Talk project here.

Darkwood Incense Cones - you will receive a set of 12 of these completely handmade incense cones, featuring vetivert, sandalwood, cedar and patchouli. Reviews have called this scent "wonderful for ritual and as an offering" and said it "sets a strong and wild tone."

Working with Animal Bones - you will receive a 32 page illustrated booklet which introduces the reader to the biological processes which form bone; gives advice on how to find bones in a natural setting, and subsequently identify and thoroughly clean them; discusses the types of crafts that can be made with bones; and explores the history and modern practices involving the sacred use of animal bones, including divination; with an annotated bibliography.

Your Choice of One of My Signed Books - you will receive a physical, paperback copy of ONE of the following - Kharis: Hellenic Polytheism Explored, Dwelling on the Threshold: Reflections of a Spirit-Worker and Devotional Polytheist, orThe Secret History of Carnival Talk. I will sign it, with personalized dedication if you wish. 

Cartomancy Session - I perform trance-assisted divination using a variety of card decks, with the help of my spirits. I have been reading cards for over 20 years (as long as I have served the spirits), and spent 7 years learning oracular trance. After receiving your question, I will schedule the session as soon as possible (within a week at most) and will email you results immediately afterwards.

Gift Certificate to Etsy Shops - you will receive a $25 gift certificate to spend in your choice of any of my Etsy shops: Goblinesquerie, Magpie & Rook or Carnival Talk.

story:
We're Going to California!

Hey all, we are coming home to sunny California to attend a leadership retreat with 99Rise, but we need your help to get there! 

99Rise is a grassroots organization building a mass movement of civil resistance to get money out of politics and win a true democracy for We the People. 

We are both leading volunteer organizers in this bottom-up movement for political equality, which means a couple things:

  1. We're absolutely committed to pursuing fundamental social, political, and economic change that will bring about a more just, equitable, and sustainable society for all.
  2. We don't get paid anything for that commitment.
Which leads us to the fact that...

We're on a Budget

We need $900 to cover travel costs that would get us from Pittsburgh, PA to San Francisco, CA and back again. 

Nearly all our fundraising at 99Rise comes from individual small-donor contributions to keep our basic operations going.

So in short, it is up to us to raise the money we need to get to California!

A Tremendous Opportunity 

Your contribution would be providing us with an incredible opportunity to grow as leaders and to get in touch with our colleagues from across the country so that we can more effectively plan where this movement goes next. Which is all critically important when considering that this is...

The Moral Issue of Our Time

The corruption of our democracy by out-of-control political spending is something that affects everyone. Not only does it halt or impede progress on every issue we care most about (whether that's climate change, education, healthcare, taxes, war, immigration, incarceration, etc.), but it violates a basic principle that I think we all hold dear: equality. 
When money is speech and about 0.05% of Americans are spending most of the money in any given election, then there is no such thing as political equality. And without that, we do not really have a democracy. 
That's why we're...

Organizing to End Corruption

That's what this is all about! And that's what your contribution would be used to accomplish. And just to be clear, 100% of all funds will go towards our travel expenses to attend the 99Rise Leadership Retreat. 

We are a couple of modest means. The bottom line is that we simply can't afford to pay for this ourselves. Thank you so much for all your love and support. We could not do this work without it.

Sincerely,

Curt & Kyle

We're Going to California! Hey all, we are coming home to sunny California to attend a leadership retreat with 99Rise, but we need your help to get there! 
99Rise is a grassroots organization building a mass movement of civil resistance to get money out of politics and win a true democracy for We the People. 
We are both leading volunteer organizers in this bottom-up movement for political equality, which means a couple things:


We're absolutely committed to pursuing fundamental social, political, and economic change that will bring about a more just, equitable, and sustainable society for all.
We don't get paid anything for that commitment.

Which leads us to the fact that...   We're on a Budget We need $900 to cover travel costs that would get us from Pittsburgh, PA to San Francisco, CA and back again. 
Nearly all our fundraising at 99Rise comes from individual small-donor contributions to keep our basic operations going.
So in short, it is up to us to raise the money we need to get to California!   A Tremendous Opportunity  Your contribution would be providing us with an incredible opportunity to grow as leaders and to get in touch with our colleagues from across the country so that we can more effectively plan where this movement goes next. Which is all critically important when considering that this is...

The Moral Issue of Our Time
The corruption of our democracy by out-of-control political spending is something that affects everyone. Not only does it halt or impede progress on every issue we care most about (whether that's climate change, education, healthcare, taxes, war, immigration, incarceration, etc.), but it violates a basic principle that I think we all hold dear: equality. 
When money is speech and about 0.05% of Americans are spending most of the money in any given election, then there is no such thing as political equality. And without that, we do not really have a democracy.

Curt & Kyle

story:
I am a social worker and writer in Portland, Oregon.  I have written a book for kids about standing up to bullies and accepting yourself.  Here is the description:

       Martina McTripaw loved hanging out with her friends at the dog park – until the Tripoli triplets started picking on her, just because she was a little bit different from her four-legged friends.    

     With the help of her wise counselor, Dr. Earl Grey,  Martina learns to be proud of who she is and stand up to the bullies  - just in time to return to the dog park and celebrate the birthday bash for her dear friend, the Goldmeister General.     

     Featuring an afterword from Dr. Earl Grey, resources for children and adults, and discussion questions for adults and children on the subject of bullying.


I have hired a very talented illustrator named Lynda Louise Mangoro, who has done a wonderful job on the illustrations.   I am also planning to self-publish the book.  I am seeking help with covering the costs of the illustration and publishing.   If I am fortunate enough to exceed my fundraising goals, the extra funds will go towards the planned sequel.

The book was inspired by my family's much-loved late, great "tripaw" Sheena, who lived a life of boundless joy and enthusiasm (pictured below).



I have created a story that is both educational and fun, and I want to share it with as many people as possible!   Thank you for your support!

story:
Fully Funded!

Thank you to everyone who pre-ordered to support Tech to Save the World. To stay up to date on publication dates, stay tuned at www.TechtoSavetheWorld.com!

Story of My Book

Tech to Save the World is a conversational guide to changing the world. Everyday people, even those who don’t consider themselves “technology people,” can use the modern tools that surround us to tackle some of our greatest challenges in development, conservation, and sustainability. 

My name is Ashley Nichols and I am the author of Tech to Save the World. I wrote this book because I wanted to learn more about the incredible technologies that were going to “save our world.” Instead, I quickly learned that technology alone can’t do anything; it’s the idealists and dreamers behind each new innovation and effort that make our world a better place.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how you and the people around you can use technologies - common and complex - to make a difference. In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for idealistic innovation. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a toolkit to help you make an impact on the causes that matter most to you.

In this book, you'll learn about the principles of idealistic innovation, and how everyday people can make an incredible impact using commonly available tools. You'll hear stories such as...

  • Fabien Cousteau’s mission to build a network of underwater space stations, PROTEUS
  • An animatronic dolphin robot that uses AI to mimic realistic behavior and connect people to wildlife without the need for captivity
  • A college student’s journey to create an app that would help his father manage PTSD symptoms and sleep through the night


You will love this book if you have a curious mind, are interested in learning more about how you can use technology in your work or to pursue your passions, and if you are open to being a trailblazer and changing the world.

Tech to Save the World is a nonfiction book that speaks to students, entrepreneurs, non-profit employees, and business executives who want to learn how to use technology to pursue groundbreaking idealistic innovations.

The Book - Tech to Save the World

Part 1 contains the introduction + chapters 1 - 4. This section sets the stage, detailing some idealistic innovations that changed the world and encouraging the reader to push back against any doubts that they can use technology to make change. It also includes tools that the reader can keep in mind as they continue their idealistic innovation trek, including an overview of world-changing technologies and a brief guide to design thinking principles.

Part 2 contains chapters 5 - 10. This section walks the reader through the principles of idealistic innovation through storytelling and the experiences of other people around the world who are using technology to make a difference. From a couple who created a Solar Suitcase to provide light to medical clinics in remote parts of the world to an animal activist who has used social media to continue championing the cause of Asian Elephants during the pandemic, this section walks through the principles that make idealistic innovation efforts successful.

Part 3 contains chapters 11 - 14. Prepped with your new knowledge of technologies and the principles of idealistic innovation, this section is your trail map to changing the world! Three sections - each themed around readers at different points in their careers - walk the reader through a step-by-step idealistic innovation effort.

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this fall.
I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Collaborators section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

About the Author

Ashley Nichols is a technology consulting executive who has worked with executives from the White House to Wall Street and beyond. Prior to becoming a consultant, she worked in higher education and communications.

Ashley’s career has been a winding journey, and at each step of the way from government to non-profits to education she has encountered students and colleagues who are passionate about causes facing our world but who have no idea how to make a difference. While she began writing Tech to Save the World to learn more about technology tools, she quickly shifted focus to help passionate people harness tech to support the causes they care most about. She hopes that this book can be a step-by-step resource for everyone who wants to make a difference, especially those who are uncomfortable with technology!

When she’s not working and writing, Ashley enjoys reading, traveling, playing Dungeons and Dragons, scuba diving, and being out and about. One of her favorite things to do in a new city is grab a coffee, take a long walk, and people watch. She lives with her very old and very grumpy calico cat Keisha and her boyfriend Matt. A night owl, Ashley gets most of her writing done in the dark of night (and always right before the deadline).

For more information, you can connect with Ashley at ashleycnichols07@gmail.com and on LinkedIn.

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TechtoSavetheWorld and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Ashley

story:
The Future Fire, a magazine of social-political speculative fiction, has been publishing feminist SF, queer SF, eco-SF, postcolonial SF, cyberpunk and horror with diverse and inclusive themes, since 2005. To celebrate our tenth birthday this year, we plan to publish an anthology containing a mixture of reprints, enhanced stories, and new material, including sequels and other spin-offs, new artwork and satirical or speculative pseudo-fiction. The anthology will be edited by Djibril al-Ayad (editor-in-chief of TFF magazine since 2005 and owner of Futurefire.net Publishing), Cécile Matthey (in-house illustrator at TFF magazine since 2006, and assistant editor since 2014), and Valeria Vitale (copyeditor and assistant editor of TFF magazine since 2012).

For a flavor of the range of queer and other content we've published in the past, see this list of Quiltbag stories in TFF, 2005-2015.

We are raising money via pre-orders on this fundraiser to pay authors and artists for the use of their work; any further income made from sales will be paid as royalties or pushed back into the magazine to pay more authors in the future. If we reach the initial goal of $2,000, we will be able to pay an average of $50 per story, and a fair amount for microfiction and art, with the rest going on IGG fees and honoring rewards for backers. Any further funds we receive above this will go into increasing the fees further, or raising the pay rate for authors and artists of TFF magazine or one of our other publications. The TFF press budget, which is funded by the editor-in-chief, will also be used to contribute to these costs.

Stretch goals:

  • $3000: Increased pay rate for Fae Visions of the Mediterranean horror anthology, to approx €30 (in Euro) per story, artwork or poem (150% of current rate).
  • $4000: Increase pay rate for TFFX anthology to an average of $75 per story (150% of current rate).
  • $5000: Increase pay rate for TFF magazine to $30/story for the next 12 months (150% of current rate).

Rewards:

Please note: all the components of each reward are listed under each level; unless specifically noted, a reward does not include all the components of the lower levels. The rewards we are offering for supporters of this fundraiser include:

  • E-book (all DRM-free, and in your choice of Kindle and EPUB format; we’ll make other formats for you if at all possible) or trade paperback copies of the TFFX anthology, or bundles including our other anthologies: Outlaw Bodies, We See a Different Frontier, Accessing the Future and Fae Visions of the Mediterranean.
  • Limited edition (not available outside of this fundraiser) trade paperback print copies of TFF magazine.
  • Signed art print: illustrator Robin E. Kaplan has made available signed art prints (8"x10" on archival photo paper) of the beautiful illustration for “Sophie and Zoe at the End of the World” in TFF#29, also the cover art for that issue (right), which you can pick up for the very modest perk level here.
  • Short story critiques: one of the editors of TFF magazine (who will be selected for best fit with your story) will read and give you professional critique and feedback on an in-progress story of up to 8,000 words. All of the editors have several years of experience reading and critiquing stories for the magazine, and proofreading and copy-editing for anthologies and other venues, and are also experienced writers of fiction and/or nonfiction themselves.
  • Custom undead dolls: TFF co-editor Valeria knits amusing and adorable undead dolls customized to look a bit like her friends and colleagues (see photos), and she will make one in your likeness if you purchase this reward. (These are NOT voodoo dolls; please do not ask for a doll to be made in the likeness of someone who is not comfortable with this!)
  • Custom story art: TFF co-editor and in-house illustrator Cécile Matthey will produce one illustration for one of your stories (see examples of her past work at TFF and below), and mail you the original work of art. A one of a kind and very good value offer! Limited availability.


Risks:

Since about half the contents of the TFFX anthology will be reprints or stories that we already have in hand, and most of the contents are from authors and artists with whom we have existing relationships, there is little to no danger of our failing to find the material to fill the anthology. In the unlikely event that there are any unavoidable delays, we will keep all backers informed via IGG updates or email.

We have run two previous fundraisers, and produced successful and acclaimed anthologies with the proceeds, as well as two other anthologies without such funds. With ten years experience producing the magazine and anthologies, we have experienced all kinds of unexpected setbacks (authors, artists or other collaborators pulling out at the last minute, for instance) and are confident we can deal swiftly and professionally with any such problems if they arise. For example we can call on our large network of collaborators and supporters to help take up any slack if we are left hanging for any reason.

Promotion and news:

Blog posts or interviews about this fundraiser or part of the TFF anniversary celebrations:
  1. Interview in Urban Fantasy Magazine
  2. Interview on Fox Spirit blog
  3. Micro-sequel Monday: “Little Match Girl, ten years on”
  4. Interview with Joyce Chng
  5. Interview with Djibril by Jocelyn Koehler
  6. Friday Flash: “A Sense of Place”
  7. Interview with Kathryn Allan at Twinja Book Reviews
  8. Micro-sequel Monday: “Galatea's Stepchildren, ten years on”
  9. Ernest Hogan, "A Low Ride with Victor Theremin"
  10. Stephanie Saulter interviews Valeria
  11. Blog post at Theaker's Quarterly Fiction
  12. Interview with Richard Thieme
  13. Rebecca Schwab interviews Bruce
  14. Interview with Lori Selke at Apex Books
  15. Friday Flash: “From the Mud, Rising Bravely”
  16. Djibril's Friday Five at Pornokitsch
  17. Margrét Helgadóttir interviews Cécile Matthey
  18. Su J. Sokol interviews Jennifer Marie Brissett
  19. TFFX writing contest
  20. Micro-sequel Monday: “Good Form, ten years on”
  21. Quiltbag stories from the last decade
  22. “My Superpower” by Djibril over at Skiffy and Fanty
  23. Alasdair Stuart interviews Valeria
  24. Cécile interviews Rebecca Schwab
  25. Valeria interviews Vanessa Fogg
  26. Friday Flash: “Now Playing”
  27. Serge interviews James W. Bennett
  28. "Keeping The Future Fire Burning" at Anne E. Johnson's blog
  29. Micro-sequel Monday: Rustwisdom
  30. Peter Tennant interviews Djibril at "Case Notes"
  31. Re-opened: "Number 10"-themed writing challenge
  32. Tracie interviews Kathryn Allan
  33. Rebecca Buchanan interviews Robin
  34. Friday Flash: Morphic Resonance
  35. Sunday Sequel: Pirate Stories
  36. Microfiction Monday: 2084
  37. Dennis Upkins interviews Cécile

story:
Malo o meni...


Zovem se Davor Novevski, živim i radim u Cavtatu i san mi je jednog dana ozbiljno se baviti književnošću. Neko vrijeme pisao sam kolumne za jedan lokalni web portal, a nekoliko pjesama objavljeno mi je i u zborniku Društva dubrovačkih pisaca Literat. U lipnju prošle godine izdao sam svoj književni prvijenac – zbirku pripovijetki „Ravno do dna“ koja objedinjuje tri pripovijetke čija se radnja događa u Dubrovniku i okolici. Oba izdanje knjige rasprodana su gotovo odmah po izlasku što me, uz brojne pozitivne kritike, potaklo na izdavanje prvog pravog romana.​

Malo o knjizi...

 

Roman naslova „Teorija sjene“ priča je o neobičnom prijateljstvu između dvoje ljudi  koji naizgled nemaju ništa zajedničko osim činjenice da žive u istoj zgradi i da su im traume koje su doživjeli u prošlosti obilježile živote koje trenutno vode. Žanrovski, radi se o kriminalističkom romanu, ali on je i mnogo više od toga. On je i priča o kajanju, grijesima iz prošlosti i moralnim dilemama u kojima se svatko od nas prije ili kasnije nađe. Na dvjestotinjak stranica „Teorija sjene“ govori o stvarnom putovanju dvoje likova, ali i metaforičkom putovanju prema spokoju i iskupljenju usput secirajući život i međuljudske odnose u Dubrovniku i okolici kroz zanimljive situacije u koje glavni likovi upadaju i ljude koje na svom putu susreću.

 

 

TROŠKOVNIK

Grafička priprema

1.200,00 kn

Lektura

1.000,00 kn

Tisak 200 komada

5.200,00 kn

Ostalo

1.000,00 kn

UKUPNO

8.400,00 kn

 

Kako uplatiti? 

 

Vrlo jednostavno. Klikom na polje BACK IT koje se nalazi odmah pri vrhu stranice ili na jedno od polja naslova GET THIS PERK otvara se novi prozor u koji upisujete svoje podatke i čim ih potvrdite, i službeno ste dio moje kampanje. Bitno je napomenuti da je Indiegogo u potpunosti provjerena i sigurna platforma tako da ne postoji bojazan da će bilo tko zloupotrijebiti vaše podatke.
 

Zašto sam se uopće odlučio za crowdfunding?

 

Odluka o grupnom financiranju ovog romana nije bila niti malo laka. Crowdfunding je u nas još uvijek u svojim začecima i samo upoznavanje ljudi s ovim konceptom predstavlja svojevrstan izazov. Ipak, odlučio sam se na pokretanje ovog projekta jer, osim realnih rizika s kojima ću se suočiti, pruža mi i neke dragocjene informacije i saznanja pa ću se tako u ovih mjesec dana koliko kampanja traje imati priliku uvjeriti koliko ljudi doista vjeruje u mene i tko je sve spreman prepoznati i podržati ono što radim.

 

Još malo o perkovima...

 

S desne strane vaših ekrana nalaze se takozvani perkovi (perks) – mali znakovi pažnje i nagrade koje dobivate za donirane iznose. Iako svaki iznos nosi neki određeni dar (perk), niti jedan od njih nije fiksan i svi su oni podložni dogovoru pa ako na primjer već imate svoj primjerak zbirke „Ravno do dna“, umjesto njega možete dobiti dva primjerka nove knjige isl.

 

Kako još možete pomoći?

 

Možda nema svatko dovoljno novca za doniranje, ali to ne znali da ne može sudjelovati u mojoj crowdfunding kampanji. Čitav koncept velikim se dijelom zasniva na „usmenoj predaji“ i pokušaju da se dopre do što većeg broja ljudi što znači da je svaki lajk i svako dijeljenje na Facebooku dragocjeno. Dakle, lajkajte objave vezane za crowdfunding, dijelite ih na društvenim mrežama (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram) i odvojite sat-dva za dolazak na promociju knjige, a ja ću sigurno pronaći način da vam se odužim. 

 

Trailer za knjigu "Teorija sjene"

story:
My name is Jonathan Nadeau and like most people I've had trials and tribulations in my life.

At the age of 14 I lost my eyesight in a very bad car accident. Then at the age of 15 my father had passed away, and by the time I was 18 my mother had passed away due to cancer. The purpose of this book is to give hope and encouragement through my life and experiences. Although losing my sight at the age of 14 seemed to be the worst moment of my life, getting in the car accident was the best thing that could ever have happened to me.  It is the reason why I started to play guitar, how I met my wife, which led to 5 awesome children, and went back to school and got my degree in business administration and computer science. Everything I have in my life I can point back to a result of the car accident and losing my sight. I am who I am today because of it and the work of God in me. Vision is one of the most important projects of my life. There are so many details of God's faithfulness in my life; this is why I need to write this book. Help me finish this book and pre-order your copy today.

With this Indiegogo campaign I'd like to get a cover designed and pay for an editor to get the book ready to be published. So you will be helping me on this campaign by pre-ordering the book. You will be able to either get a digital copy, a physical copy, or you might want an autographed copy, the choice is yours. Or maybe you'd like me to speak at your church or youth group. You will see this option also in the perks.

 I need your help to get it across the finish line. Every amount that is pledged is greatly appreciated! If you can't help out with giving a pledge then sharing it on any social media site is just as important!
