story:
Story of My Book

Your Next Mission - A journey from combat on the battlefield to a successful business, this book explores the pathways and lessons of veterans who transitioned out of the military and started a successful business.

My name is Tyler Reiser and I am the author of Your Next Mission. I wrote this book because I am on my own quest to start a successful business after the military. I wanted to learn from those who came before me in their transition and share these lessons with our fellow veterans.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover how veterans are utilizing the lessons and skills they’ve developed during their military service to build and lead successful businesses in the private sector. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for entrepreneurship in you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you start your own journey of following your dreams, in entrepreneurship or otherwise.

In this book, you'll learn about the veteran transition into entrepreneurship:

  • You’ll hear about the challenges former infantryman, Casey Lawrence faced as he transitioned. After firefights and IEDs in Afghanistan to the oil fields of Texas, you’ll see how his nonlinear journey took him down dark paths and how he found redemption.
  • The Story of Sam Meek. Moving back home after the military he took up a job as a young caddie. Through a chance encounter, he got an interview at a hedge fund, his life would never be the same.
  • You’ll see how Donny O'Malley, a Marine, produces a $100,000 video production every 6-weeks, a feat never achieved by Hollywood.
You will love this book if you are following your dreams, you’re a veteran or an entrepreneur. Your Next Mission is a non-fiction book that speaks to veterans and entrepreneurs who are transitioning out of the military and building a business for the first time.

 

Your Next Mission

The book is written in 3 Parts...

Part [1] contains the introduction + 2 chapters. You will get a glimpse into the world of post 9/11 combat and the intense nature of the battlefield. We then explore the transition after the military with the struggles and successes that come with it. You’ll find that the incredible abilities used in combat that are often forgotten when we transition out of the military.

Part [2] contains Chapters 3-6. Identifying your purpose as a starting point we review methods used to develop a business model and the lessons learned from lean manufacturing and agile development to incorporate the scientific method into entrepreneurship. We look at the ideas of perseverance, and how veteran entrepreneurs like William Treseder are using daily wins to build a lifetime of passion.

Part [3] contains Chapters 7-10. Going at it alone is certainly destined for failure. In this section, we peer into the importance of developing a network, forms of obtaining capital, leadership, and culture. The actionable insights included from research and interviews provide a framework to develop an entrepreneurial support team. Doug Doan discusses the challenges veterans face in angel investments and Mark Rockefeller shows us ways veterans obtain debt financing.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...

About the Author


Tyler Reiser is Founder and CEO of Strategic Bonds. A business that empowers small business owners in the new economy. Combining empirical evidence with today's small business to create an ecosystem of overwhelming support to owners for a higher probability of success.

I wrote this book to inspire the next generation of veterans who aspire to be entrepreneurs. The challenge is great, but the experience of the battlefield will give you the perseverance. The lessons learned from the leaders who came before you will give you the knowledge necessary to achieve your next mission.

It feels a bit like imposter syndrome as a non-expert writing this book. Who am I to write a book about something I haven’t built? What I learned in the process, has changed the way I think.

For more information, you can connect with Tyler at tyler@strategicbonds.consulting and https://www.linkedin.com/in/tyler-reiser-52627733/

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #TheVeteranAdvantage and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Tyler C Reiser

story:
Short Summary

My name is Tiffany Green-Abdullah and I am the author of The Bean Pie: 4 Generations of Faith, Family, and Fortitude. 

I wrote this book as a tribute to the voiceless women in my family who endured pain and sacrifice beyond comprehension so that our family can exist as it does today. My role is to write this so that we can uplift them and honor their commitment and sacrifice into a hopeful future. I want my children and future generations to know that they are not here by accident. The toil of our ancestors, including the success and mistakes make us who we are. No one is perfect, but it takes strength and fortitude to keep going and learn from one generation to the next. I am leaning on that strength myself as I write this book during one of the most challenging times the world has seen.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover an unknown story about the bean pie and my family’s history in the Nation of Islam. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you understand the internal pain that these women endured in breaking cycles for our future.

This book is a legacy for my family and my way to connect with my past, remind me of how far I have come and my family's history. This book is a guide to our future family to remember and acknowledge our journeys.  Making bean pies connected me to my past and created a curiosity that led me to become an author.

In this book, you'll learn about Faith, Forgiveness, and Fortitude, including:

  • How my mother, at age 14, helped to spread the bean pie from Chicago to all over the nation.
  • How Aunt Daisy migrated from Alabama to Detroit and then to Chicago and became a mogul.
  • How faith, family, and fortitude helped me overcome the death of two of my children.

You will love this book if you want to learn about unsung heroes behind history and how families can share their stories.

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copy editing for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this April 2021.

This is the 2nd round of the crowd-fund. I still need to pre-sale 76 more books to raise the entire amount needed to complete all the book formats and audiobook. 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

And more...
 

About the Author

Tiffany Green-Abdullah, M.Ed, PMP, is an award-winning educator and entrepreneur. She was the first recipient of the Masters of Education in Education and Technology from Peabody School of Education at Vanderbilt University. As a first-generation student from Chicago IL, she received a Bachelor of Science in Economics also from Vanderbilt University. Tiffany has been an entrepreneur since 1994.  She has led a consulting firm under her name since 2008 for personal and career development for professionals to design their dream careers, and strategic consulting to corporations and universities to attract and retain diverse employees. 

Tiffany is the Chief Operations Officer of Tarchitects LLC, her family’s architecture and construction firm. She and her architect husband, Tariq Abdullah are co-founders of the Tarchitects Foundation for Architecture and Design which propels young designers. Their largest program is The Community Academy for Architecture and Design, the first elementary school for architecture and design in the nation. She lives in Atlanta with her husband and 3 children. 

To contact Tiffany, connect with her at author@thebeanpie.com and thebeanpie.com
Instagram: thebeanpiebook
Facebook group: https://www.facebook.com/groups/942342042899542/

The Impact

Your contribution is about more than money. It sends a message to me and to the world that we need more voices, especially Black women writers and Black family stories. 

I hope that you are here because you care about this project and how it might inspire someone. I hope you know I have a track record of success in my career, in my community and this book is the next step for me. I plan to speak at schools, book clubs, and any organization with an interest.

It is not easy to share so many personal stories with the world, but I hope by doing so, I can impact someone who is not sure how they are going to make it through a difficult period.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes it. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #thebeanpiebook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

This is the 2nd crowdfund to raise the last bit. I am especially seeking youth-serving organizations and schools that can purchase the larger perk packages which come with a set of books and a speaking engagement just for the organization. 

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Tiffany Green-Abdullah

My name is Tiffany Green-Abdullah and I am the author of The Bean Pie: 4 Generations of Faith, Family, and Fortitude. 
I wrote this book as a tribute to the voiceless women in my family who endured pain and sacrifice beyond comprehension so that our family can exist as it does today. My role is to write this so that we can uplift them and honor their commitment and sacrifice into a hopeful future. I want my children and future generations to know that they are not here by accident. The toil of our ancestors, including the success and mistakes make us who we are. No one is perfect, but it takes strength and fortitude to keep going and learn from one generation to the next. I am leaning on that strength myself as I write this book during one of the most challenging times the world has seen.My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover an unknown story about the bean pie and my family’s history in the Nation of Islam. In this book, I hope to instill the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for you. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you understand the internal pain that these women endured in breaking cycles for our future.
This book is a legacy for my family and my way to connect with my past, remind me of how far I have come and my family's history. This book is a guide to our future family to remember and acknowledge our journeys.  Making bean pies connected me to my past and created a curiosity that led me to become an author.In this book, you'll learn about Faith, Forgiveness, and Fortitude, including:

How my mother, at age 14, helped to spread the bean pie from Chicago to all over the nation.
How Aunt Daisy migrated from Alabama to Detroit and then to Chicago and became a mogul.
How faith, family, and fortitude helped me overcome the death of two of my children.

You will love this book if you want to learn about unsung heroes behind history and how families can share their stories.

story:
Short Summary

I have spent many years exploring natural areas in Texas, writing for herpetological societies and Texas Parks & Wildlife Magazine, and giving educational talks. I co-authored a first book (with Clint King), "Herping Texas," published last year. I work as a Psychological Associate, but communicating about the natural world is a first love.

It has always been my hope that my writing will make readers feel as if they've stood where I have been in forests, prairies, and deserts that I describe. I want readers to go visit these places and see the box turtles, rattlesnakes, salamanders, and other animals that I love. As I wrote this book, I thought about what would be the ideal book for me when I was a young teen. I wanted the book to educate and to inspire a love for the natural world.

A book like this might equip a young person to go find that first turtle, or hike an unspoiled preserve. It could spark a career in herpetology, but it can only do that if you help us get it printed.

What We Need & What You Get

Nonprofit publishers do a lot, but there's some things they do not do. The illustrations for the book were done by Jack Jeansonne, a talented artist who can bring things to life in a way that words cannot. The book's publishers do not pay for those illustrations. Also, the book has to have an index, and that's typically done by a contract professional. Here's what we need:

  • $1800 will pay Jack for the series of illustrations he has prepared for the book. Another $800 will cover the production of the index for the book. 

  • We want to show our appreciation to those who contribute. The perks we are offering include signed prints of photos or illustrations from the book, up to a signed copy of the completed book when it is published (see the listed perks for details).
  • If we do not raise the entire $2600, we will use what we do raise and find other funds to complete the project. In other words, we are committed to having the book published and will use your generous contributions - whatever amount you give.

The Impact

Field herping is a growing hobby, and increasing numbers of young people and adults are interested in some aspect of herpetology. A book like this may guide people toward the wildlife and natural history side of the hobby, and I really would like to see that happen. There is nothing wrong with keeping a pet ball python or other herp, but you learn a great deal when you look at these animals as wildlife. The joy that comes from spending a day in the field and coming across a native species of snake or turtle is not soon forgotten. This book makes it more likely that a person new to field herping will know what to look for and how to stay safe. Readers will come away with a stronger conservation ethic when in the field.

The earlier book (co-authored with Clint King and also from Texas A&M University Press) has done well, and I am confident that this project will be successfully completed as well. The manuscript is written and the illustrations completed. I've chosen plenty of photographs, supplemented with a few that friends and colleagues generously let me use. You can contribute to this project with confidence that Jack and I will hold up our end of the bargain. 

 

Risks & Challenges

As I mentioned, the manuscript is done, photographs taken (or contributed) and illustrations completed. If we were not able to raise enough funds to pay for Jack's illustrations or to get indexing done, I would explore whether there are any organizational grants or other ways to raise the money. As the project moves along, I will keep contributors informed of any challenges we encounter and strategies for addressing them.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute money, you can still help in a big way! Share this link on places like Facebook or pass it along to friends. Let people know what this project might mean for increasing people's understanding of reptiles and amphibians. Remember that Indiegogo has share tools that can help with this!

story:
Story of My Book

The River and the Woods is a book set in the Northwoods of Wisconsin. On a business-related return home, a young professional must decide to love and revive his small hometown or to walk away and leave the career opportunity of a lifetime. The River and the Woods explores the intersection of industry and sustainability through the lens of personal ethics

My name is Jacob Gardner, and I am the author of The River and the Woods. I wrote this book because of my love-hate relationship with my hometown. Rural communities in Wisconsin—and all over the U.S.—are hurting. There’s a vacuum of jobs, and the towns are seeing a decline in their schools, culture, and communities. Worse yet, they are desperate for work, and they will trade anything they can to bring home the bread—even their waterways and natural beauties.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover an appreciation for rural America and maybe even rural Wisconsin. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to consider the context rural communities are in today. Together, we can consider how to improve the struggling towns without jeopardizing our planet.

Tucked in the pine and birch woods of northern Wisconsin, Matt Harris has business to do. Representing the company promising a better future to his hometown and state, Matt returns to find that towns and people can change—and drastically. Deprived of the once robust blue-collar work, buildings have been boarded up, the school has declined, politics have grown bitter, and poverty reigns supreme. The growing plight of rural and Midwestern USA has hit home. Determined to please both his boss and the town, Matt must confront his greatest dilemma: how to make his ambitions truly help the townspeople he so longs to forget. Through disasters of love, hate, ethics, and pride, Matt learns a lot about life on his visit home-—but at what cost and to whom?

You will love this book if you are a young professional, grew up in a rural town, or have an interest in sustainability.

The River and the Woods speaks to professionals, sustainability advocates, and former or current ruralites who want to grapple with small town life or economics and vulnerability or morals in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that The River and the Woods inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
  • How far will you go for your pride or your career?
  • What does it really mean to love your home—town, state, or country?
  • What is the future going to be like? What will be the balance between everyday people’s prosperity and the earth’s well being?
I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing division, bias, sustainability, a better economy, and vulnerability in professionalism will change us all for the better.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this December.

When I pre-sell 120 paperback copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Jacob Gardner is a renaissance man.

A gardener, a hiker, a business leader, and a writer, Jacob always seeks to find the beauty and opportunity in everything around him. He is passionate about good policy protecting people and planet. He currently works in healthcare software, and he co-owns an online bakery with his mother.

Jacob can be found cooking new recipes, scribbling quick poems, or walking his dog. His latest passion projects have been indoor vermicomposting and perfecting his latte skills. He is constantly reading up on politics, and he definitely has an opinion for any topic—politics or otherwise!

For more information, you can connect with Jacob at contact@jacobrgardner.com, jacobrgardner.com, LinkedIn, or Facebook.
 

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, check out: https://forms.gle/UWZa4pwPv9z7NVnR7.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #TheRiverAndTheWoods and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jacob Gardner

story:
Story of My Book

Westside Girl, Stillness of Our Hearts: Tales of a Westside Chicago Girl, What College And Corporate Don't Teach You About Getting Over Imposter Syndrome is about my early career experiences in corporate America, as a first gen college graduate, who felt like a fraud, who didn't belong, and who also learned the hard way about the imperfections that exist within the workplace, specifically mediocre managers and workplace cultures that maintain the status quo. I explore themes like perfectionism, imposter syndrome, self-care, and boundaries.  

My name is Jamese Dunlap  and I am the author of Westside Girl, Stillness. I wrote this book because I’m passionate about financial wealth and physical health. Both of those are directly tied to where you work. I kept meeting other high achieving corporate career professionals who like myself have the potential to go further in their careers, but their progress was being stifled. 

Progress was often stifled by relying on the same tools that served us well in high school and college. Tools and habits that are now outdated and less effective. Tools that got us here, but will and only serve to hold us back if we don’t replace them with better ones.

Tools include:

  • Mazlow's Hierarchy of Needs shifting away from operating in survival mode whereby we have an extreme fear of failing and making mistakes in our pursuit of safety and security 
  • Setting Healthy Boundaries overcoming the struggle to say no to others, stretching yourself too thin and taking responsibility for others’ shortcomings
  • 6 stage Job Lifecycle understanding when it is time to move on from a job you no longer love
  • Overcoming Perfectionism Recognizing and letting go of all or nothing thinking, our inability to acknowledge own strengths combined with a hyper focus on weaknesses 
  • Self-care set realistic expectations, unlearn what no longer serves us and rely on peer, mentorship, coaches and therapy for support

 

We’re told to work twice as hard to get half as much and often experience anxiety, depression, frustration and disappointments in the workplace that go unaddressed. That is until now. I’m writing this book as a solution to the problems employees face, as a blueprint to help them get unstuck and as motivation and inspiration to let them know a better path ahead is possible.

 

In this book, you'll learn the importance of dreaming big dreams, the power of mentorship inside and outside of work and the importance of resting and rejuvenating through narratives like:

  • Meeting Chris Brown on the Oprah Winfrey Show while a student at Whitney M. Young High School -- the same high school Michelle Obama attended in Chicago, IL
  • Taking time off from my first job out of college after I realized I wasn't feeling like myself
  • Working with a new therapist who introduced me to concepts I had not heard of before, like perfectionism, all or nothing mentality and codependency

 

You will love this book no matter what industry you're in, this book will save you time, money, and energy, as you begin or continue upon your corporate career journey. 

 

Westside Girl, Stillness speaks to mid-career professionals, recent college graduates, and those graduating soon, who grapple with the question, is this really all there is to life: go to school, graduate, work and pay bills and who want to look grapple with wealth and the "pursuit of happiness" in a new way, in the form of sound mental health & well-being.

Ultimately, I hope that Westside Girl, Stillness inspires reflection and fruitful discussion, around questions like:

  • Question 1: What are the things that keep me up at night and feeling worried during the day?
  • Question 2: What role do corporations play in helping foster psychologically safe place for employees?
  • Question 3: What is a wilderness season? And how can our stillness in this season, contribute to our personal growth and development, as a human beings, and as corporate professionals, too?

 

I look forward to exploring these questions and more with my readers. I believe discussing self-doubt, boundaries and perfection will change us all for the better. 

 

Westside Girl, Stillness

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the author’s note + chapters Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs: Elementary and High School and School. I tell stories about my efforts to overcome education inequality as a 12 year old in the 7th grade. I share the impact teachers in my neighborhood school had in my life, by shaping my understanding of the importance of an education and the reality of the world around me.  You'll learn how childhood upbringing and environment, can impact you. And how your parents may influence your decision making and control aspects of your life you don't realize yet.

 

Part 2 contains chapters High Achiever: College and Therapy: Work. In this section, the reader will learn about the limiting belief systems the author is carrying with her, how self defeating they are, and the role letting those beliefs go will play in contributing to her over health and happiness. The author spirals into a grave place in life that forces her into a never before experienced stillness. It's a wilderness moment. 

 

Part 3 contains chapters Stillness of Our Hearts: 6 Stage Job Lifecycle, Boundaries and Self-care. In this section, the reader learns about the impact and power of being still. The author experiences a multi-month period of stillness, away from work and the hustle and bustle of life. Resting and recovering, she experiences personal growth that creates spaces for unexpected people and opportunities to come into her life, including her absent father. 

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised here will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this fall.

 

When I raise $5,000, I will publish a paperback and ebook. Goal accomplished! This is where things get more exciting

When I raise $7,000, I will also publish an audiobook. I'm grateful for the opportunity to publish the soft back cover books. But raising an additional $2,000 to publish my book as an audiobook is definitely what I want. We can stretch our goals here. Why stop?

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • Signed Copy You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Acknowledgment Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • Feedback & Sneak Peaks You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • Final Title & Cover Selection You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • Exclusive Community Access You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Jamese is a user experience researcher, 401k educator and life learner. She's was previously featured on the Oprah Winfrey Show for her personal story and academic successes.

A Northwestern University graduate, she earned an honors degree in Sociology. Jamese brings a unique and refreshing perspective to conversations about work. with 5+ years in tech and financial services industry experience. She's experienced workplace cultures at Goldman Sachs, Google, and Bank of America and more. 

She bullet-journals and enjoys HIIT workouts. During Covid WFH, she's developed her cooking skills, something she never expected would happen. Her friends would describe her as disciplined, funny and hardworking. She describes herself as curious, focused, determined and a child of God.

 

For more information, you can connect with Jamese at mese_e_mese@yahoo.com and at @itsthejameseshow on Instagram.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Here are some alternative ways to help. Share:

  • Friends and family Please share my book with 2 friends, family members, or co-workers you think would enjoy Westside Girl, Stillness of Our Hearts via text or direct message on social media.
  • Social media network My pre-sale campaign on Instagram, Facebook, LinkedIn and Twitter with your friends, family, network and co-workers. Please use #WestsideGirl #StillnessofOurHearts and tag me @itstheJameseShow as well as my publisher, NewDegreePress, so we can amplify your efforts.
  • Indiegogo link You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,

Jamese Dunlap

I wrote this book because I’m passionate about financial wealth and physical health. Both of those are directly tied to where you work. Mazlow's Hierarchy of Needs shifting away from operating in survival mode whereby we have an extreme fear of failing and making mistakes in our pursuit of safety and security 

Setting Healthy Boundaries overcoming the struggle to say no to others, stretching yourself too thin and taking responsibility for others’ shortcomings

6 stage Job Lifecycle understanding when it is time to move on from a job you no longer love

Overcoming Perfectionism Recognizing and letting go of all or nothing thinking, our inability to acknowledge own strengths combined with a hyper focus on weaknesses 

Self-care set realistic expectations, unlearn what no longer serves us and rely on peer, mentorship, coaches and therapy for support

Meeting Chris Brown on the Oprah Winfrey Show while a student at Whitney M. Young High School -- the same high school Michelle Obama attended in Chicago, IL

story:
SHORT SUMMARY

A Gory Story is a book I started working on in 2007. It is an interactive therapy book that comes illustrated and has a set of questions to accompany the book. As one reads the questions they write in their own story in the book. Over the past five years I have made a few different versions of the book and sent them out to be put to use. In the process I have made a few changes and now am ready to publish the book in its final form.

I need help from you to help print this book so it is available for girls who have been sexually abused.

WHAT WE NEED?

 Is the funding needed to print runs of this book that we can distribute to advocacy centers and counselors. It would also help us with publicity for the book.

WHAT YOU GET?

Look to the right and you will see the perks we have for contributors.

and check the gallery to see a picture of the t shirt

HOW WILL THIS BOOK AFFECT PEOPLE?

This book will allow for someone to open up about being molested or sexually abused. Its a very hard subject for some people to open up about.  This book will let someone write out their story of what has happened to them.  Addressing the issue of what has happened is what A Gory Story lets take place.

HOW DOES THE BOOK WORK?

A Gory Story has simple questions to start with that are pretty straight forward. The pages of the book have their own questions that walk someone through gently the abuse that they have encountered.  As someone works in the book the questions stay simple in phrasing but tackle harder things.  Building a story on paper that has unfortunately already happened in life. Through answering the questions in the book a process of opening up about what has happened occurs.

WHO ARE WE?

Gregory Price, is the creator of the book and did the layout and initial design. This is my first book project and is the most important work of any form I have produced. I really believe it can have impacts in lots of lives that have been afflicted by sexual abuse.

Emily Salinas, is the illustrator.  I met Emily while in school and later on asked her to help me with the final illustrations to add a softer touch to the colors that my artistic skills could not produce. She is someone that I knew I could count on to put forth some amazing art work.

We are both alumni of the University of Montevallo in Montevallo, Alabama

story:
THE (really kind of long-winded and super-personal) SUMMARY

Writing a pitch like this is as daunting as composing a 20 page research paper 8 hours before it’s due in class. I think it would be easier to sell something like  “I’m a time traveler from the future, and I need your help to prevent the lemming overpopulation catastrophe of 2043.”  

 My name is Steven Lacey. I’m 42 years old, and I am a writer.

     Initially, it was screenplays. I finally realized that the bonus of writing prose (as opposed to scripts) was that instead of having to count on other people to bring them to life, I just had to, you know, write them. I started with short fiction. After a few years, I had enough stories that I compiled them into an anthology, called Everything In Its Right Place (and available here). Not content with just writing short stories, however, I crafted them as puzzle pieces of a greater tale; every story in that book was connected to the others, creating a causal link to reveal a larger narrative in the background of the individual stories. It was ambitious, a little bit crazy, and – considering that it was entirely a word-of-mouth PR campaign – a modest success.

      Now, while these new books represent my first attempt at writing novels, they are from a story that has been inside my head for the last 17 years. Ostensibly, the tales are space opera at its finest: the adventures of two officers who are on opposing sides in an interplanetary civil war. The conflict is between the inner and outer planets of the solar system, taking place in the early part of the 21st Century. Both stories are about the battles they get into, as well as the day-to-day lives of these characters in more of a down-to-earth kind of way. Since I’m a contrary son-of-a-gun, these books also represent a rather ambitious idea: with both stories built around that central conflict, the protagonist of each book serves as a minor antagonist in the other one, and the novels begin and end at almost the exact same time, with various crossovers throughout the narrative.

      When I say these novels are space operas, that’s because there’s more going on than might appear at first glance. Rather than spoil the surprise – there’s a minor twist at the end of each chapter (the same twist, in fact) – I ask you to please click here (blue) or here(red), where you can read each book’s first chapter in its entirety to get a better idea of what I mean. While you’re at it, this link will take you to the Facebook page I have for the series itself, so you can give it a like and show your support. (they contain adult language and situations, so reader discretion is advised).

      How did I come to finish these two novels? A little over three years ago, my mother passed away suddenly, after an unexpected illness. She was my greatest inspiration, a talented artist in her own right, and one of my biggest fans and cheerleaders. Her sudden death was easily the most difficult thing I’ve ever had to deal with, but it also shook me awake. While I really liked my coworkers,- I didn’t love my job, I actively disliked upper management, and I flat out hated the company I worked for.   I had been presented with a serious wake-up call- and an opportunity- she left me an inheritance. With this, and a little bit of savings, I took the leap that I had been avoiding for years. I quit my job to do what I love: write.

     Fun fact #1: Quitting your job to write full time could enable you to finish a novel (As I have! Two novels! Completed!).

     Fun fact #2: Quitting your job to write full time takes a lot out of the bank account. All of it, in fact.

      Which is why I started this campaign: I need your help to keep my dream alive-  long enough to actually publish these books. 

What We Need & What You Get

      So. I am asking for the bare minimum to keep the wolves at bay while I edit the books and ready them for publication. While a lot of the funding will be doing just that, a lot if it will be going toward the perks in that lovely side-bar: stickers, t-shirts, actual paper versions of the book, airfare and car rental (if any of y’all are crazy enough to jump on the more expensive swag-train), plus the giant doomsday machine I am currently building in my basement (JUST KIDDING! I live in Charleston, South Carolina; we don’t have basements. I’m building it in my garage).

     With these stories, I will build a world and create a franchise; further tales and back-stories from this world could fill several books, ones that I (and others) intend to tell in the months and years ahead. By contributing to this campaign, you will be helping to shape the reality of The Jovian Frontier from now until... whenever. So, not only are you helping me, personally, you’re also influencing this fictional world in ways that will have lasting effects. And, let’s face it, who doesn’t want to wield power, at least a little bit? Reading this right now, you’re cradling the Jovian Frontier in your palm. Will you wield this newfound power villainously by dropping it- ending your power right there - or will you be a part of the future? It’s up to you!

     Now, if I don’t meet my fundraising goal, then what does that mean? Well, the whole project won’t just dry up and go away; I will continue editing as time permits. With your support, I will be able to publish in late September/early October. Without it...

      I will make sure that every perk gets fulfilled. I will finish these books. One place I promise the money will NOT be going: dance lessons (If you’ve already watched the video, you know I have some super-sweet moves; you just can’t improve upon perfection). 

 The (Deep, Insightful, Personal) Impact

      This story-world has the potential to become something significant. As I said earlier, the back-story is rich and detailed. The characters are unique and interesting, and the stories themselves are a lot of fun, covering a lot of ground, literally and figuratively.  My goal is for this to be the start of a franchise with a broad appeal to geeks and nerds of all stripes; to that end, I’ve done my best to write positive role-model characters of varying sexes, races, and orientations. Also, for anyone to whom this kind of thing is important (which, honestly, should be everyone), both books would have the ability to pass the Bechdel Test. I hope these stories resonate with people, make them excited. I aim to make the reader rethink how they perceive and interact with other geeks and nerds who may seem different from them at first glance. I know that’s a pretty ambitious plan for a couple of pseudo-sci-fi novels by an unknown author, but I firmly believe you have to dream big to win big. So, this is me, dreaming big.

I'm Broke But I Want To Help Out Anyway? What Can I Do?

     I included the one dollar contribution level so that even the most cash-strapped person can donate to this campaign. If you cannot contribute, it’s entirely probable that you know people who can. It takes less time to share this on Twitter, Facebook, Google+, or any other social media site than it will to read this sentence. Please help me get the word out and let other folks know about it. The more help I get, the more editing I get done, the quicker the stories get out, the faster I can start to change the world.

     Yeah, that’s right, I want to change the world, too.

     Thanks for taking the time to read all of this, and let’s build the Jovian Frontier together.

Steven

The characters are unique and interesting, and the stories themselves are a lot of fun, covering a lot of ground, literally and figuratively.  My goal is for this to be the start of a franchise with a broad appeal to geeks and nerds of all stripes; to that end, I’ve done my best to write positive role-model characters of varying sexes, races, and orientations. Also, for anyone to whom this kind of thing is important (which, honestly, should be everyone), both books would have the ability to pass the Bechdel Test. I hope these stories resonate with people, make them excited. I aim to make the reader rethink how they perceive and interact with other geeks and nerds who may seem different from them at first glance. I know that’s a pretty ambitious plan for a couple of pseudo-sci-fi novels by an unknown author, but I firmly believe you have to dream big to win big. So, this is me, dreaming big.
I'm Broke But I Want To Help Out Anyway? What Can I Do?
     I included the one dollar contribution level so that even the most cash-strapped person can donate to this campaign. If you cannot contribute, it’s entirely probable that you know people who can. It takes less time to share this on Twitter, Facebook, Google+, or any other social media site than it will to read this sentence. Please help me get the word out and let other folks know about it. The more help I get, the more editing I get done, the quicker the stories get out, the faster I can start to change the world.
     Yeah, that’s right, I want to change the world, too.
     Thanks for taking the time to read all of this, and let’s build the Jovian Frontier together.
Steven

story:
What is Collective Consciousness?

Collective Consciousness is a literary magazine published by The Writers' Collective of Manitoba, a not-for-profit organization that supports emerging writers.

Once upon a time, Collective Consciousness was a black-and-white journal of creative writing by authors from Manitoba, put together with a lot of love but not a lot a funding, and, hence, not a whole lot of style.

We are revamping Collective Consciousness to create a meeting of writing and visual art - a creative arts magazine that explores new voices and new ways of telling stories through the interplay of words and images. The new Collective Consciousness will feature a myriad of new and emerging writers and artists from across Canada and around the world, and will serve to highlight those emerging from various creative communities across Manitoba.


What We'll Use the Money For 

We have enlisted a hardworking team of writers, designers, and artists to create a coffee table-quality magazine that keeps all the love and brings the style. Meet the team behind Collective Consciousness.

The revamped Collective Consciousness will include the following specs:

- 96 pages + cover
- full colour
- size of 9.5"x13"
- available space for advertising

We have two priorities:  artistic merit and diversity.

We want to publish new and emerging writers and artists that represent excellence and diversity in all of its forms, be it genre, experience, and/or perspective.

Here's how we'd like to do that:

- Print the magazine ($5962 for 1000 copies)
- Hold an awesome launch party in Winnipeg to reintroduce Collective Consciousness to readers and to celebrate the first issue's contributors ($3000 for  venue, food, and drink)
- Mail the first issue to readers ($2027 for postage)

If we don't raise the full amount, our plans will be scaled back accordingly - but Collective Consciousness will still live! 


What You Can Get

First and foremost, you can be one of our first readers and subscribers! One issue will get you 96 pages of cutting-edge writing + art from Manitoba and around the world. Take the plunge on a year's subscription and you'll get four issues of the same, delivered to your mailbox. You can upgrade your donation to get a poster of the first issue cover. 


Merely receiving Collective Consciousness not enough for ya? You can be part of our first issue! Our "Shameless Self-Promotion" package gives you a quarter page advertisement to make your own.


And, if you're feeling especially altruistic (or worried about the taxman), you can swap your perk for a charitable tax receipt.


It's Not Just a Magazine

Collective Consciousness is designed to be a gateway to the world of publishing for new and emerging writers. Gaining recognition as a professional creator can be hard. At The Writers' Collective, we're all about making the process more inclusive and welcoming.

We know there are a ton of fabulous writers and artists out there who haven't gotten a chance to show off what they can do, and we want to give a voice to that emerging talent. Collective Consciousness to be your first professional publishing credit and your first step on the road to being a professional creator.

Not only do we want to publish new and emerging writers, we want to publish as many different voices as we can! Our editorial policy is based on what we've decided to call Equitable Consideration. Equitable Consideration is based on the position that all authors and artists are different; therefore, they bring with them different ways of seeing, understanding and affecting change in the world.

We define diversity as any way in which people can and do differ, including (but not limited to) sex, gender, skin colour, ethnicity, culture, religion, sexual orientation, physical ability, mental ability, family status, socioeconomic status and political views.

At Collective Consciousness, our mandate is to celebrate and represent these myriad of differences.

And we hope that makes you as excited to read our magazine as we are to publish it!


Other Ways You Can Help

You don't have to donate money to help out (though we really appreciate it). You can also help us spread the word. Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, wherever you live on the worldwide web. And follow us on Facebook, Twitter or Tumblr to keep up with how we're doing! 

If you have a blog, newsletter or podcast and you think your followers would be interested in Collective Consciousness, we'd be happy to give you an interview or feature article. Just contact us at any of the links below!

story:
SOS—SAVE OUR SCAT!

HELP KEEP BLACK SCAT BOOKS FLOWING...

Norman Conquest (aka Derek Pell) has been publishing ever since he was a teen. In his own words: “I published my first lit mag, Pulse, when I was fifteen. It was photocopied and I don’t remember how many copies I unleashed on the unsuspecting public. A year later, I edited another xeroxed magazine called Black Journal and managed to produce 4 or 5 issues. I saved up a whopping  $250 and purchased a used mimeograph and began publishing saddle-stitched pamphlets of poetry and prose and "Freedom Zap" broadsides. The quality left plenty (if not everything) to be desired. So when I could afford it, I’d splurge and have the covers offset by a local printer. After my years as a teenage publisher, I was fortunate to receive funding through the National Endowment for the Arts and the New York State Council on the Arts which allowed me to publish seven issues of an offset printed  lit mag called Not Guilty!  I managed to publish many of the poets, writers & artists I admired: Michael McClure, Anne Waldman, Ed Sanders, Tuli Kupferberg, Patti Smith, Janine Pommy-Vega, Norman Rubington, Russell Edson, and others.”

Today, the weird/wild/wicked  books that Black Scat  publishes  are the result of Norman's passionate devotion to non-commercial art & fiction and his many years of  hard work. Specializing in absurdist humor and offbeat titles, this little press is unlike anything on the indie scene.

You may be surprised to learn, Black Scat Books is essentially a one-man-band! Since July 4th, 2012, Norman Conquest has managed to publish nearly 100 books, including limited edition chapbooks, broadside posters, and 15 issues of the magazine Black Scat Review --  all by himself.  Black Scat has published experimental novels, short story collections, art, absurdist humor, and original translations from the French--including the first English translations of 6 books by the great French humorist Alphonse Allais.

Norman devotes his time to hand-picking strange & unusual texts and art, editing, proofreading, laying out editions, creating eye-popping cover designs, typesetting, marketing, and correspondence. He is not compensated for the work and Black Scat sales do not offset his basic overhead costs.

 

NOW -- oh no! -- his computer is down and he needs to replace it along with the outdated software. He also would like to pay his authors and contributors. Your donation can make this happen and keep the good Scat flowing. There are lots of exciting projects in the pipeline -- including the first American edition of Alphonse Allais’s DOUBLE OVER!

By donating  now you can get some cool free  perks, too. Check them out on the right side of this page. And we'll be adding to the list as the campaign goes on.

Please help support Norman so Black Scat  can continue publishing its special brand of sublime art and literature.

story:
The campaign closed on April 14th, 2013. But you can continue to donate to Chocolatour via PayPal at http://chocolatour.net. Just look for the "Donate" button. Any additional funds raised will help us print more copies of the book and plan chocolate events in as many regions as we can. 

We raised a total of $7,500 via private donations and the Indiegogo site during the four weeks of the campaign. This will enable us to do a small print run of the book and cover the editorial and design costs. We hope to have the book out by June.

Thanks very much to the 112 contributors who believe in this project and love chocolate as much as I do!  

You can watch the campaign video and slideshow on YouTube at https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3DZhekCxRcU. 

 

This info helped me set the $15,000 budget for this campaign:

The first edition of this book will have more than 50 full colour photos. We therefore have opted to print it on high quality coated paper so that the photos will reproduce well. This is a highly visual book and we want the photos to look as enticing in the book as they did when I took them. Printing and digital setup costs are estimated at $10,000 for the first 500 books. Per unit costs will be reduced significantly if I can be assured that initial sales will be brisk and should order a higher number of books to be printed on the first run. That’s where your pre-orders will really help.

I have a professional editor on my team, in addition to a professional book designer, photographer and videographer who has helped me put together this video. I also need to upgrade my website to facilitate book sales. I have budgeted $4,500 for these important items. Plus, an additional  $500 for regional book launches and chocolate events to build enthusiasm for the book. This all totals $15,000.

Indiegogo will keep 9% of all funds raised as their commission. An additional 3 % fee will be withheld for all contributions made via a credit card. That means, I will receive roughly 12% less than the total contributions that are pledged.

If my campaign is successful and considerably more than $15,000 is raised, I will use the additional funds to plan launches and chocolate events outside of my home territory of Manitoba, Canada. As the book highlights chocolatiers and chocolate makers from seven countries, cocoa growers from three countries, and chocolate events and shops from around the world, it would be wonderful to be able to plan events outside of North America. Any thought of that is beyond my budget at this point in time. But with your help, I can bring Chocolatour to the world.

Please know that all contributions of any amount are welcome. You decide how much you wish to contribute, whether you would like one of the perks outlined above, and whether you wish to be named or contribute anonymously.

The Indiegogo platform is user friendly and easy to navigate. But if you wish to bypass the official campaign and make a contribution directly to me, that can be done via PayPal on our official site for the book at http://chocolatour.net. Just click the "Donate" button to support Chocolatour as you like.

 

Please help me promote this Indiegogo campaign

If a financial contribution is out of your reach right now, you can still help by promoting my campaign via your social networks, and telling friends, family, and colleagues about it. They say nine out of 10 people love chocolate and that the 10th person is lying! If that’s true and everyone loves chocolate as much as we do, Chocolatour is bound to be a hit and a welcome gift for any chocolate lover on your list.

Thank you so much for helping me publish this artisanal publishing project that celebrates the passion of artisanal chocolate. I am truly grateful to have you on Team Chocolatour.

Doreen Pendgracs

Author, Chocolatour: A Quest for the World’s Best Chocolate

story:
L’Oiseau – a Message of Hope for All Mankind

In August 2016 a little book by Swiss author Eveline Porter was published in French by the Persée publishers. This delightful little book tells the story of how a newly-hatched red bird was found and looked after by the author and her cat, became fully-fledged and begins to speak to the author. L’Oiseau, as she calls the bird, tells us the story of how seriously ill the earth is and points the way to healing.

Our publishing house now wants to publish a bi-lingual version (English and Esperanto) of this book in spring 2017 because the bird's message deserves to be be spread throughout the entire world.

L’Oiseau (La Birdo) – mesaĝo de espero por la tuta homaro

En aŭgusto 2016 aperis ĉe la eldonejo Persée en franca lingvo eta libro de la svisa verkistino Eveline Porter. Tiu-ĉi mirinda libro rakontas la historion de eta ruĝa birdo, kiu eloviĝas el ovo trovita kaj flegita de la verkistino kaj ŝia kato, flugipoviĝas kaj ekparolas al la aŭtorino. L’Oiseau, kiel ŝi simple nomas la birdon, rakontas al nia la historion pri la forta malsano de la tero kaj montras al ni vojon al la saniĝo.

Nia eldonejo nun planas en 2017 publikigi la libron en dulingva versio en la angla kaj en Esperanto, ĉar la mesaĝo de la birdo meritas disvastiĝi en la lingvo de la espero en la tuta mondo.

 

About L’Oiseau

L'Oiseau is a message of hope for the collective awareness of the possibilities available to mankind, a new perspective for existence and its potential, whose resources – like limitless treasures – reside within each of us. Patiently, L’Oiseau shows us in all its patience throughout history its passion in order to lead us to the peak of our own potential.

Pri L’Oiseau

L’Oiseau, tio estas mesaĝo de espero por konsciiĝo kolektiva pri la ebloj, kiuj estas proponitaj al la homaro. Nova perspektivo perspektivo de la ekzisto kaj ĝia potencialo, kies resursoj kiel ne imageblaj trezoroj troviĝas en ĉiu el ni. Pacience L’Oiseau revelacias sian tutan pasion dum la evoluo de la rakonto por konduki nin al nia propra kulmino.

 

About the Author

Ever since her earliest childhood, the author, who was in 1961, has had a genuine and sympathetic interest in nature, science and animals. In her search for the truth and the secrets of life she often asks questions that disturb her immediate surroundings.

Her father, a keen amateur astronomer, taught her his tremendous fascination for the infinite vastness which she understandably transferred to the infinitesimal. He also showed her how to recognise fossils as witnesses to the past and evolution.

Her numerous travels enabled her to constantly explore ever-distant horizons and to immerse herself in various cultures and creeds. She developed an unreserved devotion to the beauty and diversity of nature, thereby venerating life in all its possible forms. She finds the answers she seeks in their purest form when she shows us nature if one perceives it with the heed of a pure heart.

In a three-year stay in Alaska she experienced landscapes of awe-inspiring vastness, the Northern Lights and a fauna that had adapted to this merciless environment. In these infinite landscapes she was awed to discover how precious and fragile life is. All these experiences and encounters finally inspired her to write the story of L’Oiseau.

Pri la aŭtorino

Naskiĝinta en 1961 la aŭtorino mont­ris ek de sia frua infaneco aŭtentikan kaj bonfartigan interesiĝon por la na­turo, la scienco kaj la bestoj. Dum sia serĉado por la vero kaj la sekretoj de la vivo ŝi faras demandojn, kiuj ofte estas maltrankviligaj por ŝia ĉirkaŭaĵo.

Ŝia patro, pasia astronomo, al ŝi transdonis sian fascinon pri la senfineco granda, kiun ŝi logike rilatigas al la senfineco eta. Li ankaŭ malkovrigas al ŝi la fosiliojn, atestantojn de tempo pasinta kaj de la evoluo.

Multnombraj vojaĝoj permesis al ŝi atingi forajn horizontojn, plonĝi en malsamajn kulturojn kaj kredojn. Ŝi akiris pasion senkondiĉan por la beleco kaj la diverseco de la naturo, honorigante tiel la vivon en ĉiuj ĝiaj manifestiĝoj eblaj. La respondojn, kiujn ŝi serĉas, ŝi trovas en ilia plej pura esprimo, en tiu, kiun la naturo al ni montras, kiam oni rigardas atente kaj per koraj okuloj.

Dum trijara restado en Alasko ŝi malkovris pejsaĝojn impresajn pro sia grandeco, la polusajn lumojn kaj faŭnon mirinde adaptitan al tiu senkompata ĉirkaŭo en la alta nordo. En tiu spaco giganta, kiu ŝajnas esti senfina kaj kie la vivo estas tiel valora kaj tiel vundebla.

Ĉiuj tiuj spertoj fine inspris ŝin al la rakonto de L’Oiseau.

 

About the Wishes of L’Oiseau and the author

This book pays tribute to all those who support a world of global peace, freedom from suffering and which enables mankind to reach its potential.

Pri la deziroj de L’Oiseau kaj la aŭtorino

Honorigu tiujn, kiuj ĉiam agadis por mondo de universala paco kaj la liberigo de la suferado kun vizio de realiĝinta homaro.

 

About the Book

This book was published for the first time in summer 2016 in French by Persée. The A5 French-language version is 66 pages long and is available in bookshops.

The side-by-side bilingual version in English and Esperanto will be 100 pages long, be in A5 format and will appear on 21 March 2017 under the title of L’Oiseau (The Bird/La Birdo), ISBN 978-3-9524594-3-0. The bilingual version in German and English will be ideal reading for those taking the English-language Esperanto course in Duolingo!

Pri la libro

La libreto la unuan fojon aperis en somero 2016 ĉe la eldonejo Persée en franca lingvo. La libreto en la formato A5 enhavas en la franca versio 66 paĝojn kaj haveblas en publikaj librovendejoj.

La dulingva eldono aperos la 21-an de marto 2017 paralele en la angla kaj en Esperanto sub la titolo „L’Oiseau (The Bird/La Birdo)“, formato A5, 100 p., ISBN 978-3-9524594-3-0. Ĝi estos ieala legaĵo por la partoprenantoj de la anglalingva Esperanto-kurso en Duolingo.

 

The Funds Required

To fulfil this project we need a total of CHF9,300 for the translation into English and Esperanto, to prepare the layout and the promotion work. With an advance from the author, a contribution from the publisher and an assurance of financing from the Swiss Esperanto Society, we have already secured CHF 8,000, so that we now only need another CHF 1,300 to complete the project, which we want to obtain using this crowdfunding method.

Your support will help us finish this project. Should the target amount be exceeded, your contribution will enable our publishing company Allsprachendienst Esperanto GmbH and the Swiss Esperanto Society with other future Esperanto book and periodical projects.

If you are not able to support our campaign financially, that will not be a barrier to helping us. For example, you can promote our book project among your friends and acquaintances by telling them about this campaign and publicising it on social media.

La bezonataj rimedoj

Por plenumi tiun-ĉi projekton ni bezonas totale CHF 9300 por la traduko al la angla kaj al Esperanto, la pretigo de la kompostaĵo kaj la reklama laboro. Helpe de antaŭpago fare de la aŭtorino, kontribuo de la publikigisto kaj garantio financa de Svisa Esperanto-Societo ni jam povis sekurigi la summon de CHF 8000, tiel ke ni ebzonoas alian summon den CHF 1300 por plenumi la projekton, kiun summon ni deziras akiri uzante ĉi-tiun amasfinancan metodon.

Via subteno helpos al ni realigi la projekton. Se la celsumo estos superigita, tiam via kontribuo subtenos la publikigan elaboron de la entrepreno Allsprachendienst Esperanto GmbH kaj la Svisa Esperanto-Societo por realigi aliajn estontajn libro- kaj periodaĵo-projektojn.

Se vi ne kapablas subteni nian kampanjon finance, tio ne estos barilo por helpi al ni. Ekezmple vi povas reklami nian libroprojekton inter viaj geamikoj, rakontante al ili pri ĉi-tiu kampanjo kaj publikigante ĝin en sociaj medioj.

story_txt:
L’Oiseau – a Message of Hope for All Mankind
In August 2016 a little book by Swiss author Eveline Porter was published in French by the Persée publishers. This delightful little book tells the story of how a newly-hatched red bird was found and looked after by the author and her cat, became fully-fledged and begins to speak to the author. L’Oiseau, as she calls the bird, tells us the story of how seriously ill the earth is and points the way to healing.
Our publishing house now wants to publish a bi-lingual version (English and Esperanto) of this book in spring 2017 because the bird's message deserves to be be spread throughout the entire world.
L’Oiseau (La Birdo) – mesaĝo de espero por la tuta homaro
En aŭgusto 2016 aperis ĉe la eldonejo Persée en franca lingvo eta libro de la svisa verkistino Eveline Porter. Tiu-ĉi mirinda libro rakontas la historion de eta ruĝa birdo, kiu eloviĝas el ovo trovita kaj flegita de la verkistino kaj ŝia kato, flugipoviĝas kaj ekparolas al la aŭtorino. L’Oiseau, kiel ŝi simple nomas la birdon, rakontas al nia la historion pri la forta malsano de la tero kaj montras al ni vojon al la saniĝo.
Nia eldonejo nun planas en 2017 publikigi la libron en dulingva versio en la angla kaj en Esperanto, ĉar la mesaĝo de la birdo meritas disvastiĝi en la lingvo de la espero en la tuta mondo.
 
About L’Oiseau
L'Oiseau is a message of hope for the collective awareness of the possibilities available to mankind, a new perspective for existence and its potential, whose resources – like limitless treasures – reside within each of us. Patiently, L’Oiseau shows us in all its patience throughout history its passion in order to lead us to the peak of our own potential.
Pri L’Oiseau
L’Oiseau, tio estas mesaĝo de espero por konsciiĝo kolektiva pri la ebloj, kiuj estas proponitaj al la homaro. Nova perspektivo perspektivo de la ekzisto kaj ĝia potencialo, kies resursoj kiel ne imageblaj trezoroj troviĝas en ĉiu el ni. Pacience L’Oiseau revelacias sian tutan pasion dum la evoluo de la rakonto por konduki nin al nia propra kulmino.
 
About the Author
Ever since her earliest childhood, the author, who was in 1961, has had a genuine and sympathetic interest in nature, science and animals. In her search for the truth and the secrets of life she often asks questions that disturb her immediate surroundings.
Her father, a keen amateur astronomer, taught her his tremendous fascination for the infinite vastness which she understandably transferred to the infinitesimal. He also showed her how to recognise fossils as witnesses to the past and evolution.
Her numerous travels enabled her to constantly explore ever-distant horizons and to immerse herself in various cultures and creeds. She developed an unreserved devotion to the beauty and diversity of nature, thereby venerating life in all its possible forms. She finds the answers she seeks in their purest form when she shows us nature if one perceives it with the heed of a pure heart.
In a three-year stay in Alaska she experienced landscapes of awe-inspiring vastness, the Northern Lights and a fauna that had adapted to this merciless environment. In these infinite landscapes she was awed to discover how precious and fragile life is. All these experiences and encounters finally inspired her to write the story of L’Oiseau.
Pri la aŭtorino
Naskiĝinta en 1961 la aŭtorino mont­ris ek de sia frua infaneco aŭtentikan kaj bonfartigan interesiĝon por la na­turo, la scienco kaj la bestoj. Dum sia serĉado por la vero kaj la sekretoj de la vivo ŝi faras demandojn, kiuj ofte estas maltrankviligaj por ŝia ĉirkaŭaĵo.
Ŝia patro, pasia astronomo, al ŝi transdonis sian fascinon pri la senfineco granda, kiun ŝi logike rilatigas al la senfineco eta. Li ankaŭ malkovrigas al ŝi la fosiliojn, atestantojn de tempo pasinta kaj de la evoluo.
Multnombraj vojaĝoj permesis al ŝi atingi forajn horizontojn, plonĝi en malsamajn kulturojn kaj kredojn. Ŝi akiris pasion senkondiĉan por la beleco kaj la diverseco de la naturo, honorigante tiel la vivon en ĉiuj ĝiaj manifestiĝoj eblaj. La respondojn, kiujn ŝi serĉas, ŝi trovas en ilia plej pura esprimo, en tiu, kiun la naturo al ni montras, kiam oni rigardas atente kaj per koraj okuloj.
Dum trijara restado en Alasko ŝi malkovris pejsaĝojn impresajn pro sia grandeco, la polusajn lumojn kaj faŭnon mirinde adaptitan al tiu senkompata ĉirkaŭo en la alta nordo. En tiu spaco giganta, kiu ŝajnas esti senfina kaj kie la vivo estas tiel valora kaj tiel vundebla.
Ĉiuj tiuj spertoj fine inspris ŝin al la rakonto de L’Oiseau.
 
About the Wishes of L’Oiseau and the author
This book pays tribute to all those who support a world of global peace, freedom from suffering and which enables mankind to reach its potential.
Pri la deziroj de L’Oiseau kaj la aŭtorino
Honorigu tiujn, kiuj ĉiam agadis por mondo de universala paco kaj la liberigo de la suferado kun vizio de realiĝinta homaro.
 
About the Book
This book was published for the first time in summer 2016 in French by Persée. The A5 French-language version is 66 pages long and is available in bookshops.
The side-by-side bilingual version in English and Esperanto will be 100 pages long, be in A5 format and will appear on 21 March 2017 under the title of L’Oiseau (The Bird/La Birdo), ISBN 978-3-9524594-3-0. The bilingual version in German and English will be ideal reading for those taking the English-language Esperanto course in Duolingo!
Pri la libro
La libreto la unuan fojon aperis en somero 2016 ĉe la eldonejo Persée en franca lingvo. La libreto en la formato A5 enhavas en la franca versio 66 paĝojn kaj haveblas en publikaj librovendejoj.
La dulingva eldono aperos la 21-an de marto 2017 paralele en la angla kaj en Esperanto sub la titolo „L’Oiseau (The Bird/La Birdo)“, formato A5, 100 p., ISBN 978-3-9524594-3-0. Ĝi estos ieala legaĵo por la partoprenantoj de la anglalingva Esperanto-kurso en Duolingo.
 
The Funds Required
To fulfil this project we need a total of CHF9,300 for the translation into English and Esperanto, to prepare the layout and the promotion work. With an advance from the author, a contribution from the publisher and an assurance of financing from the Swiss Esperanto Society, we have already secured CHF 8,000, so that we now only need another CHF 1,300 to complete the project, which we want to obtain using this crowdfunding method.
Your support will help us finish this project. Should the target amount be exceeded, your contribution will enable our publishing company Allsprachendienst Esperanto GmbH and the Swiss Esperanto Society with other future Esperanto book and periodical projects.
If you are not able to support our campaign financially, that will not be a barrier to helping us. For example, you can promote our book project among your friends and acquaintances by telling them about this campaign and publicising it on social media.

Se vi ne kapablas subteni nian kampanjon finance, tio ne estos barilo por helpi al ni. Ekezmple vi povas reklami nian libroprojekton inter viaj geamikoj, rakontante al ili pri ĉi-tiu kampanjo kaj publikigante ĝin en sociaj medioj.
