"Dieses Buch wird sie so hart und laut lachen lassen, dass sie deshalb langjährige Freunde verlieren werden!"      
Magnus Delafonte (Literaturkritiker)
"Ein MUSS für jeden Reinhäuter!"
Reiner von Tattoofrei



"Hier könnte IHRE Empfehlung stehen!"
Snickers für Linkshänder


Hallo Welt, ich bin Willy. Seit ca. 15 Jahren bin ich "freier Künstler" oder wie auch immer man das nennt, wenn man beim Bäcker mit selbstgestalteten Postkarten bezahlen will ("Scher dich RAUS, du Lump!"). 

Ich liebe die Kunst. Atme für die Kunst. Und lebe für die Kunst.
Zwischendurch mache ich kommerzielle Sachen - wie z.B. die ZDFneo Zeichentrickserie "Deutsches Fleisch", Gags schreiben für Extra 3 oder Einkäufe erledigen für alte Menschen (ihr glaubt nicht, was man da verdient!).


Aber eigentlich will ich nur meine Kunst machen. Unzensiert, roh und ehrlich. Das gelingt mir immer besser, aber leicht ist es nicht. Man muss ja doch Miete zahlen (und laufende Unterhaltskosten für die ständig hungrigen Ausrutscher einer EINZIGEN Nacht... ICH HASSE DICH, VERA! DU HAST MICH REINGELEGT!)

Jetzt habe ich dieses Buch geschrieben. Also genauer gesagt, schreibe ich es gerade noch fertig. Geht ja heute: Dinge verkaufen, bevor es sie gibt. Früher nannte man das Betrug. Heute Crowdfunding. 

"Snickers für Linkshänder - Das Buch" ist eine Kurzgeschichtensammlung voller absurder Alltagssituationen, teils real, teils Phantasie, teils unerhört übertrieben, teils so dermaßen echt, wie nur unsere verrückte Welt sein kann. Wer damit jetzt so GAR NICHTS anfangen kann, wird am Ende dieses Textes eine kleine Auswahl vorfinden.

Ja, das Buch ist etwas teurer als ein Paperback im Buchhandel. Das liegt daran, dass ich weder eine Agentur, noch einen Verlag im Rücken habe und alles (vom Schreiben, über Layout bis zum Vertrieb) komplett in Eigenregie mache. Nur Lesen müsst ihr es schon selbst. 
Ich habe viel Mühe und Liebe in diese Texte gesteckt und freue mich darüber, sie nun endlich mit der Welt zu teilen. Zusätzlich gibt es in dieser Kampagne ein paar weitere "Kunstprodukte" von mir. Der Erlös fliesst zu 99% in meine Kunst rein. 1% gehen für Zigaretten und Monte drauf.

Danke für Deine Unterstützung!
Und viel Spaß weiterhin auf meinem geliebten Portal: https://www.facebook.com/snicklink/

Willy

Das biete ich an:

Snickers für Linkshänder - Das Buch

Der fresheste Shit von hier bis Honolulu in einer limitierten Edition. Die besten Kurzgeschichten von meiner Seite plus fünf EXKLUSIVE Texte, die bisher nur ein verwahrloster Puppenspieler namens Giovanni lesen durfte. Inklusive 35 wunderschöner Bildcollagen, die ich mit einer gecrackten Version von Photoshop erstellte. Gönn Dir!

   


(Die Abbildung ist nicht 100% deckungsgleich mit dem Endprodukt, weil es noch kein einziges gedrucktes Exemplar gibt. Es wird ein Paperback im schwarz-weiss-Druck sein, ca. 135 Seiten)


Meine zwei Klassiker "Berlin Fucking City I & II" als Neuauflage. Bissige Berichte eines jungen Wilden über eine Stadt, die ihre Seele verkauft - garniert mit Wut, Hass und Humor.

Die Originalauflage wird zurzeit (I kid you NOT!) zu HORRENDEN Preisen - und zwar GEBRAUCHT - gehandelt:

                   


Snicklink T-Shirt

Ein geheimes Abkommen mit JEDEM Club der Welt erlaubt es Dir mit diesem T-Shirt auf jede noch so begehrte Veranstaltung - durch bloßes Tragen - am Pöbel vorbei und KOSTENLOS reinzukommen. Außerdem ist es ein global akzeptierter Indikator dafür, dass du reich und erfolgreich bist und über gesunde, leistungsfähige Genitalien verfügst. Der Rechtsweg ist ausgeschlossen. 


I <3 Eagles Kaffeetasse
Anno 1993 zum ersten Mal als Wortbild auf dem räudigen Pullover einer älteren Dame am U-Oskar Helene Heim in Berlin/Zehlendorf gesichtet, wurde dieser "größter aller Faux-Pas" (Zehlendorfer Hipster-Anzeiger) für immer auf dieser wunderschönen Kaffeetasse verewigt um sich jeden Morgen daran zu erinnern, wie absurd diese Welt und ihre Bewohner sind.

Warum will ich Dein Geld?

 

Meine Güte, ich will absolut ehrlich sein: Niemand auf der Welt BRAUCHT dieses Buch. Sekündlich werden wir zugeballert mit minderwertigen Kunstprodukten und JEDER ist wichtig und krass und "the next big thing". Käsekuchen! Es gibt Armut und Hunger und Let's Dance auf dieser Welt. Das zu bekämpfen ist WICHTIGER! 

Aber man kann eben nicht in jeder freien Minute seines Lebens die Welt retten. Und genau HIER setzt mein Produkt ein. Auf den ersten Blick der komprimierte, kreative Gehirnsaft eines talentierten, witzigen und unglaublich gut aussehenden Internet-Nerds... ist klar, verstehe ich... aber auf den zweiten Blick: ein literarisches Bonbon, speziell konzipiert für die wenigen schönen Minuten am Tag, in denen man endlich kurz entspannen und die Welt vergessen kann. Ja, die Rede ist vom Kacken. 

Mein Anliegen ist es, dieses besondere Erlebnis im Leben eines jeden Menschen NOCH besonderer zu machen. "Snickers für Linkshänder - das Buch" bietet kurze, intensive Nuggets für den schnellen Stress-Schiss zwischendurch, aber genauso: lange Sinfonien des Wohlbefindens für ausgedehnte Spaziergänge an der Kot d'Azur.

Ich präsentiere: 50 ausgewählte Kurzgeschichten, Gedichte und Texte, die dich über die Absurdität der Existenz, aber auch über nonchalante Perlen des Alltags LAUT und HART lachen lassen werden. 

Garantiert.
Ich mein's ernst. Ich gebe jedem, der dieses Buch kauft eine LACHGARANTIE™. Solltest du NICHT mindestens DREI extreme Lachanfälle und ZWÖLF hörbare normale Lacher beim lesen dieses Buches bekommen, erhälst du dein Geld zurück. Wo gibt's sowas denn heutzutage noch? :)

Also, ihr lieben Peoples ausm Internet, meiner Community, ihr Normalos und Brutalos, ihr Fans, Freunde, Fluffer und Fallenleger... und natürlich meine schmutzigen Kumpels von der Kurfürstenstraße (LIDL-Filiale Herr Sanowsky BLEIBT - sonst BEULE!): Kauft! Kauft viele Exemplare. Verteilt die Botschaft und macht mich zu einem Mann, der stolz behaupten kann: ich kann jetzt auch ZWEI Mal in der Woche duschen. Meine Buchverkäufe machen's möglich.

Ich liebe euch alle - auch die von euch, die ich nicht kenne - wie nur ein verrückter Stalker namens Bilal, aus einem nach Pisse und Gorgonzola stinkenden Pappkarton heraus operierend - seine Angebetete lieben kann. Also krankhaft obsessiv und höchstwahrscheinlich mit anschließendem Gefängnisaufenthalt. 

Let's DO this!

story:
Thanks to some offline donations I am currently at the $350 mark! OVER HALFWAY THERE!! Thank you to everyone who's chipped in so far.

About my goal:

My name is Jessica, and I'm a writer from Houston, Texas.  Over the last year, I've received some extremely positive feedback on my writing from several agents and editors and have used that feedback to improve the novel I've been working on since November 2008, MOST WANTED, a young adult sci-fi/fantasy novel.

I learned that 16 agents who represent my age group/genre, will be accepting pitches at the DFW Writers' Conference May 19 and 20.  The ability to pitch to 16 in one weekend is huge.  There have been many success stories to come out of this conference, and I hope to be one more!

I hadn't planned to attend any other conferences for a while because of finances.  It's been tough over the last couple of years with student loans, extensive medical bills, and periods of both unemployment and underemployment (like right now).  However, when I saw how many of my top agent choices would be there, I knew I had to get there somehow.  In addition to the opportunity to pitch, there will be some fantastic classes that I'm looking forward to attending.

You can read about the conference here: http://dfwwritersconference.org/

Where you come in, if you're willing!

Here's a breakdown of the $600 I'm trying to raise:

$350 is for the registration fee (includes a full weekend of workshops on the craft and business of writing as well as one formal pitch session with an agent and lunch both days)

$250 is to cover the hotel costs for two nights ($99/night plus tax)

Additional costs not included above that will be covered if funding exceeds my goal:  I'm fortunate to have a ride there and back, so I'll only need to chip in for gas.  Based on how high gas has been, this may be pricey.  I'll also have to take care of my meals other than lunch.  If I'm able to, I'd love to have an additional formal pitch session, which would be $39.

What I can give in return:

Even if an agent offered representation at the conference, I'd most likely have to go through some revisions to MOST WANTED before we'd go on submission to the publishing houses.  Then it would take at least a year before the book debuted.  So, my gifts are mostly based on things I can give soon or things I think people would get a kick out of!  I'm offering several levels of perks depending on your donation amount.  Please see the sidebar for the gifts at each level.

The impact of your donation:

I have always loved to write.  It took me a long time to trust the voice inside me that told me I could do it.  I wrote the roughdraft of MOST WANTED in November 2008 and have revised it over and over, trying to polish it into a diamond.  Along the way, I helped start a local writing group that just had its 2-year anniversary and became involved in a national, online writing organization.  One of my short stories has been published in an anthology, and another will be published this year.  Each conference or workshop I've attended has improved my writing, and I've had some incredible opportunities to learn from published authors, editors, and agents along the way.
 
I've made the connections that will help me promote my work, now I just need the agent who is as passionate as I am about my characters.  With sixteen agents who represent Young Adult novels, the odds of getting a request for my material are really good.
 
At a recent conference I attended, both the editor and agent I had critiques with praised my writing and my voice.  That has given me the confidence to know it's time to send this novel out into the world.  With your help, I'll be one step closer.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially (and I completely understand or I wouldn't be asking for help!), please help me spread the word! I appreciate the time you've taken to read this.  Thank you for helping me along my writing path.

story:
Bref résumé

Frivolités, mon petit blogue chéri que j'ai créé il y a près d'un an, passe maintenant au format papier. Du moins, c'est l'objectif. J'ai besoin d'aide pour réaliser ce petit rêve qui alimente mon quotidien.

 Ce dont j'ai besoin et ce que vous obtenez

Pour y arriver, j'ai besoin de sous. Des sous, j'en ai pas vraiment et c'est pour ça que je vous invite à m'encourager. L'objectif actuel est de 500$. Le but: avoir assez d'argent pour couvrir les frais d'impression, du contenu photographique et peut-être aussi (mais là c'est le rêve et c'est seulement si on dépasse l'objectif) passer à un site ".com". Aussi, plus j'amasse, plus le recueil peut ressembler à ma vision artistique: une impression couleur, un papier de meilleure qualité, une oeuvre moins condensée, etc. Voyez-vous, mes besoins s'adapterons à votre engouement!

PS: Pour les contreparties, ça se passe au lancement. Sinon, pour les Montréalais je ferai la livraison à domicile. Pour les autres, on s'arrangera ;)

D'autres façons d'aider

Tu n'as pas de moyen parce que tu es dans une situation assez précaire? Je comprends. Aide-moi quand même en partageant ce projet, en en parlant à ta mère, ta grand-mère, tes besties, ton kick, tous ceux que ça pourrait intéresser d'aider un jeune artiste en difficulté.


Sois sûr de liker la page Facebook de Frivolités pour être au courant de tous les développements!


Merci là,

Coeur-coeur

story:
Short Summary

Despite the fact that we pass them everyday, we know very little about the people who serenade us on our daily journeys. This book will endeavour to tell the stories of London’s Underground buskers, portraying their lives, love of music and individual experiences from a human and visual angle, through interviews, photographs and anecdotes.

We are MA Publishing students at UCL and we are committed to publishing this book for everyone interested in busking, London, music and the eclectic world of undiscovered talent.

What We Need & What You Get

We need £500 in order to:

  • Print 200 books of at least 100 pages in a demi format (small coffee table book) and in colour. The book will contain feature stories, interviews and photographs relating to London buskers
  • Distribute the book to our contributors
As a 'Thank You' for your donation, you will get:
  • Your name in the book for any donation between £5 and £19
  • A physical copy of the book for any donation of £20 and above, as well as your name in the book
If we do not reach our goal of £500, we will still go to print with the money we do have but adapt the number of books printed to our budget.

The Impact

This aim of this book is to bring awareness to the art that lives in London's Underground. Therefore, your contributions will aid in:

  • Presenting the stories of London buskers to a larger and global audience
  • Promoting the talent of generally undiscovered artists
  • Make our project a reality

Risks & Challenges

With every project comes obstacles and producing this book is no exception.

The main challenges we are facing are:

  • Securing content - Finding buskers that inspire us and are willing to share their intimate stories with us
  • Funding - Getting enough resource to produce the best book possible that fits with our vision 
  • Timing - Coordinating with buskers and printers and everyone in between to ensure we remain on schedule. As MA students, we do have a strict deadline.

Our plan to overcome these challenges so far has been to always communicate effectively and set short-term objectives for ourselves. To this date, we remain on schedule. This campaign aims to resolve our funding issues.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not in a position to donate, you can still help us by:

  • Sharing the link to this campaign on your social media
  • Following us on Facebook (Notes from the Underground), Twitter (@notesunderbook) and Instagram (@notesunderbook)

Thank you for your interest in our project!

The Notes from the Underground team.

story:
Founded in 2014 by three Dominican Afro-Latina feminists, La Galería Magazine is an unaffiliated independent grassroots magazine fighting to give a voice to Dominicans in the diaspora and take back our stories.

 

Why You Should Support Us

La Galería Magazine's mission is to provide content that encourages dialogue, celebrates the community, and inspires action among Dominicans of the Diaspora. Our magazine documents and celebrates the stories of the Dominican Diaspora. Articles on our site have touched on topics that directly affect our community including blackness, feminism, the trauma of immigration, LGBTQ issues, food, history, love, sex, and a large array of short poems and creative stories.  La Galería Magazine understands that our stories and perceptions are different, and that only through dialogue can we begin to respect and understand one another. 

Although we only have a little over a year of being in existence, we have already published  109 articles, gotten over 90,000 views, and held five free community oriented events. We have a community of supporters who often send us positive feedback, comment on our articles, and use the writings on La Galería Magazine for class and community organizing purposes. 

La Galería Magazine is pro-liberation and solidarity in every sense of those words. As a Pan-Caribbean publication, our work may be focused on Dominicans but we stand in solidarity with other organizations and individuals who are coming into this Afro-Diasporic consciousness. 

 

La Galería is the place in which family, neighbors, and guests gather to discuss everything from the latest chisme to social and political issues. It is the place where dialogue and debate are welcomed and encouraged. Similarly to la mecedora, galerías are not exclusive to a particular class; some are built-in, others are an impromptu creation. 

 

Why We Need Your Support

La Galería does not receive any government or corporate funding. We are committed to staying independent and write opinion pieces that are anti-oppressive and that continue connecting the diaspora without any filters or compromises. We are committed to this, but to become a project that can maximize impact, we need your help!

 

We need your help to sustain us! We need to pay for website support and maintenance, hosting, coding, and protection for our website, and we’d like to be covered for at least 5 years. According to NJ Creatives, “the lowest rate for hourly design rates is $40, and the highest is $75 (although I know freelance web designers that charge $100 an hour), with an average of $59 an hour.” You can read more about website design rates here: http://executionists.com/much-website-cost-2015/

 

We need to pay our writers! We would like to compensate those who write for us in a time when writers of color aren't highlighted, are often underpaid, and are not compensated for their work. We want to hire reporters to cover events, protests and community projects; issues that are important to our community. We are also in need of translators for some of our most impactful writings that were either submitted in English or Spanish. The rates for how much we’d pay will depend on how much money we raise (so the more we raise, the more we can pay), according to an infographic created by Clear Voice, writers get paid as little as .05 cents per word (which equals $30 for a piece with the minimum required 600 words), to an average of .35 per word. Additionally, we would like to pay community photographers to take photos that can accompany these articles. 

 

We want to go to print!  Currently we're working on gathering some of our best and most read articles to put out the first edition. We also have goals to develop an anthology of Dominican writers and some stories of the Diaspora from a non-fiction, historical lens. This is especially important when looking at the need to document people's diasporic experience and some of the historical context and movements happening in the U.S. The Dominican Diaspora has done an incredible amount of work, and we need to showcase that. We want to document stories of survival as well as resistance that is far from the mainstream and that show a counter-narrative for future generations. Beyond a digital platform, we are hoping to document our legacy in print. 

We want to become more accessible! The magazine is currently online which inevitably makes us inaccessible to many people in our communities. Our current demographics include mostly millennials, but we’d like to reach folks of all ages and stages in life.

 

Imagine how cool it would be to see this on your block:


We need it to plan more events that are free! While there are some limited free spaces in New York, we notice that these tend to be small, or mainly in downtown Manhattan. We would like to hold events uptown, and in other boroughs so that we can become more accessible to our community. Places that we’d like to book tend to charge $300 to $500 per hour, unfortunately even more. Even if we chose spaces that are free, we would like to be able to donate to these spaces to help their sustainability when we do use them.

Photo by Jay Esphotography at our Second Annual Open Mic

Photo from our event El Tiguere y La Chapiadora: Heteronormativity in Dominican Culture

Photo from our event Negritud/Blackness in Dominican Culture

Please make a donation to help support our cause and continue uplifting voices of the Dominican Diaspora! If you're unable to donate at this time, please share our campaign across social media platforms. 

 

About the co-founders:

Amanda Alcantara is a writer, journalist, and community organizer. She was born in New Jersey and raised in the Dominican Republic. Amanda writes about the intersections of gender and race from a political and personal perspective. She is the author of the blog Radical Latina. Her work has appeared on Feministing, Guerrilla Feminism, and El Diario La Prensa. Amanda also does community theater and writes poetry. She’s a firm believer in healing through art and in fighting for liberation. A map of the world turned upside down hangs on her wall.

Isabel Cristina is a 26 year old Afro-Dominicana. She graduated with a Bachelor of Arts degree in English from the City College of New York. She is a lover of books and an aspiring writer, who writes stories inspired by the Dominican diaspora. Having emigrated from the Dominican Republic as a young girl, the process of immigration and her memories of the homeland inspire her writing. She is a core sister of the Sister Circle Collective and a firm believer in creating safe spaces where women could come together, organize, share stories, and empower one another.

Ynanna Djehuty is an Afro-Dominicana born and raised in the Bronx. She is a midwife, reproductive health activist and writer. The focus of her work is the empowerment of women and people of the African Diaspora. A young energetic speaker with the experience of an elder expert, she utilizes her experience as a midwife and reproductive health advocate to raise awareness on maternal and reproductive health for women, highlighting the disparities in the healthcare system in the United States for women of color. Ynanna is the creator of These Waters Run Deep, a multimedia journey into the lives and struggle of Afro-descendant women. Using reproductive and maternal health as a lens, These Waters Run Deep artfully weaves narratives that highlight the socio-political landscape by through which women of color have learned to endure for generations. Triumphing over her own personal challenges allows her to connect on an even deeper level with her audience. In October 2009, the Afro-Dominican speaker published ‘Hija De Mi Madre’ (My Mother’s Daughter), a combination of memoirs, poems and research material focusing on the effects of race on identity. Ynanna is the co-founder and associate editor of La Galería Magazine, an online publication for Dominicans of the Diaspora. She is pursuing certification as a Certified Professional Midwife.

About the team:

Joan Encarnacion is a graphic designer born and raised in the Dominican Republic, and currently living in New York City. He is a senior pursuing a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Electronic Design and Multimedia at The City College of New York.  Joan was exposed to design at a young age through his Grandfather’s sculpture and etching using a hardened dry fruit from the higüero tree, native of the Dominican Republic. Growing up with a older cousin who studied fine arts and dealing the daily electricity blackouts proudly sponsored by the Dominican Government, Joan spent a lot of his time crafting, doodling and creating. He arrived to the United States when he was 11 years old. Although Joan pursued engineering all throughout high school and half of his college career, he never stopped creating. Most of his after school time was spent sketching, learning how to play guitar, origami, graffiti, tutoring and volunteering.

Jennifer Gil-Velazquez is an Afro-Dominicana born in Boston, Massachusetts. She received her undergrad at the University of Massachusetts Boston with a degree in English and a minor in Spanish. During her time at UMASS Boston she participated in the Latino Leadership Opportunity Program as part of the Gaston Institute.  Currently Jennifer is living in New York where she is pursuing writing and research within the Afro-Caribbean diaspora.

Lilliana Tapia is a 29 year-old student, Social Service Coordinator, and aspiring writer currently living in the Bronx. NY.  Having emigrated from the Dominican Republic, she utilized the English language and early assimilation to American culture, to aid her extended relatives as they began and established their own life in New York City. Today, she is a graduate student at the Silberman School of Social Work at Hunter College, working towards a Masters degree in Social Work.  Her experiences, amongst and, as an immigrant woman of color have shaped both her career and personal goals. Lilliana plans to devote much of her work to women, especially mothers, in low-income communities. Within La Galeria and other networks, Lilliana aims to provide spaces and platforms for our communities to share, collaborate and unite.

You can learn more about us here or ask us any questions by emailing us at info@lagaleriamag.com

Ynanna is the co-founder and associate editor of La Galería Magazine, an online publication for Dominicans of the Diaspora. She is pursuing certification as a Certified Professional Midwife.About the team:Joan Encarnacion is a graphic designer born and raised in the Dominican Republic, and currently living in New York City. He is a senior pursuing a Bachelor of Fine Arts in Electronic Design and Multimedia at The City College of New York.  Joan was exposed to design at a young age through his Grandfather’s sculpture and etching using a hardened dry fruit from the higüero tree, native of the Dominican Republic. Growing up with a older cousin who studied fine arts and dealing the daily electricity blackouts proudly sponsored by the Dominican Government, Joan spent a lot of his time crafting, doodling and creating. He arrived to the United States when he was 11 years old. Although Joan pursued engineering all throughout high school and half of his college career, he never stopped creating. Most of his after school time was spent sketching, learning how to play guitar, origami, graffiti, tutoring and volunteering.Jennifer Gil-Velazquez is an Afro-Dominicana born in Boston, Massachusetts. She received her undergrad at the University of Massachusetts Boston with a degree in English and a minor in Spanish. During her time at UMASS Boston she participated in the Latino Leadership Opportunity Program as part of the Gaston Institute.  Currently Jennifer is living in New York where she is pursuing writing and research within the Afro-Caribbean diaspora.Lilliana Tapia is a 29 year-old student, Social Service Coordinator, and aspiring writer currently living in the Bronx. NY.  Having emigrated from the Dominican Republic, she utilized the English language and early assimilation to American culture, to aid her extended relatives as they began and established their own life in New York City. Today, she is a graduate student at the Silberman School of Social Work at Hunter College, working towards a Masters degree in Social Work.  Her experiences, amongst and, as an immigrant woman of color have shaped both her career and personal goals. Lilliana plans to devote much of her work to women, especially mothers, in low-income communities. Within La Galeria and other networks, Lilliana aims to provide spaces and platforms for our communities to share, collaborate and unite.You can learn more about us here or ask us any questions by emailing us at info@lagaleriamag.com

story:
Who am I? Why am I doing this?

My name is Kurt Wood. Some of you may know me as kurtwooddotcom. I have been working in the comic book industry (albeit very much on the outskirts) for about 11 years. In that time I have done self publishing, some work for bigger publishers, and a lot of freelance jobs. Most, if not all, of my work has been done for an all-ages audience. My self published works include FRANKLIN, RUMPUSS, and WILLIE WISP. I have also contributed short stories to AW YEAH COMICS. I have always wanted to create stories that my daughter and nephews could read. For the most part I think I've succeeded.

Creating comics has been fun but, believe it or not, I've never really felt I fit in that world. Not creatively, at least. The more comics I created the more I found myself wondering how I could adapt those stories into children's books. I've always loved Dr. Seuss, Roald Dahl, Mercer Mayer, Quentin Blake, and many other creators from that genre. I've really felt for a long while that my particular skill set would most fit in that world-the world of children's books. 

So I'm finally doing it. My first real children's book. DRACULA MAKES A FRIEND. Of course it would have to do with monsters.

The Book

DRACULA MAKES A FRIEND is a 32 page children's book. 32 full page illustrations.The final product will have a full color cover and gray toned interior to mimic the old monster movies. The book will be perfect bound and look very cool! If I do say so myself. 

The story is simple. Dracula is lonely. After hundreds of years Drac just wants a friend. Someone with whom to hang out. But no one in the village is willing to give him a chance because he's a, well, vampire. DMAF is about being accepting of those who are different from you. 

Why Indiegogo?

Well, I'm not a rich man. And I don't have a contract or anything with a publisher. This is ALL ME. I'm hoping to raise $3000. Every contribution helps with the costs of publishing this book on my own. From doing a large volume print run, paying for stickers and prints to promote the book, covering shipping and shipping supplies, being able to hit the rode and promote the book at conventions...every single dollar helps! Without your help there is a good chance this book would just sit in my sketchbooks never to be seen. We wouldn't want that, now would we?

Of course backing this campaign does score you some suh-WEET swag!

What do YOU get?

You would get the book. Obviously. That's the whole point of this campaign! Every copy of the book sent out during this campaign will get a quick Dracula doodle from ME on the inside cover!

But that's not all! You also have the opportunity to get:

-A PDF copy of the book

-An exclusive campaign only sticker!

-An exclusive campaign only 8.5x11 print!

-Original sketches by some of my world famous friends!

-An original page of art FROM THE BOOK! Yes. You could be the proud owner of one of my original hand drawn pages!

Why should you Contribute to this campaign?

Well...that's really up to you. I can't make you or anything. Those of you who know me know I LOVE creating new characters and new stories. My goal, with any new project I work on, is to help kids read more AND for kids to create on their own! Hopefully I help spark their imaginations just a little with my work. One of my favorite experiences I have at conventions I attend is when a kid brings me a drawing of my characters interacting with something THEY created! How cool is that?

This is the first book in a series, too! A first in my own little world populated by misunderstood monsters and wacky characters. By contributing to this campaign you would be helping me craft and shape that world. 

Can't Contribute? I Still Need YOUR Help!

If you've read all of this and still don't think this book is your cup of tea, that is more than fine. You can still help! Post this campaign on Facebook. Tweet it. Any social media sharing by you would be amazing! You would have my eternal gratitude. The more eyes that see this campaign, the more likely it will succeed!

Thank you for reading. I hope you dig what I'm trying to accomplish here.

-KWDC!*

*that's kurtwooddotcom for those not in the know :)

story:
Our Story

I run an after school programme called Treehut Art School.  Each day i teach 10 children different things from Art, Sewing, Craft, knitting, leadership, Money, Drama, and cooking. They have designed their own radio station, written and acted out their own plays, made videos and designed their own monthly e-zine.


Our new project is to cook our way to a perfect cook book for children. This means trying out recipes or coming up with new recipes. 

The Impact

The children in my programme learn how to be creative thinkers. Mistakes are learning curves and there is nothing they cant achieve. The children in my classes range from 5 to 12 years. They all work together and inspire each other. 

Each year we set a goal. The children talk through what they want to do and we look at all the options. This year we are putting a Cookbook together.

With every project we do, we also GIVE BACK and this year the children have decided to give back to JAPAN. So half of the money will go to Japan and the other half gets divided up between the children for their savings accounts.

Each child has a long term goal that they are saving for i.e. University, A house,or to travel around the world.



What We Need & What You Get

We need HELP with getting the book printed 


$1500 printing costs, for a high finish

$500 for professional photographer  (they photograph each week for 14 weeks) 

$1000 for the designer to put the book together


Other Ways You Can Help

Please let others know of our little project.

story:
Cristobal Diaz es nuestro pequeno luchador. A la corta edad de 20 meses, ha sido sometido a tres opeaciones sumamente delicadas. Cristobal sufre de la condicion  "Fatty Acids Oxidation Disease". Pacientes con el trastorno que sufre Cristobal, no pueden usar las grasas que han almacenado en su organismo para usarlas como energia de emergencia. Los tratamientos que recibe son requeridos diariamente y en muchas ocasiones, su familia no posee los medios para poder costearlos. De no ser tratada, esta alteracion en el sistema puede llegar a causar graves incapacidades como el retardo mental y en el peor de los casos, muerte subita 

Es por eso que necesitamos de su ayuda. Ayudanos a llegar a la meta de $3,000.00 para poder ofrecerle a la familia de Cristobal las herramientas necesraias para poder seguir adelante. Ningun donativo es minimo. Todo donativo es importante y necesario. 

Por amor a Cristobal es una campana basada en el amor, basada en las ganas de ayudarnos los unos a los otros. Es una campana basada en poder lograr que Crsitobal pueda llegar a tener una vida normal como cualquier nino de su edad. Sabemos que algunas personas no pueden colaborar monetariamente, pero eso no significa que no puedan ayudar. Por favor, ayudanos difundiendo la campana. Generando eco para que otras personas conozcan del caso de Cristobal. Recordando que usando la herramienta de compartir, pueden contribuir tambien con su granito de arena.

story:
Samuel's Story - The Long and Winding Road

In the early hours of the morning of the 2nd November 2005, a small bundle wrapped in a white blanket was left in a doorway at the rear of the fish market, in the old city quarter of Tangier. Nobody saw who left it and nobody took any notice. As the market came to life and the streets started to bustle with locals, somebody was inquisitive enough to take a look.

Wrapped inside the blanket was a small child, just a few days, possibly a couple of weeks old. With no visible signs of a mother or anyone taking care of the child, the local police were called and the child was taken to the local Kordobi Hospital.

One week later, and seemingly none the worse for his ordeal, this unknown child was taken into care by the Creche at the hospital, where he joined around 50 other children in a similar plight. With no papers and no known identity, the young boy was given a name by the staff of the creche. They called him Achraf and gave him a surname ‘Halim’.

A little more than three months later, a British couple (Robert and Jo Garofalo) were visiting the Creche. Laying in his cot in a room with around twenty other babies, they met Achraf for the first time; and from that moment there was an unbreakable bond between them.

A bond that was to become the nucleus of a struggle against bureaucracy for almost a year; and a roller coaster ride on a bumpy, long and winding road.

This little foundling's story entwines Politicians, a King, a Prime Minister, Rock Stars, Religion; and above all, a struggle against a system which would, had it not been for the couple’s tenacity, have seen this young boy remain in care.

Six years later, with his broken past long behind him, Samuel, fully aware of his background, is a bright young vibrant boy growing up and going to school in the leafy suburbs of Surrey; and his story has already touched the lives of tens of thousands of children and tens of thousands of adults across the UK.

In 2009, Samuel's parents launched Voice in a Million. A children's choir that perform to raise awareness of children less fortunate than themselves; children like Samuel, that need a loving family to take care of them.

Since the launch the choir has grown from 32 members, to more than 26,000; and they have performed at some of the largest venues in the UK including selling out the O2 Arena and Wembley and in 2013 will be coming to the USA. 

You can find out more about the authors and Voice in a Million on our website

Samuel's Story has been the subject of a two page feature in the Sunday Times; and Robert and Jo have now decided to publish the story in a book, in the hope that it will inspire others to take that step. 

What We Need & What You Get in Return

The book is complete; and currently being edited. The manuscript will be ready for print at the beginning of September and the first 1,000 copies will be ready 4 weeks later. Whether or not we raise any funding, we will be self-funding and publishing the first 1,000 hardback copies, so if we only raise $30 we have sold our first copy; and at least one person will be aware of the plight of some of the most unfortunate children in our society.

If we reach our goal of $15,000, we will have sufficient funds to create and market the book in paperback form and as an 'e.book'. So what do you get for your contribution?

  • $10, gets you a personal message of thanks and we will include your name in the credits and acknowledgements.

  • $30, all of the above; and we will send you by post, a signed hardback copy of the finished book on the date of publication in October, includes cost of postage.

  • $50, all of the above and one ticket to see Voice in a Million at the LG Arena in Birmingham on the 16th October or if you cannot attend, we will send you a digital audio download of the recording of the full show. Tickets will be sent out immediately after receipt of contribution

  • $100, your name in the credits and acknowledgements, the signed harback book inc postage,  and 3 tickets to Voice in a Million at the LG Arena on the 16th October. or if you cannot attend, we will send you a digital audio download of the recording of the full show, a programme with your name in the credits . Tickets will be sent out immediately after receipt of contribution

  • $250, all of the above, except instead of 3 standard tickets we will include two VIP Tickets to Voice in a Million at the LG Arena on the 16th October.

  • $500, If you are feeling generous, you can pay for 30 children from underprivileged schools to take part in Voice in a Million  as well as receiving the signed book and our heartfelt thanks. The school we will donate the places to, will send you a personal message and a photograph of their group.

  • $1,000, If you are feeling REALLY generous,you can pay for 30 children from underprivileged schools to take part in Voice in a Million and 30 of their parents to come and see them perform,  as well as receiving the signed book and our heartfelt thanks. The school we will donate the places to, will send you a personal message and a photograph of their group. 

A little more about us

Marketing and publishing is second nature to us.

Robert has been in the film, television and music business for over 25 years. As a Director and Producer, he has produced an endless list of TV documentaries, live shows, videos, albums, DVDs and even a feature film. A simple ‘google’ on his name will give you an idea as to some of that work. He has worked with some of the biggest names in entertainment, including Hollywood legends, Christopher Lee, Richard Todd and Oliver Reed. From the world of music, he has worked with Dionne Warwick, Burt Bacharach, Hal David, Holland Dozier and Holland, Sir Cliff Richard, Robin Gibb, Sir Tom Jones, Rick Wakeman, Yes, Bill Wyman, Clive Davies, Status Quo, The Hollies, Joe Brown, America, Chicago, JJ Cale, Leon Russell, Mary Wilson, Stevie Wonder, Quincy Jones and many many more.

Jo met Robert whilst working for comedian Jim Davidson in 1995 and they married in 1999. Jo has a long career in the world of musicals, having first performed on the stage at the age of 7; she went on to appear in the west end production of the Rocky Horror Show and Patsy Cline the Musical. Since then she has worked alongside Robert in their busy media company.

The Voice in a million Choir has now grown from the initial 32 members, to over 26,000.  In 2011, our show at the 02 Arena, saw 7,500 children taking part in an amazing performance.

In 2011, in addition to our arena shows, we tried out the format in provincial theatres with a Christmas themed show, ‘The Orphan’s Christmas Wish’. It was so well received in the  two initial theatres, that in 2012, the show is embarking on a 15 date tour, of England, Scotland, Wales and N Ireland.

In late 2011, Jo was invited as a featured guest on Sky News to talk about her journey and formation of the Voice in a Million Choir project.  Click HERE to view the interview.

2011, also saw a new addition to the VIAM family; and a baby sister for Samuel, when the couple adopted their second child. A process that was started in 2009, following the launch of Voice in a Million.

2012 is also seeing us take the arena style shows into other large venues including the legendary Wembley, as well as our first shows in Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland and Ireland.

We have also expanded Voice in a Million internationally, with schools now taking part from Germany, France and more recently the USA. A number of regional and national events are planned for the US from 2013.

We have already had more than 250,000 views on our YouTube Channel

So we are an unusual company. We not only stage large shows for children, giving them a fantastic experience of performing in front of thousands…we give the more talented ones a chance to shine; and teach them recording and performance techniques.

At the same time, all of the children and youngsters that take part, whether at one of our national events, regional shows , at school with their choir or at home with our online tuition, they all have the chance to join our ‘voice’, to help make a difference to the lives of children less fortunate than themselves.

Samuel's Story began like too many others, with him being abandoned and alone.

We hope that we will inspire others with this book and the Voice in a Million Project, to consider adoption or fostering, despite the seemingly insurmountable hurdles, as a life choice.

What happens if we exceed our goal ?

In the event that we exceed our goal, we will use the additional funds to assist other underprivileged schools to take part in our events. 

Please note our payments are processed securely through Paypal; and are processed through our e.commerce and merchandising company Rock on Digital.

Current Exchange rate if contributing in UK Pounds. $1.00 = £0.64

Other Ways You Can Help

In these times of austerity we don't expect everyone to jump at the chance of contributing or buying a book, but that doesn’t mean if you don't contribute you can't get involved.

Use the Indiegogo tools to share this page or to give us a like on Facebook, or Tweet us.

It was so well received in the  two initial theatres, that in 2012, the show is embarking on a 15 date tour, of England, Scotland, Wales and N Ireland.
In late 2011, Jo was invited as a featured guest on Sky News to talk about her journey and formation of the Voice in a Million Choir project.  Click HERE to view the interview.
2011, also saw a new addition to the VIAM family; and a baby sister for Samuel, when the couple adopted their second child. A process that was started in 2009, following the launch of Voice in a Million.
2012 is also seeing us take the arena style shows into other large venues including the legendary Wembley, as well as our first shows in Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland and Ireland.
We have also expanded Voice in a Million internationally, with schools now taking part from Germany, France and more recently the USA. A number of regional and national events are planned for the US from 2013.
We have already had more than 250,000 views on our YouTube Channel
So we are an unusual company. We not only stage large shows for children, giving them a fantastic experience of performing in front of thousands…we give the more talented ones a chance to shine; and teach them recording and performance techniques.
At the same time, all of the children and youngsters that take part, whether at one of our national events, regional shows , at school with their choir or at home with our online tuition, they all have the chance to join our ‘voice’, to help make a difference to the lives of children less fortunate than themselves.
Samuel's Story began like too many others, with him being abandoned and alone.
We hope that we will inspire others with this book and the Voice in a Million Project, to consider adoption or fostering, despite the seemingly insurmountable hurdles, as a life choice.
What happens if we exceed our goal ?
In the event that we exceed our goal, we will use the additional funds to assist other underprivileged schools to take part in our events. 
Please note our payments are processed securely through Paypal; and are processed through our e.commerce and merchandising company Rock on Digital.
Current Exchange rate if contributing in UK Pounds. $1.00 = £0.64
Other Ways You Can Help


In these times of austerity we don't expect everyone to jump at the chance of contributing or buying a book, but that doesn’t mean if you don't contribute you can't get involved.
Use the Indiegogo tools to share this page or to give us a like on Facebook, or Tweet us.

story:
Guelph Spoken Word

 

The Guelph Poetry Slam team is comprised of 5 nationally recognized spoken word poets who will represent Guelph at the 2012, Canadian Festival of Spoken Word in Saskatoon this October. They will compete with over 20 other teams who are representing their cities from across the vast expanses of Canada. All of the members of this year’s team bring their own unique flavors to the group. Grand champion Beth Anne blesses us with bittersweet behest. Fannon fills the air with flamboyant fecundity. Macer makes mockery of mankind’s maglioquence. Sean saturates with sardonic simile. Jaded jazzes it up with jovial jargon. The confluence of their styles creates a collective that presents the best of performance poetry. The team will also be sending the Sound Off Champion Diana to compete in the Youth competition during the festival.

 

The Guelph Poetry Slam Team is associated with the not-for-profit arts organization, Guelph Spoken Word. The organization was formed in 2008 to support local performance poets and host spoken word events and workshops. All donations made to the team are managed by Guelph Spoken Word. For more information, please visit www.guelphspokenword.ca

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We need accommodations and air fair.

 

Every person who donates gets entered into a draw to win two Ontario International Poetry Slam tickets that takes place November 10th, in Guelph at the River Run Centre.

 

You get:

 

Guelph Team CD

 

Guelph Poetry Slam Tshirt

 

Performance by the 2012 Guelph Poetry Slam team at any venue

 

Writing and performance workshop with the 2012 Guelph Poetry Slam team

 

The Impact

 

The Guelph Poetry Slam team is going out west in hopes of winning their first National championship after falling just short of the semi-finals in 2011. Spoken Word has changed the lives of many people, and the Guelph team wants to go Saskatoon to have their voices heard.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Spread the word about the team, and about Spoken Word! If you are interested in poetry in guelph visit the website www.guelphspokenword.ca. Every donation helps! If you are a youth sign up for the facebook group called Generation Poetry.

story:
Hello, My name is Mark W. O'Brien aka obeedúid~

I am a working class poet of meager means who has spent his life raising his children as a single parent while simultaneously maintaining a career as a poet. As you can guess for most of my life all of my funds have gone into raising two healthily happy adults who like their father work in service industries helping and improving the lives of others. Like my parents before me I give back to my community and ask little in return.

Several years ago I joined an online poetry forum in Fermoy County Cork Ireland at the prompting of two of my friends. At the time I had no idea what this would mean to me.

If you know me you know things often happen to me in ways that deem to prove the existence of powers and mysteries beyond our control are alive and at work in the world!

Some months after joining what has become known as the Blackwater Poetry Group I learned that my progenitor James Bryan emigrated from Fermoy in 1849!

Over the ensuing years too many occurrences of what to me now seems like "Destiny" have made themselves known for me to relate in this brief space.

However, I would love to tell you all about it in "An Irish Minute" over a Pint of Plain anytime!

Because I am who I am and I live as I do I am only asking for funds to cover strictly my transportation round trip from my home and back. That includes Trains, Plans and Automobiles only.

This trip will take my career and my the art of poetry to a whole new level! It is a dream come true! And the returning to the place of my direct ancestors, bringing full circle the journey of my DNA is the opportunity of a lifetime!

This is not only me going back home, this is 8 generations of diaspora returning to the place of our beginning. The sacred ground in the land of poets!

With your help, you can not only get me there, but come along as well via my Blog and Virtual Postcards. So come along! Join the journey!

Thanks!

Mark W. O'Brien aka obeedúid~

story:
Who We Are and What We Do:

Toronto-based Lithium Magazine is not only your Rock n' Roll Drug, it’s your one-stop shop for music news, from indie and local, to renowned global touring bands.  Looking for movie news?  We've got that too!  With plenty of live reviews, new release coverage, amazing interviews, and stellar photography, we upload content daily and boast monthly stats of approximately half a million hits.  We have a strong presence at local and out-of-town events, and our following on all of our social networking sites, including Facebook and Twitter, proves it. 

We provide well for the arts, helping to bring press to local talent in need, and also giving journalism, media and photography students a chance to acquire practical experience while doing their internships with us.                                                

Why We Need Your Help:

Being a self-funded, online magazine, we offer quality content to readers for free, and Lithium Magazine’s team of writers and photographers volunteer their time and equipment.  

 

To enhance the experience for our followers, and to promote our work and magazine, we need to branch out, as well as brand the business.  So, we’re looking to purchase T-shirts, jackets, lanyards and other logo’d products, in addition to a quality video camera and audio equipment for on-camera interviews, and perhaps a streaming radio station for the site.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you’re unable to assist us financially, please spread the word about Lithium Magazine and our campaign. Or use the sharing tools to help us get the word out; email the campaign to friends and family, “Like” us on Facebook and Tweet about our campaign.

story:
I'm a Canadian mom and I'm fed up with being embarrassed by our federal government.

The government managed to scrounge up $600k for limo driver overtime, but pulled Canada out of the UN Convention to Combat Desertification to save a measly $350k.
 
(That's 193 countries fighting droughts to 1 not, if you are keeping tabs)
 
Apparently a penny per Canadian is too hefty a price to fight famine-causing droughts.
(WORLD: FYI, we don't even use pennies here anymore.)  

I'm trying to raise the $350k it would take to keep Canada in the convention through to the 2015 Federal election ... in 60 days. 

Canada was once AWESOME, right?! We were stalwart global citizens. We were polite. We were progressive. We sported our flags with pride! But our government has gone AWOL. Foreign Affairs Minister John Baird has deserted our post, leaving the international community high and dry.
 
Desertification isn't just a problem for other countries – 60% of Canadian cropland is threatened by drought. And it's not just this Convention, Canada's been flipping the United Nations the bird on all sorts of fronts.
 
Baird may think he knows best, but Canadians damn well know better.
 
So Internet, turn over your couch cushions, fire up the bake sales and lemon aid stands... 
 
Let's show the World Canada's sorry... and the Feds who's boss! 

On June 1st, I'll trek to Ottawa to present to Baird a giant cheque signed by all you lovely contributors.
 
Kinda like this:

Along with the "Official Letter of Apology to the World from the Canadian People"

If Baird refuses the offer, the money will be donated to the Canadian Red Cross International Disaster Relief Fund as a gift from the Canadian people.
 
And next time, we promise we'll get serious about electing a government that gives a damn too.
 
Add your voice: #SorryWorld! @UNCCD @HonJohnBaird #CdnPoli
 
And if you give a damn about the world too, don't forget to sign the "Official Letter of Apology to the World from the Canadian People"

story:
The reason for the Superkid Tour

I grew up in Cambridge (Hespeler!), Ontario Canada. There were few black families in Cambridge and I loved to read. I read everything from Judy Blume to Beverly Cleary to E. B. White. What was missing in the stories was a little black girl. A mischievous, playful young girl who just wanted to have fun.
 
I am the writer of the novel Introducing Sophia Firecracker. It is the story of a nine-year-old girl who thinks she's a superhero. When Principal Corncob hints that teacher Mrs. Greenbean may also be a superhero, Sophia sets out on a mission to discover the teacher's superpowers.
 
I wrote Introducing Sophia Firecracker so that a generation of young girls and boys will have a positive image of themselves. Sophia is a character that makes kids laugh and hopefully, instills a sense of pride and self-esteem.
 
 
To this day, there is a lack of diversity in children's books; hence the need for the Superkid Tour. Sophia Firecracker is my implement for change and I want to introduce her to as many children as possible.

 

What We Need  

The Superkid Tour needs $5000 to buy as many books as possible and put gas in the car. The goal is to giveaway 3000 books across the United States and Canada.

 

From UNO to Yoko...

All the perks are on the right. The Five-Oh-Oh-Horsechack! buys books for an entire classroom of kids, the Triple-Play helps two kids and the Century Club helps ten.

Whatever you can do helps.

If you have a special request, I will do my best to accommodate. Please feel free to ask!

I understand that not everyone is able to contribute. Thanks for reading down this far anyway! You can also help to spread the word by linking out the campaign to your social media network and friends.  

                                                                                                    With thanks;
                                       A. A. Riley (hey, you can call me Angie, we're friends now!)

NOTE: I'm on the flexible plan on Indiegogo so all funds go to support the tour.

 

Nominate a SUPERKID

Do you know a Superkid who would benefit from the campaign? You do? Excellent! Please email at superkid@sophiafirecracker.com

 

RAVES for Introducing Sophia Firecracker!!!

...(I) read the intro on your website and thought it was written brilliantly - the sprouts girl made me laugh!
best wishes for both you and your book,
                                                                            -Cheryl -from email

A. A. Sophia firecracker is the book of the week in our house! All of a sudden it was plucked from the book case and that was it! So funny!                                                   -from facebook

I really love your book.  My favourite part is when Sophia tries to use her superpowers and they don’t work.
                                                                                -Emma Age 9

I recently had the opportunity to have A. A. Riley a new children’s author at our library. She read for us and the children were in total awe. The parents were also in attendance and were just as caught up in her story telling, so much so they all purchased the books and had Angie autograph the books.

I have asked her to come back this fall and go to the schools and she has agreed, Angie loved the interaction with an audience and they loved her.-

                                              - Stephanie Boltz, Director Midway Public Library

Dear A. A.,
We have been having so much fun with your book... which we’ve been reading each night at bedtime!  Z loves it and has his favourites parts that he asks me to read over and over again (esp. pp. 12-13 when he continues to laugh out loud at the mention of John Paul being a “malbec!)... he’s also reading them (his fave sections) aloud, over and over again, now too!
The other day I overheard Z announcing to his friend, as they climbed on the play structure in our backyard, that he has a funny book where a girl named Sophia calls a boy a “malbec” and then his teacher asks why he’s “calling John Paul a grape!!”. J
Thank you for the fun story times!                                                -T from email

 

New to Indiegogo?

You can buy a Superkid a book in three easy steps:

Step 1: Read through the perks  on the right.

Step 2: Click the large, green "BACK THIS PROJECT" button to the right of the trailer video at the top of this page. 

Step 3: Enter your pledge amount - and complete the steps for filling in your information. This process takes just a few seconds!

You've done it! Thanks from me and especially the SUPERKIDS!

story:
We want to raise funds to publish her book.

Narrated by America, the children's picture book America Is Furry discusses how each dog's birthday represents a different important day in American History.  Our hope is that this book will appeal to dog lovers, make dog lovers out of non-dog lovers, and teach patriotism to the child in all of us. 


Here's my ruffdraft for the book's forward, written by Patriot:

My name is Iron Patriot Red Pandadog.  I never knew Miss America Panda, she passed away before I joined the pack.  But my sister and brother Liberty and Freedom have barked about her a lot.  I understand that America was fun and gregarious, often goofy yet contemplative.  A gifted writer, she penned the roughdraft of this book but unfortunately was not able to complete it.  

When I first read her work I have to confess that I was immediately impressed by her deep understanding of American culture and patriotism.  By the way, patriotism is one of my favorite words.  I discussed this manuscript with my non-furry daddy and he agreed to let me ghost-write the remainder of the book.  So that last part of the book where America is talking about me, that wasn't actually written by her.  I'll have to take credit for it.  

My non-furry daddy did suggest that I read some books to become more familiar with other works.  He told me that by reading books, I could become a better writer and also become more effective in my contribution to this project.  Unfortunately, the words "reading" and "eating" sound really familiar

I do believe that I got a good taste of some different writing styles.  

But seriously folks, I have to admit that both America and I got a lot of help writing this book from our non-furry daddy.  We did express our thoughts to him but he was the one who wrote it all down.  

Our hope is that this book will appeal to dog lovers, make dog lovers out of non-dog lovers, and teach patriotism to the child in all of us. 



Book Summary:
America was born close to July 4, also known as Independence Day. It is the anniversary of the publication of the Declaration of Independence from Great Britain in 1776.

Liberty was born close to Memorial Day, a day for remembering and honoring military personnel who died in the service of their country, particularly those who died in battle or as a result of wounds sustained in battle

Freedom was born close to National Freedom Day.  Although not a recognized holiday, National Freedom Day honors the signing of a resolution that proposed the 13th amendment of the nation's constitution on February 1, 1865. Abraham Lincoln, who was the president at the time, signed the resolution to outlaw slavery

Patriot was born close to Veteran's Day, a day for honoring all American veterans. 

Here's America demonstrating the correct treadmill technique


Here's a picture of Liberty, Freedom and America


Here's a picture of Patriot showing his enthusiasm for crowdfunding

story:
Though we did not meet our campaign goal, Guide Her Home is still a reality.  Order your copy today! 


WELCOME TO MY INDIEGOGO CAMPAIGN

My name is Jolene Lavine and I currently make my home in Vancouver, WA, though I am a California native. I was born and raised in Sacramento and eventually moved to Folsom, CA. Yes, where the prison is. While in Folsom, my husband, Jesse, and I built a beautiful life with our daughters, Jessica and Jocelyn.

On April 29, 2010, heaven sent a hurricane in the form of the Traumatic Brain Injury our eldest daughter, Jessica, sustained while preparing for her weekly horseback riding lesson.

As we navigated emergency rooms, surgeries, medical procedures and information we never would have imagined we needed to know, I took advantage of the world of Social Media to keep our family and friends updated.

My desire to document our story wasn’t a burst of light or flash of insight. It was simply habit. Something I’d been doing online for 11 years at the time. Writing about what was happening to our family seemed like the natural thing to do.

Facebook, Livejournal and the message boards I am a part of made it easy to reach all of those in our Circle. I didn’t have to make dozens of phone calls that would have torn me apart by having to repeat the story, over and over and over again. With the Internet, I could write one message and send it to hundreds of people and know it would generate the Light and healing we needed. I’ve said more than once: The Internet saved my sanity.

When I decided to make the jump from writing about our experience online to publishing a novel, it wasn't because I thought “This is what I should do.”, but more the culmination of dozens of voices telling me: “This is what you have to do.

In living our new reality, I found my grief and heartache could no longer be contained in a Facebook status box or online journal entry. Having the monumental task of producing a novel seemed like a good idea. I hoped sharing the beauty of our story, of hope and miracles and the awesomeness that is my kid would prove to be cathartic.

I was inspired to write by the fight in Jessica, the fight in me and by the fight in all of the people pulling for our family. By the waves of energy that surrounded us from the very beginning, making miracles happen.

So, I suppose in that way, I was inspired by The Light after all.

Today, I sit, pulling together the final pieces of our story. It has been a long, arduous process, filled with excitement, misery, anger and hope. I have set this project aside many times, simply overwhelmed with the challenge of capturing the beauty of our story into 200 or so pages.

The journey has been made easier by the people who have asked me how it's going and by my focus group that has stood by me loyally, providing great feedback and cheer-leading. I have also belonged to six different writing groups, consulted three different writing coaches and have changed my vision a dozen times.

Now, it’s time for me to turn to you again. Our family and friends, acquaintances, and strangers across the world.

I hope you find something on my list of incentives that will entice you to help carry me through the final stage of this journey.

Your generous contributions will help fund the editing of the final draft, a new jolenelavine.com website, ISBN numbers, barcodes, cover design for the print books, as well as for the e-books and audio books, the interior book design, printing of the books, press kits and mailings, as well as the dreaded processing fees and shipping costs.

If together we can successfully meet this goal, I will be able to have the E-Book available by the fourth anniversary of Jessica’s accident (April 29, 2014), with print copies available shortly after.

Thank you for reading, highest love, brightest blessings, and, as always, Viva La Jessica. Let us all, once again: Guide Her Home.


STRETCH GOALS

Any funds raised over the stated goal will help with the overhaul of the Viva La Jessica website, which hasn't been updated in over three years.

If generosity exceeds those levels, we will be able to start planning book launches in Vancouver, WA and Folsom, CA.

Contributions beyond that will go to further promotion and print runs of the book.


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

The biggest risk is that I haven’t actually . . . you know . . . um . . . finished writing the book. Writing is the only other thing I am working on, beside this campaign. The fingers are flying and I project I will have everything submitted to my editor by the end of January, Mid-February at the latest.

All other risks can be listed under the category of “Life”. This is my part- full- and double-time job for the next six months, at least. Writing, and publishing this book is my big goal for the anniversary of Jessica’s accident this year. The things that would get in my way would be illness, family illness, and other unexpected emergencies we are unable to plan for.

Thank you for your support. Gratitude rising.


INCENTIVES

Due to space restrictions on the right, here is the complete list of incentive descriptions and delivery dates.

$1 – Attitude of Gratitude

I could not do this without you. Every little bit helps. Your $1.00 contribution earns my eternal gratitude. Thank you. Delivered immediately and always.


$2 – Blessings of Grace

Your $2.00 contribution earns my eternal gratitude and your name will be included on the List of Donors on my website. Delivered when the website goes live. Projected date: April 29, 2014


$5 – Viva La Jessica!

Your $5.00 contribution earns my eternal gratitude, your name included on the List of Donors on my website and a limited edition “Viva La Jessica!” bracelet. 10 at this level. Website projected: April 29, 2014. Bracelet Ship Date: March 17, 2014.


*** All Contributions above $10.00 will receive a free copy of the E-Book. ***

$10 – Be The Light

Your $10.00 contribution earns my eternal gratitude, your name included on the List of Donors on my website, a free copy of the E-Book and a limited edition “There are two ways…” candle set. 6 at this level. Website projected: April 29, 2014. Candle Ship Date: March 17, 2014.


$10 – She’s Crafty

Your $10.00 contribution earns my eternal gratitude, your name included on the List of Donors on my website, a free copy of the E-Book and a Handmade Thank You card. 20 at this level. Website & E-Book projected: April 29, 2014. Card Ship Date: March 17, 2014


$10 – Send It Up

Your $10.00 contribution earns my eternal gratitude, your name included on the List of Donors on my website, a free copy of the E-Book and the name of your choice placed on a candle on our Earth/Healing altar. Candles will be tealight sized, so will burn for 4-6 hours. 50 at this level. Website & E-Book projected: April 29, 2014. Candle burning upon request. Your $50.00 contribution earns my eternal gratitude, your name included on the List of Donors on my website, a free copy of the E-Book, a signed print book, your name listed in the acknowledgements in the print book and an invitation to join my focus group for any future work. (Critiques not necessary, this is your chance to be the first in line to read my future works.) 5 at this level. Website & E-Book projected: April 29, 2014. Invitation: Immediate. Print Book projected: May 2014.


$100.00 – You’re The Star!

Your $100.00 contribution earns my eternal gratitude, your name included on the List of Donors on my website, a free copy of the E-Book, a signed print book, your name listed in the acknowledgements in the print book and have a character in the book named after you. Naming inclusion: Immediate. Website & E-Book projected: April 29, 2014. Print Book projected: May 2014.

Your $100.00 contribution earns my eternal gratitude, your name included on the List of Donors on my website, a free copy of the E-Book, a signed print book, your name listed in the acknowledgements in the print book and you will receive, from me, a monthly homemade gift of my choice, for a year. (Gifts will have no more than a $10.00 value.)  2 at this level. Website & E-Book projected: April 29, 2014. Print book projected: May 2014. Monthly gifts begin in August of 2014.


$150.00 – Like, Really, Really Crafty.

Your $150.00 contribution earns my eternal gratitude, your name included on the List of Donors on my website, a free copy of the E-Book, a signed print book, your name listed in the acknowledgements in the print book and the right to consult with me on a homemade gift each month for a year. Meaning, you can order a gift for a loved one, request custom colors, custom sayings, etc. You control the gift. (Gifts will have no more than a $10.00 value.) 2 at this level. Website & E-Book projected: April 29, 2014. Print book projected: May 2014. Monthly gifts begin in August of 2014.


$200.00 – Pick a Card

Your $200.00 contribution earns my eternal gratitude, your name included on the List of Donors on my website, a free copy of the E-Book, a signed print book, your name listed in the acknowledgements in the print book and a weekly “reading” for a month (or four different weeks, if you’d like to spread them out). At the beginning of each week, I will “pull cards” for you. This will include four (4) Angel Cards, One (1) Power Affirmation Card and One (1) Four Agreements Card.  10 at this level. Website & E-Book projected: April 29, 2014. Print book projected: May 2014. Weekly Card Pulls will be at the time of your choosing, beginning any time after June 21, 2014.

story:
Hi! My name is Kevin Wood and I’m turning to you with help to finance a book project, entitled THE BOARD which has already created attention among the international arts and music community. I’ve been in the arts world a long time, over 35 years, with some of the major record companies such as BMG and Sony but also as head of cultural organizations around the world. I also teach, part-time, at two universities here in Europe and think this book is something that will help young and upcoming arts managers and students or arts management as well as members of boards of directors in the USA. Originally in two parts, a print version and an audio book, the classical record label, Claudio Records in the UK, had committed its impressive resources to record and to represent the audio book through its worldwide distribution network and Naxos. We have recorded the audio version and the packaging and funding for that portion of this project is now in place. In this second phase, I need to turn my attention to the printed version of THE BOARD. The publishing company, Deutsche Wissenschafts-Verlag/German University Press in Germany, has committed to the publication and international distribution. However, to make this all possible, we still need to raise the sum of €5000. We need this amount to pay for the printing of the book as well as for some marketing above and beyond what the publisher will provide. That’s why I am turning to you.  Let me describe a bit about what THE BOARD is all about and why it was written.

In writing THE BOARD, I have done so with the aim of giving to students of arts management, to those sitting on other boards of directors and to musicians, the arts public and to those who associate themselves with such cultural organizations, a set of guidelines whose purpose is to help to alert them to the signs of dry-rot and to the serious ethical pr0blems that may exist in their own organizations. The purpose of this narrative is not to frighten or dissuade anyone from joining the Board of Directors of an arts institution or from entering into a management position with such a smaller organization. There are many such non-profit entities which are governed ethically and which hold true to a high standard of behavior, dedicated to their communities and to the improvement of the quality of life in their regions. On these boards are often to be found individuals who, with creativity, energy and generosity, give of themselves for the good of the arts and culture in their region. These persons are to be praised for what they contribute society and to quality of life.

However, there are other organizations such as I have described in THE BOARD where these concerns become nothing but a footnote, where governance and a despotic and controlling board of directors evidences disregard for the consequences of their refusal to properly steward their institution. These consequences can be, and often are, dramatic for the employees and for the community and can lead to the eventual dissolution of the organization through a slow but irreversible process of decay. We have seen this in the recent economic crisis that has caused insufferable pain for millions. Such crises exist in the arts as well and the story of THE BOARD mirrors the gravity of what has taken place during this period in our history in our broader, world-wide community. THE BOARD hopes to show you the symptoms of such decay and pleads for an ethical balance and better control of such organizations for the good of the people, of the employees of such organizations, and of their community. 

The risks in now raising the hoped-for goal of €5000 will mean that I must find a way to release the work at my own expense which I will do via a loan or other means. With the support of the audio book version being underwritten by some important funders and by the recording company, itself, I have great hope the book version finds acceptance from your side.

Please watch the short video and consider helping by sponsoring this project if you can. The subject is timely and is not only about music and the arts but about parts of our lives that deal with our security, our families and our careers, issues important to us all.

Some of you will be unable to contribute. If you cannot, but are convinced that this is a subject that may also be of interest to you and others, please tell your friends, share the links with them and remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools. Many thanks for all your help and your support in this project!
