life.
However, there are other organizations such as I have
described in THE BOARD where these
concerns become nothing but a footnote, where governance and a despotic and
controlling board of directors evidences disregard for the consequences of
their refusal to properly steward their institution. These consequences can be,
and often are, dramatic for the employees and for the community and can lead to
the eventual dissolution of the organization through a slow but irreversible
process of decay. We have seen this in the recent economic crisis that has
caused insufferable pain for millions. Such crises exist in the arts as well
and the story of THE BOARD mirrors
the gravity of what has taken place during this period in our history in our
broader, world-wide community. THE BOARD
hopes to show you the symptoms of such decay and pleads for an ethical
balance and better control of such organizations for the good of the people, of
the employees of such organizations, and of their community.  
The risks in now raising the hoped-for goal of €5000 will
mean that I must find a way to release the work at my own expense which I will
do via a loan or other means. With the support of the audio book version being
underwritten by some important funders and by the recording company, itself, I have
great hope the book version finds acceptance from your side. 
Please watch the short video and consider helping by
sponsoring this project if you can. The subject is timely and is not only about
music and the arts but about parts of our lives that deal with our security,
our families and our careers, issues important to us all. 
Some of you will be unable to contribute. If you
cannot, but are convinced that this is a subject that may also be of interest
to you and others, please tell your friends, share the links with them and
remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools. Many thanks for all your help and
 your support in this project!

story:
WINNER OF THE PREMIO CAVALLINI 2011 & THE  PREMIO BAGUTTA 2007 

“The Italian Joseph Conrad” Libero, 09/07/2011

“A 20th Century Balzac” Il Giornale, 09/09/2011


The Confines of the Shadow

The Confines of the Shadow is a sequence of novels and short stories that map the transformation of the Libyan city of Benghazi from a sleepy Ottoman backwater in the 1910s to the second capital of an oil-rich kingdom in the 1960s. Alessandro Spina's saga begins in November 1912 with The Young Maronite, which sees Italian soldiers solidifying their control over Libya's coasts, leaving Libyan rebels to withdraw to the desert and prepare for a war that would last until 1931, when by dint of sheer brutality, including the internment of tens of thousands of civilians into concentration camps, the Italians crushed the rebellion and murdered its widely respected leader, Omar al-Mukhtar. Employing a cosmopolitan array of characters, ranging from Ottoman functionaries, to Sanussi aristocrats and Italian officers, Spina chronicles Italy's colonial experience from the euphoria of conquest - giving us a front row seat to the rise and subsequent fall of Fascism in the aftermath of World War II - to the country's independence in the 1950s. Spina finally concludes his narrative with the discovery of Libya's vast oil and gas reserves, which triggered the tumultuous changes that led to Muammar Gaddafi's forty-two year dictatorship.


*****************************************************************************
The Nation published André Naffis-Sahely's essay 'Spina's Shadow' in their August 18-25 issue. Banipal also featured the essay on their website to help promote our fundraising effort: Who is Alessandro Spina?
*****************************************************************************

What We Need:

Darf Publishers are seeking additional funding to help pay for the translation of the remaining two volumes of The Confines of the Shadow, which in its entirety runs to 1300 pages. Darf Publishers have already committed to issuing the first installment of this three-volume translation, and Volume 1 will include the novels The Young Maronite, The Marriage of Omar and The Nocturnal Visitor, which are set between 1912 and 1927. Volume 1 will be published in February 2015, and we hope to issue Volumes 2 and 3 in 2016 and 2017.


*****************************************************************************


Darf Publishers commissioned the South African artist Morné Visagie to produce a cover for The Confines of the Shadow. This is his description of the photograph:

In the 1700’s two exiles on Robben Island, the one being a Khoi man, and the other a Dutch Sailor, were romantically involved. After ten years they were sentenced to death on charges of homosexuality. "On 19 August 1735 the two men had weights tied to their bodies, and somewhere between the Cape and Robben Island were dropped into the ocean to drown, a death no doubt designed to cleanse the earth of their polluting presence” (Nigel Penn 1992). This photograph was taken in 2010, half way between Robben Island, where I grew up, and the Cape Town harbour.

Morné will also produce a limited edition series of prints of his photograph, which are available for sale here.


*****************************************************************************


Biographical Notes:

Alessandro Spina was the nom de plume of Basili Shafik Khouzam. Born into a family of Syrian Maronites in Benghazi in 1927, Khouzam was educated in Italian schools and attended university in Milan. Returning to Libya in 1954 to help manage his father's textile factory, Khouzam remained in the country until 1979, when the factory was nationalized by Gaddafi, at which point he retired to his country estate in Franciacorta, where he died in 2013.

André Naffis-Sahely's poetry was featured in The Best British Poetry 2014 and the Oxford Poets Anthology 2013. His translations include The Physiology of the Employee by Honoré de Balzac (Wakefield Press, 2014), Money by Émile Zola (Penguin Classics, 2015) and The Selected Poems of Abdellatif Laâbi (Carcanet Press, 2015).

Morné Visagie is based in Cape Town and was ranked one of the leading Young African Artists by Business Day WANTED in 2013. Visagie Graduated from the Michaelis School of Fine Art in 2011 and is a printer at Cape Town's only fine art printmaking studio, Warren Editions. Last year, his debut collaborative exhibition with Mbongeni Dlamini, 'Far From The Sea, Perhaps...', was shown at Whatiftheworld / Gallery.

story:
Help Me Finish the Stoning Demons Series 

Stoning Demons is an informed patient's perspective on Complex PTSD. This work is the result of five years of recovery, research and discovery that has led to a new understanding of my condition and some deep personal growth. 
I have found a method for managing my symptoms that makes me feel more empowered than traditional therapies and medications. I want to share this perspective with others who struggle with Complex PTSD. 
 In the series, I break down specific aspects of CPTSD so that the reader can develop their own understanding of this consuming psychobiological condition. I share my story and my journals throughout the series and offer links to resources that I found helpful. 
 I have 6 books that are nearly finished, a total of roughly 80k words. I plan to add two more, which will round out topic. At this point, I need to bring on the professional support of an editor so that the final ebooks are polished and solid. I am also looking to self-publish an initial set of 250 copies of each book to support speaking opportunities next year. 
I plan to use this writing as a platform for advocacy and to promote better understanding and support for CPTSD patients. I am asking for support to: 
  • Hire an editor on Elance to finish the first 6 books 
  • Print 250 copies each book 
Here's what I need: 
  • Elance editor - $1200 
  • Printing (black and white text and covers) 250 x 6 - $3300 
Your contribution will: 
  • Help me polish up the first 2 books, which are now available on Smashwords 
  • Let me fast track the release schedule for the remaining 4 books 
  • Result in print copies that can help raise understanding and support for CPTSD recovery and medical cannabis therapy 

The perks: 

  •  You will receive the full Stoning Demons series in ebook format 
  • Your name will appear in the book credits, in ebook and print formats 
  • For larger contributions, you will receive a PTSD awareness T-shirt and signed copy of the print books 
  • I will be forever grateful... finally seeing this project become real and being able to take the next steps in my life will mean so much to me :-) 

Your contribution will help me establish the foundation I need to get out there and promote a better understanding of Complex PTSD and to speak out about the lifelong effects of childhood abuse and neglect. Strong voices are needed to protect those who are vulnerable and to heal those who are still hurting. 

Stoning Demons will also be a voice for responsible use of medicinal therapies in the treatment of CPTSD symptoms. There are simply too many risks and unknowns with prescription medications. Cannabis has been effective for me -- and for many others -- and deserves a practical discussion in treatment. This series will present reasoning and methods for self-managed therapy, within the framework of a healthy lifestyle that is focused on nutrition, stress management and exercise. 

Other Ways You Can Help 

If you can't contribute, there are other ways you can help: 

  • Buy single copies of the Stoning Demons ebooks on https://www.smashwords.com/books/view/431274 
  • Give copies as gifts to CPTSD recovery groups or patients (use link above to gift on Smashwords) 
  • Like and reblog the Stoning Demons blog on http://stoningdemons.wordpress.com/

Overview

BrainImmune is a hybrid betwen an online book and a magazine.

This Website is the first online professional resource in the broad interdisciplinary area of neuroendocrine-immunology and stress-immune interactions.

The BrainImmune Website is designed to advance a new medical research area and promote increased public understanding of medical research with great potential and implications.

SPECIAL THANKS TO ALL OF OUR SUPPORTERS HERE ON INDIEGOGO! MUCH AHEAD OF TIME! THANK YOU!

Paradoxes of Medical Sciences

is BUILDING BOUNDARIES between disciplines and DRAWING DIVIDING LINES between research fields.

Why Did We Develop BrainImmune?

The BrainImmune Website was built to narrow down the conceptual and ‘cultural’ gap and separation between neuroscience and immunology.

The Novelty

There are few, if any, websites with opinions and concepts targeting the medical research community.

Built & produced by scientists, BrainImmune provides expert opinions and viewpoints, and the latest developments at the interface of neurosciences and immunology.

We offer CONCEPTS that will boost the medical research and provide key breakthroughs in the understanding of COMMON HUMAN DISEASES (see below).

Most of the concepts discussed at BrainImmune represent recent advances in the field,

The Field

Neuroendocrine immunology, i.e., neurohormonal-immune interactions, is a relatively new research field that bridges neurosciences and immunology disciplines. This area explores the cross-talk between the brain and the immune system, and the effect of peripheral nerves and hormones on immunity. The field is also referred to as neuroimmunology, neuroimmunomodulation and psychoneuroimmunology.

The first observations about the effect of psychological factors, ‘stress’, depression etc. on human health and disease date back to ancient times. For brief historical perspectives, see our short video displayed above.

Why Is Helping & Boosting the Advancement of Neuroendocrine-Immunology Research Important?

  1. There still exists a large cultural and knowledge divide between neuroscience and immunology.
  2. Immunology-related research often implies a cell-centric, reductionistic approach.
  3. Concepts discussed at BrainImmune represent the most recent advances in the field; they are not available in medical textbooks, and, as a general rule, not taught at medical schools.
  4. MOST IMPORTANTLY – this field has important clinical implications (see below).

The Stress-Immunity Link

Solid evidence indicates that all immune functions are affected, in a significant fashion, by the major stress hormones. Importantly, most, if not all major human diseases - their onset, development and course - are affected by acute (short) and/or long- term chronic stress.

BrainImmune is the first site covering stress-immune interactions with over 120 articles in this area. For more details and examples from the BrainImmune Site - see our video displayed above, or visit the Site at: http://www.brainimmune.com/

Major Clinical Implications

An increasing body of evidence also indicates that a neurohormonal- or neuroendocrine-immune dysfunction plays a major role in several human diseases.

A few examples from articles written by our experts at BrainImmune:

allergy and asthma

autoimmune diseases

cardiovascular diseases

obesity

cancer

fibromyalgia

chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS)

autism

Parkinson’s disease

dementia 

and Alzheimer’s disease

More examples are shown at the end of our ‘cover’ and ‘stress’ videos.

Therefore, promoting the development and progress of neuroendocrine immunology will provide FURTHER INSIGHTS and BREAKTHROUGHS in our understanding of many common human disorders. 

Importantly, online resources and tools such as BrainImmune may substantially BOOST the development of this field and further SPEED UP the research and progress in many COMMON HUMAN DISEASES.

Join us on our mission

to help the advancement of a new medical research field with great potential and significance.

story:
NEVER GIVE UP
His Holiness the Dalai Lama & Ron Whitehead
 
The poem that has inspired literally millions around the world is now available in this new, beautiful limited edition art-print. It will be made available for distribution during His Holiness the Dalai Lama's Visit to Louisville May 19-21, 2013. 50% of all proceeds from sales during the Visit will be donated to the Drepung Gomang Institute, host of the Visit.
 
Poet Ron Whitehead is an American original.  Founder of the Global Literary Renaissance and friend of the late Hunter S. Thompson, Whitehead has been on the front lines of the literary culture for decades. As Whitehead writes:

 
     In 1994 my life changed forever when I had the blessed honor of meeting
His Holiness the Dalai Lama. I asked His Holiness to please give me a message
to share with young people, young people of all ages. His Holiness smiled, closed
His eyes, for a long moment, then opened them and gave me His message. As He
was speaking to me all I heard were the words to this Never Give Up poem. After
His Holiness gave me his message He walked over to me, took my right hand,
squeezed it, and bowed, blessing His message and me. Later in 1994 I wrote
His Holiness, in India, with a handwritten copy of my Never Give Up poem.
I asked His Holiness for permission to produce a Published in Heaven poster
of Never Give Up with His photo included. I also asked His Holiness for His
blessing for Never Give Up. He granted both. The poster, in previous editions,
is now available and displayed all over the world. I am happy and excited about
this new edition of Never Give Up. Half of all proceeds from sales during
His Holiness' Visit will go directly to the Drepung Gomang Institute.

 
FUNDING NEEDED TO COVER COST OF PRINTING
 
Only 2K is needed to cover the cost of printing 5000 posters to made available during His Holiness' Visit to Louisville May 19-21, 2013.

The Impact

NEVER GIVE UP has already been freely distributed reached millions of people around the world with its indomitable message. With your support, this new edition of NEVER GIVE UP will reach an even wider audience, and sales will provided needed resources to the GLOBAL LITERARY RENAISSANCE.

NEVER GIVE UP.

“Nicholas Street in 1941 was a noisy, grimy place: slum row-housing beside railway yards, where children roamed while adults worked or drank. Its park was a haven for bums and drunks. In this rough atmosphere, 10-year old Howard Darwin was already making a name for himself.”

  • Canadian Press Staff: The London Free Press; pg. D2, Sep 16, 1992


Howard Darwin's story of rising up from Ottawa's mean streets by shining shoes and selling newspapers in the dirty-thirties to building a local sports empire simply needs to be told.

Help us to get to press with this amazing biography and  help preserve a remarkable piece of Ottawa's history by pre-ordering this 200 page trade paperback today.

By pre-ordering with a $15 (tax included) contribution, you will receive a first edition copy at 60% of its retail selling price in November, and ensure that this very entertaining story is told.

story:
Like most people I got happily caught in the vortex of Warren when I came up from New York, saw Glass Menagerie at the Edgcomb barn, got stinko, and before you know it, I’m living in a van in Neal Harrington’s driveway for the summer and doing a play with Phantom. The van was followed by Steve Badanes’ trailer and glass outhouse and 15 years of encouragement and support from Phantom Theater and its audiences where I brought two of my plays, ‘Sally on the Mount’ and ‘Je Regrette Tout!’ as well as performed in Phantom productions. Much of my book, Fiction Ruined My Family, began in readings at Phantom before going on to 'This American Life', publication by Riverhead Books in 2011 and HBO. (For more info and to read other work, visit jeannedarst.com.)

      I have wanted to write a book about Warren for years. Warren and the entire Mad River Valley is a beautiful area, the architecture is aggressively progressive but it is the people of Warren and Prickly Mountain that I fell for. There exists a certain spirit which, for me, is made up of a few things:  a keen sense of humor, a love of nature, food, drink, performance, intellectual curiosity, kindness and hospitality, a certain wildness, a need to create, a sense of adventure and doing things for the hell of it (a quality that is completely dying in the world at large) and finally and most important, people in Warren know how to have fun, often hard-won, sometimes baffling, competitive, frequently death-defying, but unmistakable fun. It is only recently that I realized I shouldn’t wait to write this book.

        My goal, as I said in the video, is to get these stories down in recorded audio interviews this summer, Prickly’s 50th Anniversary basheroo, and put together a proposal comprised of a sample chapter or two by the end of the summer to submit to a publisher.

         Please contribute if you can and pass this indigogo link on to anyone you think might want to support this book about Warren.

         Thank you so much, Merry Christmas and hope to see you in Warren this summer,

                   Jeanne

van in Neal Harrington’s driveway for the summer and doing a play with Phantom.
The van was followed by Steve Badanes’ trailer and glass outhouse and 15 years
of encouragement and support from Phantom Theater and its audiences where I
brought two of my plays, ‘Sally on the Mount’ and ‘Je Regrette Tout!’ as well
as performed in Phantom productions. Much of my book, Fiction Ruined My Family, began in readings at Phantom before going
on to 'This American Life', publication by Riverhead Books in 2011 and HBO. (For
more info and to read other work, visit jeannedarst.com.)
      I have wanted to write a book about Warren for years.
Warren and the entire Mad River Valley is a beautiful area, the architecture is
aggressively progressive but it is the people of Warren and Prickly Mountain
that I fell for. There exists a certain spirit
which, for me, is made up of a few things:  a keen sense of humor, a
love of nature, food, drink, performance, intellectual curiosity, kindness and
hospitality, a certain wildness, a need to create, a sense of adventure and doing
things for the hell of it (a quality that is completely dying in the world at
large) and finally and most important, people in Warren know how to have fun, often hard-won, sometimes baffling,
competitive, frequently death-defying, but unmistakable fun. It is only
recently that I realized I shouldn’t wait to write this book.
        My goal, as I said in the video, is to get these stories down in
recorded audio interviews this summer, Prickly’s 50th Anniversary
basheroo, and put together a proposal comprised of a sample chapter or two by
the end of the summer to submit to a publisher. 
         Please contribute if you can and pass this indigogo link on to
anyone you think might want to support this book about Warren. 
         Thank you so much, Merry Christmas and hope to see you in Warren
this summer, 
                   Jeanne

story:
"That Krasbaum Kid" young adult book.

My name is Edward Currelley, I've been a writer for many years. Because of personal economics it's always taken a back seat to earning a living. Most recently I had to stop working due to an injury. As luck would have it, I'm now in a position to follow my passion. This work will be the first of many, and will inspire all those who'll read it to open their hearts to understanding and patience. I grew up in a household where looking after your neighbor was something you just did, without reward, treating everyone the way you would like to be treated. The central character in this book, Jacob reminded me of how important standing up for the rights of others and on the front line for social justice and change is.

The campaign is to launch a young adult story book. The purpose is to bridge the gap of understanding between generations within family and community and to foster patience within us all.

FINANCIAL SYNOPSIS & USE OF FUNDS:

1. ISBN numbers w/ Bar Codes, 2.LCCN, Library of Congress Control Number.

3. Editing, 4.Layout & Design, 5.Additional Illustrations, 6. Printing: Perfect Binding,

7.E-Book Formatting for electronic readers, 8. Poster Design & Printing, 9. Distribution to Schools & Libraries nation wide. 10. Shipping & Mailing, 11. Web-Site Building.

  • OUR FINANCIAL GOAL IS TO RAISE $ 5750.00

The Impact

Everyone has high hopes for their campaign, we all want to change the world for the better. Realistically, thats a stretch. But wouldn't it be wonderful to have a solid impact on just a few. It's the begining that counts. Let's get started together.



Risks & Challenges

If our goals aren't met, we'll continue our quest on a smaller level, a few books, open public readings, library & book store presentations, simple venues without cost.
Ideally we would love to place a book in everyones hand, this would be impossible at this time. We will however provide every supporter with a signed personalized copy of our poster dipicting the cover of the book and a code to download the book for their electronic reader. Because all donations are given from the heart, no matter what the level of donation all supporters will receive the same gifts of appreciation.



Other Ways You Can Help, Please Share This Project With Family And Friends. Thank You For Your Support.

story:
IN BRIEF

We launched a small printed journal four years ago called Private Motor Club. We have printed seven issues and are currently working on number eight. At the beginning of the year our plan was to produce a hard back annual covering the year in historic motorsport and we set about commissioning top photographers to capture some of the big events. Unfortunately we just don't have the cashflow to produce 100 copies of the annual ourselves so we need advanced sales and advertising space to be sold.

CONTENT

Purely a picture book, we have planned a 200 page cloth covered book covering: Monte Carlo Historic Rally, Goodwood Members Meeting, Tour Auto, Mille Miglia, Barcelona and Spa Classic - 2ltr Cup / Endurance Racing Legends, Monza Historic, Goodwood Revival and the Rolex Monterey Motorsports Reunion.

Photographers: Remi Dargegen, Rob Overy, Mathieu Bonnevie and Will Broadhead.

READY TO PRINT

We have the images, we have the printers quote, we just need the funding to lay out the book and send it to print.

story:
Nuestra Historia

Durante el primer Concurso de Ciencia Ficción de La Cueva del Lobo, financiamos el premio con la publicidad del blog, pero en esta ocasión deseamos ir un paso adelante, y pedimos a nuestros lectores que nos financien para estimular a los escritores participantes en el concurso aún mas con un jugoso premio :D


El Impacto

Con este premio estimularemos a los escritores de Ciencia Ficción de habla hispana y demostraremos que la comunidad de la Ciencia Ficción en español está comprometida con sus escritores y está interesada en leer mas historias en nuestro idioma.


¿Qué necesitamos y qué obtendremos?

Tenemos dos meses para conseguir un premio para nuestros escritores, 1000 dólares, es una meta ideal que dividiríamos entre los ganadores del siguiente modo, 500 dólares para el primer lugar, 300 dólares para el segundo lugar y 200 dólares para el tercer lugar.

Pero ¿Qué pasa si no alcanzamos la maravillosa cifra de los 1000 dólares? No importa, dividimos cualquier cantidad que se consiga recolectar entre los ganadores de una forma similar a la descrita arriba, recordemos que Indie GOGO nos entregará cualquier cantidad de dinero que hayamos recolectado ¡Incluso si recolectamos mas de lo pautado! :D

Entre mas dinero consigamos recabar, tanto mas estimulados se sentirán los escritores, y entre mejores sean las historias, mas ganas tendrán los lectores de donar al premio :D


Nota: recordemos que Indie GOGO y Paypal se quedan con un mínimo porcentaje.


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Para que esto funcione necesitamos ponernos en campaña, y promoverlo al máximo, de manera que todos los posibles participantes se enteren y se motiven a integrarse. Así que además de donar dinero tenemos que utilizar nuestras habilidades sociales para que la mayor cantidad de gente se entere de lo que estamos haciendo.

Así que cuéntaselo a los lectores de tu blog, enlaza el proyecto en tu perfil de facebook o díselo a tus seguidores de Twitter. Y no te olvides de votarnos en los agregadores como Bitacoras, o Reddit.

¡Muchas gracias de antemano! :D

story:
“We’re not born to hate. That’s something we learn from other people. Unfortunately those people are often our friends and family.”

Hope Taylor, Canuga Falls, July 2013. From becoming Hope

 

‘becoming Hope’

  more than a book

becoming Hope 

is a young adult novel about seventeen year old Hope Taylor, raised to discriminate and be intolerant of others, who has her beliefs turned upside down when she is forced to perform community service by reading to Sara, a Jewish woman from Poland who survived the holocaust and internment in the Auschwitz concentration camp. It’s through Sara’s story and friendship that Hope learns to open her heart to others.

 

BECOMING HOPE: THE STORY

When seventeen-year-old Hope Taylor is caught distributing her church’s anti-Semitic literature at school she is given the choice between community service and a three-day suspension. The last thing Hope needs before final exams is another time out from school. Besides, what can be so hard about spending four weekends reading to a nearly blind old lady?  

Hope is stunned when she discovers that the old lady she has to read to is a Jewish woman from Poland. Not only is she Jewish, but Agnes claims she’s a holocaust survivor and spent a year in the Auschwitz concentration camp - both events Hope believes are exaggerated, if not outright lies. Since Hope has no choice but to stay, she begins to read to Agnes. 

The book Agnes has chosen for Hope to read is a diary Agnes kept during her year in Auschwitz.  When Hope interrogates the old woman about the authenticity of her experiences during the holocaust, she discovers how tough and wise Agnes is.

Hope continues reading the diary to Agnes during their sessions, and even sneaks it out to read on her own. The true tales Agnes weaves in the book draw Hope deep into the dark world of Auschwitz and the camp section restricted to women where Agnes recounts personal confrontations with Joseph Mengele. As Hope continues reading to Agnes, the woman’s courage and honesty dissolve Hope’s racial prejudices and help the young woman learn to be tolerant of others.

Agnes’ diary in 'becoming Hope' is based on an actual book called Auschwitz: True Tales From A Grotesque Land, written by Sara Nomberg-Przytyk, the mother of a very good friend of mine, and published by The University of North Carolina Press. Sara’s son Jerzy and Vicky Wells, the director of contracts and subsidiary rights at the UNC Press, have given me their support and permission to use Sara’s book as a storytelling device that includes using excerpts in ‘becoming Hope’. They are also interested in an idea I pitched on creating a new version of Auschwitz: True Tales From A Grotesque Land for the young adult and educational market.

 

BECOMING HOPE: THE BOOK & PROJECT 

becoming Hope is a book first and foremost, but there is more attached to it than just words and a story. It’s about what a book and its story and characters can inspire. How it can spark change, question beliefs, and open up minds and hearts. By supporting the creation, publication, and distribution of becoming Hope, you might be contributing to the making of a bestseller. Of course it all still depends on me delivering a well written story, but I do have good editors and advisors to help.

With becoming Hope, I want to create an ongoing dialogue by producing and distributing a study guide; a website where we can market and promote the book, related information, reading guides, content for educators, and an interactive forum. I will develop a revised school and student version of Sara Nomberg-Przytyk’s original book, Auschwitz: True Tales From A Grotesque Land, to present to the University of North Carolina Press, the book’s publishers. The UNC Press are aware of the project to create a combined book and reading guide, and are willing to review it for publication, or co-publication.

 

HOW BECOMING HOPE GOT STARTED

A few years ago I learned that a good friend of mine’s mother, Sara Nomberg-Przytyk, had written a book about her experience as a prisoner in Auschwitz. I borrowed the book from my friend Jerzy Przytyk, Sara’s son, and finished it in two days; breathless, exhausted, and inspired from what I had read. 

It was a powerful and well told story that contained events and information about that place and time in history that I had never been aware of. All of it told from the point of view of Jerzy’s mother, a young Jewish Polish woman named Sara. I asked Jerzy if I could adapt the book into a story that I could tell through film or stage, and he graciously agreed. 

But I soon discovered that the excitement and inspiration I got from the book didn’t help me translate the book and Sara's story into an easily made movie. It took some time until a good idea bubbled up. I went off in one direction for awhile but got stuck trying to tell the story from too many points of view. So the idea and story lingered while I tried to think my way to a solution. But thinking analytically is often a creativity killer.  

Then, a few weeks ago, I heard an interview with a young woman from the southern United States who turned away from a life and church that discriminated against Jews and Gays. This change was sparked by a friendship the young woman made with a Jewish man started through a dialogue on Twitter, 140 characters at a time. This triggered a new idea.

I remembered that a very good friend of mine told me how she had spent a summer reading the English translation of Sara’s book to her for proofreading, much like ghe fictional Hope does. My friend told me how spending that intimate time with Sara had brought the two of them closer. The light went off! 

I could use my friend’s experience as a spark to ignite 'becoming Hope', and shape it into a compelling, fictional, young adult story. This could be a book I would be proud to write, and show friends and family. A story to inspire others and open hearts. And it was a great way to tell people about Sara, her book, and experience surviving Auschwitz and the Holocaust -- all through the eyes of seventeen year old Hope Taylor. 

 

HOW YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS ARE BEING USED

 Here's where you come in.  

I’m going to finish writing Becoming Hope by the beginning of June, then self-publish both the print and eBook. At the same time I will be developing and creating a study/reading guide with friends, dedicated educators who are talented and experienced professionals.

The money raised will be used for the following:

  • Cover design.
  • Layout and book design.
  • Costs of creating and shipping perks.
  • Print 200 hardcover copies (plus shipping).
  • Print 200 paperback copies (plus shipping).
  • Website design and build.
  • Marketing and promotion.
  • Legal and business fees.

If I exceed my financial goal, I will use the additional funds to:

  • Develop a screenplay based on the book.
  • Print and distribute more books to schools and community groups.
  • Create a Becoming Hope Foundation to promote media literacy and cultural understanding.
  • Create a Becoming Hope Foundation Advisory Board consisting of creative and talented professionals from diverse fields who share the Foundation's goals.

 

WHY INDIEGOGO?

Indiegogo and other crowd-funding organizations can help writers realize their creative dreams and reach their publishing goals. The Indiegogo website provides a system that allows those artists and entrepreneurs to raise small amounts of money from many people through financial contributions in exchange for specific rewards. For the author and self publisher, it’s like offering pre-sales of their books, just like what major publishers Harper Collins, and Simon and Shuster do through digital channels like Amazon, and their own company websites.  

 

Q. CAN I CONTRIBUTE WITHOUT SELECTING A REWARD?

Yes! Just click the red button located below the amount I’ve raised so far that says "Contribute Now". This will take you to my list of perks where you can scroll down to the bottom and select "No Perk, just a Contribution" and enter the amount you want.

You can also select a perk and then when I email you to fulfill the perk selected, you can decline the perk at that time. Or you can give it to someone else.

But I’d love it if you would read the book and send me feedback!

 

CAN I GIVE MY CONTRIBUTION REWARD AS A GIFT? 

Absolutely! When I contact you to fulfill the reward, just give me the address where you want the items shipped and I’d be happy to do so.

 

CAN I CONTRIBUTE FROM OUTSIDE THE US OR CANADA?

You can contribute from anywhere! I will send rewards anywhere in the world, but due to international shipping costs, for anything outside Canada or the United States, please add $10 to your qualifying contribution of $50, and add $15 to all contributions at the $100 and $500 level.    

 

HOW TO SUPPORT BECOMING HOPE RIGHT NOW 

Please contribute whatever you can to becoming Hope and spread the word about the book! If you feel comfortable about my project then you can also send everyone you know the link to my Indiegogo page:

  • http://igg.me/at/wjlee

You can also Tweet about becoming Hope and post a link of the campaign page on your Facebook, website or Blog:

  • http://igg.me/at/wjlee

You can also contact me anytime at: 

  • info@becominghope.com

 

   Thanks for taking the time to visit, read, & review this project!

 

ABOUT ME

My name is William J. Lee, and I’m an author, screenwriter, and producer, currently writing young adult fiction from my home office in North Hatley, Quebec, Canada. You can call me Bill, just like my animated friends and supporters in the video.

I’m presently working on a young adult novel called Becoming Hope, and have written or co-written five produced feature film screenplays; written, directed, and produced a romantic comedy; produced four feature films.

Over the years, I've worked on more than 50 film and television productions, including the Academy Award winning movie Moonstruck (screenplay by John Patrick Shanley) starring Cher and Nicolas Cage; and directed by five time Oscar nominee and Irving G. Thalberg award winner Norman Jewison. I’ve also taught screenwriting at the University of Sherbrooke, and worked as a script doctor and creative consultant for production companies; independent producers; and freelance writers.

At the start of the Internet boom in 1997, I co-founded Next Picture, LLC. Our company was an early developer of entertainment related web based proprietary technology, and mobile services and applications. We partnered with talented technology and film industry professionals that included Robert De Niro and Tribeca Films; Chris Blackwell founder of Island Records and Palm Pictures; A. Kitman Ho, Golden Globe Winning and Academy Award nominated producer; creative tech innovator Catherine Devlin of Toronto based Devlin Applied Design (Devlin Digital); and John Malone’s Liberty Media.

www.about.me/williamjlee

You can contribute from anywhere! I will send rewards anywhere in the world, but due to international shipping costs, for anything outside Canada or the United States, please add $10 to your qualifying contribution of $50, and add $15 to all contributions at the $100 and $500 level.    
 

HOW TO SUPPORT BECOMING HOPE RIGHT NOW 
Please contribute whatever you can to becoming Hope and spread the word about the book! If you feel comfortable about my project then you can also send everyone you know the link to my Indiegogo page:

http://igg.me/at/wjlee
You can also Tweet about becoming Hope and post a link of the campaign page on your Facebook, website or Blog:

http://igg.me/at/wjlee
You can also contact me anytime at: 

info@becominghope.com
 

   Thanks for taking the time to visit, read, & review this project!

 
ABOUT ME
My name is William J. Lee, and I’m an author, screenwriter, and producer, currently writing young adult fiction from my home office in North Hatley, Quebec, Canada. You can call me Bill, just like my animated friends and supporters in the video.
I’m presently working on a young adult novel called Becoming Hope, and have written or co-written five produced feature film screenplays; written, directed, and produced a romantic comedy; produced four feature films.
Over the years, I've worked on more than 50 film and television productions, including the Academy Award winning movie Moonstruck (screenplay by John Patrick Shanley) starring Cher and Nicolas Cage; and directed by five time Oscar nominee and Irving G. Thalberg award winner Norman Jewison. I’ve also taught screenwriting at the University of Sherbrooke, and worked as a script doctor and creative consultant for production companies; independent producers; and freelance writers.
At the start of the Internet boom in 1997, I co-founded Next Picture, LLC. Our company was an early developer of entertainment related web based proprietary technology, and mobile services and applications. We partnered with talented technology and film industry professionals that included Robert De Niro and Tribeca Films; Chris Blackwell founder of Island Records and Palm Pictures; A. Kitman Ho, Golden Globe Winning and Academy Award nominated producer; creative tech innovator Catherine Devlin of Toronto based Devlin Applied Design (Devlin Digital); and John Malone’s Liberty Media.

story:
This year, I have the official honor of live-blogging the 2013 bi-annual Integral Theory Conference: Connecting the Integral Kosmopolitan. With the philosopher Roy Bhaskar and the integral thinker Edgar Morin (author of Homeland Earth) as plenary speakers, it's bound to be a thought-provoking event.

This year's theme – connecting the Integral Kosmopolitan – is a significant step for integral thinking, calling for those who recognize integral as, "a multiple object... trans-lineage" and "meta-disciplinary" to participate.

I've always considered myself a trans-lineage advocate, having early on begun with the works of Ken Wilber, but moving just as readily into the tremendous tomes of Jean Gebser, Sri Aurobindo, Teilhard de Chardin, and other integral thinkers like William Irwin Thompson.

When Mark Forman asked me to be this year’s official blogger, I was elated. “Sure!” I said.

But then there’s the whole issue of getting there.

This is where you come in.

My blog, Evolutionary Landscapes, is a labor of love. Put succinctly, EL is an alternative media platform for spiritual activism and a crossroad for divergent communities attempting to understand our planetary age. To cover this year's conference in the San Francisco Bay area, I'll be paying out of pocket to fly over to the West Coast from my current, muggy location in Titusville Florida (the Space Coast, by any other name).

I write because I believe there is deep significance in drawing together an emergent culture of integral and evolutionary thinkers, multiple disciplines like integral theory and liberation theology, medieval studies and cyborg anthropology. In this remixed, combinatorial age, we need multiple contexts. Synthesis is emergent. To make it possible to meet, greet, and blog my heart out for ITC, offering my careful consideration of the presenters and teachers there, I will need your financial support.

We all carry each other. Events can be supported, writers funded, communities built, all through the wonders of crowd-sourcing. It would be an honor to be carried by integral-oriented folks of all shapes and sizes: conference presenters, fellow attendees, fans of EL, and most of all, my readers. I ask you only to offer with you can, and I'll step forward with the mighty... well, keyboard, and my thoughts on the page.

What your fundraising will do:

Your ITC Blogger making it to the conference! The biggest hurdle is getting there and back again. The round-trip flight, by itself costs $450. As a recent college graduate, on the hunt for full-time work, this is simply not possible to do on my own.

I've set the minimum to $500, as this will greatly help make the trip financially possible.

Now, once I'm there, I'll be covering everything. That is, as much as my fingers can type and my brain can digest each day. I will be attending as many panels as I temporally can (and if you have anything that can extend my writing abilities through time and space, that'd be great).

In addition to live-blogging each day's amazing events (both in the conference rooms and as Mark Forman says, the "conference in the hallways." Yes, there are bound to be some interesting trans-lineage conversations), I'll be doing...

  • Interviews with panelists and attendees. 
  • Recordings, and transcripts of conversations to be published on Evolutionary Landscapes once I return home. 

Additional funds will, with much appreciation, go to EL:

  • Basic site maintenance, domain name renewal
  • Website improvements! Improved themes, website hosting upgrades, and most importantly...
  • More content! Your patronage makes EL's content possible. More articles. More interviews, podcasts. If there's sufficient support, it would be lovely to expand EL's content curation into e-books. The more time I can put into it, the more it will grow (if you build it, they will come...)

What do you get back?

Aside from me blogging ITC 2013? You make my craft possible. You improve Evolutionary Landscapes as an alternative media platform for spiritual activism and cultural investigation. You fund what I'm doing, as a labor of love and passionate scholarly pursuit. But I'd like to invite you to also reach out to me. Let's Skype.

I encourage fundraisers to reach out to me and let me know what you are doing. Before and after the conference (I'll probably still be soaring days after getting home), I'd be delighted to share my findings and experiences with you. The people I'll meet. The ideas conveyed. The possibilities opened.

I'll share what I know and tell what I've seen. Most importantly, I encourage more collaboration. If you've got something you'd like to do. A writing project, an idea to explore on EL, or simply friendly integral correspondence, let’s do it!

A deep bow of gratitude to you. Hope to see you at ITC 2013!

Other Ways to Support:

The economy is rough these days. So, even if you can't or don't want to support funding this project financially, please consider spreading the word. Let others know about this page. Share it with friends and colleagues. 

Some Big Updates!

So, in 4 days, I reached my initial goal (and the minimum funding requirement of IndieGoGo) of $500. I can't say how appreciative and graced I am by your enthusiasm and support for my campaign! Seriously, thank you. As of me writing this, there are still two weeks left - 14 days - before the campaign closes. I've continued to receive donations from some wonderful folks, and as mentioned, additional funding goes to a) meals b) transportation while in SF Bay, and c) my blog's site maintanence and upgrades (more storage, better themes, more podcasts, interviews and content). Through your support, it's possible Evolutionary Landscapes might grow by leaps and bounds. Any contributions at this point are simply grace, in my eyes. So if you feel like contributing, or want to continue to support this campaign in some way, please share this page with friends and colleagues, conference attendees and panelists, or simply readers who might be interested in the content of my blog (consciousness studies, cultural evolution, counter-cultural literature and spiritual activism). Thank you again!

10 For Everything is my collection of award-winning short stories and poetry.

10 For Everything is published by independent press, Tangerine Tide, an imprint of Orange Ocean Press. Your investment (a pre-purchase of the book) will go toward the publication fees.

story:
Storytelling to Share Christ

Help us provide solar-powered mp3 players loaded with Bible stories to the Datooga people.

Reaching the Datooga

Storytelling is an important part of the Datooga culture and telling Bible stories is a strategy our missionary friends, the Haskins, already use to share the Word. However, the Haskins are the only Christians ministering to these people and there are only 2 other saved people in the village.   ". . . the harvest is plentiful but the workers are few" Matthew 9:37

After a visit from Forrest, Kirk started thinking about ways to make the stories more available. We found a way to use technology to increase "the workers" using a solar-powered mp3 player that hangs around the the neck.  It enables each individual to have a collection of stories, in their language, they can listen to again and again.  The lack of computers ensures the data we download will not be replaced.  It is solar powered so works in the primitive circumstances. The people already wear spirit pouches as necklaces, so would be an easy adaptation to switch to Holy Spirit pouches.  In the picture above, the lady on the left is wearing a spirit pouch.

Groundbreaking Strategy

This is a revolutionary method for sharing the Bible with unreached peoples.  Lack of basics in Third World areas, like computers and electricity, have prohibited implementation of many strategies we take for granted in the United States.  With these devices, we can cheaply connect the Datooga with the Word in their own language.

Who are we?

Kirk and Renee McCarty.  We are a couple who have been passionate about missions for many years.  In fact, we fell in love on a short-term mission trip and continued to make trips as a married couple.  About 6 years ago, Renee's physical problems prohibited any more trips, but we have continued to be involved with support and prayer.

Our partners in this strategy are Forrest and Purity Haskins and their children Riley and Crystal.  They are a missionary family we have known and supported for approximately 7 years.  They are a part of the African Inland Mission (AIM) agency.

We have been impressed with their dedication, willingness to be obedient and enthusiasm.  Forrest and Purity's desire to follow the Lord's leading resulted in their living with the Datooga (Dah-toe-ga) people and working to find ways to reach them for Christ.

What We Need

Our goal is $2,500.  With that amount we would be able to purchase an mp3 player for every adult and older child in the village.

The players cost approximately $20 each, plus shipping.  We may be able to get a discount for purchasing 100+, which would simply allow us to purchase more players.  This money will only be used to purchase mp3 players.  We will use any funds collected to buy the maximun amount of players, even if we don't reach our goal.

Please help us with:

  • Donations
  • Prayer
  • Spreading the word about our project (use the indigogo link)

Be sure to look at the PowerPoint presentation in the gallery!!

story:
Diabétique depuis 41 ans, d'un diabète instable, que les meilleurs spécialistes Français n'ont pu équilibrer, j'ai accepté d'être cobaye pour tester 2 greffes de pancréas qui ne m'ont guérit que 4 mois et depuis 6 mois je fais des comas hypos dont je peux mourir ! Chaque jour, j'ignore si je vivrais le lendemain ! Un labo vient de créer un petit appareil qui, placé sous la peau du ventre, recueille une glycémie chaque 5 mn et m'alerte dès que ma glycémie dépasse les normales hypos ou hypers, ce qui me permet d'éviter les comas ! 
Exemple : je suis en sommeil profond à 5 h du matin, ma glycémie descend en dessous de la normale qui est 0,80 g de sucre dans le sang, mon taux est à 0,79, l'alarme de mon appareil se déclenche, me permettant d'aller me re-sucrer alors que sans cette alerte, je serais descendue jusqu'au coma hypo ! Je passe du sommeil au coma sans aucun symptôme ! Jusqu'à présent, on m'a trouvé à temps et sauvé mais mais en vivant seule, chaque jour est une journée où je peux mourir ! Mon énorme problème est que cet appareil est si nouveau qu'il n'est pas remboursé par la sécurité sociale et je ne reçois pour vivre que " l'allocation adulte handicapé " qui est de 850 €/mois et que l'appareil coûte une petite fortune pour moi mais surtout, tous le matériel INDISPENSABLE qui sert à son fonctionnement ! 
Il y a le " récepteur " qui est garanti 1 an mais dont j'ignore la durée de vie, l'émetteur d'ondes qui se change chaque 6 mois et le catéter qu'on place sous la peau du ventre qui doit être changé chaque semaine ! 
Sans tout cet appareillage, chaque jour peut être mon dernier ! Chaque nuit, j'ignore si je me réveillerais ! 
J'ai besoin, de vous et de vos dons !
Sans vos dons, je ne peux m'acheter ce matériel, et il serait stupide de ma part de faire des projets d'avenir !

story:
Website is up!! I have posted a sample from the book on the book website www.backtotheterritory.com check it out!!!

The music in the video was generously allowed by Floating Spirits, a thousand thanks to them ;)

My Story

Have you heard the story... "You’ve got to go to school so that you can learn..." Then.. "You’ve got to make good grades so that you can get into a good college... so that you can get a degree... so that you can get a good job... so that you can make good money... and afford a nice house and car.. so that you can have a family and a dog.. and eventually have a 'good life.'"?

 

Well, I was about half way down the wide and heavily traveled path to "the good life," when I began meeting people who had followed this map all the way to the end, of whom many seemed to be asking,

 

"Where is the part where I get to the place I was trying to go?"

 

At this point, I wasn’t experiencing 'what I was doing' to be directly complementing the 'good life' and I began to ask where exactly is it that I’m trying to get, with all this?

 

And on top of it, school had become my guide to what was important to learn in life, church was my map to salvation, pop trends and movies were my guide to how to act if I want to connect with others, money for security, and so many others were the maps that I had been hoping would lead me to the place I was trying to go; the place, that when I get there, I know there is nowhere else I want to be. But in "how to get there on my own, from wherever I happen to be sitting..." I sat in darkness.

 

All I knew was that when I surfed, in that moment, I needed nothing else to finally enjoy living, nothing else to feel free; at peace. Only to share that feeling with everybody else... and it didn’t sound like a bad place to be. But of course, I knew I couldn’t live on a surfboard... food, water, shelter, hygiene, and the rest of the conditions of existence wouldn’t allow for it. 

 

That is when the question that started this whole journey began.

"What is it about surfing that I can’t seem to get from the rest of my life?"

 

 So I began studying psychology and the state described as "Flow" by athletes in peak experiences. Then Philosophy where I developed a strong interest in researching all the scriptures, indigenous cultural beliefs, eastern and western philosophies, other contexts, and all the sciences where truths about reality were being revealed -which seemed to mirror the way I experienced reality when I surfed and also as was described in texts describing the mystical experience. 

 

And then the Journey began, where I now stand, in Sweden, where all the research, the Journey, the traveling and writing condenses into this book.

-From the Map Back to the Territory or simply   -Back to the Territory

 

And this is the Project.

 

Where I will be sharing a book I hope will offer insight into what keeps us from living our lives in this place all the time and the implications of -the description of reality during the mystical state reflecting truths revealed in various new fields of science. (of which our common experiences often do not seem to be very representative of)

 

 

What I Need & What You Get

Where the funds will go:

$5,295 is the cost of the total package of

  • professional editing,
  • cover design, 
  • kindle formatting,
  • Printing of 200 paper-back copies            (also your perks)
  • and 20 hard-back copies                        (more of perks)

All this will give me the ease to be able to focus on writing, knowing that I am not doing this alone. And the bulk printing is much more economical than printing on demand and would give me a great start off as an author by having some copies on-hand.

 

What you get: (aka perks)

All of the perks can be found with detail to the right side of the page, but the one I would like to mention here is:

Listed in the 'List of Acknowledgements' in the book:
This is so that the readers of this book can see how you all personally played a role in making this happen, which in the course of writing this book, I have come to know ALL things to happen... as a result of the role that everything plays. But also, and just as importantly, this is how I would like to share the way I see all of you, and how valuable each one of you is in this world, by showing how valuable you are in THIS world here.

 

If I do not reach my goal,

 

  • yet reach half ($2,500)

I will be using the funds to find what editing I can and will be covering the rest myself.

  • If we raise over my goal!!!

The funds will go to the translation of this book into as many languages as the funds will allow!!

 

  • If I reach double my goal!!

The funds will be used for travel, speeches and workshops across the US and Europe and a minature documentary of covering a wide variety of contexts in which this experience has been documented in an attempt to paint a picture of this place through cinematography :)

 

The Impact

The impact your funding will make, can only be described as follows:

This book is the culmination of thousands of conversations, both fruitful and unfruitful journeys, lots of research and is the way that I am wholeheartedly trying to give to the world something that might open eyes to an alternative source of wealth and health... Quality over quantity.

Website is up!! I have posted a sample from the book on the book website www.backtotheterritory.com check it out!!!
The music in the video was generously allowed by Floating Spirits, a thousand thanks to them ;) 
My Story
Have you heard the story... "You’ve got to go to school so that you can learn..." Then.. "You’ve got to make good grades so that you can get into a good college... so that you can get a degree... so that you can get a good job... so that you can make good money... and afford a nice house and car.. so that you can have a family and a dog.. and eventually have a 'good life.'"?
 
Well, I was about half way down the wide and heavily traveled path to "the good life," when I began meeting people who had followed this map all the way to the end, of whom many seemed to be asking,
 
"Where is the part where I get to the place I was trying to go?"
 
At this point, I wasn’t experiencing 'what I was doing' to be directly complementing the 'good life' and I began to ask where exactly is it that I’m trying to get, with all this?
 
And on top of it, school had become my guide to what was important to learn in life, church was my map to salvation, pop trends and movies were my guide to how to act if I want to connect with others, money for security, and so many others were the maps that I had been hoping would lead me to the place I was trying to go; the place, that when I get there, I know there is nowhere else I want to be. But in "how to get there on my own, from wherever I happen to be sitting..." I sat in darkness.
 
All I knew was that when I surfed, in that moment, I needed nothing else to finally enjoy living, nothing else to feel free; at peace. Only to share that feeling with everybody else... and it didn’t sound like a bad place to be. But of course, I knew I couldn’t live on a surfboard... food, water, shelter, hygiene, and the rest of the conditions of existence wouldn’t allow for it. 
 
That is when the question that started this whole journey began.
"What is it about surfing that I can’t seem to get from the rest of my life?"
 
 So I began studying psychology and the state described as "Flow" by athletes in peak experiences. Then Philosophy where I developed a strong interest in researching all the scriptures, indigenous cultural beliefs, eastern and western philosophies, other contexts, and all the sciences where truths about reality were being revealed -which seemed to mirror the way I experienced reality when I surfed and also as was described in texts describing the mystical experience. 
 
And then the Journey began, where I now stand, in Sweden, where all the research, the Journey, the traveling and writing condenses into this book.
-From the Map Back to the Territory or simply   -Back to the Territory
 
And this is the Project.
 
Where I will be sharing a book I hope will offer insight into what keeps us from living our lives in this place all the time and the implications of -the description of reality during the mystical state reflecting truths revealed in various new fields of science. (of which our common experiences often do not seem to be very representative of)
 
 
What I Need & What You Get
Where the funds will go:
$5,295 is the cost of the total package of

professional editing,
cover design, 
kindle formatting,
Printing of 200 paper-back copies            (also your perks)
and 20 hard-back copies                        (more of perks)

All this will give me the ease to be able to focus on writing, knowing that I am not doing this alone. And the bulk printing is much more economical than printing on demand and would give me a great start off as an author by having some copies on-hand.
 
What you get: (aka perks)
All of the perks can be found with detail to the right side of the page, but the one I would like to mention here is:
Listed in the 'List of Acknowledgements' in the book: This is so that the readers of this book can see how you all personally played a role in making this happen, which in the course of writing this book, I have come to know ALL things to happen... as a result of the role that everything plays. But also, and just as importantly, this is how I would like to share the way I see all of you, and how valuable each one of you is in this world, by showing how valuable you are in THIS world here.
 
If I do not reach my goal, 
 

yet reach half ($2,500)

I will be using the funds to find what editing I can and will be covering the rest myself.

If we raise over my goal!!!

The funds will go to the translation of this book into as many languages as the funds will allow!!
 

If I reach double my goal!! 

The funds will be used for travel, speeches and workshops across the US and Europe and a minature documentary of covering a wide variety of contexts in which this experience has been documented in an attempt to paint a picture of this place through cinematography :)

As readers of Zennie62.com know, an email came on Wednesday called "STANDING COMMITTEE OF CORRESPONDENTS, CONGRESSIONAL PRESS GALLERIES,INAUGURAL PRESS TICKET NOTIFICATION" and said:

The Standing Committee of Correspondents has assigned your organization the following for the Presidential Swearing-in Ceremony on the West Front of the U.S. Capitol on Monday, January 21st, 2013.

1  PRESS TICKET(S)

The application for this was made way back in November, just after the election. The time past by and by the time the email arrived I was where I am now: in Las Vegas covering CES 2013 (the Consumer Electronics Show).   Since I didn't budget hotel funds for the Presidential Inauguration, as I believed the press credential wasn't going to be approved, I opened this sponsorship campaign once I discovered Zennie62 was approved on Wednesday.  

To explain, this press ticket places me just a few feet away from the President Of The United States and First Lady Michelle Obama, as he takes the oath of office for his second term.  This is history.  

Here are the levels of participation for you to become part of history with me and Zennie62.com.  

1: $30: - Your name or company name will go in the end credits for each inauguration-related video.  

2: $100 - Your name or company name or logo will go in a panel after each inauguration-related video, and before the end credits.

3. $500 - Your name or company name or logo will go in a panel before each inauguration-related video.  

4. $700 - Your name or company name or logo will go in a panel before each inauguration-related video, and you will be mentioned as a sponsor at the start of each blog post related to the inauguration.

Let's make history!

story:
Hello friends around the world!

Thank you for stopping by! My name is Ruika Lin. I'm a 24-year-old from Sichuan, China currently working and living in San Francisco, CA, USA. I'm running this crowdfunding campaign to self publish an essay collection, along with several guest writers, to explore the Questions we ask in our lives. The funds raised through this campaign will help editing, designing, and marketing the book.


The title of the book is Frequently Asked Questions.

The essays are non-fictional short stories about questions we ask ourselves and each other, on our thoughts, identities, experiences, dreams, directions, interaction with people and environment around us, and perception of the world.



WRITERS:

Ruika Lin - 

Leaving home of 18 years on the other side of the planet, Ruika came to the United States in 2007 to attend the University of Virginia. Beyond the life-changing college experience at a southern public school, Ruika strives to keep a balance among different layers of her identity that she picks up along the journey as she continues to explore new environment, cultures, and human behaviors in the US and abroad. When she's not attempting to figure out how the world works, she immerses herself in the endless pleasure of music making, great conversations, writing, and homemade omelet.


David Abramovich, Guest Writer - 

David is a Russian-born human, for whom, like for Ruika, English came second. The world lacks answers, so the questions he asks are multifold. Expect a mix of "Nancy Drew" and "House of Leaves". 




Steven Boren, Guest Writer - 

*Born: Yes *Raised: Ultimate Red State Package (Utah-Idaho-LDS add ons) *School: Some, then some more... those time are all a blur of fog *Married: Really? No one is that Crazy *Kids: See section Married *Pets: Cassidy the Boonie Dog and Amelia the Tabby Cat. RIP *Profession: Musician (failed); Writer (I wrote this so failed); The Stuff I can't talk about (retired) *Hobbies: I write Pop tunes for no good reason *Places I've lived: Stanley, Idaho; Provo, Utah; Rock Springs, Wyoming; Saipan, CNMI *Home: San Francisco *Dreams: Answer is in my Essay


Kyle Lamson, Guest Writer - 

Like Ruika, Kyle also attended Mr. Jefferson's University. Instead of staying up all night at Clemons Library pondering concepts like existence, identity, and ontology, he spent his years in the mechanical engineering lab wondering why his problem set calculations never added up. It's amazing that even The Declaration, the jealous, underfunded step-sister of the school's principle paper, ever published anything he authored given his English education clearly stopped at some point in late high school. Kyle lives in San Francisco where he writes about romance, coexistence with techne, and the economization of our irrational lives. Check out two articles he wrote for The Declaration: Being There and Get Off Our Tax.


Malika Noel, Guest Writer - 

A legal aid attorney and "J.D. Distinguished Fellow", Malika is committed to social justice and a world with a little more heart. She considers herself in good company with all the weirdos who think outside of the box and dare to change the world. In her free time, she enjoys flexing her self-proclaimed poet skills and trying to live in the now. She's excited to be part of this thought provoking project and invites all the readers to ask questions of their own. 


O.G.Rose, Guest Writer - 

Daniel L. Garner and Michelle R. Opperman, known collectively as O.G. Rose, live in Charlottesville, Virginia and graduated from the University of Virginia. Rose is interested in the distinction between dreams and visions, and with how irony occurs in a world where contradiction cannot exist and yet does. You can find their writing selections at www.og-rose.com, and their photography at www.frozen-glory.com.


Dan Leifer, Guest Writer - 

Dan is an auditor by trade and remains puzzled as to why people visibly wince when they see him coming down the hall. Unlike Ruika and Kyle, Dan attended the same university that Thomas Jefferson attended in the 1700's. Dan owns a Chewbacca suit and a moonbounce and if you call them a gorilla suit or a bouncy castle he will have words and those words will be strict. Dan has been a long-time lurker of the fiction world and will be a first-time poster, so cross your fingers (unless that interferes with turning the page).



Ken Walsh, Guest Writer - 

Dr. Walsh is an Associate Professor in the Information Systems Group of the Management Department, College of Business, at University of New Orleans. He is published widely in the scientific community with articles in the Communications of the ACM, Information and Management, Journal of Computer Information Systems, and many others. His most recent book, Dockside: Kim and Eric Embrace Crowdfunding to Realize Dreams, is to be released soon. With co-author Sathiadev Mahesh, he has written the text book, Run with Office, on using the Microsoft Office Suite. Dr. Walsh has conducted consulting or research engagements with the National Science Foundation, US Navy, City of New Orleans, New Orleans RTA, and the Louisiana Partnership for Innovation, among others. Before devoting his life to research, he was a Senior Systems Analyst for Exxon leading project to develop database systems for oil and gas production. In his free time he sails. 


Being a non-native English speaker, I don't pride myself on being exceptional at written English. Before I started writing non-academic-thesis essays in English, I had always been writing in Chinese.

Several chapters in the book, including the excerpt below, are inspired by essays I wrote in Chinese over the past few years, two of which will be included in the book. Whether you read Chinese or not, each language is a form of beauty, and I'm grateful for the opportunity to share with you.

Here's an excerpt from one essay in the book: Fortuitous Encounters

story:
YOU CAN ORDER THE MAGAZINE THROUGH THIS PAGE, 

even though our first Indiegogo campaign ended on April 12.



Europe’s startup scene is booming, but one key factor of a developed startup scene is missing: a dedicated print media reciting our story and telling the world where we’re going. Rather than waiting for someone else to do it, we co-founded CoFounder, a magazine dedicated to doing exactly that. A thick package of interviews, analysis, and columns by the European startup scene and for the European startup scene.

Behind CoFounder is a good background in journalism - with Tarmo Virki who in the past served as a Reuters journalist and the head of Forbes Estonia. Combine that with Dmitri Sarle and Greg Anderson from ArcticStartup, a media company that’s been writing about the rise of the Nordic and Baltic startup scene since 2007. And a growing team of freelance writers, designers, and photographers from all over Europe.

CoFounder has already tested the market with its first issue, and now needs your help to turn this magazine into a media startup.

With premium content, we want to put this in a premium package. That means killing some trees.


CoFounder digital posters

But if you’re wondering “why a print magazine in 2015” it’s about priorities. Some great institutions are doing long-form journalism on the web, but the last thing you need is another media company gunning for your Facebook feed or throwing social share buttons in your face before and after every article. Writing for the web means selling you, the user, as a product while we’d rather sell an amazing product to you. Don’t share our articles, let your friends and colleagues borrow the magazine. They’ll like you for it. And also the nature will like it - we will plant a tree for each tree needed to produce the magazine.

It’s back to basics. We write great content, a beautiful magazine is delivered to your door, and you drink a cup of coffee while reading a unique look at the European tech sector.

CoFounder subscribers agree, having CoFounder laying on your desk, filling up your office’s Ikea shelves, or hanging out in your meeting room reflects well on you as a person.

1. It’s a conversation starter about the trends you find important.

2. It’s not staring at a screen for the 15th straight hour.

3. It says that even though you’re sucked into the fast paced digital world, there’s still a part of you that likes your words printed and pages dogeared.

We feel the same way. 

Tarmo Virki has been a journalist for over 19 years in Reuters and Forbes, running the Reuters European Tech, Media and Telecom team for years. Tarmo breaths journalism and thankfully knows how to build a magazine.

Greg Anderson has been the Editor-In-Chief of ArcticStartup for four years and knows the startup world inside-out.

Dmitri Sarle has been an entrepreneur in many different industries and is the CEO of ArcticStartup.


Arctic15: Exit Path (2014) 

We Actually Need Your Help

This is your grandpa’s crowdfunding campaign - the way they once were before successful companies realized Indiegogo is a promotion platform (more on that in our next issue).

But we really need to hit this goal to pay for printing of the next three issues and to hire more great writers. It would be fantastic if you could contribute to the cause and get a great magazine subscription out of it.

To sweeten the deal we’ve added a few great packages, we’d like to highlight. Many of them include getting CoFounder delivered to your door, but additional goodies include options like having your dedicated page in the magazine (50 characters by you at the bottom of a page), which looks like this:

You could also get your greetings printed in May Issue of the magazine, join our editorial advisory board Startup Illuminati or grab fantastically-priced tickets to Arctic15, full and half-page ads, and even a trip to Up North!

For detailed CoFounder advertising information, click here to see our media card.

The media business is a rough world - you always hear about dwindling newspaper subscriptions, confused advertisers, and media companies shuttering.

There’s no other way to say it, but we think we have the right niche and right startup mentality to take on this open market through print. 

One way or another we’re taking on Europe.

story:
I never thought I'd be alive to see my 45th birthday. But against all odds, it looks like I'll be wrapping my heart around this miracle milestone on November 9 this year.

Two drug overdoses. Ten years as a stripper. A lifetime of feeling not enough. 

It feels like I've been writing this memoir forever, and in many ways, I have.

From crumbled up cocktail napkins, to the hundred or so drafts I have saved on my lap top, there is a story inside me that needs to be told.

But I need the guidance and tools to help orchestrate my words. 

I've been accepted to attend Joyce Maynard's exclusive writer's workshop at Lake Atitlan in Guatemala. This is a life-changing opportunity that I know will propel my writing to where it needs to be in order to make this book happen.

But I won't be able to attend if I can't come up with the funds.

Which is why I'm here, humbly asking for your donation. Any amount will help and is beyond appreciated. 

NO AMOUNT IS TOO SMALL.

From the bottom of my heart, I thank you for helping make my dream of sharing this story come true.

Dreaming Big,

Christine Macdonald

Which is why I'm here, humbly asking for your donation. Any amount will help and is beyond appreciated. 
NO AMOUNT IS TOO SMALL.
From the bottom of my heart, I thank you for helping make my dream of sharing this story come true.
Dreaming Big, 
Christine Macdonald

story:
My name is Barbara Herman, and I love perfume.

I’m launching this campaign to fund the last leg of research for my first nonfiction book, Scent and Subversion: A Century of Provocative Perfume, which will be published next fall by Lyons Press.

In Scent and Subversion (which I have almost completed writing!), I will look at 20th century perfume as a medium that reflects on — and often rebels against — conventional attitudes about gender, sexuality, and the body. Scent and Subversion will feature reviews of over 300 vintage perfumes spanning the 20th century; it will be illustrated with over 100 20th century vintage perfume ads; and it will feature guides to perfume appreciation and interviews with visionary perfumers of the 21st century.

“Perfumery, a hundred-year-old art, has taken a long time dying, but on January 1, 2010 it will be officially dead. “ – Luca Turin regarding the International Fragrance Association’s ban on classic perfume ingredients

Of the 300+ perfumes I discuss in Scent and Subversion, some have been discontinued, some have been reformulated because certain ingredients are now banned, and in other cases, some have just vanished, like pulp novels with only one print run. Because all perfume will eventually evaporate, it's been important to me to delve into as many 20th century perfumes as I can get my hands (and nose) on before they all disappear.

“My newest favorite perfume blog is Yesterday’s Perfume, where Barbara Herman explores our collective cultural history as embodied in fragrance.” – Katie Puckrik, journalist, broadcaster, perfume blogger

Before I fell in love with perfume and began blogging about it four years ago on yesterdaysperfume.com, I was the editor of a women’s pop culture website TrèsSugar.com in San Francisco, and for years I was a grad student at UC Berkeley’s Department of Rhetoric and Film. Perfume seems to me just as worthy of attention as films or books, and even though its production, history and aesthetics have been written about extensively, what feels missing to me is a cultural and particularly feminist approach to analyzing perfume. Perfume, after all, has primarily been made for and marketed to women.

This has been an expensive project to curate, however, and I’m asking you to help me on this last leg of my olfactory journey into the past.

 WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTION WILL HELP FUND:

 •  I’m trying to cover around 30 vintage perfumes per 20th century decade, and there are a number of perfumes, mainly in the form of sample decants, that I still need to purchase. (I estimate the cost at around $500)

 • Because I want vintage perfume ads to help readers visualize perfume’s otherwise invisible rhetoric, I’ve amassed quite a collection of vintage perfume ads.  I still have many to purchase, however — around $500 worth.

 •  The biggest cost I’m asking you to help me to defray is the cost of a roundtrip ticket to Europe to interview perfumers and scent historians in France and Germany, and to visit the Osmothèque perfume museum at Versailles. The Osmothèque is a repository of the rarest perfumes I could not smell otherwise. (The total for that trip will be around $4000 for flight, budget lodging, and other costs.)

WHAT YOU'LL GET FOR CONTRIBUTING:

In addition to knowing that you have aided a perfume lover in her desire to share her knowledge of rapidly disappearing icons of 20th century perfumery, you will receive the following fragrant gifts as thanks: vintage perfume-scented, hand-written thank you notes; sample vials of vintage perfume; high-res frameable copies of beautiful vintage perfume ads; totebags decorated with vintage ads; signed copies of my book; and your name in the book’s acknowledgements section.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t contribute financially, please:

• Share this campaign with your friends and family

• Share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Google+, LinkedIn, etc.

• And please don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

THANK YOU!
