story:
Why I’m raising funds for The Cupola Collusion:

How many of you have uttered Martin Luther King’s famous words: “I have a dream!”? Maybe it’s jumping out of a plane, maybe it’s winning Dancing With the Stars… or maybe it’s writing that great American novel. And not just a novel—a thriller! A thriller that takes a regular guy—like you and me—pits him against overwhelming odds, watches him succeed, and fail... and ultimately succeed. Or does he? That’s a thriller—it’s fiction that keeps you turning pages far into the night!

That’s why I wrote The Cupola Collusion!

How much do I love writing? So much that I’ve written four high-concept political thrillers—that’s over five years of my life writing full time—all to nurture my dream into reality. I’m a good novelist now—Robert Ludlum’s agent represented me, in fact—but only recently has technology and the marketplace allowed novices like me to self-publish a book that proves the same quality as the last John Grisham book you bought.

But let’s back up: maybe you’re wondering why I’m turning to you for help? Perhaps you’ve heard Richard Florida’s term “The Great Reset?” It’s what many of us are going through who no longer have the life we once had, nor the job—not even the career—we once knew, nor the resources we once depended upon.

And that’s why Indiegogo is so crucial to my own “Great Reset”—to pursue that lifelong dream of being a novelist. A published novelist. That’s why your help is so crucial… and so appreciated!

If you support publishing and writing endeavors here (or anywhere), you probably already know the anemic state of traditional publishing. Self-publishing is the new “bootstrap,” as newly-minted millionaire authors like E. L. James (author of erotic novel Fifty Shades of Grey, at left) will attest.

Remember, this is no first-timer you’re pledging to support, no Chevy Chase in Funny Farm, who can’t quite make it through his first novel, no matter how big his dream proves. I’ve written novels since 1994. Your help—at any level—will turn my hobby into a career: that’s the impact you can have on my life... and the world of publishing!

Supporter  Rewards to "WOW" you!:

Sure, supporting a friend is great, and why not get some awesome rewards, too? Pledges and awards start at only $10 (you can read the rewards at right), but I’ll focus on the last few with the biggest WOW factor. And remember, every higher-level pledge includes the awards from lower levels, like the ebook and/or a paperback copy.

A Character Named for You! It's true, mom named me after Gregory Peck, but what if it was the other way around? What if a character with your name became internationally famous, like John Rambo? For this pledge, I’ll make you famous forever (hey, once it’s in the Library of Congress, it’s in the pages of history!). Pledge a little more than this award level—yes, you can do that!—and you’ll get a bigger character named for you. After all, you’d rather be the President’s Chief of Staff than an admin assistant, right? Remember, to get this specific award, you have to request this award, but you can pledge any dollar amount higher than the minimum. And remember, when Margaret Atwood did the same thing on her $94,000 Fanado Indiegogo campaign, this award cost her fans $10,000. I'm a bargain in comparison, so catch me now before I'm as successful as Margaret!

Be My (Conference) Guest! I’m blessed to live in an artistic community that boasts one of the best international writers’ conferences in the world: the San Miguel Writers’ Conference (the aforementioned Margaret Atwood spoke here two years ago). Local author Susan Page spearheads this conference, with the help of a billion volunteers. It’s geared toward readers as much as writers, so pledge this award level even if you’re not a writer. If you can get here, your standard "No Frills" level conference fee—and a gloriously sunny al fresco lunch—is on me, where I’ll personally deliver that custom-inscribed book. And if my campaign is successful, I hope to have books for sale at this conference!

Your Jane Austen Book Club & Me! That’s right—for this generous award level, I’ll gladly make time to talk with your favorite group: a book club, your Save the Whales group, even the Rotary Pancake Breakfast (hey, I love flapjacks!). Roundtrip airfare is on you, the rest is up to me (Tom Bodett, leave the light on for me at the local Motel 6!). I’ll address any topic you like, so if your club is reading Fifty Shades of Grey, I’ll just pretend to be E.L. James!

But here’s the biggest return: how many of you can say you’ve started an industry (besides you, Jeff Bezos—I know you’ll pledge some Amazon profits, right?)? With this campaign, you’ll have sponsored my Great Reset and set into motion a new career, just in the nick of time! Imagine: if William Faulkner had enjoyed an Indiegogo campaign, he wouldn’t have remained a postmaster so long.

Cost-Free Ways You Can Help:

Sure a pledge is ideal, but your active endorsement is priceless! If you’re on Facebook, click the little “Like” button above on this page, just beneath my video. Better yet, look me up here on Facebook (I’m listed as Greg Gunter, the one in San Miguel de Allende), find one of my postings on my Indiegogo campaign, and click “share” to spread the word to your friends. Believe me, I need more friends!

Another option? Like my YouTube video! If you liked the short version above, see my 7-minute video here for more chuckles and grins. You'll see how passionate I really am about this project!

If you browse in Mozilla Firefox and have the ShareThis add-on in the URL line (it’s that little orange "plus" symbol), it'll let you post this Indiegogo page to numerous social media sites. Remember, I’ve got to go viral (no, mom, it’s not contagious) to be successful—spread the word, feel the love!

The Nitty Gritty: What We Need

Let’s be clear: unlike some campaigns, I’m not asking you to fund my time to write a novel—hey, I’ve got skin in this game! My novel’s already written. In fact, The Cupola Collusion represents five years of effort to become a professional—and damn good!—novelist. That’s my donation to this campaign (well, that and a few thousand dollars already spent that you’ll see below).

Now what I need to do next is to turn this 400-page manuscript pile into a real book—one you can hold in your hands, just like that last John Grisham you took to the beach—or in your Kindle (or Nook). That small step, however, involves several people with more expertise in their respective fields than me.

Here’s the breakdown, in ascending order of when the funds you pledge get spent by me:

  • A professional thriller editor has quoted me $3,000 for a full manuscript edit and a line edit. Ouch! I have already paid, however, for a developmental edit—you’re off the hook on that one!—which is why my novel is already well polished.
  • Margot Boland, my professional book jacket designer: $625 for the jacket art design. Yep, that’s two sides and a spine!
  • Bowker fees: my ISBN, my barcode & QR code, and Inside Widget (visit my Amazon page later and see what this is) will all cost $420.
  • Stock photos for marketing—the video you watched above has several—at prices averaging ten bucks apiece. That'll run at least $200.
  • Formatting the manuscript to ePub file format and P.O.D. (print-on-demand) formats, all of which will be done by the online firm 52Novels for their contracted quote of $850.
  • The occasional graphic artist work—again, mostly for marketing—which could easily run to $500.
  • The not-to-be-missed ThrillerFest Writers’ Conference in Manhattan this July (my second time—I paid for last year’s conference out of my IRA). This is where I pitch my book to a multitude of established thriller authors, agents and industry insiders. Registration is $1,061; flights run around $800; my friend’s sofa is free, but meals are… well, you get the picture. This is another $2,500 line item if I want to make it there (in New York), ‘cuz then I’ll make it anywhere, as The Chairman sang.
  • How’s your math? You may have noticed that I’m up to $8,595 in expenses, and haven’t even reached the most expensive part yet!
  • Now here’s the most expensive part: building a platform. That involves seeking blurbs for my book (printing the book, shipping it, and needing to beg, borrow, & steal to get access to folks like John Grisham); creating an above-average web site (for my last business, it cost me $4,000 to create a professional one); building really professional social media pages (remember those stock photos and graphic artists?); and ideally a good P.R. firm who knows how to get the coveted book reviews, the right exposure, the elbow-rubbing contacts. Now, this line item of my journey to The New York Times best-seller list could easily drain my entire campaign donations, so if you got a holiday bonus, please be generous (and really, wouldn’t your politically outspoken friend—the Rush Limbaugh fanatic—prefer the paperback over the ebook?). Let’s say that $4,300 will just get me started on this journey of building my platform after the novel is published.

Baby, You’re The Best!

Hey, Carly Simon may have stolen my line, but it’s dedicated to you! I can’t thank you enough!

story:
Short Summary

On the fifth anniversary of our bookstore we decided to host an Authors Fair. It was such a success that we held it again for the 6th anniversary. It was easily twice the size of the first one and was extended to two days with panels being done the night before by some of the authors. This was well received and we plan on keeping that going each year.

The Author's Fair is now an annual tradition held each year during the anniversary of our store. This is where we need your help. Our anniversary happens to be in March and we are located in southern Indiana. Both of the past two years we have been inbetween snow or rain storms.

During this year's event we had 36 authors attend. we would like to increase this to 50 for this coming up year. We also had an animal adoption fair and had lots of dogs adopted out to good homes. We are hoping they will be back next year with more dogs and we are alooking for some other charities that would like to come and setup also.

What We Need & What You Get

To help enlarge the authors fair for this next year we need to make sure we have tents that everyone can sit under and tables to support them all. This will allow us to have more authors for you to mee. Not to mention with the Authors FAir taking place during March in southern Indiana we are always worried about rain or worse SNOW! This will make it so no matter what the weather we will have a nice event.

The majority of the funding we need is to go for Tents to cover the parking lot in front of our building and the one beside us. We have at least an 80 X 80 area we can cover with tents. The more we are able to buy the more authors we will be able to host.

After the tents we need more tables to use. Several of the authors this past year brought there own tables. This worked but we would like to be able to provide the tables for them. That way they can bring more of their books for you to enjoy.

Depending on what your contributions are we have a number of perks for you including signed books from the authors and special signed posters with signatures from all the attending authors and musicians.
 
For any signed books you get as a perk they include free shipping to anywhere in the US if you are not able to join us for the event.

The Impact

By helping us you are also helping the authors. It is getting harder and harder for authors to find outlets for their works. Bookstores are closing left and right and publishers are cutting back on their marketing budgets.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

We are always in need of new authors to attend. If you know some authors please send them our way.
 
We also are in need of volunteers to help
  • Help spread the word
  • Come in and help set up for the Authors Fair or the outside sale

We are always in need of new authors to attend. If you know some authors please send them our way.
 
We also are in need of volunteers to help


Help spread the word
Come in and help set up for the Authors Fair or the outside sale

story:
This past March, almost 100 Ann Arbor youth took to the stage sharing their voices and original poems to battle for one of the coveted six slots to represent Ann Arbor at the 2012 Slam Competition in San Francisco. 

This year's local slams featured some amazing performances. Here are the winners:

• Robyn Green

• Adam Hagopian-Zirkel

• Rachel Kerby

• Aaron Noffke

• Kylie Power-Sullivan

• Sophie Ruf

Together with their coaches, Jeff Kass and Scott Beal, these 6 youth have been working hard to create and perfect new pieces to perform at Brave New Voices. They have also been working to raise the funds to get them there on July 17, 2012 - including hosting workshops, performing poetry, and washing cars. They are more than halfway to their goal but need this push to go all the way.

Please support this awesome, dedicated group of poets. Thank you for your help in making this experience happen.

story:
>> UPDATE III <<

Knjigu će u prodaji biti krajem lipnja. Do tada ju možete nabaviti po pretprodajnoj cijeni na knjiga.act-grupa.hr!

>> UPDATE II <<

Kampanja je službeno završila 7. prosinca 2017. s prikupljenih ukupno 9.738 USD. Sada se nalazi u tzv. In Demand statusu, što znači da još uvijek imate priliku nabaviti knjigu po pretprodajnoj cijeni.
Još jednom se zahvaljujemo svim podržavateljima/icama i svima koji su na bilo koji način pomogli u promociji kampanje. Čitamo se u travnju/svibnju 2018.! 

>> UPDATE I <<

PUNK PODUZETNICI U VAŠOJ BIBLIOTECI!

ACT Grupa je oduvijek eksperimentirala i testirala - različite modele upravljanja, poslovne ideje, poduzetničke inicijative, ustrojstvene oblike…  Pa kada smo pokretali ovu našu prvu crowdfunding kampanju zamislili smo ju kao svojevrsni eksperiment, željeli smo testirati utjecaj u zajednici, vidjeti gdje smo i imamo li zaista taj neki community koji je spreman podržati izdavanje jedne takve knjige - netipične knjige o povijesti netipične organizacije.

Bili smo svjesni da 9.000,00 USD nije mali iznos, no vjerovali smo u uspjeh, u tu zajednicu, solidarnost. U tebe. Da priča o našem iskustvu može biti inspirativna i korisna drugima. No nismo ni sanjali da ćemo do cilja doći tako brzo. 

U prvom danu uspjeli smo doć do 30% ciljanog iznosa, na polovici kampanje bili smo na 80%, a tjedan dana prije kraja kampanje stigli smo do našeg cilja - iznosa potrebnog za lekturu, korekturu, dizajn, tisak i distribuciju knjige "Punk poduzetnici". Uz vašu veliku pomoć knjiga će izaći prema planu, u travnju 2018. godina. 

Ohrabreni time odlučili smo proširiti naše ciljeve i pokušati prikupiti sredstva kako bismo napravili korak dalje.

Ukoliko do 7. prosinca zajednički dođemo do 10.500,00 USD idemo na turneju! 

 

Planiramo posjetiti nekoliko gradova u Hrvatskoj, organizirati predstavljanje knjige i seriju razgovora s autorom knjige i punk poduzetnicima. Susreti se s vama, razgovarati o potencijalima razvoja u vašoj zajednici, prilikama za aktiviranje i djelovanje. I kako vam naša iskustva u tome mogu pomoći. 

 
Na svakoj stanici ove turneje planiramo posjetiti javne knjižnice, razvojne udruge i poduzetničke centre kojima će besplatno donirati knjige “Punk poduzetnici” i druga izdanja ACT Grupe.

Pozivamo te da iskoristiš priliku, podržiš kampanju i pomogneš nam da stignemo do novog cilja. Da stignemo u tvoj grad. Tvoja zajednica će ti biti zahvalna!

Bio je ponedjeljak, 20. siječnja 2003. godine.

Predsjednik Mesić je održao prijem za novinare, na HRT-u je išao Hit Depo, Ćiro Blažević je pripremao svoj Varteks za proljetni dio 1. HNL, ljudi su hrlili u kina pogledati drugi dio trilogije Gospodar prstenova, a cijena benzina narasla je za 3,3% pa je za litru Eurosupera trebalo izdvojiti vrtoglavih 6,63 kn. U Čakovcu je grupa mladih alternativaca/ki osnovala udrugu besmislenog imena, Akciju za civilnu transparentnost - ACT. Ostalo je povijest. Jedna od najaktivnijih organizacija civilnog društva u sjeverozapadnoj Hrvatskoj kasnije mijenja ime u Autonomni centar - ACT, a u kolovozu 2016. godine pripaja se ACT Grupi. 

Kroz gotovo 15 godina djelovanja, ACT Grupa je (su)osnovala 12 organizacija civilnog društva i društvenih poduzeća, 7 regionalnih i nacionalnih (prvenstveno zagovaračkih) mreža te inicirala i pomagala u razvoju više stotina neprofitnih organizacija. Provedeno je više od 140 projekata s više od 450 partnerskih organizacija. Ukupan broj direktnih korisnika ACT Grupe prelazi 74.000.  
U 2013. godini ACT Grupa (kao prva hrvatska organizacija) je započela s mjerenjem društvenog utjecaja svog djelovanja, te od tada redovito objavljuje Izvještaje o društvenom utjecaju. Posljednji, za 2016. godinu, dostupan je ovdje.

No ova hrpa brojki, praznih od sadržaja, ne govori zapravo ništa. Ono što vrijedi više od puke faktografije i kvantitete su ljudi - više od stotinu radnika/ica, stotine volontera/ki, vanjskih suradnika/ica, stotine podržavatelja ACT Grupe iz lokalne i šire zajednice koji su proteklih godina ostavili neizbrisiv trag u procesima razvoja društvenoga kapitala, civilnoga društva i društvene ekonomije u Hrvatskoj i regiji. Jedan od ključnih dionika našeg uspjeha i utjecaja si i ti!



Stoga te ovim putem pozivamo da podržiš naš projekt izdavanja knjige o ACT Grupi i njezinih 15 godina djelovanja. Knjiga neće biti samo dokument vremena i spomenar jedne od 55.000 udruga u Hrvatskoj, već i svojevrsni priručnik za razvoj organizacija civilnoga društva, razvoj društvenopoduzetničkih pothvata, priručnik za aktiviranje i djelovanje u lokalnoj zajednici, uspješne zagovaračke modele i drugo.

Pomozi izdavanje knjige!

Predstoji nam još dosta posla - autor Robert Posavec marljivo je proteklih mjeseci radio na istraživanju (nesređenog) arhivskog gradiva i dokumentacije, razgovarao s brojim akterima (sadašnjim i bivšim zaposlenicima/ama, volonterima/kama, partnerima i suradnicima, korisnicima/ama, donatorima i donosiocima odluka...) i još nekoliko mjeseci mu je potrebno da sve sintetizira u štivo koje će se čitati i proučavati sa zanimanjem. Nakon toga slijedi prijelom, dizajn i tisak, distribucija... Knjigu planiramo završiti i objaviti do travnja 2018. godine. 

Cijeli projekt košta oko 110.000 kuna (knjiga će biti tiskana na recikliranom papiru, imati tvrdi uvez, naslovnicu u boji, više od 200 stranica teksta...). Iz vlastitih izvora osigurali smo gotovo polovicu iznosa, a da bismo zatvorili financijsku konstrukciju potrebno nam je još oko 60.000 kuna, za dizajn i tisak. I tu nam je potrebna tvoja pomoć!

U znak zahvalnosti pripremili smo ti različite nagrade, odaberi ih u stupcu desno. Osim same knjige "Punk poduzetnici" tu su i različiti proizvodi naših članica ACT Printlab i Socijalne zadruge Humana nova, od plakata s grafikom naslovnice autora Bojana Miljančića, zbirke naših raniji izdanja, preko druženja s autorom Robertom Posavcem uz lokalno craft pivo iz Lepi Dečki Brewery,  nama i našim članicama, studijskih posjeta pa sve do edukacija i savjetovanja sukladno potrebama tvoje organizacije. 


Što ako ne uspijemo prikupiti sav novac?

Mi smo punk poduzetnici/e. Snalazili smo i kada su neki pokušavali sutavno uništiti hrvatsko civilno društvo, preživjet ćemo i ovo. Knjigu ćemo svakako objaviti, samo ćemo morati malo dublje zagrabiti u interne fondove. No vjerujemo u uspjeh, zajednicu, solidarnost. Da priča o našem iskustvu može biti inspirativna i korisna drugima. Da se dobro dobrim vraća. Vjerujemo u tebe. 
A interne fondove ćemo koristiti za druge razvojne programe i nove (poduzetničke) inicijative. 

Po čemu je knjiga posebna?

"Ovo nije knjiga koja govori o fantastičnim ljudima koji su bez greške došli do fenomenalnog uspjeha. Ne, ovo knjiga koja govori o tome da se kroz tisuću i jednu grešku, na mjesečnoj razini, došlo do toga što je danas prepoznato kao dobro i kao model koji vrijedi replicirati", kaže Robert. 

Knjiga na više od 200 stranica u 16 poglavlja obrađuje sljedeće teme i otvorena pitanja:

Na koji su način punk pokret i uradi sam kultura stvorili vrijednosti koje su i danas temelj ACT Grupe. Kolektivizam. Konsenzus. Zašto se javila potreba za strukturiranjem aktivizma te je li ta promjena dobra ili loša u kontekstu društvenog utjecaja. Konkretni primjeri uz analizu akcija i projekata.

Infoshop Tabula Rasa. Današnja je knjižnica Tabula Rasa započela s radom kao rupa od 12 kvadrata s frižiderom i naslonjačem u kojoj su spavali aktivisti iz cijelog svijeta. Pokrenuti su prvi rezidencijalni programi nezavisne kulture u sjeverozapadnoj Hrvatskoj. Prva umrežavanja infoshopa, razmjene knjiga, digitalizacija dijela nezavisne scene. Početak financiranja donacijama i prvi financirani projekti. Specijalizacija prema financiranju projekata i zašto je knjižnica stala s razvojem kad su krenuli projekti. Čije potrebe ona danas zadovoljava, ako zadovoljava.

Klub mladih. Poslovni model temeljen na solidarnoj ekonomiji i sivoj ekonomiji. Fluidna organizacijska struktura. Je li klub zaista bio odgovor na potrebe zajednice ili tek na vlastite potrebe. Prvi festivali nezavisne kulture. Prve razmjene programa na razini Hrvatske. Prvi besplatni neformalni specijalistički programi obrazovanja. Koncept razmjene vještina. Organizacijsko i programsko usmjeravanje prema act.klubu i act.inku.

Slobodni festival. Hacklab 2.0. Inovacija, transdiciplinarnost, zajednica. Slobodna kultura. Utjecaj. ACT. Pripitomljavanje i sređivanje vlastitih života. Donacije, fondacije, projekti. Plaće! Vizije i njihova realizacija. Utjecaj na zajednicu i pojedince.

Program JAKO. Civilno društvo sjeverne Hrvatske. Prije pokretanja Programa JAKO i danas. Kakav je utjecaj Program imao, kako ga mjeriti?

ACT Printlab. Model samozapošljavanja kao odgovor na potrebe civilnog društva. Razvoj poduzeća. Širenje. Nova zapošljavanja. Podrška organizacijama civilnog društva. Raspodjela dobiti. Utjecaj na razvoj društvenog poduzetništva. Druga tržišta i prilike za razvoj do kojeg ne dolazi. Uloge direktora zaposlenika.

ACT Konto. Zaposlenice su vlasnice. Zašto taj model nije funkcionirao. Kako se uspješno održava status quo i kako politika jednakih plaća poništava rizike i napredak.

Humana Nova. Socijalno zadrugarstvo. Radna integracija. Vlastiti prihodi. Poticaji i olakšice. Promocija proizvoda. Lajkovi na društvenim mrežama ne donose prihode. Radnici – vlasnici/ zadrugari. Udruge – vlasnici/zadruge. Zašto takav model ne funkcionira i nije poticajan. Kako je dolazilo do skaliranja i replikacije modela koji nije model te zašto javnost to vidi kao model. Država kao jamac statusa quo.

Volonterski centar Međimurja. Kako je Ana došla volontirati u ACT, zaposlila se, pokrenula volonterski ured te koja je uloga volonterskog centra. Organizacijsko strukturiranje. Usmjerenost prema van i unutra. Upravljanje.

CEDRA Čakovec. Društveno poduzetništvo i zadrugarstvo u praksi. Načela i vrijednosti. Studija slučaja. Što zadrugu čini zadrugom.

ACT Press. Upravljanje, odgovornosti, kontrola. Prodaja. Distribucija. Solidarnost. Kako se ne posluje. Studija slučaja.

Domači vrt. Što poduzećima donose strateška i poslovna planiranja i zašto ponekad ne donesu ništa. Zapošljavanje marginaliziranih skupina u poljoprivredi. Zajednica i lokalne vlasti prema nacionalnim manjinama. Lokalno tržište. Planirani modeli nisu realizirani modeli.

Centar za pomoć u kući Međimurske županije. Civilno-javno partnerstvo i pružanje socijalnih usluga van formalnog sustava.

ACT Grupa. Zagovaranje, promocija, javne politike, specifični/jedinstveni konzorcijski oblik, zajednički financijski modeli (cash pooling, fondovi).

Novi pothvati. Deseci. Stotine novih inovativnih ideja. Bez ljudi. Bez resursa.

Svako je poglavlje zasebna priča sa svojim početkom i krajem. Svako se naredno poglavlje nastavlja na prethodno. Esejističko-publicistički stil s konkretnim primjerima u svakom poglavlju. Poseban je naglasak cijele knjige na organizacijskim modelima, modelima financiranja, modelima upravljanja i vođenja, radu s ljudima. Svako poglavlje govori o jednoj važnoj točki u razvoju ACT Grupe kao vodećeg primjera društvenog poduzetništva. Primjeri će knjizi dati karakter priručnika iz kojeg se može mnogo naučiti o razvoju organizacija civilnog društva i društvenih poduzeća. 

Zaviri u svijet punk poduzetnika ovdje i ovdje!

Kako još možeš pomoći?

Vjerujemo da posljednjih 15 godina ACT Grupe nije trajno obilježilo samo naše živote, već da je na jedinstven način dotaknulo i tvoj. Nadamo se da ćeš prepoznati vrijednost ove inicijative i pomoći nam da uspješno dođemo do cilja. Nisi u mogućnosti financijski podržati izdavanje knjige? Nema problema, razumijemo te. Postoji čitav niz drugih načina kako nam možeš pomoći!

Za početak, podijeli informaciju o ovoj kampanji i planiranom terminu objave knjige među svojim prijateljima/icama, kolegama/icama, suradnicima/ama, članovima/icama obitelji, susjedima/ama. Korisnicima/ama programa tvoje organizacije. Drugim udrugama ili društvenim poduzećima. Tetama u knjižnici. 
I ne zaboravi nas pratiti na Facebooku i Twitteru uz hashtagove #PunkPoduzetnici i #15GodinaTiJeTek. 

Hvala! 

Teo, Stjepan, Igor, Darko, Margareta, Dora, Eni, Anita, Vlatka, Ivan, Momir, Sandra, Ljiljana, Mirjana, Gordana, Renato, Davor, Andrea, Mihaela, Lana, Filipa, Marijana, Sanja, Valentina, Natalija, Josip, Ljubica, Ivan, Gordana, Paula, Sanja, Ivanka, Biserka, Nada, Bojana, Jasmin, Gordana, Vesna, Snježana, Damjanka, Ivanka, Sandra, Anita, Tea, Mirjana



P.S. Kada već imamo tvoju pažnju koristimo priliku da te pozovemo da se prijaviš za sudjelovanje na globalnoj humanitarnoj utrci Wings for Life koja će se 8. svibnja 2018. istovremeno održati na nekoliko desetaka lokacija širom svijeta. Sav prikupljeni iznos ide za istraživanje ozljeda leđne moždine. ACT Grupa će već tradicionalno biti u Zadru i trčati za one koji ne mogu. Možeš se pridružiti našem timu! A nakon toga nam se pridružiš na rođendanskoj zabavi u Čakovcu.

Pomozi izdavanje knjige!Predstoji nam još dosta posla - autor Robert Posavec marljivo je proteklih mjeseci radio na istraživanju (nesređenog) arhivskog gradiva i dokumentacije, razgovarao s brojim akterima (sadašnjim i bivšim zaposlenicima/ama, volonterima/kama, partnerima i suradnicima, korisnicima/ama, donatorima i donosiocima odluka...) i još nekoliko mjeseci mu je potrebno da sve sintetizira u štivo koje će se čitati i proučavati sa zanimanjem. Nakon toga slijedi prijelom, dizajn i tisak, distribucija... Knjigu planiramo završiti i objaviti do travnja 2018. godine. Cijeli projekt košta oko 110.000 kuna (knjiga će biti tiskana na recikliranom papiru, imati tvrdi uvez, naslovnicu u boji, više od 200 stranica teksta...). Iz vlastitih izvora osigurali smo gotovo polovicu iznosa, a da bismo zatvorili financijsku konstrukciju potrebno nam je još oko 60.000 kuna, za dizajn i tisak. I tu nam je potrebna tvoja pomoć!U znak zahvalnosti pripremili smo ti različite nagrade, odaberi ih u stupcu desno. Osim same knjige "Punk poduzetnici" tu su i različiti proizvodi naših članica ACT Printlab i Socijalne zadruge Humana nova, od plakata s grafikom naslovnice autora Bojana Miljančića, zbirke naših raniji izdanja, preko druženja s autorom Robertom Posavcem uz lokalno craft pivo iz Lepi Dečki Brewery,  nama i našim članicama, studijskih posjeta pa sve do edukacija i savjetovanja sukladno potrebama tvoje organizacije. Što ako ne uspijemo prikupiti sav novac?
Mi smo punk poduzetnici/e. Snalazili smo i kada su neki pokušavali sutavno uništiti hrvatsko civilno društvo, preživjet ćemo i ovo. Knjigu ćemo svakako objaviti, samo ćemo morati malo dublje zagrabiti u interne fondove. No vjerujemo u uspjeh, zajednicu, solidarnost. Da priča o našem iskustvu može biti inspirativna i korisna drugima. Da se dobro dobrim vraća. Vjerujemo u tebe. A interne fondove ćemo koristiti za druge razvojne programe i nove (poduzetničke) inicijative. 


Po čemu je knjiga posebna?
"Ovo nije knjiga koja govori o fantastičnim ljudima koji su bez greške došli do fenomenalnog uspjeha. Ne, ovo knjiga koja govori o tome da se kroz tisuću i jednu grešku, na mjesečnoj razini, došlo do toga što je danas prepoznato kao dobro i kao model koji vrijedi replicirati", kaže Robert. Knjiga na više od 200 stranica u 16 poglavlja obrađuje sljedeće teme i otvorena pitanja:
Na koji su način punk pokret i uradi sam kultura stvorili vrijednosti koje su i danas temelj ACT Grupe. Kolektivizam. Konsenzus. Zašto se javila potreba za strukturiranjem aktivizma te je li ta promjena dobra ili loša u kontekstu društvenog utjecaja. Konkretni primjeri uz analizu akcija i projekata.

Infoshop Tabula Rasa. Današnja je knjižnica Tabula Rasa započela s radom kao rupa od 12 kvadrata s frižiderom i naslonjačem u kojoj su spavali aktivisti iz cijelog svijeta. Pokrenuti su prvi rezidencijalni programi nezavisne kulture u sjeverozapadnoj Hrvatskoj. Prva umrežavanja infoshopa, razmjene knjiga, digitalizacija dijela nezavisne scene. Početak financiranja donacijama i prvi financirani projekti. Specijalizacija prema financiranju projekata i zašto je knjižnica stala s razvojem kad su krenuli projekti. Čije potrebe ona danas zadovoljava, ako zadovoljava.
Klub mladih. Poslovni model temeljen na solidarnoj ekonomiji i sivoj ekonomiji. Fluidna organizacijska struktura. Je li klub zaista bio odgovor na potrebe zajednice ili tek na vlastite potrebe. Prvi festivali nezavisne kulture. Prve razmjene programa na razini Hrvatske. Prvi besplatni neformalni specijalistički programi obrazovanja. Koncept razmjene vještina. Organizacijsko i programsko usmjeravanje prema act.klubu i act.inku.
Slobodni festival. Hacklab 2.0. Inovacija, transdiciplinarnost, zajednica. Slobodna kultura. Utjecaj. ACT. Pripitomljavanje i sređivanje vlastitih života. Donacije, fondacije, projekti. Plaće! Vizije i njihova realizacija. Utjecaj na zajednicu i pojedince.
Program JAKO. Civilno društvo sjeverne Hrvatske. Prije pokretanja Programa JAKO i danas. Kakav je utjecaj Program imao, kako ga mjeriti?
ACT Printlab. Model samozapošljavanja kao odgovor na potrebe civilnog društva. Razvoj poduzeća. Širenje. Nova zapošljavanja. Podrška organizacijama civilnog društva. Raspodjela dobiti. Utjecaj na razvoj društvenog poduzetništva. Druga tržišta i prilike za razvoj do kojeg ne dolazi. Uloge direktora zaposlenika.
ACT Konto. Zaposlenice su vlasnice. Zašto taj model nije funkcionirao. Kako se uspješno održava status quo i kako politika jednakih plaća poništava rizike i napredak.
Humana Nova. Socijalno zadrugarstvo. Radna integracija. Vlastiti prihodi. Poticaji i olakšice. Promocija proizvoda. Lajkovi na društvenim mrežama ne donose prihode. Radnici – vlasnici/ zadrugari. Udruge – vlasnici/zadruge. Zašto takav model ne funkcionira i nije poticajan. Kako je dolazilo do skaliranja i replikacije modela koji nije model te zašto javnost to vidi kao model. Država kao jamac statusa quo.
Volonterski centar Međimurja. Kako je Ana došla volontirati u ACT, zaposlila se, pokrenula volonterski ured te koja je uloga volonterskog centra. Organizacijsko strukturiranje. Usmjerenost prema van i unutra. Upravljanje.
CEDRA Čakovec. Društveno poduzetništvo i zadrugarstvo u praksi. Načela i vrijednosti. Studija slučaja. Što zadrugu čini zadrugom.
ACT Press. Upravljanje, odgovornosti, kontrola. Prodaja. Distribucija. Solidarnost. Kako se ne posluje. Studija slučaja.
Domači vrt. Što poduzećima donose strateška i poslovna planiranja i zašto ponekad ne donesu ništa. Zapošljavanje marginaliziranih skupina u poljoprivredi. Zajednica i lokalne vlasti prema nacionalnim manjinama. Lokalno tržište. Planirani modeli nisu realizirani modeli.
Centar za pomoć u kući Međimurske županije. Civilno-javno partnerstvo i pružanje socijalnih usluga van formalnog sustava.
ACT Grupa. Zagovaranje, promocija, javne politike, specifični/jedinstveni konzorcijski oblik, zajednički financijski modeli (cash pooling, fondovi).
Novi pothvati. Deseci. Stotine novih inovativnih ideja. Bez ljudi. Bez resursa.
Svako je poglavlje zasebna priča sa svojim početkom i krajem. Svako se naredno poglavlje nastavlja na prethodno. Esejističko-publicistički stil s konkretnim primjerima u svakom poglavlju. Poseban je naglasak cijele knjige na organizacijskim modelima, modelima financiranja, modelima upravljanja i vođenja, radu s ljudima. Svako poglavlje govori o jednoj važnoj točki u razvoju ACT Grupe kao vodećeg primjera društvenog poduzetništva. Primjeri će knjizi dati karakter priručnika iz kojeg se može mnogo naučiti o razvoju organizacija civilnog društva i društvenih poduzeća. 
Zaviri u svijet punk poduzetnika ovdje i ovdje!



Kako još možeš pomoći?
Vjerujemo da posljednjih 15 godina ACT Grupe nije trajno obilježilo samo naše živote, već da je na jedinstven način dotaknulo i tvoj. Nadamo se da ćeš prepoznati vrijednost ove inicijative i pomoći nam da uspješno dođemo do cilja. Nisi u mogućnosti financijski podržati izdavanje knjige? Nema problema, razumijemo te. Postoji čitav niz drugih načina kako nam možeš pomoći!
Za početak, podijeli informaciju o ovoj kampanji i planiranom terminu objave knjige među svojim prijateljima/icama, kolegama/icama, suradnicima/ama, članovima/icama obitelji, susjedima/ama. Korisnicima/ama programa tvoje organizacije. Drugim udrugama ili društvenim poduzećima. Tetama u knjižnici. I ne zaboravi nas pratiti na Facebooku i Twitteru uz hashtagove #PunkPoduzetnici i #15GodinaTiJeTek. Hvala! 
Teo, Stjepan, Igor, Darko, Margareta, Dora, Eni, Anita, Vlatka, Ivan, Momir, Sandra, Ljiljana, Mirjana, Gordana, Renato, Davor, Andrea, Mihaela, Lana, Filipa, Marijana, Sanja, Valentina, Natalija, Josip, Ljubica, Ivan, Gordana, Paula, Sanja, Ivanka, Biserka, Nada, Bojana, Jasmin, Gordana, Vesna, Snježana, Damjanka, Ivanka, Sandra, Anita, Tea, Mirjana
P.S. Kada već imamo tvoju pažnju koristimo priliku da te pozovemo da se prijaviš za sudjelovanje na globalnoj humanitarnoj utrci Wings for Life koja će se 8. svibnja 2018. istovremeno održati na nekoliko desetaka lokacija širom svijeta. Sav prikupljeni iznos ide za istraživanje ozljeda leđne moždine. ACT Grupa će već tradicionalno biti u Zadru i trčati za one koji ne mogu. Možeš se pridružiti našem timu! A nakon toga nam se pridružiš na rođendanskoj zabavi u Čakovcu.

story:
Howdy! 

I'm Nichole, from Nashville, Tennessee. I like Prince, Wonder Woman, Niles Crane, and way too much television. 

I've known I wanted to be a writer since I was 7 years old, but pursuing art as a career seemed like a luxury I couldn't afford. So instead, I built a career in education. Yet, no matter what I did, I always came back to writing. 

I'd love to go to Paris for a month and work on a novel. Will you help me get there?

As a teenager, I learned about many Black American artists who moved to Paris, France. I found myself drawn to the work they created there. I wanted to follow the footsteps of greats like Langston Hughes, James Baldwin, and Jessie Fauset. Even now, modern day notables like Ta-Nehisi Coates end up living in Paris for stretches at a time. The City of Light has a long history of attracting Black Americans, and I am not immune to the pull.

Because I've always tried to work a "good day-job" first with writing on the side, I've never been able to give my dream career all of me. That recently changed when I decided to become a freelance writer full-time. It's challenging, but I've never felt quite so happy about my job as I do now. I feel like I've taken significant steps to accomplish a goal, but I hope you can help me arrive at another milestone.


What I Need & What You Get

  • Airfare from Atlanta, GA to Paris, France: $1100. Although I live in Nashville, TN, it's almost $700 cheaper to fly out of Atlanta, which is only a 4-hour drive from my hometown. 
  • Accommodations: $1400 USD. I will stay a month using either AirBnB or sabbaticalhomes.com to find long-term housing. 
  • Remaining funds: groceries, transportation, incidentals.
  • If I don't meet my goal, my priority will be airfare and accommodations. 
  • I will create a small travelblog to post pictures and write about any adventures, although my main purpose there is to write a novel. I will share as much as I can about my experience so you can see how far your contribution has gone. I can't guarantee I'll be able to share excerpts from the novel, but I will provide as many updates as I can.

But Why?

The novel I'm working on is something that I've had nestled in the back of my mind since high school.  It is my hope that this novel will be instrumental in earning a literary agent and book deal. Living in Paris will help me continue research for a key section of the novel, as well as provide lasting inspiration and motivation.

This is not a long vacation. I will be working.

At heart, I am a poet and fiction writer, but most of my public writing has been about pop culture, with personal essays sprinkled in. Feel free to check out some of what I do:

Los Angeles Times: A Response to 'On Pandering'
LAT Book Review: The Book of Memory
Fusion: On Black Pride and the Skin We're In 
My work at BuzzFeed
My work at The Toast
Vulture: Recaps of the TV Show Black-ish
Recaps of the TV Show The Real O'Neals
Rolling Stone: Meet the Republican Who Launched the 'Ready for Kanye' PAC
My work at ThinkProgress
Roger Ebert: Black Film and TV Directors in 2013: A Progress Report
Which Kinds of Interracial Couples Spark Outrage?
To the Life of Maya Angelou

April is National Poetry Month, and I always try to write a poem a day at my blog: https://tnwhiskeywoman.com/

I've also attended the Napa Valley Writers' Conference in Helena, CA twice and have won awards for my writing. I was the premiere recipient of the Pearl Cleage Creative Writing Award at Dillard University and won the Helen Earnhart Harley Creative Writing Award at the Ohio State University. And I've taught creative writing classes to high school students. Writing is a part of my life I never want to be without. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, please feel free to share my campaign.

Do you have any friends in Paris you can introduce to me? Have you ever been to Paris? Where should I go? Where should I eat? Recommendations are a great way to help me so I won't feel so overwhelmed by the choices the city will present. 

Thank you so much for your help. 


And Now, A Brief Excerpt of the Novel


Thursday, 10:56 PM



There were no glowing lights from a cell phone, laptop, or television. Chloe had not looked at a screen for almost an hour and had even turned her alarm clock to the wall so the numbers’ red intensity wouldn’t keep her awake. Afraid the blackout curtains may have been too much, that she had turned her bedroom into a sensory deprivation chamber, Chloe cracked the windows, letting in a bit of night air and music.


She was trying to follow Tanya’s advice and visualize the next day. The technique was supposed to help her regain control of her life and focus on more positive outcomes. Chloe tried to create an image of her brothers letting her have more say in the family business but her mind kept turning to Isaac and the kiss they’d shared earlier. She couldn’t stop thinking about how sweet and intense it was, the way his lips had still been in the shape of hers when she pulled back. Her cheeks warmed and stretched. The silly grin on her face didn’t care that no one could see it.


Maybe if Chloe had not been in complete darkness, reliving her kiss with Isaac, she would’ve seen the fog slipping into her bedroom from one of the windows. The mist was strange, a deep green that was almost black, and it moved with silky purpose toward Chloe, a nightgown across hips. It had no scent but as it reached Chloe in bed, her eyes blinked more slowly. The mist hovered over her, shaping itself like Chloe, wisps of dark green wafting away then reforming, but it had trouble with her face. Chloe’s eyes were closed now, her breathing that of sleep. She couldn’t see the thing’s shifting its diaphanous features repeatedly, unable to change its nothingness into Chloe. Gossamer fingers reached out to Chloe’s face and touched her cheek.


In her dream, Chloe stood in the middle of a street downtown. The streetlamps were dim, buzzing with dying power. She wore a dark green evening gown, a column dress that shimmered in the low light, but she was barefoot. She didn’t recognize anything around her so she began walking, following the yellow line that divides traffic. She wanted Isaac. The need flared in her without warning so she stopped to figure out what was happening. To her right, there was a bookstore. Tanya and Kacey were inside. She gathered her dress so she wouldn’t trip as she ran to them. Her best friends turned to her. Their eyes were too large for their faces, their brown irises now grey and overwhelming the whites.


“Have you seen Isaac,” Chloe began, stumbling back from them.


“No,” they said in unison. “What’s so special about him? Why are you looking for him?”


Chloe backed out of the store as her friends kept speaking as one, asking her over and over why she was looking for Isaac. She ran down the street until she found a police officer. When he turned to her, his eyes were like the others, unnaturally large with very little white to show.


“Please, help me. Something is wrong. I can’t find Isaac.” Chloe didn’t understand what was happening. The officer moved in close and grabbed her wrist.


“He is gone. I’ll take you home,” he said, the teeth in his smile too sharp to be human. He placed his free hand against her neck, pulling her face closer to his. Chloe quickly raised a knee to his groin and he fell, sneering in pain, dark green mist puffing from his mouth like winter cold.


Chloe pulled her dress higher and ran down the middle of the street, calling for Isaac. The dress began to dissipate, ribbons of material leaving stripes across her body before wrapping around her legs and arms, trapping her. She fell to the ground, bruising her cheek, her heartbeat knocking against her tongue. The gown became a cocoon, holding her in place, covering her mouth. Chloe felt a hand on her ankle and looked down. A fog inched over her until a face shifted before her wide, searching eyes. It was Isaac’s face but not.


“You look for me,” the misty face opened its mouth but didn’t shape the words. It was still learning. Its voice sounded like Isaac’s but blended with a second higher voice speaking on a one-second delay.


Chloe shook her head so hard, tears fell from her eyes. This was not the Isaac she knew.


“I am. I am he. You look for me,” the creature sounded angry, its mouth turned down sharply at the corners, an exaggeration of sadness.


“Find me,” the mist said. “You look for me.”


The dark green dress pooled around Chloe, melting, pulling her into the ground. The mist covered her face, repeating, “Find me.”


The bed sheet clung to Chloe’s gasping mouth as she jerked awake in bed. Her alarm clock still faced the wall but its morning alert chimed repeatedly. Chloe sat up and swiped at the sweat on her forehead. She turned the clock to her and dropped her face in her hands, missing the way the red display of light broke through the fog leaving the way it came.

PERKS GANZ UNTEN


What is the Land of Hope?

Was ist das Land der Hoffnung?



Some years ago, I performed as a soloist with the San Francisco Ballet, and during my time backstage I took on a huge creative project that lasted nine years - to turn a blank square meter piece of fabric into a beautiful landscape using the art of needlepainting, or embroidery. The finished piece, pictured below, shows a spectacular world where humans and nature lived in perfect harmony with one another. I called it Land of Hope, as it depicts what I believe the world could be like if we empower ourselves and our children to do good.

Während der Zeit, die ich als Solist des San Francisco Ballet hinter der Bühne bei Proben und Warten verbrachte, begann  ich ein Projekt, das letztlich neun Jahre dauerte: ich begann ein Einquadratmeter großes Stück Stoff lückenlos und mit Reliefs mit sehr dünnen Fäden zu besticken. Langsam entstand eine Märchenlandschaft, in der Menschen, Tiere und Fabelwesen in Harmonie miteinander und mit der Natur leben. So entstand das "Land der Hoffnung", von dem ich glaube, das es möglich ist, wenn wir und unsere Kindern sich dafür entscheiden.


After leaving the ballet, my wife and I opened our own dance studio in Berlin. Over the years, we have watched many of our students grow from small children into beautiful, flourishing women and men with strong values of friendship, courage, and helpfulness. Inspired by their positive influences in the world, we wish to create a multilingual children's story book intended to empower even more children to grow as our students did and make the world a better place. Our book, based on the Land of Hope tapestry, would use close-up images taken from the needlepainting artwork to tell a story of how to grow up to be a strong person by encouraging children to respect others, have courage, and be helpful, along with many other important lessons.

Nachdem ich das Ballett verliess, zog ich nach Berlin und schloss mich meiner Frau an, die dort ein Tanzstudio betrieb. Im Laufe der Jahre wurden wir Zeugen, wie aus kleinen Ballettschülern Erwachsene wurden, die als junge Männer und Frauen mit Werten wie Freundschaft, Mut und Hilfsbereitschaft lebten. Dies inspirierte mich zu der Idee eines Kinderbuches, das eine mehrsprachiges Geschichte erzählt. Und vielleicht andere Kinder beeinflusst ebenfalls andere zu respektieren, mutig und liebevoll zu sein, und die welt zu einem besseren Platz zu machen. Als Hintergrund benutze ich Nahaufnahmen des Needlepainting Werkes Land of Hope.

Land der Hoffnung, Landschaftsbild mit filigranen Details

The completed Land of Hope, a full landscape in astonishing detail.


The Story

Die Geschichte



The story focuses on Pepito, a man smaller than a blade of grass. He is envious of those around him who are big and strong, and his greatest wish is to be like them. He falls asleep one day and wakes up in the Land of Hope, where he meets many fascinating creatures. He asks each of them how he can become big and strong like them. 

One after another, each character gives suggestions to help him become a better person, such as having respect for others, giving a helping hand where needed, having courage in tough situations, and so on. In the end, Pepito realizes that having a big heart is more important than having a big body, and that even if he is small he can still make great changes in the world.

Die Geschichte erzählt von Pepito, einem Männlein klein wie ein Grashalm . Er ist neidisch auf alle um ihn herum, die groß und kräftig sind, er wünscht sich ebenso zu sein. Eines tages erwachte er im Land der Hoffnung und trifft dort viele faszinierende Wesen. Er fragt jeden, wie er denn groß und stark werden könne. Einer nach dem anderen gibt einen Rat und macht Vorschläge, um ihm zu helfen. Z.B. Respekt für andere zu haben, anderen in der Not zu helfen oder Mut in schwierigen Situationen zu beweisen und so weiter. Am Ende versteht Pepito, dass es wichtiger ist ein großes Herz als einen großen Körper zu haben, und dass auch ein kleines Männlein große Dinge in der Welt bewirken kann!


One of Horacio's sketches of Pepito. Various images like this one will be scattered throughout the pages for children to find - more information on the imagined layout can be found further down on this page.

Dies ist eine von Horacio´s Zeichnungen. Dies ist Pepito, der auf vielen Seiten auftaucht, wo ihn die Kinder suchen müssen. Mehr Information zum Lay-Out  weiter  unten auf deiser seite.

Why is this so important? 

Warum ist dieses Buch wichtig?



It is our belief that children cannot get enough positive influences in their growing years, so that they can become adults with good values to live by. When we raise a child to be good and compassionate, we bring more positive energy into the world. It's no secret that there are issues that exist around the globe that keep some people from living the best life they could have, and by teaching our next generations to be compassionate and helpful, we create a force for good that could, with time, bring peace to this world. The more we encourage children to have strong positive values, the closer we come to bringing the Land of Hope off the canvas and into reality.

Wir glauben fest daran, dass Kinder garnicht genug positive Einflüsse bei ihrer Erziehung erfahren können, um später als Erwachsene ein festes Fundament an positiven Glaubenssätzen zu haben. Jedes Kind, das zu Mitgefühl erzogen wird, wird selber immer einen positiven Beitrag in seinem Leben leisten. Die Welt ist vielerorts in Aufruhr, es gibt weltweit ernste Probleme. Da ist es wichtig, den Kindern liebevolle Energie und Erziehung zu geben, damit die Welt zu mehr Frieden und liebevollem Miteinander findet. Umso mehr Kinder starke positive Wertvorstellungen haben, umso eher kann aus dem Land of Hope Realität werden!


We are also aiming to make this book multilingual, for two main reasons: 1) We want Pepito's journey to be accessible to children all over the world, not just in English-speaking countries, and 2) exposing children to foreign languages at an early age helps them gain an interest in other cultures, which helps them develop the ideas of empathy and cooperation.  These go well with the other values presented in this book, and are especially helpful in our modern global world. Our base goal is for English and German, and we are working with a Japanese translator. Perhaps another language could be added if there is enough space and interest. We will keep you up-to-date on any developments.

Unser Ziel ist es, das Buch mehrsprachig heraus zu geben. Das hat mehrere Gründe, zum einem kann so Pepitos Geschichte in vielen Ländern gelesen und verstanden werden, zum anderen lernen Kinder von klein auf, dass es verschiedene Sprachen und Kulturen gibt, deren Unterschiedlichkeit wertfrei und selbstverständlich ist. Das ist in der globalen Welt von heute sicher von Vorteil. Im Moment gibt es die geschichte auf deutsch und englisch, eine japanische Übersetzung ist in Planung, auch andere Sprachen können hinzu gefügt werden, je nach Platz und Interesse. Wir halten Sie über die Entwicklung auf dem Laufenden,


What We Need

Was wir brauchen



Land of Hope has already been fully written, and we are already working with a German publishing company, S. Fischer Verlage, to get it out into the world. They have given us a price estimate of 7,000 Euro as an absolute minimum for production. It's a greater amount than we can afford to pay out-of-pocket, which is why we are turning to you for help! Every dollar or euro counts.

Das Land der Hoffnung ist bereits fertig geschrieben, und wir sind in Kontakt mit einem deutschen Verlagshaus (S. Fischer Verlage). Dort hat man uns einen Mindestpreis von 7 500 € für Druck und Vertrieb genannt. Leider fehlt uns das nötige geld, so wenden wir uns an Sie - jeder noch so kleine Betrag hilft.


However, our ultimate goal is €13,000 - that would cover editing, printing, production, grade-A advertisement, shipping and distribution to bookstores around the country, and would also upgrade the book into a larger, more child-friendly format. We've read the statistics on successful crowdfunding projects and know that a lower number is easier to reach, so we're hoping your generosity will go above and beyond our minimum goal to help us reach €13,000.

Das ultimative Ziel sind 13 000 €, was ausser Druck und allen damit verbundenen Kosten wie Versand und Vertrieb eine Top-Grade-A- Werbeaktion mit einschliesst. Das Buch könnte so auch ein etwas größeres, kinderfreundlicheres Format bekommen. Wir haben uns über erfolgreiche Crowdfunding-Projekte informiert und hoffen sehr, dass wir es schaffen, die optimale Summe zu erzielen. 


Even if you can't contribute monetarily to Land of Hope, you can still help us out by spreading the word to anyone who may be interested! Sharing, emailing, tweeting, and word-of-mouth are absolutely invaluable to getting this project off the ground.

Wenn Sie im Moment finanziell nicht helfen können, freuen wir uns, wenn Sie helfen, indem Sie andere auf das Projekt aufmerksam machen, die vielleicht helfen können. Soziale Netzwerke, Emails, Kaffeklasch, Mundpropaganda, all dies trägt dazu bei, das Projekt zu verwirklichen. 


This book is perfect for parents of young children, expecting parents, or even aunts, uncles, grandparents, and other relatives searching for a gift for the young ones in their lives.

Dieses Buch ist ein schönes Geschenk für Eltern kleiner Kinder, also Eltern, Tanten, Onkel, Omas und Opas, Familie und Freunde- hier ist ein Geschenk für Eure  kleinen Lieblinge!


What You Get by Helping

Was Sie bekommen, wenn Sie mithelfen



Of course, you benefit from helping us get published too! We couldn't ask for your money without giving a little something in return. Perks range from digital wallpapers and e-books to a signed hard copy and a personalized sketch from the author/artist. Check the column on the right for more details!

Natürlich sollen Sie für Ihre Hilfe auch etwas bekommen! Als Dankeschön bekommen Sie je nach Höhe der Spende z.B. digitale Wallpaper für Ihren PC, E-Bücher, signierte Exemplare, eine originale Zeichnung des Autors und mehr. Bitte schauen Sie in die Spalte hier rechts für mehr Information.


On the left, a Land of Hope folder. Ideally, the finished book will look something like this as well. On the right, Horacio's autobiography, Confessions of a Male Belly Dancer.These and many other perks are available to our supporters!

Links im Bild: Das Land der Hoffnung
Idealerweise wird das Kinderbuch so aussehen. Rechts sehen Sie Horacio´s Autobiographie "Confessions of a Male Belldancer". Dies sind Beispiele für die Perks für Unterstützer.

Predicted Timeline

Zeitplan



So, how long is this all going to take? 

So, wann wird was passieren?



In a perfect world, the timeline would look something like this:

Wenn alles klappt, sieht der Plan aus wie folgt:



October 31st, 2014: Crowdfunding begins!

Mid-December 2014: Crowdfunding ends, all funds calculated, collected, and sent to publishers. Digital perks sent to supporters - just in time for the holidays!

January 2015: Publishing company begins production process for Land of Hope

Summer 2015: Printing is completed, books sent to Horacio and later distributed to bookstores

Summer/Fall 2015: Physical rewards shipped out to supporters, arriving once again just in time for the holidays!

31. Oktober 2014: das Crowdfunding beginnt!
Mitte Dezenber 2014: das Crowdfunding endet, alle Spenden gehen an den Verlag, die digitalen Perks (Belohnungen)  gehen an die Spender, pünktlich zum Weihnachtsfest!
Januar 2015: der Verlag beginnt die Produktion.
Sommer 2015: der Druck ist fertig, die Bücher werden versendet und an Buchläden verschickt.
Sommer/Herbst 2015: alle nicht-digitalen Perks , d.h. alle Geschenke werden verschickt, pünktlich zum nächsten Fest!


Realistically, we know lots of things could happen to delay this process. If the crowdfuding isn't as successful as we hope, it may take some extra time to scrape up the last bit of money needed to pay the publishers. Printing may take longer than expected at the publishers, and mailing speeds can sometimes be unpredictable, especially internationally and around holidays. We can't know ahead of time what might happen, but we promise to keep you informed of all updates, good and bad, as soon as we find out about them. 

Es können immer Dinge passieren, die den Ablauf verzögern. Wenn z.B. das Crowdfunding nicht den gewünschten Erfolg hat. kann es noch dauern, bis wir den Rest zusammen gekratzt haben. Der Druck kann läner dauern, Versandzeiten können abweichen (vor allem international). Falls eine Verzögerung eintritt, werden alle benachrichtigt sobald wir davon Kenntnis haben.



How it Will Look

Wie wird das Buch aussehen?



We are envisioning our book to be approximately 22 x 1 x 30 centimeters. Each turn of the page will reveal a beautiful photograph from the Land of Hope tapestry, with a corresponding text (in at least two languages) on the other side that tells Pepito's story. Small sketches of the little man in various poses will appear alongside the text.

Wir planen das Buch in der Größe 22 x 1 x 30 cm. Bei jedem Umblättern sieht man eine neue Seite mit einem Bildausschenitt des Werkes "Land der Hoffnung" zeigen mit den dazu gehörigen Texten in mindestens zwei Sprachen auf der gegenüberliegenden Seite. Kleine Zeichnungen des kleinen Pepito ergänzen das Bild.


One of our draft pages. So far, this only has the German text, and the height isn't exactly right. As soon as we have an updated version of this, we will let you know! See below for the English and Japanese translations that will be on this page:

Hier ein Beispiel, erstmal nur mit dem deutschen Text und vorläufigem Format. Der englische Text folgt:




'To his great surprise Pepito met a man who was even smaller then he was.

Pepito said to him: “How can you be happy being so very small?”

And the small man answered: “Because I see that life is full of treasures like this pot of gold at the end of the rainbow.”

“Yes”, said Pepito, “I see. But I want to be big.”

“Good," said the small man, “then you must respect all persons whether they are smaller or bigger than you; then you will be big. Come with me to the pond for a drink.”'

 our ultimate goal is €13,000 - that would cover editing, printing, 
production, grade-A advertisement, shipping and distribution to 
bookstores around the country, and would also upgrade the book into a 
larger, more child-friendly format. We've read the statistics on 
successful crowdfunding projects and know that a lower number is easier 
to reach, so we're hoping your generosity will go above and beyond our 
minimum goal to help us reach €13,000.
Das
 ultimative Ziel sind 13 000 €, was ausser Druck und allen damit 
verbundenen Kosten wie Versand und Vertrieb eine Top-Grade-A- 
Werbeaktion mit einschliesst. Das Buch könnte so 
auch ein etwas größeres, kinderfreundlicheres Format bekommen. Wir haben
 uns über erfolgreiche Crowdfunding-Projekte informiert und hoffen sehr,
 dass wir es schaffen, die optimale Summe zu erzielen. 

Even if you can't 
contribute monetarily to Land of Hope, you can still help us out by 
spreading the word to anyone who may be interested! Sharing, emailing, 
tweeting, and word-of-mouth are absolutely invaluable to getting this 
project off the ground.
Wenn
 Sie im Moment finanziell nicht helfen können, freuen wir uns, wenn Sie 
helfen, indem Sie andere auf das Projekt aufmerksam machen, die 
vielleicht helfen können. Soziale Netzwerke, Emails, Kaffeklasch, 
Mundpropaganda, all dies trägt dazu bei, das Projekt zu verwirklichen. 

 This book is perfect for parents of young
 children, expecting parents, or even aunts, uncles, grandparents, and 
other relatives searching for a gift for the young ones in their lives. 
Dieses
 Buch ist ein schönes Geschenk für Eltern kleiner Kinder, also Eltern, 
Tanten, Onkel, Omas und Opas, Familie und Freunde- hier ist ein Geschenk
 für Eure  kleinen Lieblinge!What You Get by Helping

Was Sie bekommen, wenn Sie mithelfen


Of
 course, you benefit from helping us get published too! We couldn't ask 
for your money without giving a little something in return. Perks range 
from digital wallpapers and e-books to a signed hard copy and a 
personalized sketch from the author/artist. Check the column on the right for more details!
Natürlich sollen Sie für Ihre Hilfe auch etwas bekommen! Als Dankeschön
 bekommen Sie je nach Höhe der Spende z.B. digitale Wallpaper für Ihren 
PC, E-Bücher, signierte Exemplare, eine originale Zeichnung des Autors 
und mehr. Bitte schauen Sie in die Spalte hier rechts für mehr Information.


On the left, a Land of Hope folder. Ideally, the finished book will 
look something like this as well. On the right, Horacio's autobiography,
 Confessions of a Male Belly Dancer.These and many other perks are available to our supporters!Links im Bild: Das Land der Hoffnung
Idealerweise wird das Kinderbuch so aussehen. Rechts sehen Sie Horacio´s
 Autobiographie "Confessions of a Male Belldancer". Dies sind Beispiele 
für die Perks für Unterstützer.Predicted Timeline
Zeitplan

So, how long is this all going to take? 
So, wann wird was passieren?

In a perfect world, the timeline would look something like this:
Wenn alles klappt, sieht der Plan aus wie folgt:

October 31st, 2014: Crowdfunding begins!
Mid-December
 2014: Crowdfunding ends, all funds calculated, collected, and sent to 
publishers. Digital perks sent to supporters - just in time for the 
holidays!
January 2015: Publishing company begins production process for Land of Hope
Summer 2015: Printing is completed, books sent to Horacio and later distributed to bookstores
Summer/Fall 2015: Physical rewards shipped out to supporters, arriving once again just in time for the holidays!
31. Oktober 2014: das Crowdfunding beginnt!
Mitte Dezenber 2014: das Crowdfunding endet, alle Spenden gehen an den 
Verlag, die digitalen Perks (Belohnungen)  gehen an die Spender, 
pünktlich zum Weihnachtsfest!
Januar 2015: der Verlag beginnt die Produktion.
Sommer 2015: der Druck ist fertig, die Bücher werden versendet und an Buchläden verschickt.
Sommer/Herbst 2015: alle nicht-digitalen Perks , d.h. alle Geschenke werden verschickt, pünktlich zum nächsten Fest!Realistically, we know lots of things could happen to 
delay this process. If the crowdfuding isn't as successful as we hope, 
it may take some extra time to scrape up the last bit of money needed to
 pay the publishers. Printing may take longer than expected at the 
publishers, and mailing speeds can sometimes be unpredictable, 
especially internationally and around holidays. We can't know ahead of 
time what might happen, but we promise to keep you informed of all 
updates, good and bad, as soon as we find out about them. 
Es können immer Dinge passieren, die den Ablauf verzögern. Wenn z.B. das
 Crowdfunding nicht den gewünschten Erfolg hat. kann es noch
 dauern, bis wir den Rest zusammen gekratzt haben. Der Druck kann läner 
dauern, Versandzeiten können abweichen (vor allem international). Falls 
eine Verzögerung eintritt, werden alle benachrichtigt sobald wir davon 
Kenntnis haben.

How it Will Look
Wie wird das Buch aussehen?

We are envisioning our book to be approximately 22 x 1 x 30
 centimeters. Each turn of the page will reveal a beautiful photograph 
from the Land of Hope tapestry, with a corresponding text (in at least 
two languages) on the other side that tells Pepito's story. Small 
sketches of the little man in various poses will appear alongside the 
text.
Wir planen das Buch in der Größe 22
 x 1 x 30 cm. Bei jedem Umblättern sieht man eine neue Seite mit einem 
Bildausschenitt des Werkes "Land der Hoffnung" zeigen mit den dazu 
gehörigen Texten in mindestens zwei Sprachen auf der gegenüberliegenden 
Seite. Kleine Zeichnungen des kleinen Pepito ergänzen das Bild.


One of our draft pages. So far, this only has the German text, and 
the height isn't exactly right. As soon as we have an updated version of
 this, we will let you know! See below for the English and Japanese translations that 
will be on this page: Hier ein Beispiel, erstmal nur mit dem deutschen Text und vorläufigem Format. Der englische Text folgt:


'To his great surprise Pepito met a man who was even smaller then he was.
Pepito said to him: “How can you be happy being so very small?”
And the small man answered: “Because I see that life is full of treasures like this pot of gold at the end of the rainbow.”
“Yes”, said Pepito, “I see. But I want to be big.”
“Good," said the small man, “then you must respect all persons 
whether they are smaller or bigger than you; then you will be big. Come 
with me to the pond for a drink.”'

story:
Help us finish the 2016 Hanging Lantern Review print issue, preorder a copy, and reserve a spot at our Spring Reading + Release Party!


  • JOURNAL RELEASE DATE: May 24, 2016

READING + RELEASE PARTY:
May 24 (6:30 pm - Doors at 6) 
Dallidet Adobe
San Luis Obispo, CA

We're Hanging Lantern Review, San Luis Obispo's first literary journal made for and by Central Coast teens! We publish high quality middle school and high school fiction, nonfiction, poetry, and art. We're ready to release our 4th Annual Issue! Every pledge gets us closer to our goal, and ensures that we will continue to be able to invest in our local literary culture for years to come! 

Who are we? Our staff is made up of real high school students from San Luis Obispo Classical Academy. We work all year long to solicit quality work from our peers, curate, design, and publish our beautiful journal, coordinate a blog and website, and host writing-inspired events. 



In 2013, we launched an IndieGoGo campaign, and with your help, we raised over $2500! That got us started. Since then, we have had an amazing FOUR SEASONS in print, and we want to keep going! Since we last held a fundraiser, we have curated, printed, and sold hundreds of issues, purchased a new Mac computer for our designers, and funded a subscription for Adobe software. We have published work from high schoolers and middle schoolers from more than 10 local schools, and we've held TWO SUMMER WORKSHOPS for aspiring writers. 

Now, heading into another busy release season, we need just a little bit of money up front to get these journals out on time and allow us to throw an awesome Spring Reading & Release Party to celebrate what we've been able to accomplish together.

What We Need + What You Get

  • We'll need around $500 to cover the up front costs of printing and shipping the journal, and renting the venue for our release party! We are an entirely self-funded school club. We raise all our own funds and manage all our own money. Therefore, every contribution makes a powerful impact!

    Here are some preorder/perk options: 

  • Preorder the 2016 Hanging Lantern Review Print Issue ($10)
  • Reserve a ticket to our Spring Reading and Release Party ($10) 
  • Print Issue + Release Party Ticket Bundle ($15) *Best Value
  • Hanging Lantern Review Catalogue Collection ($25.00)
  • 2 Release Party Tickets + 2 Print Issues ($30.00) *Best Value 
  • Or, if you just want to make a donation to the journal, we would be honored to have your help!

Risks & Challenges

This is a flexible funding campaign, which means we are opting to accept any and all donations, even if we don't meet our minimum goal. This is because the issue is on its way - even if we don't meet the goal this spring, we will still get the issue out, and every dollar will help us to do that! Having the funds come early through our preorder eliminates strain on our budget, and allows us to get a head start for next year! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't pledge or won't be able to attend the release party, we would love help spreading the word through Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter!

story:
¿Qué?

Notas sueltas es una de esas historias con múltiples capas semánticas que, para deleite del lector, se van abriendo a media que avanzan sus páginas ofreciendo un punto de vista para cada nuevo tema que va surgiendo.

Cuando, a partir de un encuentro absolutamente casual, Diego Jiménez Guzmán, famoso cantaor de flamenco, y Marta Roca Forcadell, soprano de reconocido prestigio en el mundo de la ópera, comienzan a vivir una apasionada historia de amor, los dos saben que esa relación no va a ser precisamente un camino de rosas, dada su acendrada pertenencia a mundos tan distintos.

El excluyente ideario nacionalista que practica parte de la familia de Marta y la automarginación social que profesa la familia gitana de Diego, ponen  impedimentos más que suficientes al avance de un amor contra el cual algunos llegan a emplear todo tipo de malas artes, incluyendo la conspiración y el terror, que arrastra a los dos protagonistas a un forzado exilio.

Sin duda, un testimonio del momento político que vive hoy la sociedad catalana, pero, sobre todo, un testimonio humano que habla de libertad, de justicia, y de amor; el amor de siempre, muy anterior a las diferencias de origen y cultura.  

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a José Montero.

Nacido en Lena (Asturias). Profesionalmente, ha sido ejecutivo de nivel medio en una empresa de ámbito estatal. Ha desempañado distintas responsabilidades sindicales durante algunos años: desde Secretario General del Sindicato Ferroviario de UGT, o Secretario de Formación de la Federación de Transportes UGT de Cataluña, a miembro de la Comisión Ejecutiva Nacional de la UGT de Cataluña.

Ha sido Concejal del Ayuntamiento de Ripoll (1979 -1981) y Diputado del Parlament de Catalunya en la primera legislatura (1980 – 1984); así como escritor novel con algunos títulos publicados eBooks Kindle: Del rojo vivo al rosa fuerte, Las ruinas del molino viejo, Víctima de la buena suerte, Crónica de un encuentro imposible, La misma.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Notas sueltas que saldría después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y José Montero vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Hello, I am Swami Cat.  The Puppet Guru who teaches little Yogis how to stretch, breathe and laugh their way to purrr-fect peace! Since 2013 Yoga Girl (A.K.A. Karuna Lynne, Yoga Instructor and public school theatre teacher) and I have created performances, workshops, videos, books and most recently a Yoga CD! Through the use of Yoga poses, breathing exercises, songs and stories, I teach meditation and mindfulness to the young and young-at-heart.

At the end of a peaceful Yoga festival a few years ago, children were helping us clean up when a bee flew into our sight. The children screamed and one previously sweet, helpful young boy swatted at the bee in order to harm it. It was a teachable moment in which to remind the children that Yoga is about not wishing harm on any living thing and that bees are not scary. They are amazing & vital for our survival!

When we met SonnyBee, a young honey bee who loves to teach others about how "Healthy hives give us healthy lives," Yoga Girl and I knew we had found the perfect collaborator. We spent a few months writing it and we're so excited to share it with you. Here's the synopsis:

Swami Cat & Yoga Girl are biking in the beautiful woods when they bump into a little bee, named SonnyBee. SonnyBee is worried because his best friend BillyBee is missing. Together they search for him and meet a turtle, a frog and a farmer. The farmer is about to harm a beehive. They learn the importance of bees, as well as ahimsa-- the Yoga word for non-violence. Will SonnyBee, Swami Cat and Yoga Girl save the beehive and find BillyBee?

We only need one more thing. The illustrations! We found a really fun artist named Sara Dilley and she's a bee fanatic too! Check out her artwork on her website HERE and also here are a few samples of the rough draft pencil drawings:

All we need is $1650 to create this very important children's book. Here is the breakdown of what we need:

$1200 for Illustrator

$250 for bookmaking on Createspace (An Amazon Company)

$200 for mailings

Total:$1650 (Stretch goal for book advertising & donations of books to charity $1950)

As you can see we are not looking to pay ourselves. We are more interested in getting the books out there into the world and into the little readers' hands. 

For every $50 we exceed our goal we will give a book to children’s non-profit charities

10% of all book sale profits go to Honeybeesanctuary.org an organization dedicated to saving the bees & 10% to Yoga Life Society a 5013c non-profit dedicated to teaching individual, global & universal peace.

Help us reach our attainable goal & we will be eternally grateful! We will honor every donation with a shout out on our website, Facebook, Twitter & Instagram! 

If we don't reach our entire goal we will still honor all donations with their respective gifts. We will just need to spend our time selling more books afterward to repay ourselves for the publishing/illustrator costs. This will take away from our advertising and promotion of the book, as well as working on our next masterpiece.

Hello, I am Swami Cat.  The Puppet Guru who teaches little Yogis how to stretch, breathe and laugh their way to purrr-fect peace! Since 2013 Yoga Girl (A.K.A. Karuna Lynne, Yoga Instructor and public school theatre teacher) and I have created performances, workshops, videos, books and most recently a Yoga CD! Through the use of Yoga poses, breathing exercises, songs and stories, I teach meditation and mindfulness to the young and young-at-heart.
At the end of a peaceful Yoga festival a few years ago, children were helping us clean up when a bee flew into our sight. The children screamed and one previously sweet, helpful young boy swatted at the bee in order to harm it. It was a teachable moment in which to remind the children that Yoga is about not wishing harm on any living thing and that bees are not scary. They are amazing & vital for our survival!
When we met SonnyBee, a young honey bee who loves to teach others about how "Healthy hives give us healthy lives," Yoga Girl and I knew we had found the perfect collaborator. We spent a few months writing it and we're so excited to share it with you. Here's the synopsis:
Swami Cat & Yoga Girl are biking in the beautiful woods when they bump into a little bee, named SonnyBee. SonnyBee is worried because his best friend BillyBee is missing. Together they search for him and meet a turtle, a frog and a farmer. The farmer is about to harm a beehive. They learn the importance of bees, as well as ahimsa-- the Yoga word for non-violence. Will SonnyBee, Swami Cat and Yoga Girl save the beehive and find BillyBee?
We only need one more thing. The illustrations! We found a really fun artist named Sara Dilley and she's a bee fanatic too! Check out her artwork on her website HERE and also here are a few samples of the rough draft pencil drawings:

story:
My Deal

In 2010 I was broke, homeless, and unable to find work. Through some miracle I managed to make a little money selling short science fiction and horror on Amazon, iBooks, and Barnes & Noble, and by the end of 2011 I was bringing in four figures a month in royalties and no longer homeless. I did so well that I was able to stop spending time sending out endless job applications.

Fast forward to 2018 and I'm supporting myself writing novels, designing tabletop rpg products, and producing podcasts. I'm still poor, but I'm able to earn enough to live on, and that is a pretty big deal for someone without a day job. Fortunate too, since I've been doing this for seven years and that gap in my work history makes finding a job almost impossible.

Unfortunately it barely covers my "not being homeless" expenses, so when something happens - a laptop breaking, for example - I don't have the emergency funds to get a new one.

To keep working I need a new laptop

I don't need much from a laptop, just one that provides me with the minimum necessary to run the software I use to create my books. Scrivener, InDesign, Photoshop. You get the picture. $500, the minimum IndieGoGo lets you run a campaign for, should be enough.

Maybe if we make more I'll pick up something better. That'd be nice.

In exchange, hey. I'm a prolific guy. You like books? Games? Stories? I've written a lot of things in the last eight years.

  • Cold Reboot is my cyberpunk series, about a woman who wakes up in 2025 with no memory of the last decade. Now she wanders the streets of 2025 Chicago, trying to get by on a meager allowance of government assistance credits, without friends, funds, or a work history within the last decade. We're two books in, and I plan to wrap up the trilogy by the end of the year.
  • Galvanic Century is steampunk thrillers and mysteries set in a steampunk Edwardian era where galvanic killers stalk the night, sky pirates plague the skies, and Queen Victoria yet rules from her platinum throne. There are six books in the series so far.
  • Grief is an apocalyptic literary horror short story collection that examines the sociology of loss.
  • I've published a few roleplaying game supplements under the Taoscordian Games imprint.
  • I produce two podcasts, the serial audiodrama series Synesthesia Theatre and the Working Class Creatives interview show.

Support me in my quest to get a new laptop, and I've got a lot of books to offer in gratitude - both those already written, and those yet to be.

I'd like to keep writing

I'd like to keep writing. Even more, I'd like to keep earning a living. I wear a lot of hats, I make a lot of things, but all of it relies on having a good machine to work on. Let's be honest - the economy is still a mess, and a seven year gap in my work history isn't really going to help me find a job anywhere. I really don't have any other options, so your support here really saves me.

Risks & Challenges

There's not a lot of risk here. Most of the books I'm offering as perks are already written, already published, already out there. And, as I've mentioned, it's not like I'm going to stop writing... it's honestly turned me into a bit of a workaholic. I don't really want to do anything other than write.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? That's cool. I appreciate the desire to help. Instead, maybe share the campaign on social media? Or buy one of my books, give it a read? Follow me on Twitter at @mcoorlim?

If you really want to help, consider supporting me on Patreon.
