story:
The Cornish Legends Book

I am Sheridan James Lunt, and I have made animating Cornish legends my passion. My animated series 'Piski Tells the Cornish Legends' can be seen on youtube.

I’ve had a life-long interest in world mythology, and especially the arts that accompany such story-telling. The storybooks in my library are treasured objects and enduring inspirations.

I began learning Cornish Folklore while living in Falmouth. The tradition comprises an alternate history in which all Cornwall’s dangerous beauty and melancholy desolation play out in the lives of celebrated Cornishmen and Women whose very names have been remembered. For those who know and love this country, these stories are the heart and soul of Cornwall.

Our folkloric traditions are kept alive by their retelling, and I believe the artworks and writing I have composed on this subject would make a beautiful book. It retells nine classic stories, of mermaids, giants, piskeys, smugglers, witches and ghosts, with thirty full colour illustrations evoking Cornwall’s myriad aspects.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Through this campaign I hope to raise £1,111 to fund a first edition.

Any donation, no matter how small, would be so gratefully received.

However, all contributions above £10 will be thanked with a 6 track mp3 download of the audiobook. 

A £35 donation secures the kind donator their own numbered edition of the book.

A £45 donation receives a signed and numbered book

A £55 donation sees the name of the contributor appear in print, with thanks, within the book itself.

A £70 donation receives two books, numbered signed and with the contributor's name in print. 

Donations above £95 will secure the opportunity of owning original artwork used in the animated series, including puppets and hand-drawn pictures. Of course these are unique and variable, and I will contact contributors personally to find the right items, appropriate to their contribution. Also all previous perks.

 

The Impact

The retelling of folkloric traditions keeps them alive, and books like these make their contribution. I have also been developing the project more widely, with a view to creating a live storytelling show that could include projections and puppetry. The project could help connect audiences everywhere, but especially those in Cornwall itself, with the country's magnificent cultural heritage.

I'm delighted to announce that Kowethas an Yeth Kernewek: The Cornish Language Fellowship have begun the work of translating my animated stories into Cornish, which improves the educational aspect, and extends the reach of the project tremendously.

All this, together with the proposed print of this book, would support the furtherance of Cornish life and culture.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

This campaign can be helped immeasurably simply by sharing links and news on social media.

story:
Smiling Banjo: A Half Century of Love and Music at the Philadelphia Folk Festival.​ 

The Philadelphia Folk Festival has become such an important part of some people's lives that the first thing they do at the beginning of each year is block off the weekend of "Fest", as many call it, because they can't imagine a year where they don't attend. Over 10,000 people come to the festival each year.

Yet, there has never been a book about the history of the festival or ways of showing off the amazing photographs by the talented photographers who have captured the visual history of the festival for over five decades. 

 

 

Three of us, Eric Ring, Jayne Toohey, and John Lupton came together and decided to put together a coffee table book that celebrated the stories and the photos that make this festival loved by thousands.

Dozens of photographers donated their images for this project and we have photos from the very first festival in 1962 up to modern times.

 

Have you ever told people about how you go to the festival every year, but they don't understand your passion?

 

 

The book will be a great addition to your coffee table or bookshelf and will show family and friends why this festival is such an important part of your life.

The book also has many of the countless stories that we collected from volunteers and festival-goers. For example, when Mike McGrath (also known from hosting  the nationally syndicated NPR show "You Bet Your Garden") was a member of the security committee and had to deal with a gang of bikers that come to the festival.

The first phalanx of bikers showed up around noon. Mike remembers, “They had a ritual where they would all arrive together and pull up in these straight lines. And at some unseen signal - I was standing right there - they turned their bikes off, all at the same time, and it went from this deafening roar to a deafening silence.”

 

Have you ever wondered what musician

played in what year?

If we meet our goal we intend to have an index up through the 2017 or 2018 festival of every musician who has played at the festival and what year. The index will be by year and by artist. 

Think about what a great resource the book will be as part of your library.

 

Support The Parent Organization

Best of all, the profits and royalties of this book will go directly to the Philadelphia Folksong Society, the charitable organization that puts on this event each year.

 

Why We Are Asking For Your Support.

 

The book has been written and the photographs have been selected.

What is left is to cover the cost of publication so the quality of the book will properly represent this festival. We want to create a book that expresses the history, music, and relationships that make the festival so important.

This campaign will generate the funds needed to pay for the wholesale costs of the book so the valuable resources of the Philadelphia Folksong Society can be used for next years festival and their other charitable missions, like the Odyssey of American Music program and the Philadelphia Music Co-op, rather than for our project. 

Most of the contribution levels will come with a copy of the book which we project will be available in August 2018. 

Thank you for your support.

story:
Short Summary

Our perceptions of ourselves and of the greater world around us influence the choices we make every day. In turn, the choices we make influence our perspective of the world around us. The very act of making those choices helps each of us define our own unique sense of purpose.

I’m Michelle Phillips, author of Little Big Head, a book that explores the role our choices play in creating a life full of meaning. When reading this book, we’ll explore what can happen — and did happen to me — when outside influences skew our self-perception and our world view. In Little Big Head, I allow my own personal stories to unfold in unflinching detail: lessons learned, challenges conquered, relationships made, and improvements that have yet to come.It is my hope that along the way you’ll enjoy getting to know me and I’ll even enjoy getting to know myself again. This book is more than just a trip down memory lane. It’s a quest to understand myself, my world and my choices. I hope this book provides you with the reassurance that no matter who you are or where your choices have led you thus far, you, too, have the power to choose change and to create a meaningful, purpose-filled life.

I wrote this book to discover how choice plays a role in how we see the world around us, and how making choices helps us to define our own unique sense of purpose.

When reading this book, you will enjoy personal stories about my life that examine how the choices we make give our life meaning. This book will provide you clarity and reassurance that you are on the right path, and need to make the choice that is best for you, no matter what. Our family, friends, community members and the media can sometimes skew our perception of the world around us. It is important that we take time to reflect on this. I have found knowing yourself, at your core, can only be achieved through reflection and curiosity. Understanding the situation and the need and hunger to learn more. These two things have played a large role in the way I view myself, and the world around me. This book is a recount of my life until today, the lessons I’ve learned, challenges conquered, relationships made, and the improvement that has yet to come. I hope this book provides you with the reassurance that as a culture, we really aren’t that different. No matter who you are or where you come from, everyday we make choices that have power to change our lives for the better.

In this book, you'll learn about my struggle and successes with education, control and confidence.

  • Education: I grew up thinking that I was not smart and would not achieve anything of prestige when it came to my academics. After being put down by assignments, test scores and teachers, I thought there was no way to improve. I didn’t understand the point. I didn’t realize what exactly I was learning. I learned many things in school that did not come from a textbook. We must ask questions, understand the process and be willing to be vulnerable in order to improve. My experience in the classroom taught me several things I textbook never could, and for that, I am thankful.
  • Control: As human beings, we long for a sense of ownership, for control over outcomes, for final say in decisions that impact our lives. Even in situations where we have the autonomy to call our own shots, our power comes with limitations. We can’t change people or control their thoughts, their choices. We only have the power to control what goes on inside of our own little heads and the choices we make every day. And sometimes, the most powerful thing we can do is to have the courage to admit we need help.
  • Confidence: I can attribute much of my academic and professional success to my sense of self-confidence. I have found that having a “Little Big Head” is essential to understand who you are, what you’re doing and where you want to go. Your head has to be big enough to have the confidence to take the risk and prove to others you believe in yourself, but small enough to have humility in knowing that there is always room for improvement. Building confidence is not always the easiest thing to do, but it comes from your core, doing things 100% for you and pursuing the things you truly feel passionate about.

 

You will like this book if you have ever found yourself short on confidence and slightly out of control. You’ll love this book if you’re open to self-reflection and hungry to learn how the choices we make at critical moments help us define who we are and what we believe in.

Little Big Head is a non-fiction book that speaks to young adults transitioning from a history of structured education to the harsh realities of the real world. curious individuals who are interested in my journey in understanding how my choices have defined my sense of self.

 

The Book - Little Big Head

The book is written in three Parts....


Part one contains the introduction and stories that detail my relationship with religion. Part one also introduces my passion for acting and my summer camp experiences. This section introduces the initial understanding I had of myself, and the important moments that shaped the way I got to know my surroundings.

Part two contains Chapters 7-12. This section deals with my experiences in high school. The development and experiences we have in high school have the ability to make an imprint on the way we view the world and understand those around us. Rival high schools that merged into one, an extreme drop in confidence due to a test score, an eating disorder that disrupted my life and relationships were just a few of the moments that were critical to building myself into the person I am today.

Part three contains Chapters 13-14. In order to fully understand how the decisions we make have a direct impact on the course of our life and our physical and emotional well being, I must give you an update on where I am today. My parents are getting older, I am moving across the country and life isn’t slowing down for anyone. In the next six months, my life is going to change dramatically. But I have to stick to my roots, listen to Joni Mitchell and remember that every large problem can be broken down into simple, achievable steps.

 

What We Need & What You Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2020.
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer.
Once I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I get to publish! When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook! When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition! But, I can’t do any of this without you.

So to make you want it EVEN more...

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish!
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

 

About the Author

Michelle Phillips loves being outside, singing Landslide (Dixie Chicks version) and eating nachos. She was raised on microwave popcorn, Joni Mitchell and the CBS show Survivor. Among these passions, she loves to talk to people and deeply understands the importance of sharing a good laugh with a great friend.

A senior at the University of Michigan, she too is crying and dealing with the emotions of COVID-19 ending her college career. In late July, she’ll take her Little Big Head to the West Coast, where she’s an incoming Associate Software Engineer at the Walt Disney Company, part of the EMERGE leadership rotational program.

I wrote this book to encourage others to take risks, ask questions and to be their best selves, in any situation. At a critical time of my life, I wanted to share my story to how I got to where I am today and the challenges I had to navigate to get to this point. I initially wanted to understand how entertainers can be successful in the entertainment industry coming from “untraditional” backgrounds. This idea evolved into a deeper understanding of how we make pivotal choices to change our lives, the risk in these choices and the aftermath of making them.

For more information you can connect with Michelle at michellemariephil@gmail.com and LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/michelle-phillips-5....
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #LittleBigHead and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Michelle

The very act of making those choices helps each of us define our own unique sense of purpose.I’m Michelle Phillips, author of Little Big Head, a book that explores the role our choices play in creating a life full of meaning. When reading this book, we’ll explore what can happen — and did happen to me — when outside influences skew our self-perception and our world view. In Little Big Head, I allow my own personal stories to unfold in unflinching detail: lessons learned, challenges conquered, relationships made, and improvements that have yet to come.It is my hope that along the way you’ll enjoy getting to know me and I’ll even enjoy getting to know myself again. This book is more than just a trip down memory lane. It’s a quest to understand myself, my world and my choices. I hope this book provides you with the reassurance that no matter who you are or where your choices have led you thus far, you, too, have the power to choose change and to create a meaningful, purpose-filled life.
I wrote this book to discover how choice plays a role in how we see the world around us, and how making choices helps us to define our own unique sense of purpose.When reading this book, you will enjoy personal stories about my life that examine how the choices we make give our life meaning. This book will provide you clarity and reassurance that you are on the right path, and need to make the choice that is best for you, no matter what. Our family, friends, community members and the media can sometimes skew our perception of the world around us. It is important that we take time to reflect on this. I have found knowing yourself, at your core, can only be achieved through reflection and curiosity. Understanding the situation and the need and hunger to learn more. These two things have played a large role in the way I view myself, and the world around me. This book is a recount of my life until today, the lessons I’ve learned, challenges conquered, relationships made, and the improvement that has yet to come. I hope this book provides you with the reassurance that as a culture, we really aren’t that different. No matter who you are or where you come from, everyday we make choices that have power to change our lives for the better.In this book, you'll learn about my struggle and successes with education, control and confidence.

Education: I grew up thinking that I was not smart and would not achieve anything of prestige when it came to my academics. After being put down by assignments, test scores and teachers, I thought there was no way to improve. I didn’t understand the point. I didn’t realize what exactly I was learning. I learned many things in school that did not come from a textbook. We must ask questions, understand the process and be willing to be vulnerable in order to improve. My experience in the classroom taught me several things I textbook never could, and for that, I am thankful.
Control: As human beings, we long for a sense of ownership, for control over outcomes, for final say in decisions that impact our lives. Even in situations where we have the autonomy to call our own shots, our power comes with limitations. We can’t change people or control their thoughts, their choices. We only have the power to control what goes on inside of our own little heads and the choices we make every day. And sometimes, the most powerful thing we can do is to have the courage to admit we need help.
Confidence: I can attribute much of my academic and professional success to my sense of self-confidence. I have found that having a “Little Big Head” is essential to understand who you are, what you’re doing and where you want to go. Your head has to be big enough to have the confidence to take the risk and prove to others you believe in yourself, but small enough to have humility in knowing that there is always room for improvement. Building confidence is not always the easiest thing to do, but it comes from your core, doing things 100% for you and pursuing the things you truly feel passionate about.

 
You will like this book if you have ever found yourself short on confidence and slightly out of control. You’ll love this book if you’re open to self-reflection and hungry to learn how the choices we make at critical moments help us define who we are and what we believe in.Little Big Head is a non-fiction book that speaks to young adults transitioning from a history of structured education to the harsh realities of the real world. curious individuals who are interested in my journey in understanding how my choices have defined my sense of self.
 
The Book - Little Big Head
The book is written in three Parts....
Part one contains the introduction and stories that detail my relationship with religion. Part one also introduces my passion for acting and my summer camp experiences. This section introduces the initial understanding I had of myself, and the important moments that shaped the way I got to know my surroundings.Part two contains Chapters 7-12. This section deals with my experiences in high school. The development and experiences we have in high school have the ability to make an imprint on the way we view the world and understand those around us. Rival high schools that merged into one, an extreme drop in confidence due to a test score, an eating disorder that disrupted my life and relationships were just a few of the moments that were critical to building myself into the person I am today.Part three contains Chapters 13-14. In order to fully understand how the decisions we make have a direct impact on the course of our life and our physical and emotional well being, I must give you an update on where I am today. My parents are getting older, I am moving across the country and life isn’t slowing down for anyone. In the next six months, my life is going to change dramatically. But I have to stick to my roots, listen to Joni Mitchell and remember that every large problem can be broken down into simple, achievable steps.
 

What We Need & What You Get
This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in July, 2020.
The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
The Copyediting for My Book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this summer.
Once I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I get to publish! When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook! When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition! But, I can’t do any of this without you.So to make you want it EVEN more...I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish!
A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

 
About the Author
Michelle Phillips loves being outside, singing Landslide (Dixie Chicks version) and eating nachos. She was raised on microwave popcorn, Joni Mitchell and the CBS show Survivor. Among these passions, she loves to talk to people and deeply understands the importance of sharing a good laugh with a great friend.A senior at the University of Michigan, she too is crying and dealing with the emotions of COVID-19 ending her college career. In late July, she’ll take her Little Big Head to the West Coast, where she’s an incoming Associate Software Engineer at the Walt Disney Company, part of the EMERGE leadership rotational program.I wrote this book to encourage others to take risks, ask questions and to be their best selves, in any situation. At a critical time of my life, I wanted to share my story to how I got to where I am today and the challenges I had to navigate to get to this point. I initially wanted to understand how entertainers can be successful in the entertainment industry coming from “untraditional” backgrounds. This idea evolved into a deeper understanding of how we make pivotal choices to change our lives, the risk in these choices and the aftermath of making them.For more information you can connect with Michelle at michellemariephil@gmail.com and LinkedIn - https://www.linkedin.com/in/michelle-phillips-5.... 

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 
Other Ways You Can Help
Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #LittleBigHead and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.
Thank you so much of all of your love and support!Thanks again,Michelle

PLEASE NOTE: ALL ORDERS WILL BE SENT ONCE CAMPAIGN HAS ENDED ON FEB 14th. WE WOULD LIKE TO THANK EVERYONE THAT SUPPORTED THE SIGNALS CAMPAIGN AND MADE IT SUCH A SUCCESS

Busting/Hacking the publishing business model: that's why I, a former Presidential Advisor (@DrPippaM), am offering you my non-fiction/economics book on Indiegogo. It's called Signals: The Breakdown of the Social Contract and the Rise of Geopolitics. Nobody has launched a serious book on economics this way before (see the reviews from Heads of Governments, CEOs and 16 year olds below and don't miss the shoes and magazine covers too). It costs £17.00 for the hardcover and £13.00 for the ebook.

Just click the pink CONTRIBUTE NOW button on the right then ADD PERK on the next page and choose the version you want - the hardcover or the ebook. Don't worry about the contribution amount above that button, you can choose the price on the next page.

For bulk book orders please use the perk for 10 or 50 or 100 copies or just use the "custom" button on the hardcover perk page and put in the overall amount you want (so 100 copies is £1700). If you want signed copies (bulk orders only for now), email us on signals@drpmgroup.com

IF YOU CONTRIBUTE BUT DON'T WANT A BOOK WE'LL USE THE CAPITAL FOR BUILDING THE IDEAS LIKE THE YOUNG AMBASSADORS PROGRAM (another perk) WHERE WE WILL WORK WITH YOUNG PEOPLE WHO LOVE ECONOMICS BUT ARE FRUSTRATED THAT ECONOMICS DEMANDS SO MUCH MATH AND FAILS TO ADDRESS THE KEY SOCIAL ISSUES OF OUR TIME. I ALSO PLAN TO LAUNCH A USEFUL AND FUNNY ECONOMICS VIDEO SERIES SHORTLY TO HELP SPREAD THE WORD.

I am aiming to sell a minimum of 1000 copies during the Indiegogo campaign before launching it to the wider public (on January 13th, 2015 in the LSE Public Lecture Series). But, the big goal is to empower you, the reader, so that you can navigate the world economy better than ever before. The book is a finished product and ready to go (it's taken me three years and a long career in economics to write it!) 

More than anything, I am asking you to buy and read Signals so that together we can change the language of economics. Economics does not have to be all math, 

formulas and complicated theory (see my chapter four which is called "The Algorithm Made me Do It"). Economics is also about everyday events that "signal" to us from fashion magazine covers (I write about this particular British Vogue cover - Thank you Conde Nast for giving me permission to use the image!) ....

to military events (between the US, Russia and China and others) 


to the shrinking size of steaks and the reduced size and number of chocolates in a box. (See below for examples about shoes, fighter jets, F1 and more...)


Here's what some experts have to say about my book....

James Galbraith, Chair in Government/Business, University of Texas “better than Piketty". (Thomas Piketty is the author of the best-selling economics book in modern history, Capital, which is mainly full of math, theory and about how to redistribute wealth. This is the opposite of my book, which is all about explaining the world economy in plain English and helping the public be part of the economy of tomorrow which is already being built today!) 

Rohan Bedi, 16 year old student “absolutely loved reading it.”


Dr. Tun Mahathir Mohamad, former Prime Minister of Malaysia “Dr. Pippa Malmgren’s book is essential reading”. 

Sir Stuart Rose, former CEO and Chairman Marks and Spencer, says the ideas here are “a Tour de Force”.

Tidjane Thiam, CEO Prudential Plc “provocative ideas” and a “unique perspective”.

The Hon. Ambassador John Bruton, Former Prime Minister of Ireland “a great book”.


Dr. Liam Fox, former British Defence Minister, British MP “Pippa’s work is impressive and groundbreaking."


Heidi Roizen, Partner DFJ and Board DMGT (Silicon Valley Venture Capital) “Dr. Pippa Malmgren’s book is a must read, full of insights into what our ‘regular’ world can tell us about the future shape of our economic reality.”


Toshio Fukui, Former Governor Bank of Japan “fascinating, stimulating book! First-class quality.”

Peter van Manen, Mclaren (F1) “opens our eyes”. 

Peter Pereira Gray, Wellcome Trust “a delightfully easy read, a precious gift indeed”.

Leslie Sheppard, CSO MIT Forum for Supply Chain Innovation “gives us great optimism”. 

Art Laffer, former US Presidential Economic Advisor “Making economics colorful, intelligible, cool and accessible to the general public, Pippa has written a winner for one and all.”

Greg Williamson, CIO BP Pension Fund, “stellar” “I love this book!”

Major General Nick Pope CBE, Master of Signals Intelligence, British Ministry of Defence “a fascinating read. Full of lateral insights”.

Philip Blackwell, former owner Blackwell’s books “This timely book combines an engaging and accessible style with a fresh lens through which to think about and start making sense of the fast changing world we live in.”

James Rickards, author of Currency Wars, “At the true convergence of geopolitics + global capital, there are only a few pros. One is @DrPippaM.”

Bob Jenkins, former board of the Financial Policy Committee, Bank of England “One lesson remains to be relearned since the financial crisis – geopolitical risk. Learn it here.”

Laura Susa, undergraduate at Melbourne University “it’s a fantastic book! The examples will appeal to a broad range of people.” 

Here is an interview I did about the "Maker Movement" which is so very important in the world economy today.

If you need more, here is the short description on the inside front flap:
Signals Inside Front Flap

Economic signals are everywhere, from fashion magazine covers to grocery stores to military events. They empower by revealing the story of the world economy with all its stark contradictions. Central banks are trying to create inflation but say there is little chance it will happen, yet many feel their cost of living is already rising. Interest rates are at record low levels but the debt still seems to be at record highs. Stock markets are at record highs but economies still feel weak.

These conflicting pressures are stressing and breaking the vital social contracts that exist between citizens and their governments. They set in motion many seemingly unrelated outcomes: social unrest, the movement of manufacturing and jobs back to the US and the West and the return of geopolitics between the superpowers. The solution is risk-taking and innovation. Luckily, tomorrow’s economy is already being built today. By being alert to the many signals around us, anyone can better navigate through the turbulence to the treasures of the world economy.

Oh and I very deliberately chose hot pink as the signature colour for Signals. Economics is cool and sexy. It's about the forces that touch your life every day. Why do all the examples in economics have to be about steel or auto parts? I use examples like shoes, 

fashion (Ralph and Russo), artwork (For The Love of God), 

F1 Racing    Team Brawn GP

 The America's Cup Yacht Race,    John Bertrand

motorcycle maintenance (Shop Class), 

and even perfume (a beautiful story of risk taking)   

Of course, there are also references to useful Nobel prize winning ideas from Sir John Hicks, Friederich von Hayek and Albert Einstein ...     and a lesson from chess.....


But, I also explain why Greek mythology matters in economics (see the chapter called "Hubris and Nemesis" and my conclusion, "Cutting through the Gordian Knot"). Finally, find out why it matters (to you) that Tolkien's character, Gollum, lives above the door in the Oval Office ( I saw him when I worked there....).

------------------------------ -----------------------------

That's one of the perks of working in the White House. Your perks for supporting a new conversation about economics include:

Having something to give your parents, friends or the young people you know that will get them excited about the world economy and help them build their place in it. It will give you a ton of stories to tell as well.

Access to free videos and articles about the world economy (including my upcoming video series, Fifty Shades of Economics!)

Coffee mugs that remind you to take some calculated risks every day (see the perks section)

The opportunity to engage in live webinars with me, the author, on economic topics that matter to you. 

And, if you can't buy the book please feel free to engage with me on twitter @DrPippaM, Facebook, LinkedIn and Youtube. I am always putting up new compelling stories about what's going on in the world that will give you something to talk about about and think about. My job is to help everybody realize they can be a productive part of the economy. 

Keep in mind, I am asking you to be part of a bigger story already. The greater the success here, the more likely it is that I can ensure non-fiction authors no longer need to depend on traditional publishing houses to gain global distribution. This will give Indiegogo and crowd funding a more powerful role in the publishing arena. It will bring you more authors and more books in future.

The Young Ambassadors programme is designed to bring young people

Thanks in advance for your support! Whoever you are and whatever you do, I promise that this book will help you better navigate in the world economy whatever diverse troubles and treasures it may bring. 

All my best, Pippa

My name is Mariposa Boyd. I am fourteen years old, and my new novel, Shards of Shadow, is my way of making a difference in the world.  Our hearts are our greatest weapons, and that is the message I am trying to tell people with this book.

However, editing and publishing are huge costs, and I will never be able to give this gift to the world without the generous support of kind and selfless people such as yourself. Your financial support will help me reach my goal of $2,500 and share my passion and wisdom with everyone.

Donations of $100 and more will receive a free, signed copy of the book when it is released. Donations of $500 and more will also be acknowledged in the published book. Please tell your friends and family about my cause. Every penny will make me smile. Thank you in advance for your help in making the world a better place.

story:
What is Hypocrite Reader?

Hypocrite Reader is an online leftist magazine founded in Brooklyn in 2011. Each issue is centered around a theme, like PROPHECIES, SYMPTOMS, or GENERATION. You can view our complete list of past themes here. We publish writing that is conceptual and timely, useful and unexpected.

 

Why do we need money now?

Since July 2020, we have been a paying market. We remain committed to paying our contributors while keeping our articles free to readers. While we work toward developing a steady stream of funding through our Patreon, we’re asking for your help to accomplish two short-term goals: publishing our summer issue, TEETH, and hiring a web designer.

 

Money for TEETH

On July 15th, 2021, we will publish our 98th issue, TEETH. The bulk of the money we need is for writers. Our intensive editing process demands considerable work from our contributors, and we want to pay them fairly for it. On top of that, some amount of money will be used to promote their articles in order to help them build the readership they deserve, and some will be used to pay a featured artist.

 

Money for Web Design

As the magazine has expanded, it has gradually outgrown many aspects of its 2011 site design. While you may not be able to tell from afar, the magazine’s neck is twisted sideways and its limbs are popping out the windows. Our long wishlist of improvements includes, among other things, a way to notify casual readers of upcoming events, contests, and special projects; accessibility tools, such as a large font option; the ability to retain new visitors by suggesting an article to read next and making it easier to browse through an issue; flexible formatting options for articles that don’t fit the standard mold; and certain aesthetic improvements. While we have yet to decide just how far the aesthetic redesign will go, we all agree that functionality improvements are crucial and should be implemented in a way that looks nice—and that means hiring a web designer.

 

Money for Miscellany

A small fraction of the money we earn will go toward paying our web dues and shipping out the perks associated with this campaign.

 

What We’ve Accomplished Since Last Time

Our October fundraiser surpassed its goal, due in substantial part to a single extremely generous donation. In January, we published PROPHECIES, complete with artwork by and an interview with our first-ever “featured artist,” Ravi Amar Zupa. In April, we surprised you with a followup mini-issue, PROPHECIES II, with four more articles and an original cover animation. Taken together, PROPHECIES and PROPHECIES II represent the largest issue Hypocrite Reader has ever published, and this mega-issue has received more hits than any other issue in its first months of publication since we began keeping records. We were able to pay each contributor more than $100 for their work, which is remarkable for an institutionally-unaffiliated magazine of our size. And several people told us that the event we held to celebrate the launch of PROPHECIES was one of the warmest and most free-flowing online discussions they’d attended. 

Over the same six months since our last fundraiser, we’ve also brought several new editors into our horizontal collective and said goodbye to one. We’ve created a Patreon, and had a great deal of fun writing our monthly patrons-only newsletters. The newsletter we sent out on the first of May included an advice column and an annotated playlist, and we’ve got lots more creative content coming your way. We have nearly 4,000 Twitter followers now; when Twitter Czar Erica Eisen started her devilish rituals, we had about four hundred. And we've completed the first, exploratory phase of our website redesign process. 

We’re very grateful for the support we’ve received over the last year. When editor Cat Pierro emailed us a year ago to suggest a reboot, not one of us expected that the project would become such a large part of our lives. We’re glad it has. If you’re one of the people who have helped make our work possible, whether financially or otherwise—thank you.  

 

How You Can Contribute

If you can’t afford to give, we’d love it if you’d share this page with people who might. Otherwise, go ahead and select a perk from the sidebar to make a donation! We have awesome T-shirts, anthologies, and more. We can even subject you to our intensive editorial process for bargain prices. If you prefer to make a smaller, monthly donation, we’d love that too, and you can do it here; be sure to explore the different benefits on offer for each Patreon tier. And if there’s some other way you’d like to help, you can always write us at hypocriterdr@gmail.com.

What is Hypocrite Reader?
Hypocrite Reader is an online leftist magazine founded in Brooklyn in 2011. Each issue is centered around a theme, like PROPHECIES, SYMPTOMS, or GENERATION. You can view our complete list of past themes here. We publish writing that is conceptual and timely, useful and unexpected.
 
Why do we need money now?
Since July 2020, we have been a paying market. We remain committed to paying our contributors while keeping our articles free to readers. While we work toward developing a steady stream of funding through our Patreon, we’re asking for your help to accomplish two short-term goals: publishing our summer issue, TEETH, and hiring a web designer.
 
Money for TEETH
On July 15th, 2021, we will publish our 98th issue, TEETH. The bulk of the money we need is for writers. Our intensive editing process demands considerable work from our contributors, and we want to pay them fairly for it. On top of that, some amount of money will be used to promote their articles in order to help them build the readership they deserve, and some will be used to pay a featured artist.
 
Money for Web Design
As the magazine has expanded, it has gradually outgrown many aspects of its 2011 site design. While you may not be able to tell from afar, the magazine’s neck is twisted sideways and its limbs are popping out the windows. Our long wishlist of improvements includes, among other things, a way to notify casual readers of upcoming events, contests, and special projects; accessibility tools, such as a large font option; the ability to retain new visitors by suggesting an article to read next and making it easier to browse through an issue; flexible formatting options for articles that don’t fit the standard mold; and certain aesthetic improvements. While we have yet to decide just how far the aesthetic redesign will go, we all agree that functionality improvements are crucial and should be implemented in a way that looks nice—and that means hiring a web designer.
 
Money for Miscellany
A small fraction of the money we earn will go toward paying our web dues and shipping out the perks associated with this campaign. What We’ve Accomplished Since Last Time

story:
Story of My Book

Dear Jesus, Send Coffee: Finding Joy in the Chaos of Early Motherhood is a collection of funny truths, explorations of reality versus expectation, and interviews with real mamas and experts about the beautiful and trying time that is early motherhood. In this book we explore the common insecurities of moms, the personal and societal reasons they exist, and finally, how to move past them to reclaim your joy!

My name is Meredith Redmon and I am the author of Dear Jesus, Send Coffee. I wrote this book because I know how hard the beginning of motherhood can be. I want all mamas to be seen and validated, and to feel less alone through reading this book.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that while the mess of motherhood is hard, it can also be beautiful. I hope to instill in you the same passion and excitement that I have for raising my own babies and empowering other mamas. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you drop the perfection game and find your stride.

In this book, you'll learn about real moms just like you, and how they coped with the big issues of the early years - like feeding and sleeping challenges. You'll hear stories such as...
 

How mamas overcame their own postpartum body image struggles. 

How women banded together to support one another in the throws of postpartum depression or miscarriage struggles.

I am losing all of the perfect filtering of my own journey: I will share lots of my own #momfailmoments so you know you aren't the only one who prays for bedtime and then scrolls through baby pictures as soon as your kiddos go to sleep. 


You will love this book if you are thinking of starting a family soon, are living in the throws of the early years, or just love looking back on those times nostalgically.

Dear Jesus, Send Coffee is a nonfiction book that speaks to new parents and seasoned mamas who want to cut through the noise and pressures of perfection, and instead, just be the moms they were created to be. 

 

The Book - Dear Jesus, Send Coffee

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1: The Insecurities contains the introduction + chapters 1-5. In these sections, we explore some common insecurities new moms face: how we get pregnant/give birth, how our kids eat, how they sleep, our parenting styles, and outside influences (well meaning or not!).

Part 2: The Why? contains chapters 6-10. In this section, we explore the societal reasons for insecurities like mental load and social media pressures, as well as the internal reasons such as personality type and maternal mental health.

Part 3: The Now What? contains chapters 11-14. In the final section, we get into the practical ways to find community, develop a personal passion, and get on your path to living life with more joy. 
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August, 2021.
The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.

When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 240 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 320 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
 

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

A portion of the proceeds will go to Postpartum Support International so that all moms can get the support they need in such a tender time. 

And much more!

 

About the Author


Meredith Redmon is a former pediatric ICU nurse turned stay at home mom and writer. 

Meredith wrote this book because she knows all too well the changes that occur when you start your family. From the gleeful moments over new milestones to the lonely, late night, rocking chair marathons. Her vision is to create a community where all mamas are welcome. Where moms can see the unfiltered, imperfect chaos — and still find grace for herself and her kids.

Meredith is a mama of two littles aged 5 and 3. She loves a good workout offset by carbs and a glass of wine (balance!). Married to her husband of seven years, she lives with her family in Oklahoma, chasing kids and writing about the ups and downs of motherhood. 

For more information, you can connect with Meredith at motherhoodbymeredith@gmail.com and on Instagram @motherhoodbymeredith on Linkedin, or on clubhouse @mcredmon.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #DearJesusSendCoffee and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Meredith

story:
Hello Friend -

My name is Lonnie Helgerson and I have been in the business franchising industry for nearly 30 years. During that time I have started five franchise brands from scratch and been the CEO of others such as Ident-A-Kid Services of America. There isn't much in franchising that I haven't done, but to save time, I will let you read the rest of my background on my profile page.

For a number of years, many of my friends and acquaintances have been asking me to write a book about franchising. About a year ago, after some real prodding from an author friend - I decided to begin my own quest as a writer, which has been a very exciting challenge and learning experience.


The Book 5 Pennies

Every year - tens of thousands of new franchisees open their doors for business looking to fulfill the American dream of success. And every year hundreds and hundreds of new franchise companies announce their plans to be the next McDonald's, SUBWAY, Marriott, RE/MAX, or Great Clips. But beyond the initial legal work, basic operations manual, some training, and a fancy logo to get started what does it really take to be a successful franchise brand?


My book 5 Pennies: Ten Rules to Successfully Building a Franchise Mega-Brand and Maximizing System Profits is a book that I believe is long overdue to be written because if focuses on the core ingredient of franchising, which is franchisee owner profitability.

While most people think of Mega as something being very large, in my book it means something extraordinary and world class. If you like Good to Great by Jim Collins - my book translates this to "Good is never good enough, but Mega is great and sustainable." Franchise Mega-Brands continuously seek to excel to greatness.Throughout the book I use franchise Mega-Brand "Best of Class" examples that illustrate the Ten Rules for successful franchising. In addition, I start each chapter with a franchising Mega-Wreck story and then finish it at the end of the same chapter to illustrate the importance of each rule. All of the franchise Mega-Wreck stories are true and because of the severity of some, I have not shared the names of all franchise brands, unless they are public companies or otherwise known.

Definition

Franchise Mega-Brand
- A franchise system that excels to greatness with a profitable and sustainable franchisee business model.


During the course of writing 5 Pennies, I interviewed a number of well-known franchise executives such as Fred DeLuca, the Founder & CEO of SUBWAY, Melanie Bergeron, Chair of Two Men and a Truck, along with many others because their companies are included in the book as "Best of Class" examples in various chapters. While conducting these interviews, I also had some of them read draft excerpts of my manuscript for feedback on the overall content.

Resoundingly - they have all told me that I am spot-on with the focus of the book and that it will tremendously help existing brands of any size shore up their foundation and formulate strategic plans. In addition, entrepreneurs growing their business and considering franchising as an expansion model will find 5 Pennies to be a "must have" strategic planning guide for doing it right the first time.

Many other books have been written about "how to" franchise a business, but none exist about how to effectively manage and grow a national franchise brand.

How I Need Your Help & What You Get in Return

5 Pennies is nearly complete, with only one chapter left to write. In true serial entrepreneur fashion, I have decided to utilize crowdfunding as a tool to raise money for putting the final touches on the book - which are professional editing, cover design, publishing, and distribution.

My fundraising goal is $7,500 and I have put together some really cool goodies for you to get in return for helping me out. All donation levels are graciously appreciated and will be put to use right away for editing and cover design. Because the book is nearly done you will receive your draft chapters almost immediately if you participate.

Regardless if I raise all of the money or not, the project will be completed as I can personally fund it. For those of you that know me - it has to be perfect, so it will just take me a little longer to complete without the funding. And if you have contributed at some level, I personally guarantee you will still get your perks for helping me out.

Other Ways You Can Help

Lastly - I have one final favor to ask of you... Please share this with everyone you know, so that I can get the word out about this exciting new book coming called 5 Pennies. You can find social media sharing tools right here on this page.


I sincerely appreciate all of the help you are giving me and hope that you enjoy reading and benefiting from 5 Pennies very soon!

story:
Ryan Nicole Hartmann is a miracle of modern science. Ten fingers, 10 toes, and zero HIV.

That's saying something, considering how she was conceived. Her HIV-positive father had sex with his HIV-negative wife. Without a condom. And no one got HIV.

The story of how Ryan and babies like her came to be is the story of couples and scientists who imagined a world in which unprotected sex didn't have to be a death sentence. And it's a story of risk: about the risks women take every day to have sex with their HIV-positive husbands, how much risk they're willing to to take to have a baby, and the potential risks to all of us if they were to throw away the condoms. Would they have normal, healthy babies? Or would they pass on the virus, leading to a resurgence in the epidemic? And finally, it's the story of how an unlikely, 13-year-long study of couples around the world proved the unthinkable true: That unprotected sex can be safer sex for some couples, thus clearing the way for babies like Ryan.

That's what HIV and Baby Makes Three is all about. It's the rigorously reported, compassionately written, real-life story of two couples, their longing for a family and the scientists, doctors and researchers who helped--and hindered them--along the way.

This is where you come in.

Why an Indiegogo campaign?

Help me turn this piece of long-form journalism into a Kindle Single. The reporting and writing of the story is complete. But before it can go to Amazon for publishing, it must be edited and fact-checked thoroughly. Then, publishing the article as an ebook will allow me to take advantage of the capabilities of the medium to use photos, graphics and animations to explain some of the more scientifically tricky facts. The $6,000 breaks down this way:

  • $1,100 for editing
  • $1,500 for fact-checking
  • $400 for graphic design
  • $1,000 for photography of the couples in San Francisco and Maryland
  • $2,000 for animations
  • $500 for contingencies

* What happens if we raise more than $6,000? All additional funds will go toward additional interactive elements, videos and promotion of the ebook.


FAQ

  • This article does not promote unsafe sex. Rather, it lays out exactly how hard a decision it was for these couples to decide to go against decades of conventional wisdom, as well as the scientific and ethical challenges doctors face in helping their HIV-positive patients and their partners create a family.
  • Having said that, it also does not stigmatize HIV-discordant couples for wanting to have children. It sees this drive to form a family as normal and natural.
  • This is not an opinion piece. This is a piece of journalism that follows two couples from falling in love to having their first child. It includes doctors, scientists, and public health officials who put their journey into context, with both advances in HIV science and the current state of the epidemic.
  • This story focuses on HIV-positive men and their HIV-negative wives. There are HIV-positive women married to HIV-negative men, of course, and a world of research on transmission rates between gay men. Those stories are worth telling, too, but they aren't this story.
  • HIV-discordant couples adopt every year. That's a great story, and this article does address the question of adoption. But it's about couples trying to get pregnant the old-fashioned way.
  • This story is not about magical thinking. While it is told from the perspective of the couples, it's also deeply rooted in the science of HIV medicine and teaches readers what HIV is like today.

About me:

I'm a freelance healthcare journalist (http://boerner.contently.com). My work has appeared in some of the nation's largest magazines, newspapers and websites, including the San Francisco Chronicle, Better Homes and Gardens, USA Today, Prevention and AARP.org. I've won awards and fellowships for my reporting from places like the Association of Health Care Journalists and the University of Southern California. I specialize in telling thoughtful stories that illuminate the challenges people face in getting the healthcare they need, and how they make tough choices for themselves and their loved ones.

Will you help me?

This story is about two things: The shocking news out of the scientific community that unprotected sex doesn't have to be a death sentence, and the medications that make that possible; and the totally human yearning for a family. Put those together and what you have is a disease that has changed, even while our ideas about HIV have stayed, often, stuck in the 1980s. We're in a pivotal time, though--a time when this information could be used wrongly to fuel unsafe behavior that could lead to more deaths, or it could lead, as the President said, an "HIV-free generation."

How we take this information is up to us. In order to understand it, though, we have to understand the real issues facing people with HIV, and the state of HIV medicine today. HIV and Baby Makes Three connects those dots and give us a working framework for understanding the HIV world as exists today, not as it did in the last century. 

Let’s re-tell the story of how we make babies in the modern age.

And it's a story of risk: about the risks women take every day to have sex with their HIV-positive husbands, how much risk they're willing to to take to have a baby, and the potential risks to all of us if they were to throw away the condoms. Would they have normal, healthy babies? Or would they pass on the virus, leading to a resurgence in the epidemic? And finally, it's the story of how an unlikely, 13-year-long study of couples around the world proved the unthinkable true: That unprotected sex can be safer sex for some couples, thus clearing the way for babies like Ryan.
That's what HIV and Baby Makes Three is all about. It's the rigorously reported, compassionately written, real-life story of two couples, their longing for a family and the scientists, doctors and researchers who helped--and hindered them--along the way.
This is where you come in.
Why an Indiegogo campaign?
Help me turn this piece of long-form journalism into a Kindle Single. The reporting and writing of the story is complete. But before it can go to Amazon for publishing, it must be edited and fact-checked thoroughly. Then, publishing the article as an ebook will allow me to take advantage of the capabilities of the medium to use photos, graphics and animations to explain some of the more scientifically tricky facts. The $6,000 breaks down this way:


$1,100 for editing
$1,500 for fact-checking
$400 for graphic design
$1,000 for photography of the couples in San Francisco and Maryland
$2,000 for animations
$500 for contingencies

* What happens if we raise more than $6,000? All additional funds will go toward additional interactive elements, videos and promotion of the ebook.

FAQ


This article does not promote unsafe sex. Rather, it lays out exactly how hard a decision it was for these couples to decide to go against decades of conventional wisdom, as well as the scientific and ethical challenges doctors face in helping their HIV-positive patients and their partners create a family.
Having said that, it also does not stigmatize HIV-discordant couples for wanting to have children. It sees this drive to form a family as normal and natural.
This is not an opinion piece. This is a piece of journalism that follows two couples from falling in love to having their first child. It includes doctors, scientists, and public health officials who put their journey into context, with both advances in HIV science and the current state of the epidemic.
This story focuses on HIV-positive men and their HIV-negative wives. There are HIV-positive women married to HIV-negative men, of course, and a world of research on transmission rates between gay men. Those stories are worth telling, too, but they aren't this story.
HIV-discordant couples adopt every year. That's a great story, and this article does address the question of adoption. But it's about couples trying to get pregnant the old-fashioned way.
This story is not about magical thinking. While it is told from the perspective of the couples, it's also deeply rooted in the science of HIV medicine and teaches readers what HIV is like today.

About me:


I'm a freelance healthcare journalist (http://boerner.contently.com). My work has appeared in some of the nation's largest magazines, newspapers and websites, including the San Francisco Chronicle, Better Homes and Gardens, USA Today, Prevention and AARP.org. I've won awards and fellowships for my reporting from places like the Association of Health Care Journalists and the University of Southern California. I specialize in telling thoughtful stories that illuminate the challenges people face in getting the healthcare they need, and how they make tough choices for themselves and their loved ones.

Will you help me?This story is about two things: The shocking news out of the scientific community that unprotected sex doesn't have to be a death sentence, and the medications that make that possible; and the totally human yearning for a family. Put those together and what you have is a disease that has changed, even while our ideas about HIV have stayed, often, stuck in the 1980s. We're in a pivotal time, though--a time when this information could be used wrongly to fuel unsafe behavior that could lead to more deaths, or it could lead, as the President said, an "HIV-free generation."
How we take this information is up to us. In order to understand it, though, we have to understand the real issues facing people with HIV, and the state of HIV medicine today. HIV and Baby Makes Three connects those dots and give us a working framework for understanding the HIV world as exists today, not as it did in the last century. 
Let’s re-tell the
story of how we make babies in the modern age.

story:
Hey hey,

ich heiße Daniel und lebe derzeit in Berlin. Dort studiere ich Journalismus und bin nebenbei als Freelancer tätig.

Seit über einem Jahr betreibe ich einen Blog mit Kurzgeschichten und Binsenweisheiten vom Zusammenleben mit dem Geist eines schrulligen Wals namens Qual. Skurrile Gestalten, Alltagsanekdoten und abstruse philosophische Gedankengänge - Sinn und Wahnsinn geben sich hier die Klinke in die Hand und sorgen für ein kreatives literarisches Potpourri:

http://qual-der-wahl.com/

Zu diesem Blog ist bereits ein Buch erschienen, das zweite soll nun Ende Mai/Anfang Juni folgen. Da ich mit meinem bisherigen Verlag keine guten Erfahrungen gemacht habe, will ich "Qual der Wa(h)l - Walwiederholung" in Eigendruck herausbringen. Und nun kommt ihr ins Spiel:

Die geplante erste Auflage von 250 Exemplaren kostet rund 700€. Bislang habe ich noch keine Ölquelle im Garten gefunden, daher ist das für mich eine Menge Schotter. Jeder Cent wäre also äußerst hilfreich und verhindert unter Umständen, dass mein Konto mit roten Zahlen um sich wirft. Und mein ehrenamtliches Team an Grafikern und meine Lektorin würden sich sicher auch über eine kleine Aufmerksamkeit freuen.

Je höher die Auflage ist, umso niedriger ist der Preis pro Buch. Daher bin ich sehr gerne bereit ab einer Unterstützung in Höhe von 5€ ein quasi Gratis-Exemplar (siehe "Perk" oder auch einfach "Belohnung" rechts) an jeden Spender zu schicken - samt Ferrero-Küsschen, persönlicher Widmung und Signatur, wenn das erwünscht sein sollte. :)

Schaut euch also gerne bei Gelegenheit den Blog an, esst mal wieder einen Apfel und erzählt euren Leuten von diesem Wahnsinnsprojekt.


Bis dahin,

 

Daniel (und Qual)

story:
***Breaking News***


A little competition...
Get your friends to contribute and your copy of the eBook is free!
The person who pops the most referrals will receive a free signed printed copy. 
Send us a message for more details.

Get a sneak preview by listening to the audiobook. Come check it out! 
Tune in on Soundcloud

***Thanks!***


Hi! I'm Kerry, the cheerful author of "Happy Dunk: Life, Love, and the Pursuit of Happiness". 

I'm originally from Massachusetts, but since I'm obsessed with travel, we probably didn't meet there! So, if we've had the good fortune to cross paths, maybe a touch of my affection for you appears within the pages of this story. So thank you for sharing your truths, your pains, and your wonderful self with me. It's been awesome!

Say more? Of course I will! Happy Dunk has been inspired by the hundreds of 20somethings I have met primarily through my travels in the United States over the last 10 years. Don't get too excited- I'm not spilling the beans on a single secret I've ever been told. A promise is a promise! Because here's the thing, even the weirdest and most corrupt times of our lives aren't so weird after all. Life though, life can be pretty weird. But us? We are pretty darn close to perfect- just the way we are. Wrinkled t-shirts, stinky laundry, overdue library books & all.

When I started to work on this project, it was with much resistance and I'll be honest, only at the encouragement of some supportive friends. Just because I was grumpy about the lack of literature exploring the world of 20somethings today, why should I be the one to do anything about it? What if I want to be lazy and passive? Surely, someone is a better writer, a better fit for the task at hand.

But here I am, one year later, and the book is so close to ready for you! 

Yes, for you! I did this for you, but why?

Because you deserve a contemporary piece of fiction exploring all the yucky stuff that we've been so determined to avoid facing. Why would I do that to you? That sounds terrible! Well, it's not so bad, it turns out. Just like the beginning phases of this project, it just takes a bit of stomping around in the mucky muck before you get to the other side and find yourself somewhere that is definitely worth it!


Learn more about the book from our original campaign video 


What We Need & What You Get

  • Money!!! Is that what it always comes down to?!! Well, yes, and no. I'm determined to get this book into the hands of the people who need it most, but your contributions can make it happen much faster! 
  • The goal of $500 just gets the book into a digital format...at a snail's pace! 
  • If we reach $1,500, a first printing run will blast off!
  • If we reach $6,000, I can pay TEAM Happy Dunk fair wages for their labor in helping me get the book into your hands.
  • Start the Pursuit- for $12 USD buckaroos, snag yourself a copy of the eBook the minute it becomes available
  • Touch Some Happy! - for $30 secure yourself a copy of the eBook and a print copy 
  • Life Support- for $50 get an eBook for yourself and I'll donate a copy to a local library's digital collection. Why? Because I love community libraries, and I hope you do too.
  • Loving You- for $100 Touch Some Happy! perks are yours with a donated copy and with a love letter from yours truly, right inside!
  • If we don’t reach the entire goal the funds will still be directed to the production of the eBook and print copies will be on hold as we raise other monies. It's that simple. One way or another- this is going down. 

The Impact

I took a year of unpaid leave from my work life to write this book. What?! Am I crazy?!! Yes, yes, yes. I'm not worried about making up for that lost income, it was my calling, it was my choice, and I'm happy I did it. I do, however, want to be sure my supporting editors and artists get paid! 

Support TEAM Happy Dunk! I've put together an amazing, hard working, committed team of 18-34 year olds who live all across the US, from LA to Boston. By supporting this project you are securing a meaningful, relevant gig for 8 freelancers. 

Keep the happiness circulating! Everyone deserves a fair share, and that's what I'm working towards by hiring young folks seeking the path to entrepreneurship. I'm doing my best to help them get on their way and your contribution isn't just scoring you a good read and some other perks, you are helping them on their way.

If you've ever wondered what it is like to toss it all up in the air and see what happens, this book gives you a sneak peek into the panic, chaos, and joy that inevitably ensues. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Nothing to spare this month? Hey, not to worry, we've all been there. Want to help? Spreading the word about this campaign and the book is an essential part of moving things along. So thank you for posting on your favorite social media site or for telling a family member, friend, or colleague who is a 20something, feeling blue, and could use a little dose of chasing 'happy'. 

And that’s all there is to it!


with a smile- 

Kerry


Visit us on Facebook for more News about the Book

story:
THIS IS NOT A FUNDRAISER. PLEASE DO NOT SEND MONEY OTHER THAN FOR BOOK ORDERS.


When we launched the Wee Black Book, the first thing people asked  us was how they could get print copies of it. And that gave us a bit of a dilemma.


The Problem

With no independence referendum currently on the horizon, we didn't want to blow the Wings Fighting Fund on something that had no tangible goal, and when we asked readers they agreed with that view but they still wanted print copies.

There's also the issue that the huge ad-hoc network that distributed the Wee Blue Book during the 2014 referendum doesn't really exist any more - people have lives to get on with and can't spend days on end driving all over the country with vanloads full of boxes of books.


The Solution

So this time we're making it personal. For the Wee Black Book, we've decided to make it available in small quantities at subsidised cost, so that rather than having thousands sent to centralised hubs and having people fight for them, anyone can get a couple of dozen for friends, family, workmates and neighbours, for just a few pounds to cover (most of) the price of printing, postage and packing. 

Then you can use them however you see fit, and in your own time. Target every copy carefully at someone you think could be persuaded, or just fire them through every letterbox in your postcode at random and hope for the best - it's your call.


The End

And that's pretty much that.
